a10_server.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' server object.
body: a10_server
username: required, default: null. # An account with administrator privileges.
server_ip: not required, default: null. # The SLB server IPv4 address.
server_name: required, default: undefined. # The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server name.

server_ports: not required, default: null. # A list of ports to create for the server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(protocol:), but can also optionally specify the C(status:). See the examples below for details. This parameter is required when C(state) is C(present).
partition: not required, default: null. # set active-partition
state: not required, default: present. # This is to specify the operation to create, update or remove SLB server.
server_status: not required, default: enabled. # The SLB virtual server status.
host: required, default: null. # Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.

write_config: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
password: required, default: null. # Password for the C(username) account.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
a10_server_axapi3
username: required, default: null. # An account with administrator privileges.
server_ip: required, default: undefined. # The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server IPv4 address.
server_name: required, default: undefined. # The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server name.
server_ports: not required, default: null. # A list of ports to create for the server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(protocol:).
server_status: not required, default: enable. # The SLB (Server Load Balancer) virtual server status.
host: required, default: null. # Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.

write_config: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).

operation: not required, default: create. # Create, Update or Remove SLB server. For create and update operation, we use the IP address and server name specified in the POST message. For delete operation, we use the server name in the request URI.
password: required, default: null. # Password for the C(username) account.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

a10_service_group.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' service groups.
body: a10_service_group
username: required, default: null. # An account with administrator privileges.
service_group: required, default: null. # The SLB (Server Load Balancing) service-group name
partition: not required, default: null. # set active-partition
service_group_protocol: not required, default: tcp. # The SLB service-group protocol of TCP or UDP.

servers: not required, default: null. # A list of servers to add to the service group. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(server:) and C(port:), but can also optionally specify the C(status:). See the examples below for details.
host: required, default: null. # Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.

write_config: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
service_group_method: not required, default: round-robin. # The SLB service-group load balancing method, such as round-robin or weighted-rr.
password: required, default: null. # Password for the C(username) account.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

a10_virtual_server.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' virtual servers.
body: a10_virtual_server
username: required, default: null. # An account with administrator privileges.
virtual_server: required, default: null. # The SLB (Server Load Balancing) virtual server name.
partition: not required, default: null. # set active-partition

virtual_server_ports: not required, default: undefined. # A list of ports to create for the virtual server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(type:), but can also optionally specify the C(service_group:) as well as the C(status:). See the examples below for details. This parameter is required when C(state) is C(present).
host: required, default: null. # Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.
virtual_server_status: not required, default: enable. # The SLB virtual server status, such as enabled or disabled.

write_config: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
virtual_server_ip: not required, default: null. # The SLB virtual server IPv4 address.
password: required, default: null. # Password for the C(username) account.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

accelerate.description: Enable accelerated mode on remote node
body: accelerate
timeout: not required, default: 300. # The number of seconds the socket will wait for data. If none is received when the timeout value is reached, the connection will be closed.
minutes: not required, default: 30. # The I(accelerate) listener daemon is started on nodes and will stay around for this number of minutes before turning itself off.
port: not required, default: 5099. # TCP port for the socket connection

multi_key: not required, default: false. # When enabled, the daemon will open a local socket file which can be used by future daemon executions to upload a new key to the already running daemon, so that multiple users can connect using different keys. This access still requires an ssh connection as the uid for which the daemon is currently running.
ipv6: not required, default: false. # The listener daemon on the remote host will bind to the ipv6 localhost socket if this parameter is set to true.

aci_aep.description: Manage attachable Access Entity Profile (AEP) on Cisco ACI fabrics (infra:AttEntityP)
body: aci_aep
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
aep: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Attachable Access Entity Profile.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the AEP.

aci_ap.description: Manage top level Application Profile (AP) objects on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:Ap)
body: aci_ap
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
descr: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the AP.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
ap: required, default: undefined. # The name of the application network profile.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
tenant: required, default: undefined. # The name of an existing tenant.

aci_bd.description: Manage Bridge Domains (BD) on Cisco ACI Fabrics (fv:BD)
body: aci_bd
bd: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Bridge Domain.
arp_flooding: not required, default: false. # Determines if the Bridge Domain should flood ARP traffic.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).

endpoint_retention_action: not required, default: resolve. # Determines if the Bridge Domain should inherit or resolve the End Point Retention Policy.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domain to End Point Retention Policies to C(resolve).
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the Bridge Domain.
l3_unknown_multicast: not required, default: flood. # Determines the forwarding method to use for unknown multicast destinations.,The APCI defaults new Bridge Domains to C(flood).
enable_routing: not required, default: true. # Determines if IP forwarding should be allowed.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).
vrf: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the VRF.
bd_type: not required, default: ethernet. # The type of traffic on the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(ethernet).
ip_learning: not required, default: undefined. # Determines if the Bridge Domain should learn End Point IPs.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Tenant.
l2_unknown_unicast: not required, default: proxy. # Determines what forwarding method to use for unknown l2 destinations.,The APIC defaults new Bridge domains to C(proxy).
endpoint_retention_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the End Point Retention Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overriding the default End Point Retention Policy.
multi_dest: not required, default: bd-flood. # Determines the forwarding method for L2 multicast, broadcast, and link layer traffic.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(bd-flood).

endpoint_clear: not required, default: false. # Clears all End Points in all Leaves when C(yes).,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).,The value is not reset to disabled once End Points have been cleared; that requires a second task.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
ipv6_nd_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overridding the default IPV6 ND Policy.
igmp_snoop_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the IGMP Snooping Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overriding the default IGMP Snooping Policy.
endpoint_move_detect: not required, default: garp. # Determines if GARP should be enabled to detect when End Points move.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(garp).
enable_multicast: not required, default: false. # Determines if PIM is enabled,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).
limit_ip_learn: not required, default: true. # Determines if the BD should limit IP learning to only subnets owned by the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).

aci_bd_subnet.description: Manage Subnets on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:Subnet)
body: aci_bd_subnet
bd: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Bridge Domain.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description for the Subnet.
nd_prefix_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Prefix Policy to associate with the Subnet.
enable_vip: not required, default: false. # Determines if the Subnet should be treated as a VIP; used when the BD is extended to multiple sites.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(no).
mask: not required, default: undefined. # The subnet mask for the Subnet.,This is the number assocated with CIDR notation.

preferred: not required, default: false. # Determines if the Subnet is preferred over all available Subnets. Only one Subnet per Address Family (IPv4/IPv6). can be preferred in the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(no).

subnet_control: not required, default: nd_ra. # Determines the Subnet's Control State.,The querier_ip option is used to treat the gateway_ip as an IGMP querier source IP.,The nd_ra option is used to treate the gateway_ip address as a Neighbor Discovery Router Advertisement Prefix.,The no_gw option is used to remove default gateway functionality from the gateway address.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(nd_ra).
route_profile: not required, default: undefined. # The Route Profile to the associate with the Subnet.
route_profile_l3_out: not required, default: undefined. # The L3 Out that contains the assocated Route Profile.

scope: not required, default: private. # Determines if scope of the Subnet.,The private option only allows communication with hosts in the same VRF.,The public option allows the Subnet to be advertised outside of the ACI Fabric, and allows communication with hosts in other VRFs.,The shared option limits communication to hosts in either the same VRF or the shared VRF.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(private).
gateway: not required, default: undefined. # The IPv4 or IPv6 gateway address for the Subnet.
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Tenant.
subnet_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Subnet.

aci_bd_to_l3out.description: Bind Bridge Domain to L3 Out on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:RsBDToOut)
body: aci_bd_to_l3out
bd: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Bridge Domain.
l3out: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the l3out to associate with th Bridge Domain.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Tenant.

aci_config_rollback.description: Provides rollback and rollback preview functionality for Cisco ACI fabrics (config:ImportP)
body: aci_config_rollback
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
export_policy: required, default: undefined. # The export policy that the C(snapshot) is associated to.
import_mode: not required, default: atomic. # Determines how the import should be handled by the APIC.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(atomic).
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description for the Import Policy.
compare_export_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The export policy that the C(compare_snapshot) is associated to.
import_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Import Policy to use for config rollback.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
compare_snapshot: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the snapshot to compare with C(snapshot).
fail_on_decrypt: not required, default: yes. # Determines if the APIC should fail the rollback if unable to decrypt secured data.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(yes).
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
state: not required, default: rollback. # Use C(preview) for previewing the diff between two snapshots.,Use C(rollback) for reverting the configuration to a previous snapshot.

snapshot: required, default: undefined. # The name of the snapshot to rollback to, or the base snapshot to use for comparison.,The C(aci_snapshot) module can be used to query the list of available snapshots.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
import_type: not required, default: replace. # Determines how the current and snapshot configuration should be compared for replacement.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(replace).
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

aci_config_snapshot.description: Manage Config Snapshots on Cisco ACI fabrics (config:Snapshot, config:ExportP)
body: aci_config_snapshot
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
include_secure: not required, default: yes. # Determines if secure information should be included in the backup.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(yes).
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
format: not required, default: json. # Sets the config backup to be formatted in JSON or XML.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(json)
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
export_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Export Policy to use for Config Snapshots.
max_count: not required, default: 3. # Determines how many snapshots can exist for the Export Policy before the APIC starts to rollover.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(3).
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
snapshot: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the snapshot to delete.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description for the Config Export Policy.

aci_contract.description: Manage contract resources on Cisco ACI fabrics (vz:BrCP)
body: aci_contract
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
contract: required, default: undefined. # The name of the contract.
priority: not required, default: unspecified. # The desired QoS class to be used.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
dscp: not required, default: unspecified. # The target Differentiated Service (DSCP) value.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
scope: not required, default: context. # The scope of a service contract.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
tenant: required, default: undefined. # The name of the tenant.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the contract.

aci_contract_subject.description: Manage initial Contract Subjects on Cisco ACI fabrics (vz:Subj)
body: aci_contract_subject
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the contract subject.
dscp: not required, default: unspecified. # The target DSCP.,The APIC defaults new Contract Subjects to C(unspecified).
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the tenant.
subject: not required, default: undefined. # The contract subject name.
provider_match: not required, default: at_least_one. # The match criteria across providers.,The APIC defaults new Contract Subjects to C(at_least_one).
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
consumer_match: not required, default: at_least_one. # The match criteria across consumers.,The APIC defaults new Contract Subjects to C(at_least_one).
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
contract: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Contract.
priority: not required, default: unspecified. # The QoS class.,The APIC defaults new Contract Subjects to C(unspecified).
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.

reverse_filter: not required, default: true. # Determines if the APIC should reverse the src and dst ports to allow the return traffic back, since ACI is stateless filter.,The APIC defaults new Contract Subjects to C(yes).
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

aci_contract_subject_to_filter.description: Bind Contract Subjects to Filters on Cisco ACI fabrics (vz:RsSubjFiltAtt)
body: aci_contract_subject_to_filter
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
subject: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Contract Subject.
contract: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the contract.
filter: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the Filter to bind to the Subject.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.

tenant: required, default: undefined. # The name of the tenant.
log: not required, default: none. # Determines if the binding should be set to log.,The APIC defaults new Subject to Filter bindings to C(none).

body: aci_epg
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
bd: required, default: undefined. # Name of the bridge domain being associated with the EPG.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the EPG.
fwd_control: not required, default: none. # The forwarding control used by the EPG.,The APIC defaults new EPGs to C(none).
ap: required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing application network profile, that will contain the EPGs.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
intra_epg_isolation: not required, default: unenforced. # Intra EPG Isolation.
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing tenant.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
priority: not required, default: unspecified. # QoS class.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
epg: required, default: undefined. # Name of the end point group.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

aci_epg_monitoring_policy.description: Manage monitoring policies on Cisco ACI fabrics (mon:EPGPol)
body: aci_epg_monitoring_policy
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.

aci_epg_to_contract.description: Bind EPGs to Contracts on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:RsCons and fv:RsProv)
body: aci_epg_to_contract
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
provider_match: not required, default: at_least_one. # The matching algorithm for Provided Contracts.,The APIC defaults new EPG to Provided Contracts to C(at_least_one).
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
contract: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the contract.

ap: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing application network profile, that will contain the EPGs.
state: not required, default: present. # Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds.
epg: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the end point group.
contract_type: required, default: undefined. # Determines if the EPG should Provide or Consume the Contract.
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
tenant: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing tenant.

aci_epg_to_domain.description: Bind EPGs to Domains on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:RsDomAtt)
body: aci_epg_to_domain
username: required, default: admin. # The username to use for authentication.
domain: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the physical or virtual domain being associated with the EPG.
encap: not required, default: undefined. # The VLAN encapsulation for the EPG when binding a VMM Domain with static encap_mode.,This acts as the secondary encap when using useg.
allow_useg: not required, default: encap. # Allows micro-segmentation.,The APIC defaults new EPG to Domain bindings to use C(encap).
domain_type: not required, default: undefined. # Determines if the Domain is physical (phys) or virtual (vmm).
ap: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing application network profile, that will contain the EPGs.
encap_mode: not required, default: auto. # The ecapsulataion method to be used.,The APIC defaults new EPG to Domain bindings to C(auto).
use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
vm_provider: not required, default: undefined. # The VM platform for VMM Domains.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to use for authentication.
resolution_immediacy: not required, default: lazy. # Determines when the policies should be resolved and available.,The APIC defaults new EPG to Domain bindings to C(lazy).
