azure_rm_storageblob.description: Manage blob containers and blob objects.
body: azure_rm_storageblob
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
force: not required, default: false. # Overwrite existing blob or file when uploading or downloading. Force deletion of a container that contains blobs.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
resource_group: required, default: undefined. # Name of the resource group to use.

tags: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of string:string pairs to assign as metadata to the object. Metadata tags on the object will be updated with any provided values. To remove tags set append_tags option to false.
dest: not required, default: null. # Destination file path. Use with state 'present' to download a blob.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
content_language: not required, default: null. # Set the blob content-language header.
content_type: not required, default: null. # Set the blob content-type header. For example, 'image/png'.
public_access: not required, default: null. # Determine a container's level of public access. By default containers are private. Can only be set at time of container creation.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
src: not required, default: null. # Source file path. Use with state 'present' to upload a blob.
container: required, default: undefined. # Name of a blob container within the storage account.

append_tags: not required, default: true. # Use to control if tags field is canonical or just appends to existing tags. When canonical, any tags not found in the tags parameter will be removed from the object's metadata.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

state: not required, default: present. # Assert the state of a container or blob.,Use state 'absent' with a container value only to delete a container. Include a blob value to remove a specific blob. A container will not be deleted, if it contains blobs. Use the force option to override, deleting the container and all associated blobs.,Use state 'present' to create or update a container and upload or download a blob. If the container does not exist, it will be created. If it exists, it will be updated with configuration options. Provide a blob name and either src or dest to upload or download. Provide a src path to upload and a dest path to download. If a blob (uploading) or a file (downloading) already exists, it will not be overwritten unless the force parameter is true.
blob: not required, default: null. # Name of a blob object within the container.
content_md5: not required, default: null. # Set the blob md5 hash value.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
storage_account_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the storage account to use.
content_disposition: not required, default: null. # Set the blob content-disposition header.
cache_control: not required, default: null. # Set the blob cache-control header.
content_encoding: not required, default: null. # Set the blob encoding header.
azure_rm_subnet
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the subnet.
resource_group: required, default: undefined. # Name of resource group.
virtual_network_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing virtual network with which the subnet is or will be associated.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
state: not required, default: present. # Assert the state of the subnet. Use 'present' to create or update a subnet and 'absent' to delete a subnet.
security_group_name: not required, default: null. # Name of an existing security group with which to associate the subnet.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
address_prefix_cidr: required, default: undefined. # CIDR defining the IPv4 address space of the subnet. Must be valid within the context of the virtual network.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
azure_rm_virtualmachine

virtual_network_resource_group: not required, default: undefined. # When creating a virtual machine, if a specific virtual network from another resource group should be used, use this parameter to specify the resource group to use.
resource_group: required, default: undefined. # Name of the resource group containing the virtual machine.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

image: required, default: undefined. # A dictionary describing the Marketplace image used to build the VM. Will contain keys: publisher, offer, sku and version. NOTE: set image.version to 'latest' to get the most recent version of a given image.
managed_disk_type: not required, default: undefined. # Managed OS disk type

ssh_public_keys: not required, default: undefined. # For os_type Linux provide a list of SSH keys. Each item in the list should be a dictionary where the dictionary contains two keys: path and key_data. Set the path to the default location of the authorized_keys files. On an Enterprise Linux host, for example, the path will be /home/<admin username>/.ssh/authorized_keys. Set key_data to the actual value of the public key.
storage_container_name: not required, default: vhds. # Name of the container to use within the storage account to store VHD blobs. If no name is specified a default container will created.
allocated: not required, default: true. # Toggle that controls if the machine is allocated/deallocated, only useful with state='present'.
ssh_password_enabled: not required, default: true. # When the os_type is Linux, setting ssh_password_enabled to false will disable SSH password authentication and require use of SSH keys.

vm_size: not required, default: undefined. # A valid Azure VM size value. For example, 'Standard_D4'. The list of choices varies depending on the subscription and location. Check your subscription for available choices. Required when creating a VM.

remove_on_absent: not required, default: all. # When removing a VM using state 'absent', also remove associated resources,It can be 'all' or a list with any of the following: ['network_interfaces', 'virtual_storage', 'public_ips'],Any other input will be ignored

append_tags: not required, default: true. # Use to control if tags field is canonical or just appends to existing tags. When canonical, any tags not found in the tags parameter will be removed from the object's metadata.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

short_hostname: not required, default: undefined. # Name assigned internally to the host. On a linux VM this is the name returned by the `hostname` command. When creating a virtual machine, short_hostname defaults to name.

virtual_network_name: not required, default: undefined. # When creating a virtual machine, if a network interface name is not provided, one will be created. The new network interface will be assigned to the first virtual network found in the resource group. Use this parameter to provide a specific virtual network instead.

state: not required, default: present. # Assert the state of the virtual machine.,State 'present' will check that the machine exists with the requested configuration. If the configuration of the existing machine does not match, the machine will be updated. Use options started, allocated and restarted to change the machine's power state.,State 'absent' will remove the virtual machine.

subnet_name: not required, default: undefined. # When creating a virtual machine, if a network interface name is not provided, one will be created. The new network interface will be assigned to the first subnet found in the virtual network. Use this parameter to provide a specific subnet instead.
location: not required, default: undefined. # Valid Azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.

public_ip_allocation_method: not required, default: Static. # If a public IP address is created when creating the VM (because a Network Interface was not provided), determines if the public IP address remains permanently associated with the Network Interface. If set to 'Dynamic' the public IP address may change any time the VM is rebooted or power cycled.

network_interface_names: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing network interface names to add to the VM. If a network interface name is not provided when the VM is created, a default network interface will be created. In order for the module to create a network interface, at least one Virtual Network with one Subnet must exist.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.

admin_password: not required, default: undefined. # Password for the admin username. Not required if the os_type is Linux and SSH password authentication is disabled by setting ssh_password_enabled to false.
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.

tags: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of string:string pairs to assign as metadata to the object. Metadata tags on the object will be updated with any provided values. To remove tags set append_tags option to false.
started: not required, default: true. # Use with state 'present' to start the machine. Set to false to have the machine be 'stopped'.

open_ports: not required, default: undefined. # If a network interface is created when creating the VM, a security group will be created as well. For Linux hosts a rule will be added to the security group allowing inbound TCP connections to the default SSH port 22, and for Windows hosts ports 3389 and 5986 will be opened. Override the default open ports by providing a list of ports.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

storage_blob_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name fo the storage blob used to hold the VM's OS disk image. If no name is provided, defaults to the VM name + '.vhd'. If you provide a name, it must end with '.vhd'
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the virtual machine.
restarted: not required, default: false. # Use with state 'present' to restart a running VM.
admin_username: not required, default: undefined. # Admin username used to access the host after it is created. Required when creating a VM.
os_type: not required, default: Linux. # Base type of operating system.

storage_account_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing storage account that supports creation of VHD blobs. If not specified for a new VM, a new storage account named <vm name>01 will be created using storage type 'Standard_LRS'.
data_disks: not required, default: null. # Describes list of data disks.
os_disk_caching: not required, default: ReadOnly. # Type of OS disk caching.
azure_rm_virtualmachine_extension
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
publisher: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the extension handler publisher.
virtual_machine_extension_type: not required, default: undefined. # The type of the extension handler.
auto_upgrade_minor_version: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the extension handler should be automatically upgraded across minor versions.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the vm extension
resource_group: required, default: undefined. # Name of a resource group where the vm extension exists or will be created.
settings: not required, default: undefined. # Json formatted public settings for the extension.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
state: not required, default: present. # Assert the state of the vm extension. Use 'present' to create or update a vm extension and 'absent' to delete a vm extension.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
location: not required, default: resource_group location. # Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
protected_settings: not required, default: undefined. # Json formatted protected settings for the extension.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
type_handler_version: not required, default: undefined. # The type version of the extension handler.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
virtual_machine_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the virtual machine where the extension should be create or updated.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
version: not required, default: null. # Specific version number of an image.

location: required, default: undefined. # Azure location value (ie. westus, eastus, eastus2, northcentralus, etc.). Supplying only a location value will yield a list of available publishers for the location.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
azure_rm_virtualnetwork
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.

dns_servers: not required, default: null. # Custom list of DNS servers. Maximum length of two. The first server in the list will be treated as the Primary server. This is an explicit list. Existing DNS servers will be replaced with the specified list. Use the purge_dns_servers option to remove all custom DNS servers and revert to default Azure servers.
resource_group: required, default: undefined. # name of resource group.

tags: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of string:string pairs to assign as metadata to the object. Metadata tags on the object will be updated with any provided values. To remove tags set append_tags option to false.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.

address_prefixes_cidr: not required, default: null. # List of IPv4 address ranges where each is formatted using CIDR notation. Required when creating a new virtual network or using purge_address_prefixes.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
purge_dns_servers: not required, default: false. # Use with state present to remove existing DNS servers, reverting to default Azure servers. Mutually exclusive with dns_servers.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
name: required, default: undefined. # name of the virtual network.

append_tags: not required, default: true. # Use to control if tags field is canonical or just appends to existing tags. When canonical, any tags not found in the tags parameter will be removed from the object's metadata.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
state: not required, default: present. # Assert the state of the virtual network. Use 'present' to create or update and 'absent' to delete.
location: not required, default: resource_group location. # Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.
purge_address_prefixes: not required, default: false. # Use with state present to remove any existing address_prefixes.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
azure_rm_virtualnetwork_facts
profile: not required, default: null. # Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
name: not required, default: null. # Only show results for a specific security group.
resource_group: not required, default: null. # Limit results by resource group. Required when filtering by name.
tags: not required, default: null. # Limit results by providing a list of tags. Format tags as 'key' or 'key:value'.
ad_user: not required, default: null. # Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

cloud_environment: not required, default: AzureCloud. # For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
secret: not required, default: null. # Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
client_id: not required, default: null. # Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
subscription_id: not required, default: null. # Your Azure subscription Id.
password: not required, default: null. # Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
tenant: not required, default: null. # Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

bcf_switch.description: Create and remove a bcf switch.
body: bcf_switch
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the switch.
access_token: not required, default: undefined. # Big Cloud Fabric access token. If this isn't set then the environment variable C(BIGSWITCH_ACCESS_TOKEN) is used.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the switch should be present or absent.
mac: required, default: undefined. # The MAC address of the switch.
controller: required, default: undefined. # The controller IP address.
leaf_group: not required, default: undefined. # The leaf group of the switch if the switch is a leaf.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
fabric_role: required, default: undefined. # Fabric role of the switch.

beadm.description: Manage ZFS boot environments on FreeBSD/Solaris/illumos systems.
body: beadm
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete ZFS boot environment.
force: not required, default: false. # Specifies if the unmount should be forced.
name: required, default: undefined. # ZFS boot environment name.
mountpoint: not required, default: false. # Path where to mount the ZFS boot environment
snapshot: not required, default: false. # If specified, the new boot environment will be cloned from the given snapshot or inactive boot environment.
options: not required, default: false. # Create the datasets for new BE with specific ZFS properties. Multiple options can be specified. This option is available only on Solarish platforms.
description: not required, default: false. # Associate a description with a new boot environment. This option is available only on Solarish platforms.
bearychat

url: required, default: undefined. # BearyChat WebHook URL. This authenticates you to the bearychat service. It looks like C(https://hook.bearychat.com/=ae2CF/incoming/e61bd5c57b164e04b11ac02e66f47f60).
text: not required, default: undefined. # Message to send.
markdown: not required, default: yes. # If C(yes), text will be parsed as markdown.

attachments: not required, default: undefined. # Define a list of attachments. For more information, see https://github.com/bearyinnovative/bearychat-tutorial/blob/master/robots/incoming.md#attachments
channel: not required, default: undefined. # Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the default channel selected by the I(url).

bigip_command.description: Run arbitrary command on F5 devices.
body: bigip_command

retries: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

commands: required, default: undefined. # The commands to send to the remote BIG-IP device over the configured provider. The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries as expired.,The I(commands) argument also accepts an alternative form that allows for complex values that specify the command to run and the output format to return. This can be done on a command by command basis. The complex argument supports the keywords C(command) and C(output) where C(command) is the command to run and C(output) is 'text' or 'one-line'.

wait_for: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true by the configured retries, the task fails. See examples.

interval: not required, default: 1. # Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditional, the interval indicates how to long to wait before trying the command again.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

match: not required, default: all. # The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy. Valid values are C(all) or C(any). If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the I(wait_for) must be satisfied. If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.
bigip_config

reset: not required, default: false. # Loads the default configuration on the device. If this option is specified, the default configuration will be loaded before any commands or other provided configuration is run.

save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running-config to startup-config. This operation is performed after any changes are made to the current running config. If no changes are made, the configuration is still saved to the startup config. This option will always cause the module to return changed.

merge_content: not required, default: undefined. # Loads the specified configuration that you want to merge into the running configuration. This is equivalent to using the C(tmsh) command C(load sys config from-terminal merge). If you need to read configuration from a file or template, use Ansible's C(file) or C(template) lookup plugins respectively.
verify: not required, default: true. # Validates the specified configuration to see whether they are valid to replace the running configuration. The running configuration will not be changed.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_configsync_actions.description: Perform different actions related to config-sync.
body: bigip_configsync_actions

sync_most_recent_to_device: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies that the system synchronizes configuration data from the device with the most recent configuration. In this case, the device will do a "pull" from the most recently updated device. This option is mutually exclusive with the C(sync_device_to_group) options.
device_group: required, default: undefined. # The device group that you want to perform config-sync actions on.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

sync_device_to_group: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies that the system synchronizes configuration data from this device to other members of the device group. In this case, the device will do a "push" to all the other devices in the group. This option is mutually exclusive with the C(sync_group_to_device) option.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
overwrite_config: not required, default: false. # Indicates that the sync operation overwrites the configuration on the target.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_device_dns
search: not required, default: undefined. # A list of domains that the system searches for local domain lookups, to resolve local host names.

cache: not required, default: disable. # Specifies whether the system caches DNS lookups or performs the operation each time a lookup is needed. Please note that this applies only to Access Policy Manager features, such as ACLs, web application rewrites, and authentication.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
ip_version: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the DNS specifies IP addresses using IPv4 or IPv6.
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the variable on the system. When C(present), guarantees that an existing variable is set to C(value).

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
forwarders: not required, default: undefined. # A list of BIND servers that the system can use to perform DNS lookups
name_servers: not required, default: undefined. # A list of name serverz that the system uses to validate DNS lookups
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_device_ntp.description: Manage NTP servers on a BIG-IP
body: bigip_device_ntp
ntp_servers: not required, default: . # A list of NTP servers to set on the device. At least one of C(ntp_servers) or C(timezone) is required.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the NTP servers on the system. When C(present), guarantees that the NTP servers are set on the system. When C(absent), removes the specified NTP servers from the device configuration.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
timezone: not required, default: UTC. # The timezone to set for NTP lookups. At least one of C(ntp_servers) or C(timezone) is required.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_device_sshd.description: Manage the SSHD settings of a BIG-IP
body: bigip_device_sshd
log_level: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the minimum SSHD message level to include in the system log.
allow: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies, if you have enabled SSH access, the IP address or address range for other systems that can use SSH to communicate with this system.
banner_text: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the text to include on the pre-login banner that displays when a user attempts to login to the system using SSH.
banner: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to enable the banner or not.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
inactivity_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the number of seconds before inactivity causes an SSH session to log out.
login: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies, when checked C(enabled), that the system accepts SSH communications.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Port that you want the SSH daemon to run on.

bigip_facts.description: Collect facts from F5 BIG-IP devices
body: bigip_facts
include: required, default: null. # Fact category or list of categories to collect
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
filter: not required, default: null. # Shell-style glob matching string used to filter fact keys. Not applicable for software, provision, and system_info fact categories.
session: not required, default: true. # BIG-IP session support; may be useful to avoid concurrency issues in certain circumstances.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_gtm_datacenter
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description of the data center.
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the data center should be enabled. At least one of C(state) and C(enabled) are required.
location: not required, default: undefined. # The location of the data center.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: undefined. # The state of the datacenter on the BIG-IP. When C(present), guarantees that the data center exists. When C(absent) removes the data center from the BIG-IP. C(enabled) will enable the data center and C(disabled) will ensure the data center is disabled. At least one of state and enabled are required.
contact: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the contact for the data center.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the data center.

bigip_gtm_facts.description: Collect facts from F5 BIG-IP GTM devices.
body: bigip_gtm_facts
filter: not required, default: None. # Perform regex filter of response. Filtering is done on the name of the resource. Valid filters are anything that can be provided to Python's C(re) module.
include: required, default: undefined. # Fact category to collect

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
bigip_gtm_pool
alternate_lb_method: not required, default: undefined. # The load balancing mode that the system tries if the C(preferred_lb_method) is unsuccessful in picking a pool.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the GTM pool.

type: not required, default: undefined. # The type of GTM pool that you want to create. On BIG-IP releases prior to version 12, this parameter is not required. On later versions of BIG-IP, this is a required parameter.

fallback_ip: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the IPv4, or IPv6 address of the server to which the system directs requests when it cannot use one of its pools to do so. Note that the system uses the fallback IP only if you select the C(fallback_ip) load balancing method.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: required, default: undefined. # Pool member state. When C(present), ensures that the pool is created and enabled. When C(absent), ensures that the pool is removed from the system. When C(enabled) or C(disabled), ensures that the pool is enabled or disabled (respectively) on the remote device.

fallback_lb_method: not required, default: undefined. # The load balancing mode that the system tries if both the C(preferred_lb_method) and C(alternate_lb_method)s are unsuccessful in picking a pool.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
preferred_lb_method: not required, default: undefined. # The load balancing mode that the system tries first.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_gtm_virtual_server.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP GTM virtual servers
body: bigip_gtm_virtual_server
virtual_server_name: required, default: undefined. # Virtual server name
virtual_server_server: required, default: undefined. # Virtual server server
state: not required, default: present. # Virtual server state
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
host: not required, default: None. # Virtual server host

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
port: not required, default: None. # Virtual server port

bigip_gtm_wide_ip.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP GTM wide ip.
body: bigip_gtm_wide_ip
lb_method: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the load balancing method used to select a pool in this wide IP. This setting is relevant only when multiple pools are configured for a wide IP.

name: required, default: undefined. # Wide IP name. This name must be formatted as a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). You can also use the alias C(wide_ip) but this is deprecated and will be removed in a future Ansible version.

type: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the type of wide IP. GTM wide IPs need to be keyed by query type in addition to name, since pool members need different attributes depending on the response RDATA they are meant to supply. This value is required if you are using BIG-IP versions >= 12.0.0.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) or C(enabled), ensures that the Wide IP exists and is enabled. When C(absent), ensures that the Wide IP has been removed. When C(disabled), ensures that the Wide IP exists and is disabled.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_hostname.description: Manage the hostname of a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_hostname
hostname: required, default: undefined. # Hostname of the BIG-IP host.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

bigip_iapp_service.description: Manages TCL iApp services on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_iapp_service

force: not required, default: false. # Forces the updating of an iApp service even if the parameters to the service have not changed. This option is of particular importance if the iApp template that underlies the service has been updated in-place. This option is equivalent to re-configuring the iApp if that template has changed.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the iApp service that you want to deploy.

parameters: not required, default: undefined. # A hash of all the required template variables for the iApp template. If your parameters are stored in a file (the more common scenario) it is recommended you use either the `file` or `template` lookups to supply the expected parameters.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present), ensures that the iApp service is created and running. When C(absent), ensures that the iApp service has been removed.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

template: not required, default: undefined. # The iApp template from which to instantiate a new service. This template must exist on your BIG-IP before you can successfully create a service. This parameter is required if the C(state) parameter is C(present).

bigip_iapp_template.description: Manages TCL iApp templates on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_iapp_template

force: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether or not to force the uploading of an iApp. When C(yes), will force update the iApp even if there are iApp services using it. This will not update the running service though. Use C(bigip_iapp_service) to do that. When C(no), will update the iApp only if there are no iApp services using the template.

name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the iApp template that you want to delete. This option is only available when specifying a C(state) of C(absent) and is provided as a way to delete templates that you may no longer have the source of.
partition: not required, default: Common. # Device partition to manage resources on.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

content: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the contents of an iApp template directly to the specified value. This is for simple values, but can be used with lookup plugins for anything complex or with formatting. C(content) must be provided when creating new templates.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the iRule should exist or not.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_irule.description: Manage iRules across different modules on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_irule
src: required, default: undefined. # The iRule file to interpret and upload to the BIG-IP. Either one of C(src) or C(content) must be provided.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the iRule.
module: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP module to add the iRule to.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

content: not required, default: undefined. # When used instead of 'src', sets the contents of an iRule directly to the specified value. This is for simple values, but can be used with lookup plugins for anything complex or with formatting. Either one of C(src) or C(content) must be provided.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the iRule should exist or not.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_monitor_http.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM http monitors
body: bigip_monitor_http

interval: not required, default: none. # The interval specifying how frequently the monitor instance of this template will run. By default, this interval is used for up and down states. The default API setting is 5.

timeout: not required, default: none. # The number of seconds in which the node or service must respond to the monitor request. If the target responds within the set time period, it is considered up. If the target does not respond within the set time period, it is considered down. You can change this number to any number you want, however, it should be 3 times the interval number of seconds plus 1 second. The default API setting is 16.
parent: not required, default: http. # The parent template of this monitor template
ip: not required, default: none. # IP address part of the ipport definition. The default API setting is "0.0.0.0".

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
port: not required, default: none. # Port address part of the ip/port definition. The default API setting is 0.
receive_disable: required, default: none. # The receive disable string for the monitor call
name: required, default: null. # Monitor name
receive: required, default: none. # The receive string for the monitor call
partition: not required, default: Common. # Partition for the monitor
send: required, default: none. # The send string for the monitor call
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # Monitor state

time_until_up: not required, default: none. # Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the first successful response before a node will be marked up. A value of 0 will cause a node to be marked up immediately after a valid response is received from the node. The default API setting is 0.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
parent_partition: not required, default: Common. # Partition for the parent monitor

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_monitor_tcp.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM tcp monitors.
body: bigip_monitor_tcp
name: required, default: undefined. # Monitor name.

parent: not required, default: /Common/tcp. # The parent template of this monitor template. Once this value has been set, it cannot be changed. By default, this value is the C(tcp) parent on the C(Common) partition.
receive: not required, default: undefined. # The receive string for the monitor call.

ip: not required, default: undefined. # IP address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'.,If this value is an IP address, and the C(type) is C(tcp) (the default), then a C(port) number must be specified.

interval: not required, default: undefined. # The interval specifying how frequently the monitor instance of this template will run. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 5. This value B(must) be less than the C(timeout) value.

timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds in which the node or service must respond to the monitor request. If the target responds within the set time period, it is considered up. If the target does not respond within the set time period, it is considered down. You can change this number to any number you want, however, it should be 3 times the interval number of seconds plus 1 second. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 16.
send: not required, default: undefined. # The send string for the monitor call.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

time_until_up: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the first successful response before a node will be marked up. A value of 0 will cause a node to be marked up immediately after a valid response is received from the node. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 0.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
type: not required, default: tcp. # The template type of this monitor template.,Deprecated in 2.4. Use one of the C(bigip_monitor_tcp_echo) or C(bigip_monitor_tcp_half_open) modules instead.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

port: not required, default: undefined. # Port address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'. Note that if specifying an IP address, a value between 1 and 65535 must be specified,This argument is not supported for TCP Echo types.

bigip_monitor_tcp_echo.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM tcp monitors.
body: bigip_monitor_tcp_echo
name: required, default: undefined. # Monitor name.

parent: not required, default: /Common/tcp. # The parent template of this monitor template. Once this value has been set, it cannot be changed. By default, this value is the C(tcp) parent on the C(Common) partition.

ip: not required, default: undefined. # IP address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'.,If this value is an IP address, and the C(type) is C(tcp) (the default), then a C(port) number must be specified.

interval: not required, default: undefined. # The interval specifying how frequently the monitor instance of this template will run. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 5. This value B(must) be less than the C(timeout) value.

timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds in which the node or service must respond to the monitor request. If the target responds within the set time period, it is considered up. If the target does not respond within the set time period, it is considered down. You can change this number to any number you want, however, it should be 3 times the interval number of seconds plus 1 second. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 16.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

time_until_up: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the first successful response before a node will be marked up. A value of 0 will cause a node to be marked up immediately after a valid response is received from the node. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 0.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_monitor_tcp_half_open.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM tcp monitors.
body: bigip_monitor_tcp_half_open
name: required, default: undefined. # Monitor name.

parent: not required, default: /Common/tcp. # The parent template of this monitor template. Once this value has been set, it cannot be changed. By default, this value is the C(tcp) parent on the C(Common) partition.

ip: not required, default: undefined. # IP address part of the IP/port definition. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be '*'.,If this value is an IP address, and the C(type) is C(tcp) (the default), then a C(port) number must be specified.

interval: not required, default: undefined. # The interval specifying how frequently the monitor instance of this template will run. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 5. This value B(must) be less than the C(timeout) value.

timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds in which the node or service must respond to the monitor request. If the target responds within the set time period, it is considered up. If the target does not respond within the set time period, it is considered down. You can change this number to any number you want, however, it should be 3 times the interval number of seconds plus 1 second. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 16.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

time_until_up: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the amount of time in seconds after the first successful response before a node will be marked up. A value of 0 will cause a node to be marked up immediately after a valid response is received from the node. If this parameter is not provided when creating a new monitor, then the default value will be 0.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_node
monitors: not required, default: null. # Monitor template name list. Always use the full path to the monitor.
session_state: not required, default: null. # Set new session availability status for node
name: not required, default: null. # Node name
monitor_state: not required, default: null. # Set monitor availability status for node
description: not required, default: null. # Node description.
partition: not required, default: Common. # Partition
host: required, default: null. # Node IP. Required when state=present and node does not exist. Error when state=absent.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: required, default: present. # Pool member state

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
monitor_type: not required, default: null. # Monitor rule type when monitors > 1
quorum: not required, default: null. # Monitor quorum value when monitor_type is m_of_n
bigip_pool
lb_method: not required, default: undefined. # Load balancing method. When creating a new pool, if this value is not specified, the default of C(round-robin) will be used.
reselect_tries: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the number of times the system tries to contact a pool member after a passive failure.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies descriptive text that identifies the pool.
service_down_action: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the action to take when node goes down in pool.
host: not required, default: undefined. # Pool member IP.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
monitors: not required, default: undefined. # Monitor template name list. If the partition is not provided as part of the monitor name, then the C(partition) option will be used instead.
name: required, default: undefined. # Pool name
quorum: not required, default: undefined. # Monitor quorum value when C(monitor_type) is C(m_of_n).
slow_ramp_time: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the ramp-up time (in seconds) to gradually ramp up the load on newly added or freshly detected up pool members.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Pool member port.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
monitor_type: not required, default: undefined. # Monitor rule type when C(monitors) > 1.

bigip_pool_member.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM pool members
body: bigip_pool_member
description: not required, default: null. # Pool member description
monitor_state: not required, default: null. # Set monitor availability status for pool member
host: required, default: undefined. # Pool member IP

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
rate_limit: not required, default: null. # Pool member rate limit (connections-per-second). Setting this to 0 disables the limit.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
port: required, default: undefined. # Pool member port
pool: required, default: undefined. # Pool name. This pool must exist.
session_state: not required, default: null. # Set new session availability status for pool member
ratio: not required, default: null. # Pool member ratio weight. Valid values range from 1 through 100. New pool members -- unless overridden with this value -- default to 1.
partition: not required, default: Common. # Partition
connection_limit: not required, default: null. # Pool member connection limit. Setting this to 0 disables the limit.

preserve_node: not required, default: no. # When state is absent and the pool member is no longer referenced in other pools, the default behavior removes the unused node o bject. Setting this to 'yes' disables this behavior.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: required, default: present. # Pool member state
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
priority_group: not required, default: null. # Sets priority group for a pool member.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_provision

level: not required, default: nominal. # Sets the provisioning level for the requested modules. Changing the level for one module may require modifying the level of another module. For example, changing one module to C(dedicated) requires setting all others to C(none). Setting the level of a module to C(none) means that the module is not run.
module: required, default: undefined. # The module to provision in BIG-IP.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the provisioned module on the system. When C(present), guarantees that the specified module is provisioned at the requested level provided that there are sufficient resources on the device (such as physical RAM) to support the provisioned module. When C(absent), de-provision the module.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_qkview
max_file_size: not required, default: 0. # Max file size, in bytes, of the qkview to create. By default, no max file size is specified.
force: not required, default: true. # If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.
complete_information: not required, default: true. # Include complete information in the qkview.
asm_request_log: not required, default: false. # When C(True), includes the ASM request log data. When C(False), excludes the ASM request log data.
dest: required, default: undefined. # Destination on your local filesystem when you want to save the qkview.
filename: not required, default: localhost.localdomain.qkview. # Name of the qkview to create on the remote BIG-IP.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
exclude_core: not required, default: false. # Exclude core files from the qkview.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
exclude: not required, default: undefined. # Exclude various file from the qkview.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_routedomain.description: Manage route domains on a BIG-IP
body: bigip_routedomain

flow_eviction_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The eviction policy to use with this route domain. Apply an eviction policy to provide customized responses to flow overflows and slow flows on the route domain.
service_policy: not required, default: undefined. # Service policy to associate with the route domain.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies descriptive text that identifies the route domain.
parent: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the route domain the system searches when it cannot find a route in the configured domain.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
id: required, default: undefined. # The unique identifying integer representing the route domain.
vlans: not required, default: undefined. # VLANs for the system to use in the route domain
connection_limit: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for the route domain. Setting this to C(0) turns off connection limits.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
strict: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the system enforces cross-routing restrictions or not.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the route domain should exist or not.
routing_protocol: not required, default: undefined. # Dynamic routing protocols for the system to use in the route domain.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
bwc_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The bandwidth controller for the route domain.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_selfip.description: Manage Self-IPs on a BIG-IP system
body: bigip_selfip
name: required, default: Value of C(address). # The self IP to create.
vlan: required, default: undefined. # The VLAN that the new self IPs will be on.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the variable on the system. When C(present), guarantees that the Self-IP exists with the provided attributes. When C(absent), removes the Self-IP from the system.

allow_service: not required, default: undefined. # Configure port lockdown for the Self IP. By default, the Self IP has a "default deny" policy. This can be changed to allow TCP and UDP ports as well as specific protocols. This list should contain C(protocol):C(port) values.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
netmask: required, default: undefined. # The netmasks for the self IP.
route_domain: not required, default: none. # The route domain id of the system. If none, id of the route domain will be "0" (default route domain)

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
address: not required, default: undefined. # The IP addresses for the new self IP. This value is ignored upon update as addresses themselves cannot be changed after they are created.
traffic_group: not required, default: undefined. # The traffic group for the self IP addresses in an active-active, redundant load balancer configuration.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
