validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_snat_pool.description: Manage SNAT pools on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_snat_pool
members: not required, default: None. # List of members to put in the SNAT pool. When a C(state) of present is provided, this parameter is required. Otherwise, it is optional.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the SNAT pool should exist or not.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
append: not required, default: false. # When C(yes), will only add members to the SNAT pool. When C(no), will replace the existing member list with the provided member list.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the SNAT pool.

bigip_snmp.description: Manipulate general SNMP settings on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_snmp

agent_status_traps: not required, default: undefined. # When C(enabled), ensures that the system sends a trap whenever the SNMP agent starts running or stops running. This is usually enabled by default on a BIG-IP.

agent_authentication_traps: not required, default: undefined. # When C(enabled), ensures that the system sends authentication warning traps to the trap destinations. This is usually disabled by default on a BIG-IP.
device_warning_traps: not required, default: undefined. # When C(enabled), ensures that the system sends device warning traps to the trap destinations. This is usually enabled by default on a BIG-IP.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
contact: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the name of the person who administers the SNMP service for this system.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
location: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the description of this system's physical location.

bigip_snmp_trap.description: Manipulate SNMP trap information on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_snmp_trap
snmp_version: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies to which Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) version the trap destination applies.

network: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the name of the trap network. This option is not supported in versions of BIG-IP < 12.1.0. If used on versions < 12.1.0, it will simply be ignored.
destination: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the address for the trap destination. This can be either an IP address or a hostname.
community: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the community name for the trap destination.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present), ensures that the cloud connector exists. When C(absent), ensures that the cloud connector does not exist.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the port for the trap destination.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the SNMP configuration endpoint.
bigip_ssl_certificate

key_src: not required, default: undefined. # This is the local filename of the private key. Either one of C(key_src), C(key_content), C(cert_src) or C(cert_content) must be provided when C(state) is C(present).

key_content: not required, default: undefined. # When used instead of 'key_src', sets the contents of a certificate key directly to the specified value. This is used with lookup plugins or for anything with formatting or templating. Either one of C(key_src), C(key_content), C(cert_src) or C(cert_content) must be provided when C(state) is C(present).
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

cert_src: not required, default: undefined. # This is the local filename of the certificate. Either one of C(key_src), C(key_content), C(cert_src) or C(cert_content) must be provided when C(state) is C(present).
state: not required, default: present. # Certificate and key state. This determines if the provided certificate and key is to be made C(present) on the device or C(absent).

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

cert_content: not required, default: undefined. # When used instead of 'cert_src', sets the contents of a certificate directly to the specified value. This is used with lookup plugins or for anything with formatting or templating. Either one of C(key_src), C(key_content), C(cert_src) or C(cert_content) must be provided when C(state) is C(present).
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
passphrase: not required, default: undefined. # Passphrase on certificate private key

name: required, default: undefined. # SSL Certificate Name.  This is the cert/key pair name used when importing a certificate/key into the F5. It also determines the filenames of the objects on the LTM (:Partition:name.cer_11111_1 and :Partition_name.key_11111_1).
bigip_sys_db
key: required, default: undefined. # The database variable to manipulate.
value: not required, default: undefined. # The value to set the key to. At least one of value and state C(reset) are required.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the variable on the system. When C(present), guarantees that an existing variable is set to C(value). When C(reset) sets the variable back to the default value. At least one of value and state C(reset) are required.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
bigip_sys_global
security_banner: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the system displays an advisory message on the login screen.

net_reboot: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies, when C(enabled), that the next time you reboot the system, the system boots to an ISO image on the network, rather than an internal media drive.
banner_text: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the text to present in the advisory banner.
console_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the number of seconds of inactivity before the system logs off a user that is logged on.

quiet_boot: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies, when C(enabled), that the system suppresses informational text on the console during the boot cycle. When C(disabled), the system presents messages and informational text on the console during the boot cycle.
mgmt_dhcp: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether or not to enable DHCP client on the management interface
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the variable on the system. When C(present), guarantees that an existing variable is set to C(value).

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
gui_setup: not required, default: undefined. # C(enable) or C(disabled) the Setup utility in the browser-based Configuration utility
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

lcd_display: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies, when C(enabled), that the system menu displays on the LCD screen on the front of the unit. This setting has no effect when used on the VE platform.

bigip_ucs.description: Manage upload, installation and removal of UCS files.
body: bigip_ucs

no_license: not required, default: undefined. # Performs a full restore of the UCS file and all the files it contains, with the exception of the license file. The option must be used to restore a UCS on RMA devices (Returned Materials Authorization).

force: not required, default: undefined. # If C(yes) will upload the file every time and replace the file on the device. If C(no), the file will only be uploaded if it does not already exist. Generally should be C(yes) only in cases where you have reason to believe that the image was corrupted during upload.
reset_trust: not required, default: undefined. # When specified, the device and trust domain certs and keys are not loaded from the UCS. Instead, a new set is regenerated.

no_platform_check: not required, default: undefined. # Bypasses the platform check and allows a UCS that was created using a different platform to be installed. By default (without this option), a UCS created from a different platform is not allowed to be installed.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # When C(installed), ensures that the UCS is uploaded and installed, on the system. When C(present), ensures that the UCS is uploaded. When C(absent), the UCS will be removed from the system. When C(installed), the uploading of the UCS is idempotent, however the installation of that configuration is not idempotent.

include_chassis_level_config: not required, default: undefined. # During restore of the UCS file, include chassis level configuration that is shared among boot volume sets. For example, cluster default configuration.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

ucs: not required, default: undefined. # The path to the UCS file to install. The parameter must be provided if the C(state) is either C(installed) or C(activated). When C(state) is C(absent), the full path for this parameter will be ignored and only the filename will be used to select a UCS for removal. Therefore you could specify C(/mickey/mouse/test.ucs) and this module would only look for C(test.ucs).
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
passphrase: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the passphrase that is necessary to load the specified UCS file.

bigip_user.description: Manage user accounts and user attributes on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_user
update_password: not required, default: on_create. # C(always) will allow to update passwords if the user chooses to do so. C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
shell: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set the users shell.
full_name: not required, default: undefined. # Full name of the user.
password_credential: not required, default: undefined. # Set the users password to this unencrypted value. C(password_credential) is required when creating a new account.
username_credential: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user to create, remove or modify.

partition_access: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the administrative partition to which the user has access. C(partition_access) is required when creating a new account. Should be in the form "partition:role". Valid roles include C(acceleration-policy-editor), C(admin), C(application-editor), C(auditor) C(certificate-manager), C(guest), C(irule-manager), C(manager), C(no-access) C(operator), C(resource-admin), C(user-manager), C(web-application-security-administrator), and C(web-application-security-editor). Partition portion of tuple should be an existing partition or the value 'all'.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the account should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_virtual_address.description: Manage LTM virtual addresses on a BIG-IP.
body: bigip_virtual_address

icmp_echo: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies how the systems sends responses to (ICMP) echo requests on a per-virtual address basis for enabling route advertisement. When C(enabled), the BIG-IP system intercepts ICMP echo request packets and responds to them directly. When C(disabled), the BIG-IP system passes ICMP echo requests through to the backend servers. When (selective), causes the BIG-IP system to internally enable or disable responses based on virtual server state; C(when_any_available), C(when_all_available, or C(always), regardless of the state of any virtual servers.

auto_delete: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the system automatically deletes the virtual address with the deletion of the last associated virtual server. When C(disabled), specifies that the system leaves the virtual address even when all associated virtual servers have been deleted. When creating the virtual address, the default value is C(enabled).
connection_limit: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the number of concurrent connections that the system allows on this virtual address.

state: not required, default: present. # The virtual address state. If C(absent), an attempt to delete the virtual address will be made. This will only succeed if this virtual address is not in use by a virtual server. C(present) creates the virtual address and enables it. If C(enabled), enable the virtual address if it exists. If C(disabled), create the virtual address if needed, and set state to C(disabled).
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
netmask: not required, default: 255.255.255.255. # Netmask of the provided virtual address. This value cannot be modified after it is set.

arp_state: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the system accepts ARP requests. When (disabled), specifies that the system does not accept ARP requests. Note that both ARP and ICMP Echo must be disabled in order for forwarding virtual servers using that virtual address to forward ICMP packets. If (enabled), then the packets are dropped.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
address: required, default: undefined. # Virtual address. This value cannot be modified after it is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

use_route_advertisement: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies whether the system uses route advertisement for this virtual address. When disabled, the system does not advertise routes for this virtual address.

advertise_route: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies what routes of the virtual address the system advertises. When C(when_any_available), advertises the route when any virtual server is available. When C(when_all_available), advertises the route when all virtual servers are available. When (always), always advertises the route regardless of the virtual servers available.

bigip_virtual_server.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM virtual servers
body: bigip_virtual_server
route_advertisement_state: not required, default: disabled. # Enable route advertisement for destination
partition: not required, default: Common. # Partition
description: not required, default: None. # Virtual server description
fallback_persistence_profile: not required, default: None. # Specifies the persistence profile you want the system to use if it cannot use the specified default persistence profile.
default_persistence_profile: not required, default: None. # Default Profile which manages the session persistence
all_rules: not required, default: None. # List of rules to be applied in priority order
enabled_vlans: not required, default: None. # List of vlans to be enabled. When a VLAN named C(ALL) is used, all VLANs will be allowed.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.
port: not required, default: None. # Port of the virtual server. Required when state=present and vs does not exist. If you specify a value for this field, it must be a number between 0 and 65535.
all_policies: not required, default: None. # List of all policies enabled for the virtual server.
name: required, default: undefined. # Virtual server name
snat: not required, default: None. # Source network address policy
destination: required, default: undefined. # Destination IP of the virtual server (only host is currently supported). Required when state=present and vs does not exist.
all_profiles: not required, default: None. # List of all Profiles (HTTP,ClientSSL,ServerSSL,etc) that must be used by the virtual server
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # Virtual Server state,Absent, delete the VS if present,C(present) (and its synonym enabled), create if needed the VS and set state to enabled,C(disabled), create if needed the VS and set state to disabled
pool: not required, default: None. # Default pool for the virtual server
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.

bigip_vlan.description: Manage VLANs on a BIG-IP system
body: bigip_vlan
name: required, default: undefined. # The VLAN to manage. If the special VLAN C(ALL) is specified with the C(state) value of C(absent) then all VLANs will be removed.

tagged_interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies a list of tagged interfaces and trunks that you want to configure for the VLAN. Use tagged interfaces or trunks when you want to assign a single interface or trunk to multiple VLANs.
untagged_interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies a list of untagged interfaces and trunks that you want to configure for the VLAN.
server: required, default: undefined. # The BIG-IP host. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the VLAN on the system. When C(present), guarantees that the VLAN exists with the provided attributes. When C(absent), removes the VLAN from the system.
tag: not required, default: undefined. # Tag number for the VLAN. The tag number can be any integer between 1 and 4094. The system automatically assigns a tag number if you do not specify a value.

user: required, default: undefined. # The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server_port: not required, default: 443. # The BIG-IP server port. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. This option can be omitted if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description to give to the VLAN.

bigmon_chain.description: Create and remove a bigmon inline service chain.
body: bigmon_chain
access_token: not required, default: undefined. # Bigmon access token. If this isn't set, the environment variable C(BIGSWITCH_ACCESS_TOKEN) is used.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the service chain should be present or absent.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
controller: required, default: undefined. # The controller IP address.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the chain.

bigmon_policy.description: Create and remove a bigmon out-of-band policy.
body: bigmon_policy
policy_description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of policy.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the policy.
access_token: not required, default: undefined. # Bigmon access token. If this isn't set, the environment variable C(BIGSWITCH_ACCESS_TOKEN) is used.
start_time: not required, default: ansible_date_time.iso8601. # Date the policy becomes active
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the policy should be present or absent.
priority: not required, default: 100. # A priority associated with this policy. The higher priority policy takes precedence over a lower priority.

action: not required, default: forward. # Forward matching packets to delivery interfaces, Drop is for measure rate of matching packets, but do not forward to delivery interfaces, capture packets and write to a PCAP file, or enable NetFlow generation.
controller: required, default: undefined. # The controller address.
duration: not required, default: 0. # Run policy for duration duration or until delivery_packet_count packets are delivered, whichever comes first.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
delivery_packet_count: not required, default: 0. # Run policy until delivery_packet_count packets are delivered.
bigpanda
description: not required, default: undefined. # Free text description of the deployment.
url: not required, default: https://api.bigpanda.io. # Base URL of the API server.
component: required, default: undefined. # The name of the component being deployed. Ex: billing
token: required, default: undefined. # API token.
state: required, default: undefined. # State of the deployment.
version: required, default: undefined. # The deployment version.
hosts: not required, default: machine's hostname. # Name of affected host name. Can be a list.
env: not required, default: undefined. # The environment name, typically 'production', 'staging', etc.
owner: not required, default: undefined. # The person responsible for the deployment.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

blockinfile.description: Insert/update/remove a text block surrounded by marker lines.
body: blockinfile
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

insertafter: not required, default: EOF. # If specified, the block will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the block at the end of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, C(EOF) will be used instead.
path: required, default: undefined. # The file to modify.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).
marker: not required, default: # {mark} ANSIBLE MANAGED BLOCK. # The marker line template. "{mark}" will be replaced with "BEGIN" or "END".
follow: not required, default: no. # This flag indicates that filesystem links, if they exist, should be followed.

validate: not required, default: None. # The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

insertbefore: not required, default: None. # If specified, the block will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the block at the beginning of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, the block will be inserted at the end of the file.

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
create: not required, default: no. # Create a new file if it doesn't exist.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the block should be there or not.

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
block: not required, default: . # The text to insert inside the marker lines. If it's missing or an empty string, the block will be removed as if C(state) were specified to C(absent).
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
boundary_meter
state: not required, default: true. # Whether to create or remove the client from boundary
apikey: required, default: undefined. # Organizations boundary API KEY
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
apiid: required, default: undefined. # Organizations boundary API ID
name: required, default: undefined. # meter name
bower
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the bower package
production: not required, default: false. # Install with --production flag
name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of a bower package to install
version: not required, default: undefined. # The version to be installed
relative_execpath: not required, default: null. # Relative path to bower executable from install path
path: required, default: undefined. # The base path where to install the bower packages
offline: not required, default: false. # Install packages from local cache, if the packages were installed before

bundler.description: Manage Ruby Gem dependencies with Bundler
body: bundler
executable: not required, default: null. # The path to the bundler executable
chdir: not required, default: temporary working directory. # The directory to execute the bundler commands from. This directoy needs to contain a valid Gemfile or .bundle/ directory
gemfile: not required, default: Gemfile in current directory. # Only applies if state is C(present). The path to the gemfile to use to install gems.
clean: not required, default: no. # Only applies if state is C(present). If set removes any gems on the target host that are not in the gemfile
user_install: not required, default: yes. # Only applies if state is C(present). Installs gems in the local user's cache or for all users
extra_args: not required, default: null. # A space separated string of additional commands that can be applied to the Bundler command. Refer to the Bundler documentation for more information
state: not required, default: present. # The desired state of the Gem bundle. C(latest) updates gems to the most recent, acceptable version

deployment_mode: not required, default: no. # Only applies if state is C(present). If set it will only install gems that are in the default or production groups. Requires a Gemfile.lock file to have been created prior

binstub_directory: not required, default: null. # Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install any gem bins files to. When executed the bin files will run within the context of the Gemfile and fail if any required gem dependencies are not installed. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)

exclude_groups: not required, default: null. # A list of Gemfile groups to exclude during operations. This only applies when state is C(present). Bundler considers this a 'remembered' property for the Gemfile and will automatically exclude groups in future operations even if C(exclude_groups) is not set
local: not required, default: no. # If set only installs gems from the cache on the target host
gem_path: not required, default: RubyGems gem paths. # Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install the gems into. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)

bzr.description: Deploy software (or files) from bzr branches
body: bzr
dest: required, default: undefined. # Absolute path of where the branch should be cloned to.
executable: not required, default: null. # Path to bzr executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.
version: not required, default: head. # What version of the branch to clone.  This can be the bzr revno or revid.
force: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), any modified files in the working tree will be discarded.  Before 1.9 the default value was "yes".
name: required, default: undefined. # SSH or HTTP protocol address of the parent branch.
campfire
msg: required, default: undefined. # The message body.
token: required, default: undefined. # API token.
subscription: required, default: undefined. # The subscription name to use.
notify: not required, default: undefined. # Send a notification sound before the message.
room: required, default: undefined. # Room number to which the message should be sent.
capabilities
capability: required, default: null. # Desired capability to set (with operator and flags, if state is C(present)) or remove (if state is C(absent))
path: required, default: null. # Specifies the path to the file to be managed.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the entry should be present or absent in the file's capabilities.

catapult.description: Send a sms / mms using the catapult bandwidth api
body: catapult
src: required, default: null. # One of your catapult telephone numbers the message should come from (must be in E.164 format, like C(+19195551212)).
user_id: required, default: null. # User Id from Api account page.
api_secret: required, default: null. # Api Secret from Api account page.
dest: required, default: null. # The phone number or numbers the message should be sent to (must be in E.164 format, like C(+19195551212)).
media: not required, default: undefined. # For MMS messages, a media url to the location of the media to be sent with the message.
api_token: required, default: null. # Api Token from Api account page.
msg: required, default: null. # The contents of the text message (must be 2048 characters or less).

ce_aaa_server.description: Manages AAA server global configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_aaa_server
acct_scheme_name: not required, default: null. # Accounting scheme name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
first_author_mode: not required, default: null. # Preferred authorization mode.
authen_scheme_name: not required, default: null. # Name of an authentication scheme. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
author_scheme_name: not required, default: null. # Name of an authorization scheme. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
radius_server_group: not required, default: null. # RADIUS server group's name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
domain_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a domain. The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.
first_authen_mode: not required, default: null. # Preferred authentication mode.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
local_user_group: not required, default: null. # Name of the user group where the user belongs. The user inherits all the rights of the user group. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
hwtacas_template: not required, default: null. # Name of a HWTACACS template. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
accounting_mode: not required, default: null. # Accounting Mode.

ce_aaa_server_host.description: Manages AAA server host configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_aaa_server_host
radius_server_port: not required, default: null. # Configured server port for a particular server. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
hwtacacs_server_ipv6: not required, default: null. # Server IPv6 address. Must be a valid unicast IP address. The total length is 128 bits.
local_service_type: not required, default: null. # The type of local user login through, such as ftp ssh snmp telnet.
radius_server_name: not required, default: null. # Hostname of configured server. The value is a string of 0 to 255 case-sensitive characters.
radius_server_mode: not required, default: null. # Configured primary or secondary server for a particular server.
hwtacacs_server_type: not required, default: null. # Hwtacacs server type.
radius_vpn_name: not required, default: null. # Set VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.
radius_server_ipv6: not required, default: null. # IPv6 address of configured server. The total length is 128 bits.
radius_server_type: not required, default: null. # Type of Radius Server.
hwtacacs_server_ip: not required, default: null. # Server IPv4 address. Must be a valid unicast IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters, in dotted decimal notation.
local_user_group: not required, default: null. # Name of the user group where the user belongs. The user inherits all the rights of the user group. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
local_user_level: not required, default: null. # Login level of a local user. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15.
radius_server_ip: not required, default: null. # IPv4 address of configured server. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters, in dotted decimal notation.
local_ftp_dir: not required, default: null. # FTP user directory. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
hwtacacs_vpn_name: not required, default: null. # VPN instance name.
hwtacacs_is_secondary_server: not required, default: false. # Whether the server is secondary.
radius_group_name: not required, default: null. # RADIUS server group's name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
hwtacacs_template: not required, default: null. # Name of a HWTACACS template. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
local_password: not required, default: null. # Login password of a user. The password can contain letters, numbers, and special characters. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
hwtacacs_server_host_name: not required, default: null. # Hwtacacs server host name.
local_user_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a local user. The value is a string of 1 to 253 characters.
hwtacacs_is_public_net: not required, default: false. # Set the public-net.

ce_acl.description: Manages base ACL configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl
acl_step: not required, default: null. # ACL step. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20. The default value is 5.

acl_name: required, default: undefined. # ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 2000 to 2999 indicates a basic ACL. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.
log_flag: not required, default: false. # Flag of logging matched data packets.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Source IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
src_mask: not required, default: null. # Mask of a source IP address. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.
rule_action: not required, default: null. # Matching mode of basic ACL rules.

rule_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a basic ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The value is case-insensitive, and cannot contain spaces or begin with an underscore (_).
acl_num: not required, default: null. # ACL number. The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.
vrf_name: not required, default: null. # VPN instance name. The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.The default value is _public_.
acl_description: not required, default: null. # ACL description. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
rule_id: not required, default: null. # ID of a basic ACL rule in configuration mode. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

time_range: not required, default: null. # Name of a time range in which an ACL rule takes effect. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The value is case-insensitive, and cannot contain spaces. The name must start with an uppercase or lowercase letter. In addition, the word "all" cannot be specified as a time range name.
rule_description: not required, default: null. # Description about an ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
frag_type: not required, default: null. # Type of packet fragmentation.

ce_acl_advance.description: Manages advanced ACL configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl_advance
acl_step: not required, default: null. # ACL step. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20. The default value is 5.
protocol: not required, default: null. # Protocol type.
precedence: not required, default: null. # Data packets can be filtered based on the priority field. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.
src_port_op: not required, default: null. # Range type of the source port.
log_flag: not required, default: false. # Flag of logging matched data packets.
time_range: not required, default: null. # Name of a time range in which an ACL rule takes effect.
src_port_begin: not required, default: null. # Start port number of the source port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
frag_type: not required, default: null. # Type of packet fragmentation.
dest_port_op: not required, default: null. # Range type of the destination port.
dest_pool_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a destination pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
acl_description: not required, default: null. # ACL description. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
ttl_expired: not required, default: false. # Whether TTL Expired is matched, with the TTL value of 1.
icmp_type: not required, default: null. # ICMP type. This parameter is available only when the packet protocol is ICMP. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.
src_mask: not required, default: null. # Source IP address mask. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.
icmp_name: not required, default: null. # ICMP name.
established: not required, default: false. # Match established connections.
igmp_type: not required, default: null. # Internet Group Management Protocol.
tos: not required, default: null. # ToS value on which data packet filtering is based. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15.
acl_num: not required, default: null. # ACL number. The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999.
rule_action: not required, default: null. # Matching mode of basic ACL rules.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
tcp_flag_mask: not required, default: null. # TCP flag mask value. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
src_port_end: not required, default: null. # End port number of the source port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
dest_ip: not required, default: null. # Destination IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
icmp_code: not required, default: null. # ICMP message code. Data packets can be filtered based on the ICMP message code. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.
dest_port_end: not required, default: null. # End port number of the destination port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

acl_name: required, default: undefined. # ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 3000 to 3999 indicates a advance ACL. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.
dscp: not required, default: null. # Differentiated Services Code Point. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
rule_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a basic ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
rule_description: not required, default: null. # Description about an ACL rule.
dest_mask: not required, default: null. # Destination IP address mask. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.
src_port_pool_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a source port pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Source IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
syn_flag: not required, default: null. # TCP flag value. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
vrf_name: not required, default: null. # VPN instance name. The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.The default value is _public_.
src_pool_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a source pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
dest_port_begin: not required, default: null. # Start port number of the destination port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
dest_port_pool_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a destination port pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
rule_id: not required, default: null. # ID of a basic ACL rule in configuration mode. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.

ce_acl_interface.description: Manages applying ACLs to interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl_interface
interface: required, default: undefined. # Interface name. Only support interface full name, such as "40GE2/0/1".
direction: required, default: undefined. # Direction ACL to be applied in on the interface.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

acl_name: required, default: undefined. # ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 2000 to 4999. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.

ce_bfd_global.description: Manages BFD global configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_global

tos_exp_dynamic: not required, default: null. # Indicates the priority of BFD control packets for dynamic BFD sessions. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default priority is 7, which is the highest priority of BFD control packets.
default_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the default multicast IP address. The value ranges from 224.0.0.107 to 224.0.0.250.

damp_init_wait_time: not required, default: null. # Specifies an initial flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.
bfd_enable: not required, default: null. # Enables the global Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) function.

delay_up_time: not required, default: null. # Specifies the delay before a BFD session becomes Up. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds. The default value is 0, indicating that a BFD session immediately becomes Up.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

damp_max_wait_time: not required, default: null. # Specifies a maximum flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 15000.

damp_second_wait_time: not required, default: null. # Specifies a secondary flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 5000.

tos_exp_static: not required, default: null. # Indicates the priority of BFD control packets for static BFD sessions. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default priority is 7, which is the highest priority of BFD control packets.

ce_bfd_session.description: Manages BFD session configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_session
src_addr: not required, default: null. # Indicates the source IP address carried in BFD packets.
out_if_name: not required, default: null. # Specifies the type and number of the interface bound to the BFD session.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
dest_addr: not required, default: null. # Specifies the peer IP address bound to the BFD session.

vrf_name: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a Virtual Private Network (VPN) instance that is bound to a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value _public_ is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
create_type: not required, default: null. # BFD session creation mode, the currently created BFD session only supports static or static auto-negotiation mode.
session_name: required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

use_default_ip: not required, default: false. # Indicates the default multicast IP address that is bound to a BFD session. By default, BFD uses the multicast IP address 224.0.0.184. You can set the multicast IP address by running the default-ip-address command. The value is a bool type.
addr_type: not required, default: null. # Specifies the peer IP address type.

ce_bfd_view.description: Manages BFD session view configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_view
local_discr: not required, default: null. # Specifies the local discriminator of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 16384.
detect_multi: not required, default: null. # Specifies the local detection multiplier of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 3 to 50.
remote_discr: not required, default: null. # Specifies the remote discriminator of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
description: not required, default: null. # Specifies the description of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters with spaces.
admin_down: not required, default: false. # Enables the BFD session to enter the AdminDown state. By default, a BFD session is enabled. The default value is bool type.
tos_exp: not required, default: null. # Specifies a priority for BFD control packets. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default value is 7, which is the highest priority.
min_tx_interval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the minimum interval for receiving BFD packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
min_rx_interval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the minimum interval for sending BFD packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
session_name: required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters without spaces.
wtr_interval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the WTR time of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 60, in minutes. The default value is 0.

ce_bgp.description: Manages BGP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp
router_id: not required, default: null. # ID of a router that is in IPv4 address format.
memory_limit: not required, default: no_use. # Support BGP RIB memory protection.

vrf_rid_auto_sel: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, VPN BGP instances are enabled to automatically select router IDs. If the value is false, VPN BGP instances are disabled from automatically selecting router IDs.
suppress_interval: not required, default: null. # Suppress interval.
as_number: not required, default: null. # Local AS number. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
confed_id_number: not required, default: null. # Confederation ID. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
bgp_rid_auto_sel: not required, default: no_use. # The function to automatically select router IDs for all VPN BGP instances is enabled.
default_af_type: not required, default: null. # Type of a created address family, which can be IPv4 unicast or IPv6 unicast. The default type is IPv4 unicast.
conn_retry_time: not required, default: null. # ConnectRetry interval. The value is an integer, in seconds. The default value is 32s.
is_shutdown: not required, default: no_use. # Interrupt BGP all neighbor.

keepalive_time: not required, default: null. # If the value of a timer changes, the BGP peer relationship between the routers is disconnected. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 21845. The default value is 60.
confed_peer_as_num: not required, default: null. # Confederation AS number, in two-byte or four-byte format. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
min_hold_time: not required, default: null. # Min hold time, in seconds. The value of the hold time can be 0 or range from 20 to 65535.

ebgp_if_sensitive: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, After the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are deleted immediately when the interface goes Down. If the value is  false, After the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are not deleted immediately when the interface goes Down.
check_first_as: not required, default: no_use. # Check the first AS in the AS_Path of the update messages from EBGP peers.
clear_interval: not required, default: null. # Clear interval.
confed_nonstanded: not required, default: no_use. # Configure the device to be compatible with devices in a nonstandard confederation.
time_wait_for_rib: not required, default: null. # Period of waiting for the End-Of-RIB flag. The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 3000. The default value is 600.
hold_time: not required, default: null. # Hold time, in seconds. The value of the hold time can be 0 or range from 3 to 65535.
as_path_limit: not required, default: null. # Maximum number of AS numbers in the AS_Path attribute. The default value is 255.
hold_interval: not required, default: null. # Hold interval.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
vrf_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters.

keep_all_routes: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the system stores all route update messages received from all peers (groups) after BGP connection setup. If the value is false, the system stores only BGP update messages that are received from peers and pass the configured import policy.
gr_peer_reset: not required, default: no_use. # Peer disconnection through GR.
graceful_restart: not required, default: no_use. # Enable GR of the BGP speaker in the specified address family, peer address, or peer group.

ce_bgp_af.description: Manages BGP Address-family configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_af

reflector_cluster_id: not required, default: null. # Set a cluster ID. Configuring multiple RRs in a cluster can enhance the stability of the network. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
ingress_lsp_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Ingress lsp policy name.

vrf_rid_auto_sel: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, VPN BGP instances are enabled to automatically select router IDs. If the value is false, VPN BGP instances are disabled from automatically selecting router IDs.
preference_internal: not required, default: null. # Set the protocol priority of IBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
maximum_load_balance: not required, default: null. # Specify the maximum number of equal-cost routes in the BGP routing table. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
preference_local: not required, default: null. # Set the protocol priority of a local BGP route. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
preference_external: not required, default: null. # Set the protocol priority of EBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

router_id_neglect: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the router ID attribute is ignored when BGP selects the optimal route. If the value is false, the router ID attribute is not ignored when BGP selects the optimal route.
default_local_pref: not required, default: null. # Set the Local-Preference attribute. The value is an integer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
reflector_cluster_ipv4: not required, default: null. # Set a cluster ipv4 address. The value is expressed in the format of an IPv4 address.

prefrence_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Set a routing policy to filter routes so that a configured priority is applied to the routes that match the specified policy. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.

default_rt_import_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, importing default routes to the BGP routing table is allowed. If the value is false, importing default routes to the BGP routing table is not allowed.
nhp_relay_route_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the name of a route-policy for route iteration. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.

igp_metric_ignore: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the metrics of next-hop IGP routes are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the metrics of next-hop IGP routes are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route. A route with a smaller metric has a higher priority.

as_path_neglect: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the AS path attribute is ignored when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the AS path attribute is not ignored when BGP selects an optimal route. An AS path with a smaller length has a higher priority.
auto_frr_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP auto FRR is enabled. If the value is false, BGP auto FRR is disabled.
mask_len: not required, default: null. # Specify the mask length of an IP address. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

ibgp_ecmp_nexthop_changed: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in IBGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in IBGP load-balancing scenarios.
af_type: required, default: undefined. # Address family type of a BGP instance.
nexthop_third_party: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the third-party next hop function is enabled. If the value is false, the third-party next hop function is disabled.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
default_med: not required, default: null. # Specify the Multi-Exit-Discriminator (MED) of BGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
add_path_sel_num: not required, default: null. # Number of Add-Path routes. The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 64.

med_none_as_maximum: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, when BGP selects an optimal route, the system uses 4294967295 as the MED value of a route if the route's attribute does not carry a MED value. If the value is false, the system uses 0 as the MED value of a route if the route's attribute does not carry a MED value.

ebgp_ecmp_nexthop_changed: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in EBGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in EBGP load-balancing scenarios.

ecmp_nexthop_changed: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in BGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in BGP load-balancing scenarios.
lowest_priority: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, enable reduce priority to advertise route. If the value is false, disable reduce priority to advertise route.
rr_filter_number: not required, default: null. # Set the number of the extended community filter supported by an RR group. The value is a string of 1 to 51 characters.
import_process_id: not required, default: null. # Process ID of an imported routing protocol. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
router_id: not required, default: null. # ID of a router that is in IPv4 address format. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
determin_med: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP deterministic-MED is enabled. If the value is false, BGP deterministic-MED is disabled.
load_balancing_as_path_ignore: not required, default: no_use. # Load balancing as path ignore.

reflect_chg_path: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the route reflector is enabled to modify route path attributes based on an export policy. If the value is false, the route reflector is disabled from modifying route path attributes based on an export policy.

always_compare_med: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the MEDs of routes learned from peers in different autonomous systems are compared when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the MEDs of routes learned from peers in different autonomous systems are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route.

allow_invalid_as: not required, default: no_use. # Allow routes with BGP origin AS validation result Invalid to be selected. If the value is true, invalid routes can participate in route selection. If the value is false, invalid routes cannot participate in route selection.
relay_delay_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, relay delay enable. If the value is false, relay delay disable.
rib_only_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the name of a routing policy. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
max_load_ebgp_num: not required, default: null. # Specify the maximum number of equal-cost EBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
import_protocol: not required, default: null. # Routing protocol from which routes can be imported.

ebgp_if_sensitive: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, after the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are deleted immediately when the interface goes Down. If the value is false, after the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are not deleted immediately when the interface goes Down.
network_address: not required, default: null. # Specify the IP address advertised by BGP. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.

supernet_uni_adv: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the function to advertise supernetwork unicast routes is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise supernetwork unicast routes is disabled.
next_hop_sel_depend_type: not required, default: default. # Next hop select depend type.
originator_prior: not required, default: no_use. # Originator prior.

active_route_advertise: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP is enabled to advertise only optimal routes in the RM to peers. If the value is false, BGP is not enabled to advertise only optimal routes in the RM to peers.
reflect_between_client: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, route reflection is enabled between clients. If the value is false, route reflection is disabled between clients.

policy_vpn_target: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, VPN-Target filtering function is performed for received VPN routes. If the value is false, VPN-Target filtering function is not performed for received VPN routes.

summary_automatic: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, automatic aggregation is enabled for locally imported routes. If the value is false, automatic aggregation is disabled for locally imported routes.

rib_only_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP routes cannot be advertised to the IP routing table. If the value is false, Routes preferred by BGP are advertised to the IP routing table.
max_load_ibgp_num: not required, default: null. # Specify the maximum number of equal-cost IBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
route_sel_delay: not required, default: null. # Route selection delay. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600.

supernet_label_adv: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the function to advertise supernetwork label is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise supernetwork label is disabled.

vrf_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

policy_ext_comm_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, modifying extended community attributes is allowed. If the value is false, modifying extended community attributes is not allowed.

ce_bgp_neighbor.description: Manages BGP peer configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_neighbor
prepend_global_as: not required, default: no_use. # Add the global AS number to the Update packets to be advertised.
ebgp_max_hop: not required, default: null. # Maximum number of hops in an indirect EBGP connection. The value is an ranging from 1 to 255.

is_ignore: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the session with a specified peer is torn down and all related routing entries are cleared. If the value is false, the session with a specified peer is retained.
prepend_fake_as: not required, default: no_use. # Add the Fake AS number to received Update packets.
fake_as: not required, default: null. # Fake AS number that is specified for a local peer. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.

is_single_hop: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the system is enabled to preferentially use the single-hop mode for BFD session setup between IBGP peers. If the value is false, the system is disabled from preferentially using the single-hop mode for BFD session setup between IBGP peers.
conventional: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the router has all extended capabilities. If the value is false, the router does not have all extended capabilities.
remote_as: required, default: undefined. # AS number of a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
hold_time: not required, default: null. # Specify the Hold time of a peer or peer group. The value is 0 or an integer ranging from 3 to 65535.
tx_interval: not required, default: null. # Specify the minimum interval at which BFD packets are sent. The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
pswd_cipher_text: not required, default: null. # The character string in a password identifies the contents of the password, spaces not supported. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
local_if_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a source interface that sends BGP packets. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
rx_interval: not required, default: null. # Specify the minimum interval at which BFD packets are received. The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
vrf_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created.

dual_as: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the EBGP peer can use either a fake AS number or the actual AS number. If the value is false, the EBGP peer can only use a fake AS number.
connect_mode: not required, default: null. # The value can be Connect-only, Listen-only, or Both.
description: not required, default: null. # Description of a peer, which can be letters or digits. The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters.

is_log_change: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP is enabled to record peer session status and event information. If the value is false, BGP is disabled from recording peer session status and event information.
keep_alive_time: not required, default: null. # Specify the Keepalive time of a peer or peer group. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 21845. The default value is 60.
key_chain_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the Keychain authentication name used when BGP peers establish a TCP connection. The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-insensitive characters.
conn_retry_time: not required, default: null. # ConnectRetry interval. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
min_hold_time: not required, default: null. # Specify the Min hold time of a peer or peer group.
multiplier: not required, default: null. # Specify the detection multiplier. The default value is 3. The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 50.

valid_ttl_hops: not required, default: null. # Enable GTSM on a peer or peer group. The valid-TTL-Value parameter is used to specify the number of TTL hops to be detected. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

is_bfd_block: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, peers are enabled to inherit the BFD function from the peer group. If the value is false, peers are disabled to inherit the BFD function from the peer group.
tcp_MSS: not required, default: null. # Maximum TCP MSS value used for TCP connection establishment for a peer. The value is an integer ranging from 176 to 4096.
is_bfd_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BFD is enabled. If the value is false, BFD is disabled.
route_refresh: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, BGP is enabled to advertise REFRESH packets. If the value is false, the route refresh function is enabled.
peer_addr: required, default: undefined. # Connection address of a peer, which can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
pswd_type: not required, default: null. # Enable BGP peers to establish a TCP connection and perform the Message Digest 5 (MD5) authentication for BGP messages.
mpls_local_ifnet_disable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, peer create MPLS Local IFNET disable. If the value is false, peer create MPLS Local IFNET enable.

ce_bgp_neighbor_af.description: Manages BGP neighbor Address-family configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_neighbor_af
import_pref_filt_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the IPv4 filtering policy applied to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 169 characters.
advertise_irb: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, advertised IRB routes are distinguished. If the value is false, advertised IRB routes are not distinguished.

substitute_as_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the function to replace a specified peer's AS number in the AS-Path attribute with the local AS number is enabled. If the value is false, the function to replace a specified peer's AS number in the AS-Path attribute with the local AS number is disabled.

advertise_ext_community: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the extended community attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the extended community attribute is not advertised to peers.

default_rt_match_mode: not required, default: null. # null, Null. matchall, Advertise the default route if all matching conditions are met. matchany, Advertise the default route if any matching condition is met.
redirect_ip: not required, default: no_use. # Redirect ip.
route_limit: not required, default: null. # Configure the maximum number of routes that can be accepted from a peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
import_as_path_filter: not required, default: null. # Apply an AS_Path-based filtering policy to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

public_as_only_force: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, sent BGP update messages carry only the public AS number but do not carry private AS numbers. If the value is false, sent BGP update messages can carry private AS numbers.
vpls_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, vpls enable. If the value is false, vpls disable.
allow_as_loop_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, repetitive local AS numbers are allowed. If the value is false, repetitive local AS numbers are not allowed.
advertise_arp: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, advertised ARP routes are distinguished. If the value is false, advertised ARP routes are not distinguished.
import_as_path_name_or_num: not required, default: null. # A routing strategy based on the AS path list for routing received by a designated peer.
af_type: required, default: undefined. # Address family type of a BGP instance.
orf_mode: not required, default: null. # ORF mode. null, Default value. receive, ORF for incoming packets. send, ORF for outgoing packets. both, ORF for incoming and outgoing packets.

nexthop_configure: not required, default: null. # null, The next hop is not changed. local, The next hop is changed to the local IP address. invariable, Prevent the device from changing the next hop of each imported IGP route when advertising it to its BGP peers.

discard_ext_community: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the extended community attribute in the peer route information is discarded. If the value is false, the extended community attribute in the peer route information is not discarded.

is_nonstd_ipprefix_mod: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, Non-standard capability codes are used during capability negotiation. If the value is false, RFC-defined standard ORF capability codes are used during capability negotiation.

keep_all_routes: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the system stores all route update messages received from all peers (groups) after BGP connection setup. If the value is false, the system stores only BGP update messages that are received from peers and pass the configured import policy.
