orftype: not required, default: null. # ORF Type. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
advertise_community: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the community attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the community attribute is not advertised to peers.
export_as_path_name_or_num: not required, default: null. # Application of a AS path list based filtering policy to the routing of a specified peer.
adv_add_path_num: not required, default: null. # The number of addPath advertise route. The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 64.

ipprefix_orf_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the address prefix-based Outbound Route Filter (ORF) capability is enabled for peers. If the value is false, the address prefix-based Outbound Route Filter (ORF) capability is disabled for peers.

route_limit_type: not required, default: null. # Noparameter, After the number of received routes exceeds the threshold and the timeout timer expires,no action. AlertOnly, An alarm is generated and no additional routes will be accepted if the maximum number of routes allowed have been received. IdleForever, The connection that is interrupted is not automatically re-established if the maximum number of routes allowed have been received. IdleTimeout, After the number of received routes exceeds the threshold and the timeout timer expires, the connection that is interrupted is automatically re-established.
remote_address: required, default: undefined. # IPv4 or IPv6 peer connection address.
public_as_only_skip_peer_as: not required, default: no_use. # Public as only skip peer as.
origin_as_valid: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, Application results of route announcement. If the value is false, Routing application results are not notified.

route_limit_idle_timeout: not required, default: null. # Specify the value of the idle-timeout timer to automatically reestablish the connections after they are cut off when the number of routes exceeds the set threshold. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1200.

reflect_client: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the local device functions as the route reflector and a peer functions as a client of the route reflector. If the value is false, the route reflector and client functions are not configured.
import_rt_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the filtering policy applied to the routes learned from a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
route_limit_percent: not required, default: null. # Specify the percentage of routes when a router starts to generate an alarm. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.
export_rt_policy_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the filtering policy applied to the routes to be advertised to a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.

public_as_only: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, sent BGP update messages carry only the public AS number but do not carry private AS numbers. If the value is false, sent BGP update messages can carry private AS numbers.
redirect_ip_vaildation: not required, default: no_use. # Redirect ip vaildation.
import_acl_name_or_num: not required, default: null. # Apply an IPv4 ACL-based filtering policy to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
allow_as_loop_limit: not required, default: null. # Set the maximum number of repetitive local AS number. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.
add_path_mode: not required, default: null. # null, Null. receive, Support receiving Add-Path routes. send, Support sending Add-Path routes. both, Support receiving and sending Add-Path routes.
export_as_path_filter: not required, default: null. # Apply an AS_Path-based filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.
vpls_ad_disable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, enable vpls-ad. If the value is false, disable vpls-ad.
public_as_only_replace: not required, default: no_use. # Private as replaced by public as number.
public_as_only_limited: not required, default: no_use. # Limited use public as number.
preferred_value: not required, default: null. # Assign a preferred value for the routes learned from a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
export_acl_name_or_num: not required, default: null. # Apply an IPv4 ACL-based filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
soostring: not required, default: null. # Configure the Site-of-Origin (SoO) extended community attribute. The value is a string of 3 to 21 characters.

update_pkt_standard_compatible: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, When the vpnv4 multicast neighbor receives and updates the message, the message has no label. If the value is false, When the vpnv4 multicast neighbor receives and updates the message, the message has label.

advertise_remote_nexthop: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the remote next-hop attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the remote next-hop attribute is not advertised to any peers.
vrf_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created.
default_rt_adv_policy: not required, default: null. # Specify the name of a used policy. The value is a string. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
export_pref_filt_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the IPv4 filtering policy applied to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 169 characters.

default_rt_adv_enable: not required, default: no_use. # If the value is true, the function to advertise default routes to peers is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise default routes to peers is disabled.
rt_updt_interval: not required, default: null. # Specify the minimum interval at which Update packets are sent. The value is an integer, in seconds. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 600.

ce_command.description: Run arbitrary command on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_command

retries: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed.  The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

commands: required, default: undefined. # The commands to send to the remote HUAWEI CloudEngine device over the configured provider.  The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of I(retries) has been exceeded.

wait_for: not required, default: null. # Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward.   If the conditional is not true by the configured retries, the task fails.  See examples.

match: not required, default: all. # The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the I(wait_for) must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

interval: not required, default: 1. # Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command.  If the command does not pass the specified conditional, the interval indicates how to long to wait before trying the command again.
ce_config

src: not required, default: null. # The I(src) argument provides a path to the configuration file to load into the remote system.  The path can either be a full system path to the configuration file if the value starts with / or relative to the root of the implemented role or playbook. This argument is mutually exclusive with the I(lines) and I(parents) arguments.

backup: not required, default: false. # This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(current-configuration) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.

after: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

lines: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device current-configuration.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

replace: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

parents: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

defaults: not required, default: false. # The I(defaults) argument will influence how the current-configuration is collected from the device.  When the value is set to true, the command used to collect the current-configuration is append with the all keyword.  When the value is set to false, the command is issued without the all keyword.

save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the current-configuration to saved-configuration.  This operation is performed after any changes are made to the current running config.  If no changes are made, the configuration is still saved to the startup config.  This option will always cause the module to return changed.

config: not required, default: null. # The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current current-configuration to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current-configuration for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuration to use as the base config for comparison.

match: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the current-configuration on the remote device.

before: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

ce_dldp.description: Manages global DLDP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_dldp
reset: not required, default: null. # Specify whether reset DLDP state of disabled interfaces.
enable: not required, default: null. # Set global DLDP enable state.
work_mode: not required, default: null. # Set global DLDP work-mode.

auth_pwd: not required, default: null. # Specifies authentication password. The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive plaintexts or 24/32/48/108/128 case-sensitive encrypted characters. The string excludes a question mark (?).

time_internal: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interval for sending Advertisement packets. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100, in seconds. The default interval for sending Advertisement packets is 5 seconds.
auth_mode: not required, default: null. # Specifies authentication algorithm of DLDP.

ce_dldp_interface.description: Manages interface DLDP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_dldp_interface
reset: not required, default: null. # Specify whether reseting interface DLDP state.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
enable: not required, default: null. # Set interface DLDP enable state.
interface: required, default: undefined. # Must be fully qualified interface name, i.e. GE1/0/1, 10GE1/0/1, 40GE1/0/22, 100GE1/0/1.
mode_enable: not required, default: null. # Set DLDP compatible-mode enable state.

local_mac: not required, default: null. # Set the source MAC address for DLDP packets sent in the DLDP-compatible mode. The value of MAC address is in H-H-H format. H contains 1 to 4 hexadecimal digits.

ce_eth_trunk.description: Manages Eth-Trunk interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_eth_trunk
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
force: not required, default: false. # When true it forces Eth-Trunk members to match what is declared in the members param. This can be used to remove members.
mode: not required, default: null. # Specifies the working mode of an Eth-Trunk interface.
members: not required, default: null. # List of interfaces that will be managed in a given Eth-Trunk. The interface name must be full name.

min_links: not required, default: null. # Specifies the minimum number of Eth-Trunk member links in the Up state. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to the maximum number of interfaces that can be added to a Eth-Trunk interface.

trunk_id: required, default: undefined. # Eth-Trunk interface number. The value is an integer. The value range depends on the assign forward eth-trunk mode command. When 256 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 255. When 512 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 511. When 1024 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 1023.
hash_type: not required, default: null. # Hash algorithm used for load balancing among Eth-Trunk member interfaces.

ce_evpn_bd_vni.description: Manages EVPN VXLAN Network Identifier (VNI) on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bd_vni
vpn_target_export: not required, default: null. # Add VPN targets to the export VPN target list of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.

route_distinguisher: not required, default: null. # Configures a route distinguisher (RD) for a BD EVPN instance. The format of an RD can be as follows,1) 2-byte AS number:4-byte user-defined number, for example, 1:3. An AS number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295. The AS and user-defined numbers cannot be both 0s. This means that an RD cannot be 0:0.,2) Integral 4-byte AS number:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 65537:3. An AS number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.,3) 4-byte AS number in dotted notation:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 0.0:3 or 0.1:0. A 4-byte AS number in dotted notation is in the format of x.y, where x and y are integers ranging from 0 to 65535.,4) A user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535. The AS and user-defined numbers cannot be both 0s. This means that an RD cannot be 0.0:0.,5) 32-bit IP address:2-byte user-defined number. For example, 192.168.122.15:1. An IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.,6) 'auto' specifies the RD that is automatically generated.
vpn_target_both: not required, default: null. # Add VPN targets to both the import and export VPN target lists of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.
evpn: not required, default: enable. # Create or delete an EVPN instance for a VXLAN in BD view.
vpn_target_import: required, default: undefined. # Add VPN targets to the import VPN target list of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.
bridge_domain_id: required, default: undefined. # Specify an existed bridge domain (BD).The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

ce_evpn_bgp.description: Manages BGP EVPN configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bgp
as_number: not required, default: null. # Specifies integral AS number. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
advertise_l2vpn_evpn: not required, default: null. # Enable or disable a device to advertise IP routes imported to a VPN instance to its EVPN instance.
advertise_router_type: not required, default: null. # Configures a device to advertise routes to its BGP EVPN peers.
vpn_name: not required, default: null. # Associates a specified VPN instance with the IPv4 address family. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
peer_group_name: not required, default: null. # Specify the name of a peer group that BGP peers need to join. The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
bgp_instance: required, default: undefined. # Name of a BGP instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
peer_enable: not required, default: null. # Enable or disable a BGP device to exchange routes with a specified peer or peer group in the address family view.
peer_address: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IPv4 address of a BGP EVPN peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ce_evpn_bgp_rr.description: Manages RR for the VXLAN Network on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bgp_rr
as_number: required, default: null. # Specifies the number of the AS, in integer format. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
bgp_instance: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a BGP instance. The value of instance-name can be an integer 1 or a string of 1 to 31.
reflect_client: not required, default: null. # Configure the local device as the route reflector and the peer or peer group as the client of the route reflector.
peer: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IPv4 address or the group name of a peer.
bgp_evpn_enable: not required, default: enable. # Enable or disable the BGP-EVPN address family.
policy_vpn_target: not required, default: null. # Enable or disable the VPN-Target filtering.
peer_type: not required, default: null. # Specify the peer type.

ce_evpn_global.description: Manages global configuration of EVPN on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_global
evpn_overlay_enable: required, default: undefined. # Configure EVPN as the VXLAN control plane.

ce_facts.description: Gets facts about HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_facts

gather_subset: not required, default: !config. # When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

ce_file_copy.description: Copy a file to a remote cloudengine device over SCP on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_file_copy
local_file: required, default: undefined. # Path to local file. Local directory must exist. The maximum length of local_file is 4096.

remote_file: not required, default: null. # Remote file path of the copy. Remote directories must exist. If omitted, the name of the local file will be used. The maximum length of remote_file is 4096.

file_system: not required, default: flash:. # The remote file system of the device. If omitted, devices that support a file_system parameter will use their default values. File system indicates the storage medium and can be set to as follows, 1) 'flash:' is root directory of the flash memory on the master MPU. 2) 'slave#flash:' is root directory of the flash memory on the slave MPU. If no slave MPU exists, this drive is unavailable. 3) 'chassis ID/slot number#flash:' is root directory of the flash memory on a device in a stack. For example, 1/5#flash indicates the flash memory whose chassis ID is 1 and slot number is 5.

ce_info_center_debug.description: Manages information center debug configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_debug
debug_enable: not required, default: no_use. # Whether a device is enabled to output debugging information.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
debug_level: not required, default: null. # Debug level permitted to output.
channel_id: not required, default: null. # Number of a channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.

module_name: not required, default: null. # Module name of the rule. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The default value is default. Please use lower-case letter, such as [aaa, acl, arp, bfd].
debug_time_stamp: not required, default: null. # Timestamp type of debugging information.

ce_info_center_global.description: Manages outputting logs on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_global
server_ip: not required, default: null. # Log server address, IPv4 or IPv6 type. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The value can be an valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.
filter_log_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the filtered log. The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters.
facility: not required, default: null. # Log record tool.
ssl_policy_name: not required, default: null. # SSL policy name. The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-sensitive characters.
transport_mode: not required, default: null. # Transport mode. The value is of the enumerated type and case-sensitive.
channel_cfg_name: not required, default: console. # Channel name.The value is a string of 1 to 30 case-sensitive characters. The default value is console.
suppress_enable: not required, default: null. # Whether a device is enabled to suppress duplicate statistics. The value is of the Boolean type.
channel_out_direct: not required, default: null. # Direction of information output.
channel_id: not required, default: null. # Number for channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.
filter_feature_name: not required, default: null. # Feature name of the filtered log. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters.
is_default_vpn: not required, default: false. # Use the default VPN or not.
server_domain: not required, default: null. # Server name. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters.
level: not required, default: null. # Level of logs saved on a log server.
packet_priority: not required, default: null. # Set the priority of the syslog packet.The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default value is 0.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Log source ip address, IPv4 or IPv6 type. The value is a string of 0 to 255. The value can be an valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.
channel_name: not required, default: null. # Channel name. The value is a string of 1 to 30 case-sensitive characters.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
vrf_name: not required, default: null. # VPN name on a log server. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. The default value is _public_.

logfile_max_size: not required, default: 32. # Maximum size (in MB) of a log file. The default value is 32.,The value range for log files is [4, 8, 16, 32], for security files is [1, 4],,and for operation files is [1, 4].

server_port: not required, default: null. # Number of a port sending logs.The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535. For UDP, the default value is 514. For TCP, the default value is 601. For TSL, the default value is 6514.
timestamp: not required, default: null. # Log server timestamp. The value is of the enumerated type and case-sensitive.
info_center_enable: not required, default: null. # Whether the info-center function is enabled. The value is of the Boolean type.
ip_type: not required, default: null. # Log server address type, IPv4 or IPv6.

logfile_max_num: not required, default: null. # Maximum number of log files of the same type. The default value is 200.,The value range for log files is[3, 500], for security files is [1, 3],and for operation files is [1, 7].

ce_info_center_log.description: Manages information center log configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_log
log_level: not required, default: null. # Specifies a log severity.
log_enable: not required, default: no_use. # Indicates whether log filtering is enabled.

log_buff_size: not required, default: null. # Specifies the maximum number of logs in the log buffer. The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 10240. If logbuffer-size is 0, logs are not displayed.
channel_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a channel ID. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
log_buff_enable: not required, default: no_use. # Enables the Switch to send logs to the log buffer.
log_time_stamp: not required, default: null. # Sets the timestamp format of logs.
module_name: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a module. The value is a module name in registration logs.

ce_info_center_trap.description: Manages information center trap configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_trap
trap_time_stamp: not required, default: null. # Timestamp format of alarm information.
trap_buff_size: not required, default: null. # Size of a trap buffer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1024. The default value is 256.
channel_id: not required, default: null. # Number of a channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
trap_level: not required, default: null. # Trap level permitted to output.
trap_buff_enable: not required, default: no_use. # Whether a trap buffer is enabled to output information.

module_name: not required, default: null. # Module name of the rule. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The default value is default. Please use lower-case letter, such as [aaa, acl, arp, bfd].
trap_enable: not required, default: no_use. # Whether a device is enabled to output alarms.

ce_interface.description: Manages physical attributes of interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_interface
state: required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.

admin_state: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interface management status. The value is an enumerated type. up, An interface is in the administrative Up state. down, An interface is in the administrative Down state.
description: not required, default: null. # Specifies an interface description. The value is a string of 1 to 242 case-sensitive characters, spaces supported but question marks (?) not supported.
interface: not required, default: null. # Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/10, Tunnel1.
interface_type: not required, default: null. # Interface type to be configured from the device.
mode: not required, default: null. # Manage Layer 2 or Layer 3 state of the interface.
l2sub: not required, default: false. # Specifies whether the interface is a Layer 2 sub-interface.

ce_interface_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF interface instanceon HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_interface_ospf
cost: not required, default: null. # The cost associated with this interface. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 65535.
area: required, default: undefined. # Ospf area associated with this ospf process. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer between 1 and 4294967295.
silent_interface: not required, default: false. # Setting to true will prevent this interface from receiving HELLO packets. Valid values are 'true' and 'false'.
auth_mode: not required, default: null. # Specifies the authentication type.
auth_key_id: not required, default: null. # Authentication key id when C(auth_mode) is 'hmac-sha256', 'md5' or 'hmac-md5. Valid value is an integer is in the range from 1 to 255.
dead_interval: not required, default: null. # Time interval an ospf neighbor waits for a hello packet before tearing down adjacencies. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 235926000.
auth_text_simple: not required, default: null. # Specifies a password for simple authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 8 characters.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
process_id: required, default: undefined. # Specifies a process ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
hello_interval: not required, default: null. # Time between sending successive hello packets. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 65535.
auth_text_md5: not required, default: null. # Specifies a password for MD5, HMAC-MD5, or HMAC-SHA256 authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
interface: required, default: undefined. # Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/10.

ce_ip_interface.description: Manages L3 attributes for IPv4 and IPv6 interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ip_interface
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
version: not required, default: v4. # IP address version.
addr: not required, default: null. # IPv4 or IPv6 Address.
interface: required, default: undefined. # Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22, vlanif10.
mask: not required, default: null. # Subnet mask for IPv4 or IPv6 Address in decimal format.
ipv4_type: not required, default: main. # Specifies an address type. The value is an enumerated type. main, primary IP address. sub, secondary IP address.

ce_link_status.description: Get interface link status on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_link_status

interface: required, default: undefined. # For the interface parameter, you can enter C(all) to display information about all interface, an interface type such as C(40GE) to display information about interfaces of the specified type, or full name of an interface such as C(40GE1/0/22) or C(vlanif10) to display information about the specific interface.

ce_mlag_config.description: Manages MLAG configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mlag_config
eth_trunk_id: not required, default: null. # Name of the peer-link interface. The value is in the range from 0 to 511.

pseudo_priority: not required, default: null. # The priority of a pseudo nickname. The value is an integer that ranges from 128 to 255. The default value is 192. A larger value indicates a higher priority.
ip_address: not required, default: null. # IP address bound to the DFS group. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
priority_id: not required, default: null. # Priority of a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254. The default value is 100.

vpn_instance_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the VPN instance bound to the DFS group. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces. The value _public_ is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
peer_link_id: not required, default: null. # Number of the peer-link interface. The value is 1.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
dfs_group_id: not required, default: present. # ID of a DFS group. The value is 1.
nickname: not required, default: null. # The nickname bound to a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65471.
pseudo_nickname: not required, default: null. # A pseudo nickname of a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65471.

ce_mlag_interface.description: Manages MLAG interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mlag_interface
eth_trunk_id: not required, default: null. # Name of the local M-LAG interface. The value is ranging from 0 to 511.
mlag_id: not required, default: null. # ID of the M-LAG. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 2048.
mlag_error_down: not required, default: null. # Configure the interface on the slave device to enter the Error-Down state.
mlag_system_id: not required, default: null. # M-LAG global LACP system MAC address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The default value is the MAC address of the Ethernet port of MPU.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
dfs_group_id: not required, default: present. # ID of a DFS group.The value is 1.
interface: not required, default: null. # Name of the interface that enters the Error-Down state when the peer-link fails. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
mlag_priority_id: not required, default: null. # M-LAG global LACP system priority. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535. The default value is 32768.

ce_mtu.description: Manages MTU settings on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mtu
interface: not required, default: null. # Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.

jumbo_max: not required, default: null. # Maximum frame size. The default value is 9216. The value is an integer and expressed in bytes. The value range is 1536 to 12224 for the CE12800 and 1536 to 12288 for ToR switches.
jumbo_min: not required, default: null. # Non-jumbo frame size threshod. The default value is 1518. The value is an integer that ranges from 1518 to jumbo_max, in bytes.
mtu: not required, default: null. # MTU for a specific interface. The value is an integer ranging from 46 to 9600, in bytes.

ce_netconf.description: Run an arbitrary netconf command on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netconf
rpc: required, default: undefined. # The type of rpc.
cfg_xml: required, default: undefined. # The config xml string.

ce_netstream_aging.description: Manages timeout mode of NetStream on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_aging
timeout_type: not required, default: null. # Netstream timeout type.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
type: not required, default: null. # Specifies the packet type of netstream timeout active interval.
manual_slot: not required, default: null. # Specifies the slot number of netstream manual timeout.
timeout_interval: not required, default: 30. # Netstream timeout interval. If is active type the interval is 1-60. If is inactive ,the interval is 5-600.

ce_netstream_export.description: Manages netstream export on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_export
bgp_nexthop: not required, default: disable. # Configures the statistics to carry BGP next hop information. Currently, only V9 supports the exported packets carrying BGP next hop information.
host_port: not required, default: null. # Specifies the destination UDP port number of the exported packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies source address which can be IPv6 or IPv4 of the exported NetStream packet.
host_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies destination address which can be IPv6 or IPv4 of the exported NetStream packet.
as_option: not required, default: null. # Specifies the AS number recorded in the statistics as the original or the peer AS number.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
version: not required, default: null. # Sets the version of exported packets.
type: required, default: null. # Specifies NetStream feature.
host_vpn: not required, default: null. # Specifies the VPN instance of the exported packets carrying flow statistics. Ensure the VPN instance has been created on the device.

ce_netstream_global.description: Manages global parameters of NetStream on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_global
statistics_direction: not required, default: null. # Specifies the netstream statistic direction.
index_switch: not required, default: 16. # Specifies the netstream index-switch.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
sampler_interval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the netstream sampler interval, length is 1 - 65535.
statistics_record: not required, default: null. # Specifies the flexible netstream statistic record, length is 1 - 32.
sampler_direction: not required, default: null. # Specifies the netstream sampler direction.
interface: required, default: null. # Netstream global interface.
type: not required, default: ip. # Specifies the type of netstream global.

ce_netstream_template.description: Manages NetStream template configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_template
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
collect_interface: not required, default: null. # Configure the input or output interface that are included in the flexible flow statistics sent to NSC.
record_name: not required, default: null. # Configure the name of netstream record. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
description: not required, default: null. # Configure the description of netstream record. The value is a string of 1 to 80 case-insensitive characters.
type: required, default: undefined. # Configure the type of netstream record.
collect_counter: not required, default: null. # Configure the number of packets and bytes that are included in the flexible flow statistics sent to NSC.
match: not required, default: null. # Configure flexible flow statistics template keywords.

ce_ntp.description: Manages core NTP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ntp
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
is_preferred: not required, default: null. # Makes given NTP server or peer the preferred NTP server or peer for the device.
peer: not required, default: null. # Network address of NTP peer.
key_id: not required, default: null. # Authentication key identifier to use with given NTP server or peer.
vpn_name: not required, default: _public_. # Makes the device communicate with the given NTP server or peer over a specific vpn.
server: not required, default: null. # Network address of NTP server.

source_int: not required, default: null. # Local source interface from which NTP messages are sent. Must be fully qualified interface name, i.e. C(40GE1/0/22), C(vlanif10). Interface types, such as C(10GE), C(40GE), C(100GE), C(Eth-Trunk), C(LoopBack), C(MEth), C(NULL), C(Tunnel), C(Vlanif).

ce_ntp_auth.description: Manages NTP authentication configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ntp_auth
auth_type: not required, default: encrypt. # Whether the given password is in cleartext or has been encrypted. If in cleartext, the device will encrypt it before storing it.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
auth_pwd: not required, default: null. # Plain text with length of 1 to 255, encrypted text with length of 20 to 392.
key_id: required, default: undefined. # Authentication key identifier (numeric).
trusted_key: not required, default: disable. # Whether the given key is required to be supplied by a time source for the device to synchronize to the time source.
auth_mode: not required, default: null. # Specify authentication algorithm.
authentication: not required, default: null. # Configure ntp authentication enable or unconfigure ntp authentication enable.

ce_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ospf
addr: not required, default: null. # Specifies the address of the network segment where the interface resides. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

area: not required, default: null. # Specifies the area ID. The area with the area-id being 0 is a backbone area. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer between 1 and 4294967295.
max_load_balance: not required, default: null. # The maximum number of paths for forward packets over multiple paths. Valid value is an integer in the range from 1 to 64.
mask: not required, default: null. # IP network wildcard bits in decimal format between 0 and 32.
auth_mode: not required, default: null. # Specifies the authentication type.
auth_key_id: not required, default: null. # Authentication key id when C(auth_mode) is 'hmac-sha256', 'md5' or 'hmac-md5. Valid value is an integer is in the range from 1 to 255.
auth_text_simple: not required, default: null. # Specifies a password for simple authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 8 characters.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
process_id: required, default: undefined. # Specifies a process ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
nexthop_addr: not required, default: null. # IPv4 address for configure next-hop address's weight. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address.
auth_text_md5: not required, default: null. # Specifies a password for MD5, HMAC-MD5, or HMAC-SHA256 authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
nexthop_weight: not required, default: null. # Indicates the weight of the next hop. The smaller the value is, the higher the preference of the route is. It is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254.

ce_ospf_vrf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF VPN instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ospf_vrf
description: not required, default: null. # Specifies the description information of ospf process.
lsaostartinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the start interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 1000, the default value is 500.

lsaastartinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the start interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 500.
lsaointerval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in second, from 0 to 10, the default value is 5.
bandwidth: not required, default: null. # Specifies the reference bandwidth used to assign ospf cost. Valid values are an integer, in Mbps, 1 - 2147483648, the default value is 100.
spfintervalmi: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interval to calculate SPF when use millisecond level  timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 10000.
spfinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interval to calculate SPF when use second level  timer. Valid value is an integer, in second, from 1 to 10.

lsaointervalflag: not required, default: false. # Specifies whether cancel the interval of LSA originate or not. If set the parameter but noe specifies value, the default will be used. true:cancel the interval of LSA originate, the interval is 0. false:do not cancel the interval of LSA originate.
lsaomaxinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the max interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 10000, the default value is 5000.

lsaalflag: not required, default: false. # Specifies the mode of timer to calculate interval of arrive LSA. If set the parameter but not specifies value, the default will be used. If true use general timer. If false use intelligent timer.

lsaamaxinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the max interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 1000.
lsaoholdinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the hold interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 5000, the default value is 1000.

spfintervaltype: not required, default: intelligent-timer. # Specifies the mode of timer which used to calculate SPF. If set the parameter but noe specifies value, the default will be used. If is intelligent-timer, then use intelligent timer. If is timer, then use second level timer. If is millisecond, then use millisecond level timer.
lsaainterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the interval of arrive LSA when use the general timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000.

spfstartinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the start interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 1000, the default value is 50.
route_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies the ospf private route id,. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "10.1.1.1") the length is 0 - 20.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.

spfmaxinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the max interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 20000, the default value is 5000.

spfholdinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the hold interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 5000, the default value is 200.

lsaaholdinterval: not required, default: null. # Specifies the hold interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 500.
ospf: required, default: null. # The ID of the ospf process. Valid values are an integer, 1 - 4294967295, the default value is 1.
vrf: not required, default: _public_. # Specifies the vpn instance which use ospf,length is 1 - 31. Valid values are a string.
ce_reboot
save_config: not required, default: false. # Flag indicating whether to save the configuration.
confirm: not required, default: false. # Safeguard boolean. Set to true if you're sure you want to reboot.

ce_rollback.description: Set a checkpoint or rollback to a checkpoint on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_rollback

commit_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the label of the configuration rollback point to which system configurations are expected to roll back. The value is an integer that the system generates automatically.
oldest: not required, default: null. # Specifies the number of configuration rollback points. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 80.
last: not required, default: null. # Specifies the number of configuration rollback points. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 80.
action: required, default: undefined. # The operation of configuration rollback.

filename: not required, default: null. # Specifies a configuration file for configuration rollback. The value is a string of 5 to 64 case-sensitive characters in the format of *.zip, *.cfg, or *.dat, spaces not supported.

label: not required, default: null. # Specifies a user label for a configuration rollback point. The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive ASCII characters, spaces not supported. The value must start with a letter and cannot be presented in a single hyphen (-).

ce_sflow.description: Manages sFlow configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_sflow
agent_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IPv4/IPv6 address of an sFlow agent.
export_route: not required, default: null. # Configures the sFlow packets sent by the switch not to carry routing information.
counter_collector: not required, default: null. # Indicates the ID list of the counter collector.

rate_limit_slot: not required, default: null. # Specifies the slot where the rate of output sFlow packets is limited. If this parameter is not specified, the rate of sFlow packets sent from all cards to the control plane is limited. The value is an integer or a string of characters.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the source IPv4/IPv6 address of sFlow packets.

collector_datagram_size: not required, default: null. # Specifies the maximum length of sFlow packets sent from an sFlow agent to an sFlow collector. The value is an integer, in bytes. It ranges from 1024 to 8100. The default value is 1400.
sample_collector: not required, default: null. # Indicates the ID list of the collector.
rate_limit: not required, default: null. # Specifies the rate of sFlow packets sent from a card to the control plane. The value is an integer that ranges from 100 to 1500, in pps.
sample_direction: not required, default: null. # Enables flow sampling in the inbound or outbound direction.

collector_meth: not required, default: null. # Configures the device to send sFlow packets through service interfaces, enhancing the sFlow packet forwarding capability. The enhanced parameter is optional. No matter whether you configure the enhanced mode, the switch determines to send sFlow packets through service cards or management port based on the routing information on the collector. When the value is meth, the device forwards sFlow packets at the control plane. When the value is enhanced, the device forwards sFlow packets at the forwarding plane to enhance the sFlow packet forwarding capacity.

collector_ip_vpn: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.

forward_enp_slot: not required, default: null. # Enable the Embedded Network Processor (ENP) chip function. The switch uses the ENP chip to perform sFlow sampling, and the maximum sFlow sampling interval is 65535. If you set the sampling interval to be larger than 65535, the switch automatically restores it to 65535. The value is an integer or 'all'.
collector_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IPv4/IPv6 address of the sFlow collector.
sflow_interface: not required, default: null. # Full name of interface for Flow Sampling or Counter. It must be a physical interface, Eth-Trunk, or Layer 2 subinterface.
sample_length: not required, default: null. # Specifies the maximum length of sampled packets. The value is an integer and ranges from 18 to 512, in bytes. The default value is 128.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
collector_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies the ID of an sFlow collector. This ID is used when you specify the collector in subsequent sFlow configuration.
sample_rate: not required, default: null. # Specifies the flow sampling rate in the format 1/rate. The value is an integer and ranges from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 8192.
collector_udp_port: not required, default: null. # Specifies the UDP destination port number of sFlow packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535. The default value is 6343.
counter_interval: not required, default: null. # Indicates the counter sampling interval. The value is an integer that ranges from 10 to 4294967295, in seconds. The default value is 20.
collector_description: not required, default: null. # Specifies the description of an sFlow collector. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

ce_snmp_community.description: Manages SNMP community configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_community
notify_view: not required, default: null. # Mib view name for notification.
community_name: not required, default: null. # Unique name to identify the community.
community_mib_view: not required, default: null. # Mib view name.
read_view: not required, default: null. # Mib view name for read.
acl_number: not required, default: null. # Access control list number.
group_name: not required, default: null. # Unique name to identify the SNMPv3 group.
write_view: not required, default: null. # Mib view name for write.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
security_level: not required, default: null. # Security level indicating whether to use authentication and encryption.
access_right: not required, default: null. # Access right read or write.

ce_snmp_contact.description: Manages SNMP contact configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_contact
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
contact: required, default: null. # Contact information.

ce_snmp_location.description: Manages SNMP location configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_location
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
location: required, default: null. # Location information.

ce_snmp_target_host.description: Manages SNMP target host configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_target_host
security_name_v3: not required, default: null. # Security Name V3.
recv_port: not required, default: null. # UDP Port number used by network management to receive alarm messages.
security_model: not required, default: null. # Security Model.
vpn_name: not required, default: null. # VPN instance Name.
address: not required, default: null. # Network Address.
security_name: not required, default: null. # Security Name.
notify_type: not required, default: null. # To configure notify type as trap or inform.
connect_port: not required, default: null. # Udp port used by SNMP agent to connect the Network management.
version: not required, default: null. # Version(s) Supported by SNMP Engine.
host_name: not required, default: null. # Unique name to identify target host entry.
security_level: not required, default: null. # Security level indicating whether to use authentication and encryption.
interface_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the interface to send the trap message.
is_public_net: not required, default: no_use. # To enable or disable Public Net-manager for target Host.

ce_snmp_traps.description: Manages SNMP traps configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_traps
feature_name: not required, default: null. # Alarm feature name.
interface_type: not required, default: null. # Interface type.
trap_name: not required, default: null. # Alarm trap name.
port_number: not required, default: null. # Source port number.
interface_number: not required, default: null. # Interface number.

ce_snmp_user.description: Manages SNMP user configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_user
priv_key: not required, default: null. # The encryption password. Password length 8-255 characters.
aaa_local_user: not required, default: null. # Unique name to identify the local user.
auth_key: not required, default: null. # The authentication password. Password length, 8-255 characters.
usm_user_name: not required, default: null. # Unique name to identify the USM user.
acl_number: not required, default: null. # Access control list number.
auth_protocol: not required, default: null. # Authentication protocol.
remote_engine_id: not required, default: null. # Remote engine id of the USM user.
priv_protocol: not required, default: null. # Encryption protocol.
user_group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group where user belongs to.

ce_startup.description: Manages a system startup information on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_startup
slot: not required, default: null. # Position of the device.The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The possible value of slot is all, slave-board, or the specific slotID.
action: not required, default: null. # Display the startup information.
cfg_file: not required, default: present. # Name of the configuration file that is applied for the next startup. The value is a string of 5 to 255 characters.
patch_file: not required, default: null. # Name of the patch file that is applied for the next startup.
software_file: not required, default: null. # File name of the system software that is applied for the next startup. The value is a string of 5 to 255 characters.

ce_static_route.description: Manages static route configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_static_route
prefix: required, default: undefined. # Destination ip address of static route.
aftype: required, default: undefined. # Destination ip address family type of static route.
description: not required, default: null. # Name of the route. Used with the name parameter on the CLI.
pref: not required, default: null. # Preference or administrative difference of route (range 1-255).
mask: required, default: undefined. # Destination ip mask of static route.
destvrf: not required, default: null. # VPN instance of next hop ip address.
nhp_interface: not required, default: null. # Next hop interface full name of static route.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
next_hop: not required, default: null. # Next hop address of static route.
vrf: not required, default: null. # VPN instance of destination ip address.
tag: not required, default: null. # Route tag value (numeric).

ce_stp.description: Manages STP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_stp
loop_protection: not required, default: null. # Enable loop protection on the current port.

tc_protection_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set the maximum number of TC BPDUs that the MSTP can handle. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255. The default value is 1 on the switch.
bpdu_filter: not required, default: null. # Specify a port as a BPDU filter port.
stp_converge: not required, default: null. # STP convergence mode. Fast means set STP aging mode to Fast. Normal means set STP aging mode to Normal.
stp_mode: not required, default: null. # Set an operation mode for the current MSTP process. The mode can be STP, RSTP, or MSTP.
bpdu_protection: not required, default: null. # Configure BPDU protection on an edge port. This function prevents network flapping caused by attack packets.
root_protection: not required, default: null. # Enable root protection on the current port.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
cost: not required, default: null. # Set the path cost of the current port. The default instance is 0.
stp_enable: not required, default: null. # Enable or disable STP on a switch.
interface: not required, default: null. # Interface name. If the value is C(all), will apply configuration to all interfaces. if the value is a special name, only support input the full name.
tc_protection: not required, default: null. # Configure the TC BPDU protection function for an MSTP process.
edged_port: not required, default: null. # Set the current port as an edge port.

tc_protection_interval: not required, default: null. # Set the time the MSTP device takes to handle the maximum number of TC BPDUs and immediately refresh forwarding entries. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds.

ce_switchport.description: Manages Layer 2 switchport interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_switchport
native_vlan: not required, default: null. # If C(mode=trunk), used as the trunk native VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
access_vlan: not required, default: null. # If C(mode=access), used as the access VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
mode: not required, default: null. # The link type of an interface.
interface: required, default: null. # Full name of the interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22.
trunk_vlans: not required, default: null. # If C(mode=trunk), used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk, such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.

ce_vlan.description: Manages VLAN resources and attributes on Huawei CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vlan
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
vlan_range: not required, default: null. # Range of VLANs such as C(2-10) or C(2,5,10-15), etc.
name: not required, default: null. # Name of VLAN, in the range from 1 to 31.
vlan_id: not required, default: null. # Single VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
description: not required, default: null. # Specify VLAN description, in the range from 1 to 80.

ce_vrf.description: Manages VPN instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
vrf: required, default: undefined. # VPN instance, the length of vrf name is 1 - 31, i.e. "test", but can not be C(_public_).
description: not required, default: null. # Description of the vrf, the string length is 1 - 242 .

ce_vrf_af.description: Manages VPN instance address family on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf_af
vpn_target_type: not required, default: null. # VPN instance vpn target type.
vpn_target_state: not required, default: undefined. # Manage the state of the vpn target.
vrf_aftype: not required, default: v4. # VPN instance address family.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the af.

route_distinguisher: not required, default: undefined. # VPN instance route distinguisher,the RD used to distinguish same route prefix from different vpn. The RD must be setted before setting vpn_target_value.
vrf: required, default: null. # VPN instance.
evpn: not required, default: false. # Is extend vpn or normal vpn.

vpn_target_value: not required, default: undefined. # VPN instance target value. Such as X.X.X.X:number<0-65535> or number<0-65535>:number<0-4294967295> or number<0-65535>.number<0-65535>:number<0-65535> or number<65536-4294967295>:number<0-65535> but not support 0:0 and 0.0:0.

ce_vrf_interface.description: Manages interface specific VPN configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf_interface
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
vrf: required, default: undefined. # VPN instance, the length of vrf name is 1 ~ 31, i.e. "test", but can not be C(_public_).

vpn_interface: required, default: undefined. # An interface that can binding VPN instance, i.e. 40GE1/0/22, Vlanif10. Must be fully qualified interface name. Interface types, such as 10GE, 40GE, 100GE, LoopBack, MEth, Tunnel, Vlanif....

ce_vrrp.description: Manages VRRP interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vrrp
vrrp_type: not required, default: null. # Type of a VRRP backup group.

auth_mode: not required, default: null. # Authentication type used for VRRP packet exchanges between virtual routers. The values are noAuthentication, simpleTextPassword, md5Authentication. The default value is noAuthentication.
is_plain: not required, default: false. # Select the display mode of an authentication key. By default, an authentication key is displayed in ciphertext.
interface: not required, default: null. # Name of an interface. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
preempt_timer_delay: not required, default: null. # Preemption delay. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600. The default value is 0.
gratuitous_arp_interval: not required, default: null. # Interval at which gratuitous ARP packets are sent, in seconds. The value ranges from 30 to 1200.The default value is 300.

auth_key: not required, default: null. # This object is set based on the authentication type. When noAuthentication is specified, the value is empty. When simpleTextPassword or md5Authentication is specified, the value is a string of 1 to 8 characters in plaintext and displayed as a blank text for security.
vrid: not required, default: present. # VRRP backup group ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
priority: not required, default: null. # Configured VRRP priority. The value ranges from 1 to 254. The default value is 100. A larger value indicates a higher priority.

recover_delay: not required, default: null. # Delay in recovering after an interface goes Up. The delay is used for interface flapping suppression. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600. The default value is 0 seconds.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify desired state of the resource.
version: not required, default: null. # VRRP version. The default version is v2.
virtual_ip: not required, default: null. # Virtual IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.
admin_interface: not required, default: null. # Tracked mVRRP interface name. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
admin_ignore_if_down: not required, default: false. # mVRRP ignores an interface Down event.
fast_resume: not required, default: null. # mVRRP's fast resume mode.
admin_flowdown: not required, default: false. # Disable the flowdown function for service VRRP.
holding_multiplier: not required, default: null. # The configured holdMultiplier.The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 10. The default value is 3.
admin_vrid: not required, default: null. # Tracked mVRRP ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

advertise_interval: not required, default: null. # Configured interval between sending advertisements, in milliseconds. Only the master router sends VRRP advertisements. The default value is 1000 milliseconds.

ce_vxlan_arp.description: Manages ARP attributes of VXLAN on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_arp
evn_bgp: not required, default: null. # Enables EVN BGP.
vbdif_name: not required, default: null. # Full name of VBDIF interface, i.e. Vbdif100.
bridge_domain_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a BD(bridge domain) ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
evn_server: not required, default: null. # Configures the local device as the router reflector (RR) on the EVN network.
evn_peer_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IP address of an EVN BGP peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
evn_source_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the source address of an EVN BGP peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
arp_collect_host: not required, default: null. # Enables EVN BGP or BGP EVPN to collect host information.
arp_suppress: not required, default: null. # Enables ARP broadcast suppression in a BD.
evn_reflect_client: not required, default: null. # Configures the local device as the route reflector (RR) and its peer as the client.
host_collect_protocol: not required, default: null. # Enables EVN BGP or BGP EVPN to advertise host information.

ce_vxlan_gateway.description: Manages gateway for the VXLAN network on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_gateway

dfs_source_vpn: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a VPN instance bound to a DFS group. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies the ID of a DFS group. The value must be 1.
arp_direct_route: not required, default: null. # Enable VLINK direct route on VBDIF interface.

dfs_peer_vpn: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of the VPN instance that is associated with all-active gateway peer. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
vbdif_name: not required, default: null. # Full name of VBDIF interface, i.e. Vbdif100.
vpn_vni: not required, default: null. # Specifies a VNI ID. Binds a VXLAN network identifier (VNI) to a virtual private network (VPN) instance. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000000.

vbdif_mac: not required, default: null. # Specifies a MAC address for a VBDIF interface. The value is in the format of H-H-H. Each H is a 4-digit hexadecimal number, such as C(00e0) or C(fc01). If an H contains less than four digits, 0s are added ahead. For example,  C(e0) is equal to C(00e0). A MAC address cannot be all 0s or 1s or a multicast MAC address.

vbdif_bind_vpn: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of the VPN instance that is associated with the interface. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_source_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IPv4 address bound to a DFS group. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
dfs_udp_port: not required, default: null. # Specifies the UDP port number of the DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1025 to 65535.
arp_distribute_gateway: not required, default: null. # Enable the distributed gateway function on VBDIF interface.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
dfs_all_active: not required, default: null. # Creates all-active gateways.

vpn_instance: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_peer_ip: not required, default: null. # Configure the IP address of an all-active gateway peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ce_vxlan_global.description: Manages global attributes of VXLAN and bridge domain on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_global

nvo3_prevent_loops: not required, default: null. # Loop prevention of VXLAN traffic in non-enhanced mode. When the device works in non-enhanced mode, inter-card forwarding of VXLAN traffic may result in loops.
nvo3_eth_trunk_hash: not required, default: null. # Eth-Trunk from load balancing VXLAN packets in optimized mode.
tunnel_mode_vxlan: not required, default: null. # Set the tunnel mode to VXLAN when configuring the VXLAN feature.
nvo3_acl_extend: not required, default: null. # Enabling or disabling the VXLAN ACL extension function.
bridge_domain_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
nvo3_gw_enhanced: not required, default: null. # Configuring the Layer 3 VXLAN Gateway to Work in Non-loopback Mode.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
nvo3_ecmp_hash: not required, default: null. # Load balancing of VXLAN packets through ECMP in optimized mode.
nvo3_service_extend: not required, default: null. # Enabling or disabling the VXLAN service extension function.

ce_vxlan_tunnel.description: Manages VXLAN tunnel configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_tunnel
vni_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a VXLAN network identifier (VNI) ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000000.
nve_mode: not required, default: null. # Specifies the working mode of an NVE interface.
source_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies an IP address for a source VTEP. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
bridge_domain_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
peer_list_ip: not required, default: null. # Specifies the IP address of a remote VXLAN tunnel endpoints (VTEP). The value is in dotted decimal notation.
state: not required, default: present. # Manage the state of the resource.
nve_name: not required, default: null. # Specifies the number of an NVE interface. The value ranges from 1 to 2.
protocol_type: not required, default: null. # The operation type of routing protocol.

ce_vxlan_vap.description: Manages VXLAN virtual access point on HUAWEI CloudEngine Devices.
body: ce_vxlan_vap
state: not required, default: present. # Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

pe_vid: not required, default: null. # When I(encapsulation) is 'qinq', specifies an inner VLAN ID for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
l2_sub_interface: not required, default: null. # Specifies an Sub-Interface full name, i.e. "10GE1/0/41.1". The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-insensitive characters, spaces supported.

ce_vid: not required, default: null. # When I(encapsulation) is 'dot1q', specifies a VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag. When I(encapsulation) is 'qinq', specifies an outer VLAN ID for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
encapsulation: not required, default: null. # Specifies an encapsulation type of packets allowed to pass through a Layer 2 sub-interface.
bind_vlan_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies the VLAN binding to a BD(Bridge Domain). The value is an integer ranging ranging from 1 to 4094.
bridge_domain_id: not required, default: null. # Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
circonus_annotation
category: required, default: undefined. # Annotation Category
start: not required, default: I(now). # Unix timestamp of event start
description: required, default: undefined. # Description of annotation
title: required, default: undefined. # Title of annotation
duration: not required, default: 0. # Duration in seconds of annotation
api_key: required, default: undefined. # Circonus API key
stop: not required, default: I(now) + I(duration). # Unix timestamp of event end

cisco_spark.description: Send a message to a Cisco Spark Room or Individual.
body: cisco_spark
personal_token: required, default: undefined. # Your personal access token required to validate the Spark API.
message: required, default: undefined. # The message you would like to send.
recipient_id: required, default: undefined. # The unique identifier associated with the supplied C(recipient_type).
message_type: not required, default: text. # Specifies how you would like the message formatted.
recipient_type: required, default: undefined. # The request parameter you would like to send the message to.,Messages can be sent to either a room or individual (by ID or E-Mail).

cl_bond.description: Configures a bond port on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_bond

clag_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a unique clag_id for every dual connected bond on each peer switch. The value must be between 1 and 65535 and must be the same on both peer switches in order for the bond to be considered dual-connected.
lacp_rate: not required, default: 1. # The lacp rate.
xmit_hash_policy: not required, default: layer3+4. # Transmit load balancing algorithm. As of Cumulus Linux 2.5 only I(layer3+4) policy is supported.
miimon: not required, default: 100. # The mii link monitoring interval.
mstpctl_portadminedge: not required, default: undefined. # Enables admin edge port.
mode: not required, default: 802.3ad. # The bond mode, as of Cumulus Linux 2.5 only LACP bond mode is supported.
lacp_bypass_allow: not required, default: undefined. # Enable LACP bypass.
lacp_bypass_all_active: not required, default: undefined. # Activate all interfaces for bypass. It is recommended to configure all_active instead of using bypass_priority.
virtual_mac: not required, default: undefined. # Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
min_links: not required, default: 1. # Minimum number of links.
lacp_bypass_period: not required, default: undefined. # Period for enabling LACP bypass. Max value is 900.
alias_name: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the port.
lacp_bypass_priority: not required, default: undefined. # List of ports and priorities. Example I("swp1=10, swp2=20").
addr_method: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the port to use DHCP. To enable this feature use the option I(dhcp).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface.
mstpctl_bpduguard: not required, default: undefined. # Enables BPDU Guard on a port in vlan-aware mode.
location: not required, default: /etc/network/interfaces.d. # Interface directory location.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).
pvid: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).
slaves: required, default: undefined. # Bond members.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).
vids: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
mstpctl_portnetwork: not required, default: undefined. # Enables bridge assurance in vlan-aware mode.
virtual_ip: not required, default: undefined. # Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.

cl_bridge.description: Configures a bridge port on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_bridge
addr_method: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the port to use DHCP. To enable this feature use the option I(dhcp).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface.
virtual_ip: not required, default: undefined. # Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
vlan_aware: not required, default: undefined. # Enables vlan-aware mode.
mstpctl_treeprio: not required, default: undefined. # Set spanning tree root priority. Must be a multiple of 4096.
virtual_mac: not required, default: undefined. # Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).
pvid: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.

stp: not required, default: yes. # Enables spanning tree Protocol. As of Cumulus Linux 2.5 the default bridging mode, only per vlan RSTP or 802.1d is supported. For the vlan aware mode, only common instance STP is supported
location: not required, default: /etc/network/interfaces.d. # Interface directory location.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).
vids: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
alias_name: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the port.
ports: required, default: undefined. # List of bridge members.
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).
