cl_img_install.description: Install a different Cumulus Linux version.
body: cl_img_install

src: required, default: undefined. # The full path to the Cumulus Linux binary image. Can be a local path, http or https URL. If the code version is in the name of the file, the module will assume this is the version of code you wish to install.

version: not required, default: None. # Inform the module of the exact version one is installing. This overrides the automatic check of version in the file name. For example, if the binary file name is called CumulusLinux-2.2.3.bin, and version is set to '2.5.0', then the module will assume it is installing '2.5.0' not '2.2.3'. If version is not included, then the module will assume '2.2.3' is the version to install.
switch_slot: not required, default: no. # Switch slots after installing the image. To run the installed code, reboot the switch.

cl_interface.description: Configures a front panel port, loopback or management port on Cumulus Linux.
body: cl_interface
clagd_sys_mac: not required, default: undefined. # Clagd system mac address. Recommended to use the range starting with 44:38:39:ff. Needs to be the same between 2 Clag switches.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).
virtual_mac: not required, default: undefined. # Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
alias_name: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the port.
mstpctl_portadminedge: not required, default: undefined. # Enables admin edge port.
speed: not required, default: undefined. # Set speed of the swp(front panel) or management(eth0) interface. speed is in MB.
virtual_ip: not required, default: undefined. # Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
addr_method: not required, default: undefined. # Address method.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface.
clagd_enable: not required, default: undefined. # Enables the clagd daemon. This command should only be applied to the clag peerlink interface.
mstpctl_bpduguard: not required, default: undefined. # Enables BPDU Guard on a port in vlan-aware mode.

clagd_priority: not required, default: undefined. # Integer that changes the role the switch has in the clag domain. The lower priority switch will assume the primary role. The number can be between 0 and 65535.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).
pvid: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.
location: not required, default: /etc/network/interfaces.d. # Interface directory location
clagd_peer_ip: not required, default: undefined. # IP address of the directly connected peer switch interface.
vids: not required, default: undefined. # In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
mstpctl_portnetwork: not required, default: undefined. # Enables bridge assurance in vlan-aware mode.
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).

cl_interface_policy.description: Configure interface enforcement policy on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_interface_policy
location: not required, default: /etc/network/interfaces.d/. # Directory to store interface files.
allowed: required, default: undefined. # List of ports to run initial run at 10G.
cl_license
src: required, default: undefined. # The full path to the license. Can be local path or HTTP URL.

force: not required, default: undefined. # Force installation of a license. Typically not needed. It is recommended to manually run this command via the ansible command. A reload of switchd is not required. Running the force option in a playbook will break the idempotent state machine of the module and cause the switchd notification to kick in all the time, causing a disruption.
cl_ports
speed_4_by_10g: not required, default: undefined. # List of 40G ports that will be unganged to run as 4 10G ports.
speed_10g: not required, default: undefined. # List of ports to run initial run at 10G.
speed_40g: not required, default: undefined. # List of ports to run initial run at 40G.
speed_40g_div_4: not required, default: undefined. # List of 10G ports that will be ganged to form a 40G port.

clc_aa_policy.description: Create or Delete Anti Affinity Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_aa_policy
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create or delete the policy.
location: required, default: undefined. # Datacenter in which the policy lives/should live.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Anti Affinity Policy.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

clc_alert_policy.description: Create or Delete Alert Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_alert_policy
name: not required, default: None. # The name of the alert policy. This is mutually exclusive with id
metric: not required, default: None. # The metric on which to measure the condition that will trigger the alert. This is required for state 'present'
alert_recipients: not required, default: None. # A list of recipient email ids to notify the alert. This is required for state 'present'
alias: required, default: undefined. # The alias of your CLC Account
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create or delete the policy.

threshold: not required, default: None. # The threshold that will trigger the alert when the metric equals or exceeds it. This is required for state 'present' This number represents a percentage and must be a value between 5.0 - 95.0 that is a multiple of 5.0
id: not required, default: None. # The alert policy id. This is mutually exclusive with name
duration: not required, default: None. # The length of time in minutes that the condition must exceed the threshold. This is required for state 'present'

clc_blueprint_package.description: deploys a blue print package on a set of servers in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_blueprint_package
server_ids: required, default: undefined. # A list of server Ids to deploy the blue print package.
package_id: required, default: undefined. # The package id of the blue print.
package_params: not required, default: [object Object]. # The dictionary of arguments required to deploy the blue print.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install or un-install the package. Currently it supports only "present" for install action.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.
clc_firewall_policy
destination_account_alias: not required, default: None. # CLC alias for the destination account
destination: not required, default: None. # The list of destination addresses for traffic on the terminating firewall. This is required when state is 'present'
enabled: not required, default: true. # Whether the firewall policy is enabled or disabled
location: required, default: undefined. # Target datacenter for the firewall policy
source: not required, default: None. # The list  of source addresses for traffic on the originating firewall. This is required when state is 'present"
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create or delete the firewall policy
firewall_policy_id: not required, default: None. # Id of the firewall policy. This is required to update or delete an existing firewall policy
source_account_alias: required, default: undefined. # CLC alias for the source account
ports: not required, default: None. # The list of ports associated with the policy. TCP and UDP can take in single ports or port ranges.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the provisioning tasks to finish before returning.

clc_group.description: Create/delete Server Groups at Centurylink Cloud
body: clc_group
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create or delete the group
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Server Group
parent: not required, default: undefined. # The parent group of the server group. If parent is not provided, it creates the group at top level.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.
location: not required, default: undefined. # Datacenter to create the group in. If location is not provided, the group gets created in the default datacenter associated with the account
description: not required, default: undefined. # A description of the Server Group

clc_loadbalancer.description: Create, Delete shared loadbalancers in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_loadbalancer
status: not required, default: enabled. # The status of the loadbalancer
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the loadbalancer
method: not required, default: None. # -The balancing method for the load balancer pool
alias: required, default: undefined. # The alias of your CLC Account
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create or delete the load balancer pool
location: required, default: undefined. # The location of the datacenter where the load balancer resides in
nodes: not required, default: . # A list of nodes that needs to be added to the load balancer pool
port: not required, default: None. # Port to configure on the public-facing side of the load balancer pool
persistence: not required, default: None. # The persistence method for the load balancer
description: not required, default: None. # A description for the loadbalancer
clc_modify_server
alert_policy_id: not required, default: None. # The alert policy id to be associated to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'alert_policy_name'
anti_affinity_policy_name: not required, default: None. # The anti affinity policy name to be set for a hyper scale server. This is mutually exclusive with 'anti_affinity_policy_id'
state: not required, default: present. # The state to insure that the provided resources are in.
anti_affinity_policy_id: not required, default: None. # The anti affinity policy id to be set for a hyper scale server. This is mutually exclusive with 'anti_affinity_policy_name'
alert_policy_name: not required, default: None. # The alert policy name to be associated to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'alert_policy_id'
memory: not required, default: None. # Memory (in GB) to set to the server.
server_ids: required, default: undefined. # A list of server Ids to modify.
cpu: not required, default: None. # How many CPUs to update on the server
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the provisioning tasks to finish before returning.

clc_publicip.description: Add and Delete public ips on servers in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_publicip
server_ids: required, default: undefined. # A list of servers to create public ips on.
state: not required, default: present. # Determine whether to create or delete public IPs. If present module will not create a second public ip if one already exists.
protocol: not required, default: TCP. # The protocol that the public IP will listen for.
ports: not required, default: None. # A list of ports to expose. This is required when state is 'present'
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

clc_server.description: Create, Delete, Start and Stop servers in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_server
cpu_autoscale_policy_id: not required, default: None. # The autoscale policy to assign to the server.
anti_affinity_policy_name: not required, default: None. # The anti-affinity policy to assign to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'anti_affinity_policy_id'.
storage_type: not required, default: standard. # The type of storage to attach to the server.
anti_affinity_policy_id: not required, default: None. # The anti-affinity policy to assign to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'anti_affinity_policy_name'.
ttl: not required, default: None. # The time to live for the server in seconds.  The server will be deleted when this time expires.
count_group: not required, default: None. # Required when exact_count is specified.  The Server Group use to determine how many severs to deploy.
secondary_dns: not required, default: None. # Secondary DNS used by the server.
custom_fields: not required, default: . # The list of custom fields to set on the server.
packages: not required, default: . # The list of blue print packages to run on the server after its created.
group: not required, default: Default Group. # The Server Group to create servers under.

exact_count: not required, default: None. # Run in idempotent mode.  Will insure that this exact number of servers are running in the provided group, creating and deleting them to reach that count.  Requires count_group to be set.
state: not required, default: present. # The state to insure that the provided resources are in.
location: not required, default: None. # The Datacenter to create servers in.
template: not required, default: None. # The template to use for server creation.  Will search for a template if a partial string is provided. This is required when state is 'present'
memory: not required, default: 1. # Memory in GB.
server_ids: not required, default: . # Required for started, stopped, and absent states. A list of server Ids to insure are started, stopped, or absent.
type: not required, default: standard. # The type of server to create.
managed_os: not required, default: false. # Whether to create the server as 'Managed' or not.
additional_disks: not required, default: . # The list of additional disks for the server
description: not required, default: None. # The description to set for the server.
add_public_ip: not required, default: false. # Whether to add a public ip to the server
alert_policy_id: not required, default: None. # The alert policy to assign to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'alert_policy_name'.
alert_policy_name: not required, default: None. # The alert policy to assign to the server. This is mutually exclusive with 'alert_policy_id'.
password: not required, default: None. # Password for the administrator / root user
ip_address: not required, default: None. # The IP Address for the server. One is assigned if not provided.
public_ip_protocol: not required, default: TCP. # The protocol to use for the public ip if add_public_ip is set to True.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the provisioning tasks to finish before returning.
count: not required, default: 1. # The number of servers to build (mutually exclusive with exact_count)
name: not required, default: None. # A 1 to 6 character identifier to use for the server. This is required when state is 'present'
network_id: not required, default: None. # The network UUID on which to create servers.
primary_dns: not required, default: None. # Primary DNS used by the server.
alias: not required, default: None. # The account alias to provision the servers under.
public_ip_ports: not required, default: . # A list of ports to allow on the firewall to the servers public ip, if add_public_ip is set to True.
source_server_password: not required, default: None. # The password for the source server if a clone is specified.
os_type: not required, default: None. # Only required for bare metal servers. Specifies the OS to provision with the bare metal server.
configuration_id: not required, default: None. # Only required for bare metal servers. Specifies the identifier for the specific configuration type of bare metal server to deploy.
cpu: not required, default: 1. # How many CPUs to provision on the server

clc_server_snapshot.description: Create, Delete and Restore server snapshots in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_server_snapshot
server_ids: required, default: undefined. # The list of CLC server Ids.
expiration_days: not required, default: 7. # The number of days to keep the server snapshot before it expires.
state: not required, default: present. # The state to insure that the provided resources are in.
wait: not required, default: true. # Whether to wait for the provisioning tasks to finish before returning.
cloudflare_dns

solo: not required, default: null. # Whether the record should be the only one for that record type and record name. Only use with C(state=present),This will delete all other records with the same record name and type.
account_email: required, default: undefined. # Account email.
weight: not required, default: 1. # Service weight. Required for C(type=SRV)
proxied: not required, default: false. # Proxy through cloudflare network or just use DNS
ttl: not required, default: 1 (automatic). # The TTL to give the new record. Must be between 120 and 2,147,483,647 seconds, or 1 for automatic.
port: not required, default: null. # Service port. Required for C(type=SRV)

account_api_token: required, default: undefined. # Account API token. You can obtain your API key from the bottom of the Cloudflare 'My Account' page, found here: U(https://www.cloudflare.com/a/account)
zone: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Zone to work with (e.g. "example.com"). The Zone must already exist.
service: not required, default: null. # Record service. Required for C(type=SRV)
proto: not required, default: null. # Service protocol. Required for C(type=SRV)
value: not required, default: null. # The record value. Required for C(state=present)
priority: not required, default: 1. # Record priority. Required for C(type=MX) and C(type=SRV)
record: not required, default: @. # Record to add. Required if C(state=present). Default is C(@) (e.g. the zone name)
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the record(s) should exist or not
timeout: not required, default: 30. # Timeout for Cloudflare API calls
type: not required, default: null. # The type of DNS record to create. Required if C(state=present)

cloudformation.description: Create or delete an AWS CloudFormation stack
body: cloudformation
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
disable_rollback: not required, default: false. # If a stacks fails to form, rollback will remove the stack
notification_arns: not required, default: null. # The Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic ARNs to publish stack related events.
tags: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of tags to associate with stack and its resources during stack creation. Can be updated later, updating tags removes previous entries.
stack_name: required, default: undefined. # name of the cloudformation stack

template_url: not required, default: undefined. # Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack.,If 'state' is 'present' and the stack does not exist yet, either 'template' or 'template_url' must be specified (but not both). If 'state' is present, the stack does exist, and neither 'template' nor 'template_url' are specified, the previous template will be reused.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

role_arn: not required, default: null. # The role that AWS CloudFormation assumes to create the stack. See the AWS CloudFormation Service Role docs U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/using-iam-servicerole.html)
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

stack_policy: not required, default: null. # the path of the cloudformation stack policy. A policy cannot be removed once placed, but it can be modified. (for instance, [allow all updates](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/protect-stack-resources.html#d0e9051)

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

template_format: not required, default: json. # (deprecated) For local templates, allows specification of json or yaml format. Templates are now passed raw to CloudFormation regardless of format. This parameter is ignored since Ansible 2.3.
template_parameters: not required, default: [object Object]. # a list of hashes of all the template variables for the stack
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

state: required, default: undefined. # If state is "present", stack will be created.  If state is "present" and if stack exists and template has changed, it will be updated. If state is "absent", stack will be removed.

template: not required, default: null. # The local path of the cloudformation template.,This must be the full path to the file, relative to the working directory. If using roles this may look like "roles/cloudformation/files/cloudformation-example.json".,If 'state' is 'present' and the stack does not exist yet, either 'template' or 'template_url' must be specified (but not both). If 'state' is present, the stack does exist, and neither 'template' nor 'template_url' are specified, the previous template will be reused.

changeset_name: not required, default: null. # Name given to the changeset when creating a changeset, only used when create_changeset is true. By default a name prefixed with Ansible-STACKNAME is generated based on input parameters. See the AWS Change Sets docs U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/using-cfn-updating-stacks-changesets.html)

create_changeset: not required, default: false. # If stack already exists create a changeset instead of directly applying changes. See the AWS Change Sets docs U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/using-cfn-updating-stacks-changesets.html). WARNING: if the stack does not exist, it will be created without changeset. If the state is absent, the stack will be deleted immediately with no changeset.

cloudformation_facts.description: Obtain facts about an AWS CloudFormation stack
body: cloudformation_facts
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
stack_template: not required, default: false. # Get stack template body for the stack
all_facts: not required, default: false. # Get all stack information for the stack
stack_policy: not required, default: false. # Get stack policy for the stack

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
stack_events: not required, default: false. # Get stack events for the stack
stack_name: not required, default: null. # The name or id of the CloudFormation stack. Gathers facts for all stacks by default.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
stack_resources: not required, default: false. # Get stack resources for the stack
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

cloudfront_facts.description: Obtain facts about an AWS CloudFront distribution
body: cloudfront_facts
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
list_streaming_distributions: not required, default: false. # Get a list of streaming distributions.
origin_access_identity_config: not required, default: false. # Get the configuration information about an origin access identity. Requires I(origin_access_identity_id) to be specified.

streaming_distribution_configuration: not required, default: false. # Get the configuration information about a specified RTMP distribution. Requires I(distribution_id) or I(domain_name_alias) to be specified.
invalidation: not required, default: false. # Get information about an invalidation. Requires I(invalidation_id) to be specified.
domain_name_alias: not required, default: undefined. # Can be used instead of I(distribution_id) - uses the aliased CNAME for the cloudfront distribution to get the distribution id where required.
list_invalidations: not required, default: false. # Get a list of invalidations. Requires I(distribution_id) or I(domain_name_alias) to be specified.
origin_access_identity_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the cloudfront origin access identity to get information about.
list_distributions_by_web_acl_id: not required, default: false. # Get a list of distributions using web acl id as a filter. Requires I(web_acl_id) to be set.
origin_access_identity: not required, default: false. # Get information about an origin access identity. Requires I(origin_access_identity_id) to be specified.
all_lists: not required, default: false. # Get all cloudfront lists that do not require parameters.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
list_distributions: not required, default: false. # Get a list of cloudfront distributions.
summary: not required, default: false. # Returns a summary of all distributions, streaming distributions and origin_access_identities. This is the default behaviour if no option is selected.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
web_acl_id: not required, default: undefined. # Used with I(list_distributions_by_web_acl_id).

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
streaming_distribution: not required, default: false. # Get information about a specified RTMP distribution. Requires I(distribution_id) or I(domain_name_alias) to be specified.

distribution_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the CloudFront distribution. Used with I(distribution), I(distribution_config), I(invalidation), I(streaming_distribution), I(streaming_distribution_config), I(list_invalidations).
distribution_config: not required, default: false. # Get the configuration information about a distribution. Requires I(distribution_id) or I(domain_name_alias) to be specified.
invalidation_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the invalidation to get information about. Used with I(invalidation).
distribution: not required, default: false. # Get information about a distribution. Requires I(distribution_id) or I(domain_name_alias) to be specified.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
list_origin_access_identities: not required, default: false. # Get a list of cloudfront origin access identities. Requires I(origin_access_identity_id) to be set.

cloudscale_server.description: Manages servers on the cloudscale.ch IaaS service
body: cloudscale_server
volume_size_gb: not required, default: 10. # Size of the root volume in GB
uuid: not required, default: undefined. # UUID of the server,Either C(name) or C(uuid) are required. These options are mutually exclusive.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the Server,Either C(name) or C(uuid) are required. These options are mutually exclusive.
use_public_network: not required, default: true. # Attach a public network interface to the server
state: not required, default: running. # State of the server
image: not required, default: undefined. # Image used to create the server
use_ipv6: not required, default: true. # Enable IPv6 on the public network interface
user_data: not required, default: undefined. # Cloud-init configuration (cloud-config) data to use for the server.
anti_affinity_with: not required, default: undefined. # UUID of another server to create an anti-affinity group with
use_private_network: not required, default: false. # Attach a private network interface to the server
bulk_volume_size_gb: not required, default: null (no bulk storage volume). # Size of the bulk storage volume in GB
api_token: not required, default: undefined. # cloudscale.ch API token.,This can also be passed in the CLOUDSCALE_API_TOKEN environment variable.
flavor: not required, default: undefined. # Flavor of the server
ssh_keys: not required, default: undefined. # List of SSH public keys,Use the full content of your .pub file here.
cloudtrail
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: not required, default: [object Object]. # A hash/dictionary of tags to be applied to the CloudTrail resource.,Remove completely or specify an empty dictionary to remove all tags.

kms_key_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the KMS key ID to use to encrypt the logs delivered by CloudTrail. This also has the effect of enabling log file encryption.,The value can be an alias name prefixed by "alias/", a fully specified ARN to an alias, a fully specified ARN to a key, or a globally unique identifier.,Examples,alias/MyAliasName,arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:123456789012:alias/MyAliasName,arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012,12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012,See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/encrypting-cloudtrail-log-files-with-aws-kms.html)

s3_bucket_name: not required, default: undefined. # An existing S3 bucket where CloudTrail will deliver log files.,This bucket should exist and have the proper policy.,See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/aggregating_logs_regions_bucket_policy.html),Required when C(state=present)
is_multi_region_trail: not required, default: false. # Specify whether the trail belongs only to one region or exists in all regions.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
sns_topic_name: not required, default: undefined. # SNS Topic name to send notifications to when a log file is delivered
s3_key_prefix: not required, default: undefined. # S3 Key prefix for delivered log files. A trailing slash is not necessary and will be removed.
enable_logging: not required, default: true. # Start or stop the CloudTrail logging. If stopped the trail will be paused and will not record events or deliver log files.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

enable_log_file_validation: not required, default: false. # Specifies whether log file integrity validation is enabled.,CloudTrail will create a hash for every log file delivered and produce a signed digest file that can be used to ensure log files have not been tampered.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name for the CloudTrail.,Names are unique per-region unless the CloudTrail is a mulit-region trail, in which case it is unique per-account.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

cloudwatch_logs_role_arn: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies a full ARN for an IAM role that assigns the proper permissions for CloudTrail to create and write to the log group listed below.,See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/send-cloudtrail-events-to-cloudwatch-logs.html),Example arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/CloudTrail_CloudWatchLogs_Role,Required when C(cloudwatch_logs_log_group_arn)

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
include_global_events: not required, default: true. # Record API calls from global services such as IAM and STS.

cloudwatch_logs_log_group_arn: not required, default: undefined. # A full ARN specifying a valid CloudWatch log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered. The log group should already exist.,See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/awscloudtrail/latest/userguide/send-cloudtrail-events-to-cloudwatch-logs.html),Example arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:123456789012:log-group:CloudTrail/DefaultLogGroup:*,Required when C(cloudwatch_logs_role_arn)

state: required, default: undefined. # Add or remove CloudTrail configuration.,The following states have been preserved for backwards compatibility. C(state=enabled) and C(state=disabled).,enabled=present and disabled=absent.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

cloudwatchevent_rule.description: Manage CloudWatch Event rules and targets
body: cloudwatchevent_rule
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
role_arn: not required, default: undefined. # The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the rule
description: not required, default: undefined. # A description of the rule
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
event_pattern: not required, default: undefined. # A string pattern (in valid JSON format) that is used to match against incoming events to determine if the rule should be triggered
schedule_expression: not required, default: undefined. # A cron or rate expression that defines the schedule the rule will trigger on. For example, C(cron(0 20 * * ? *)), C(rate(5 minutes))
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the rule is present (and enabled), disabled, or absent

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

targets: not required, default: undefined. # A dictionary array of targets to add to or update for the rule, in the form C({ id: [string], arn: [string], role_arn: [string], input: [valid JSON string], input_path: [valid JSONPath string], ecs_parameters: {task_definition_arn: [string], task_count: [int]}}). I(id) [required] is the unique target assignment ID. I(arn) (required) is the Amazon Resource Name associated with the target. I(role_arn) (optional) is The Amazon Resource Name of the IAM role to be used for this target when the rule is triggered. I(input) (optional) is a JSON object that will override the event data when passed to the target.  I(input_path) (optional) is a JSONPath string (e.g. C($.detail)) that specifies the part of the event data to be passed to the target. If neither I(input) nor I(input_path) is specified, then the entire event is passed to the target in JSON form. I(task_definition_arn) [optional] is ecs task definition arn. I(task_count) [optional] is ecs task count.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the rule you are creating, updating or deleting. No spaces or special characters allowed (i.e. must match C([\.\-_A-Za-z0-9]+))

cnos_backup.description: Backup the current running or startup configuration to a remote server on devices running Lenovo CNOS
body: cnos_backup

username: required, default: null. # Configures the username used to authenticate the connection to the remote device. The value of the username parameter is used to authenticate the SSH session. While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.
serverpassword: required, default: null. # Specify the password for the server relating to the protocol used.

outputfile: required, default: null. # This specifies the file path where the output of each command execution is saved. Each command that is specified in the merged template file and each response from the device are saved here. Usually the location is the results folder, but you can choose another location based on your write permission.

protocol: required, default: null. # This refers to the protocol used by the network device to interact with the remote server to where to upload the backup configuration. The choices are FTP, SFTP, TFTP, or SCP. Any other protocols will result in error. If this parameter is not specified, there is no default value to be used.

configType: required, default: null. # This specifies what type of configuration will be backed up. The choices are the running or startup configurations. There is no default value, so it will result in an error if the input is incorrect.

host: required, default: null. # This is the variable used to search the hosts file at /etc/ansible/hosts and identify the IP address of the device on which the template is going to be applied. Usually the Ansible keyword {{ inventory_hostname }} is specified in the playbook as an abstraction of the group of network elements that need to be configured.
deviceType: required, default: null. # This specifies the type of device where the method is executed. The choices NE1072T,NE1032,NE1032T,NE10032, NE2572 are added since version 2.4
serverusername: required, default: null. # Specify the username for the server relating to the protocol used.

password: required, default: null. # Configures the password used to authenticate the connection to the remote device. The value of the password parameter is used to authenticate the SSH session. While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.

enablePassword: not required, default: null. # Configures the password used to enter Global Configuration command mode on the switch. If the switch does not request this password, the parameter is ignored.While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.
rcserverip: required, default: null. # -This specifies the IP Address of the remote server to where the configuration will be backed up.

rcpath: required, default: null. # This specifies the full file path where the configuration file will be copied on the remote server. In case the relative path is used as the variable value, the root folder for the user of the server needs to be specified.

cnos_conditional_template.description: Manage switch configuration using templates based on condition on devices running Lenovo CNOS
body: cnos_conditional_template

username: required, default: null. # Configures the username used to authenticate the connection to the remote device. The value of the username parameter is used to authenticate the SSH session. While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.

host: required, default: null. # This is the variable used to search the hosts file at /etc/ansible/hosts and identify the IP address of the device on which the template is going to be applied. Usually the Ansible keyword {{ inventory_hostname }} is specified in the playbook as an abstraction of the group of network elements that need to be configured.

outputfile: required, default: null. # This specifies the file path where the output of each command execution is saved. Each command that is specified in the merged template file and each response from the device are saved here. Usually the location is the results folder, but you can choose another location based on your write permission.
deviceType: required, default: null. # This specifies the type of device where the method is executed. The choices NE1072T,NE1032,NE1032T,NE10032, NE2572 are added since version 2.4

condition: required, default: null. # If you specify condition=<flag string> in the inventory file against any device, the template execution is done for that device in case it matches the flag setting for that task.

password: required, default: null. # Configures the password used to authenticate the connection to the remote device. The value of the password parameter is used to authenticate the SSH session. While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.

enablePassword: not required, default: null. # Configures the password used to enter Global Configuration command mode on the switch. If the switch does not request this password, the parameter is ignored.While generally the value should come from the inventory file, you can also specify it as a variable. This parameter is optional. If it is not specified, no default value will be used.
flag: required, default: null. # If a task needs to be executed, you have to set the flag the same as it is specified in the inventory for that device.

commandfile: required, default: null. # This specifies the path to the CNOS command file which needs to be applied. This usually comes from the commands folder. Generally this file is the output of the variables applied on a template file. So this command is preceded by a template module. The command file must contain the Ansible keyword {{ inventory_hostname }} and the condition flag in its filename to ensure that the command file is unique for each switch and condition. If this is omitted, the command file will be overwritten during iteration. For example, commandfile=./commands/clos_leaf_bgp_{{ inventory_hostname }}_LP21_commands.txt
