account: not required, default: null. # Account the resource is related to.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
resource_type: required, default: undefined. # Type of the resource.

cs_role.description: Manages user roles on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_role
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the role.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the role.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
id: not required, default: null. # ID of the role.,If provided, C(id) is used as key.
role_type: not required, default: User. # Type of the role.,Only considered for creation.
description: not required, default: null. # Description of the role.

cs_router.description: Manages routers on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_router
account: not required, default: null. # Account the router is related to.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the router.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the router is related to.
zone: not required, default: null. # Name of the zone the router is deployed in.,If not set, all zones are used.
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the router is related to.
service_offering: not required, default: null. # Name or id of the service offering of the router.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the router.

cs_securitygroup.description: Manages security groups on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_securitygroup
account: not required, default: null. # Account the security group is related to.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
description: not required, default: null. # Description of the security group.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the security group to be created in.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the security group.
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the security group is related to.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the security group.

cs_securitygroup_rule.description: Manages security group rules on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_securitygroup_rule
icmp_code: not required, default: null. # Error code for this icmp message. Required if C(protocol=icmp).
end_port: not required, default: null. # End port for this rule. Required if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp), but C(start_port) will be used if not set.
protocol: not required, default: tcp. # Protocol of the security group rule.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
start_port: not required, default: null. # Start port for this rule. Required if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp).
cidr: not required, default: 0.0.0.0/0. # CIDR (full notation) to be used for security group rule.
icmp_type: not required, default: null. # Type of the icmp message being sent. Required if C(protocol=icmp).
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
user_security_group: not required, default: null. # Security group this rule is based of.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the security group to be created in.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the security group rule.
security_group: required, default: undefined. # Name of the security group the rule is related to. The security group must be existing.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
type: not required, default: ingress. # Ingress or egress security group rule.

cs_snapshot_policy.description: Manages volume snapshot policies on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_snapshot_policy
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the volume is related to.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.

schedule: not required, default: null. # Time the snapshot is scheduled. Required if C(state=present).,Format for C(interval_type=HOURLY): C(MM),Format for C(interval_type=DAILY): C(MM:HH),Format for C(interval_type=WEEKLY): C(MM:HH:DD (1-7)),Format for C(interval_type=MONTHLY): C(MM:HH:DD (1-28))
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.

vm: not required, default: null. # Name of the instance to select the volume from.,Use C(volume_type) if VM has a DATADISK and ROOT volume.,In case of C(volume_type=DATADISK), additionally use C(device_id) if VM has more than one DATADISK volume.,Either C(volume) or C(vm) is required.
time_zone: not required, default: UTC. # Specifies a timezone for this command.
volume: not required, default: null. # Name of the volume.,Either C(volume) or C(vm) is required.
vpc: not required, default: null. # Name of the vpc the instance is deployed in.
max_snaps: not required, default: 8. # Max number of snapshots.
device_id: not required, default: null. # ID of the device on a VM the volume is attached to.,This will only be considered if VM has multiple DATADISK volumes.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the volume is related to.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
interval_type: not required, default: daily. # Interval of the snapshot.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
volume_type: not required, default: null. # Type of the volume.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the volume is related to.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the snapshot policy.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.

cs_sshkeypair.description: Manages SSH keys on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_sshkeypair
public_key: not required, default: null. # String of the public key.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the public key is related to.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the public key to be registered in.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the public key.
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the public key is related to.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of public key.

cs_staticnat.description: Manages static NATs on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_staticnat
vm_guest_ip: not required, default: false. # VM guest NIC secondary IP address for the static NAT.
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the static NAT is related to.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
vm: not required, default: null. # Name of virtual machine which we make the static NAT for.,Required if C(state=present).
vpc: not required, default: null. # VPC the network related to.
ip_address: required, default: undefined. # Public IP address the static NAT is assigned to.
network: not required, default: null. # Network the IP address is related to.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the static NAT is related to.
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: null. # Name of the zone in which the virtual machine is in.,If not set, default zone is used.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the static NAT is related to.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the static NAT.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.

cs_storage_pool.description: Manages Primary Storage Pools on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_storage_pool
managed: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the storage pool should be managed by CloudStack.,Only considere on creation.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
storage_tags: not required, default: undefined. # Tags associated with this storage pool.
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the cluster.
pod: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the pod.
storage_url: not required, default: undefined. # URL of the storage pool.,Required if C(state=present).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the storage pool.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the zone in which the host should be deployed.,If not set, default zone is used.
capacity_iops: not required, default: undefined. # Bytes CloudStack can provision from this storage pool.
hypervisor: not required, default: undefined. # Required when creating a zone scoped pool.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the storage pool.
capacity_bytes: not required, default: undefined. # Bytes CloudStack can provision from this storage pool.
provider: not required, default: DefaultPrimary. # Name of the storage provider e.g. SolidFire, SolidFireShared, DefaultPrimary, CloudByte.
scope: not required, default: undefined. # The scope of the storage pool.,Defaults to cluster when C(cluster) is provided, otherwise zone.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
allocation_state: not required, default: undefined. # Allocation state of the storage pool.

cs_template.description: Manages templates on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_template
is_featured: not required, default: false. # Register the template to be featured.,Only used if C(state) is present.
sshkey_enabled: not required, default: false. # True if the template supports the sshkey upload feature.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.

vm: not required, default: null. # VM name the template will be created from its volume or alternatively from a snapshot.,VM must be in stopped state if created from its volume.,Mutually exclusive with C(url).
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the template, snapshot or VM is related to.
is_extractable: not required, default: false. # True if the template or its derivatives are extractable.
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: null. # Name of the zone you wish the template to be registered or deleted from.,If not specified, first found zone will be used.
format: not required, default: null. # The format for the template.,Relevant when using C(state=present).
is_dynamically_scalable: not required, default: false. # Register the template having XS/VMWare tools installed in order to support dynamic scaling of VM CPU/memory.,Only used if C(state) is present.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the template.
template_filter: not required, default: self. # Name of the filter used to search for the template.

is_ready: not required, default: false. # This flag is used for searching existing templates.,If set to C(true), it will only list template ready for deployment e.g. successfully downloaded and installed.,Recommended to set it to C(false).
details: not required, default: null. # Template details in key/value pairs.
is_routing: not required, default: null. # True if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router.,Only considered if C(url) is used.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
bits: not required, default: 64. # 32 or 64 bits support.
tags: not required, default: null. # List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,To delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
is_public: not required, default: false. # Register the template to be publicly available to all users.,Only used if C(state) is present.
requires_hvm: not required, default: false. # true if this template requires HVM.
password_enabled: not required, default: false. # True if the template supports the password reset feature.
display_text: not required, default: null. # Display text of the template.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the template, snapshot or VM is related to.
template_tag: not required, default: null. # the tag for this template.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the template.
url: not required, default: null. # URL of where the template is hosted on C(state=present).,URL to which the template would be extracted on C(state=extracted).,Mutually exclusive with C(vm).
checksum: not required, default: false. # The MD5 checksum value of this template.,If set, we search by checksum instead of name.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
cross_zones: not required, default: false. # Whether the template should be synced or removed across zones.,Only used if C(state) is present or absent.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the template to be registered in.
snapshot: not required, default: null. # Name of the snapshot, created from the VM ROOT volume, the template will be created from.,C(vm) is required together with this argument.
mode: not required, default: http_download. # Mode for the template extraction.,Only used if C(state=extracted).
hypervisor: not required, default: null. # Name the hypervisor to be used for creating the new template.,Relevant when using C(state=present).
os_type: not required, default: null. # OS type that best represents the OS of this template.

cs_user.description: Manages users on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_user
username: required, default: undefined. # Username of the user.
domain: not required, default: ROOT. # Domain the user is related to.
last_name: not required, default: null. # Last name of the user.,Required on C(state=present).
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
first_name: not required, default: null. # First name of the user.,Required on C(state=present).
timezone: not required, default: null. # Timezone of the user.
password: not required, default: null. # Password of the user to be created.,Required on C(state=present).,Only considered on creation and will not be updated if user exists.
keys_registered: not required, default: null. # If API keys of the user should be generated.,Note: Keys can not be removed by the API again.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the user will be created under.,Required on C(state=present).
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the user.,C(unlocked) is an alias for C(enabled).
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
email: not required, default: null. # Email of the user.,Required on C(state=present).

cs_vmsnapshot.description: Manages VM snapshots on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_vmsnapshot
snapshot_memory: not required, default: false. # Snapshot memory if set to true.
domain: not required, default: undefined. # Domain the VM snapshot is related to.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the snapshot.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
tags: not required, default: undefined. # List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,To delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
vm: required, default: undefined. # Name of the virtual machine.
name: required, default: undefined. # Unique Name of the snapshot. In CloudStack terms display name.
account: not required, default: undefined. # Account the VM snapshot is related to.
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the zone in which the VM is in. If not set, default zone is used.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the project the VM is assigned to.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the snapshot.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.

cs_volume.description: Manages volumes on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_volume
custom_id: not required, default: null. # Custom id to the resource.,Allowed to Root Admins only.
domain: not required, default: null. # Name of the domain the volume to be deployed in.
force: not required, default: false. # Force removal of volume even it is attached to a VM.,Considered on C(state=absnet) only.
disk_offering: not required, default: null. # Name of the disk offering to be used.,Required one of C(disk_offering), C(snapshot) if volume is not already C(state=present).
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
tags: not required, default: null. # List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,To delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
shrink_ok: not required, default: false. # Whether to allow to shrink the volume.
vm: not required, default: null. # Name of the virtual machine to attach the volume to.
display_volume: not required, default: true. # Whether to display the volume to the end user or not.,Allowed to Root Admins only.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the volume.
min_iops: not required, default: null. # Min iops
size: not required, default: null. # Size of disk in GB
account: not required, default: null. # Account the volume is related to.
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: null. # Name of the zone in which the volume should be deployed.,If not set, default zone is used.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the volume.,C(name) can only contain ASCII letters.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the volume to be deployed in.
max_iops: not required, default: null. # Max iops
snapshot: not required, default: null. # The snapshot name for the disk volume.,Required one of C(disk_offering), C(snapshot) if volume is not already C(state=present).
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.

cs_vpc.description: Manages VPCs on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_vpc
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the VPC is related to.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.
tags: not required, default: null. # List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,For deleting all tags, set an empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
api_secret: not required, default: null. # Secret key of the CloudStack API.
api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.
account: not required, default: null. # Account the VPC is related to.
cidr: not required, default: null. # CIDR of the VPC, e.g. 10.1.0.0/16,All VPC guest networks' CIDRs must be within this CIDR.,Required on C(state=present).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the VPC.
display_text: not required, default: null. # Display text of the VPC.,If not set, C(name) will be used for creating.
vpc_offering: not required, default: null. # Name of the VPC offering.,If not set, default VPC offering is used.
network_domain: not required, default: null. # Network domain for the VPC.,All networks inside the VPC will belong to this domain.
poll_async: not required, default: true. # Poll async jobs until job has finished.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
zone: not required, default: null. # Name of the zone.,If not set, default zone is used.
api_region: not required, default: cloudstack. # Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.
project: not required, default: null. # Name of the project the VPC is related to.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the VPC.
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.

cs_vpn_gateway.description: Manages site-to-site VPN gateways on Apache CloudStack based clouds.

cs_zone.description: Manages zones on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_zone
domain: not required, default: null. # Domain the zone is related to.,Zone is a public zone if not set.

cs_zone_facts.description: Gathering facts of zones from Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_zone_facts
api_key: not required, default: null. # API key of the CloudStack API.
api_url: not required, default: null. # URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.
api_http_method: not required, default: get. # HTTP method used.

api_timeout: not required, default: 10. # HTTP timeout.

name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the zone.

cv_server_provision.description: Provision server port by applying or removing template configuration to an Arista CloudVision Portal configlet that is applied to a switch.
body: cv_server_provision
username: required, default: undefined. # The user that will be used to connect to CVP for making API calls.

port_vlan: not required, default: None. # The vlan that should be applied to the port for this server. This parameter is dependent on a proper template that supports single vlan provisioning with it. If a port vlan is specified by the template specified does not support this the module will exit out with no changes. If a template is specified that requires a port vlan but no port vlan is specified the module will exit out with no changes.
protocol: not required, default: https. # The protocol to use when making API calls to CVP. CVP defaults to https and newer versions of CVP no longer support http.
switch_port: required, default: undefined. # The physical port number on the switch that the new server is connected to.
server_name: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or identifier for the server that is having it's switch port provisioned.

port: not required, default: None. # The port number to use when making API calls to the CVP node. This will default to the default port for the specified protocol. Port 80 for http and port 443 for https.
host: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the CVP node being connected to.

template: required, default: undefined. # A path to a Jinja formatted template file that contains the configuration block that will be applied to the specified switch port. This template will have variable fields replaced by the module before being applied to the switch configuration.

auto_run: not required, default: false. # Flag that determines whether or not the module will execute the CVP task spawned as a result of changes to a switch configlet. When an add or remove action is taken which results in a change to a switch configlet, CVP will spawn a task that needs to be executed for the configuration to be applied to the switch. If this option is True then the module will determined the task number created by the configuration change, execute it and wait for the task to complete. If the option is False then the task will remain in the Pending state in CVP for a network administrator to review and execute.

action: not required, default: show. # The action for the module to take. The actions are add, which applies the specified template config to port, remove, which defaults the specified interface configuration, and show, which will return the current port configuration with no changes.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the user that will be used to connect to CVP for API calls.
switch_name: required, default: undefined. # The hostname of the switch is being configured for the server being provisioned.

cyberark_authentication.description: Module for CyberArk Vault Authentication using PAS Web Services SDK
body: cyberark_authentication
username: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the user who will logon to the Vault.
use_radius_authentication: not required, default: no. # Whether or not users will be authenticated via a RADIUS server. Valid values are true/false.
new_password: not required, default: undefined. # The new password of the user. This parameter is optional, and enables you to change a password.
cyberark_session: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary set by a CyberArk authentication containing the different values to perform actions on a logged-on CyberArk session.
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies if an authentication logon/logoff and a cyberark_session should be added/removed.
password: not required, default: undefined. # The password of the user.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(false) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
use_shared_logon_authentication: not required, default: no. # Whether or not Shared Logon Authentication will be used.
api_base_url: not required, default: undefined. # A string containing the base URL of the server hosting CyberArk's Privileged Account Security Web Services SDK.

cyberark_user.description: Module for CyberArk User Management using PAS Web Services SDK
body: cyberark_user
username: required, default: undefined. # The name of the user who will be queried (for details), added, updated or deleted.
first_name: not required, default: undefined. # The user first name.
last_name: not required, default: undefined. # The user last name.

initial_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password that the new user will use to log on the first time. This password must meet the password policy requirements. this parameter is required when state is present -- Add User.
user_type_name: not required, default: EPVUser. # The type of user.
new_password: not required, default: undefined. # The user updated password. Make sure that this password meets the password policy requirements.

cyberark_session: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary set by a CyberArk authentication containing the different values to perform actions on a logged-on CyberArk session, please see M(cyberark_authentication) module for an example of cyberark_session.
group_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the group the user will be added to.
disabled: not required, default: no. # Whether or not the user will be disabled. Valid values = true/false.
change_password_on_the_next_logon: not required, default: no. # Whether or not the user must change their password in their next logon. Valid values = true/false.
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies the state needed for the user present for create user, absent for delete user.
expiry_date: not required, default: undefined. # The date and time when the user account will expire and become disabled.
location: not required, default: undefined. # The Vault Location for the user.
email: not required, default: undefined. # The user email address.
data_pipeline
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Datapipeline to create/modify/delete.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
tags: not required, default: null. # A dict of key:value pair(s) to add to the pipeline.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: not required, default: present. # The requested state of the pipeline.
objects: not required, default: undefined. # A list of pipeline object definitions, each of which is a dict that takes the keys C(id), C(name) and C(fields).
values: not required, default: undefined. # A list of parameter values (dicts) in the pipeline definition. Each dict takes the keys C(id) and C(stringValue) both of which are strings.
timeout: not required, default: 300. # Time in seconds to wait for the pipeline to transition to the requested state, fail otherwise.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
parameters: not required, default: undefined. # A list of parameter objects (dicts) in the pipeline definition.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
description: not required, default: . # An optional description for the pipeline being created.
datadog_event
date_happened: not required, default: now. # POSIX timestamp of the event.,Default value is now.
alert_type: not required, default: info. # Type of alert.
title: required, default: null. # The event title.
text: required, default: null. # The body of the event.
tags: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of tags to apply to the event.
app_key: required, default: undefined. # Your DataDog app key.
priority: not required, default: normal. # The priority of the event.
host: not required, default: {{ ansible_hostname }}. # Host name to associate with the event.
aggregation_key: not required, default: null. # An arbitrary string to use for aggregation.
api_key: required, default: null. # Your DataDog API key.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
datadog_monitor
notify_audit: not required, default: false. # A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor.
timeout_h: not required, default: null. # The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.
tags: not required, default: None. # A list of tags to associate with your monitor when creating or updating. This can help you categorize and filter monitors.

thresholds: not required, default: [object Object]. # A dictionary of thresholds by status. This option is only available for service checks and metric alerts. Because each of them can have multiple thresholds, we don't define them directly in the query."]
new_host_delay: not required, default: null. # A positive integer representing the number of seconds to wait before evaluating the monitor for new hosts. This gives the host time to fully initialize.
app_key: required, default: undefined. # Your DataDog app key.
query: not required, default: null. # The monitor query to notify on with syntax varying depending on what type of monitor you are creating.

message: not required, default: null. # A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events. Monitor message template variables can be accessed by using double square brackets, i.e '[[' and ']]'.
id: not required, default: null. # The id of the alert. If set, will be used instead of the name to locate the alert.
locked: not required, default: false. # A boolean indicating whether changes to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the alert.

no_data_timeframe: not required, default: 2x timeframe for metric, 2 minutes for service. # The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.
silenced: not required, default: . # Dictionary of scopes to timestamps or None. Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is None.

require_full_window: not required, default: null. # A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set this to False for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped.
notify_no_data: not required, default: false. # A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting..
renotify_interval: not required, default: null. # The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.
state: required, default: undefined. # The designated state of the monitor.
escalation_message: not required, default: null. # A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the '@username' notification we allow elsewhere. Not applicable if renotify_interval is None
api_key: required, default: undefined. # Your DataDog API key.
type: not required, default: null. # The type of the monitor.,The 'event alert'is available starting at Ansible 2.1
dconf
state: not required, default: present. # The action to take upon the key/value.
key: required, default: undefined. # A dconf key to modify or read from the dconf database.

value: not required, default: undefined. # Value to set for the specified dconf key. Value should be specified in GVariant format. Due to complexity of this format, it is best to have a look at existing values in the dconf database. Required for C(state=present).
debconf
value: not required, default: null. # Value to set the configuration to
vtype: not required, default: null. # The type of the value supplied.,C(seen) was added in 2.2.
question: not required, default: null. # A debconf configuration setting
name: required, default: null. # Name of package to configure.
unseen: not required, default: false. # Do not set 'seen' flag when pre-seeding
debug
msg: not required, default: Hello world!. # The customized message that is printed. If omitted, prints a generic message.
var: not required, default: undefined. # A variable name to debug.  Mutually exclusive with the 'msg' option.
verbosity: not required, default: 0. # A number that controls when the debug is run, if you set to 3 it will only run debug when -vvv or above

dellos10_command.description: Run commands on remote devices running Dell OS10
body: dellos10_command

retries: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditions.

commands: required, default: undefined. # List of commands to send to the remote dellos10 device over the configured provider. The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries has expired.

wait_for: not required, default: null. # List of conditions to evaluate against the output of the command. The task will wait for each condition to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true within the configured number of I(retries), the task fails. See examples.

interval: not required, default: 1. # Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

dellos10_config.description: Manage Dell EMC Networking OS10 configuration sections
body: dellos10_config

src: not required, default: null. # Specifies the source path to the file that contains the configuration or configuration template to load.  The path to the source file can either be the full path on the Ansible control host or a relative path from the playbook or role root directory.  This argument is mutually exclusive with I(lines).

backup: not required, default: false. # This argument causes the module to create a full backup of the current C(running-config) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.

after: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  As with I(before), the playbook designer can use this argument  to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

lines: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config. Note the configuration command syntax as the device config parser automatically modifies some commands. This argument is mutually exclusive with I(src).

update: not required, default: merge. # The I(update) argument controls how the configuration statements are processed on the remote device.  Valid choices for the I(update) argument are I(merge) and I(check).  When you set the argument to I(merge), the configuration changes merge with the current device running configuration.  When you set the argument to I(check), the configuration updates are determined but not actually configured on the remote device.

replace: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device. If you set the replace argument to I(line), then the modified lines push to the device in configuration mode.  If you set the replace argument to I(block), then the entire command block pushes to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

parents: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If you omit the parents argument, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config at the conclusion of the module running.  If you specify check mode, this argument is ignored.

config: not required, default: null. # The playbook designer can use the C(config) argument to supply the base configuration to be used to validate necessary configuration changes.  If you specify this argument, the module does not download the running-config from the remote node.

match: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If you set match to I(line), commands match line by line.  If you set match to I(strict), command lines match by position.  If you set match to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if you set match to I(none), the module does not attempt to compare the source configuration with the running configuration on the remote device.

before: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  The playbook designer can  use this argument to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

dellos10_facts.description: Collect facts from remote devices running Dell EMC Networking OS10
body: dellos10_facts

gather_subset: not required, default: !config. # When supplied, this argument restricts the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  You can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  You can also use values with an initial M(!) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.
