deploy_helper.description: Manages some of the steps common in deploying projects.
body: deploy_helper

unfinished_filename: not required, default: DEPLOY_UNFINISHED. # the name of the file that indicates a deploy has not finished. All folders in the releases_path that contain this file will be deleted on C(state=finalize) with clean=True, or C(state=clean). This file is automatically deleted from the I(new_release_path) during C(state=finalize).

keep_releases: not required, default: 5. # the number of old releases to keep when cleaning. Used in C(finalize) and C(clean). Any unfinished builds will be deleted first, so only correct releases will count. The current version will not count.

current_path: not required, default: current. # the name of the symlink that is created when the deploy is finalized. Used in C(finalize) and C(clean). Returned in the C(deploy_helper.current_path) fact.

state: not required, default: present. # the state of the project. C(query) will only gather facts, C(present) will create the project I(root) folder, and in it the I(releases) and I(shared) folders, C(finalize) will remove the unfinished_filename file, create a symlink to the newly deployed release and optionally clean old releases, C(clean) will remove failed & old releases, C(absent) will remove the project folder (synonymous to the M(file) module with C(state=absent))

shared_path: not required, default: shared. # the name of the folder that will hold the shared resources. This can be relative to C(path) or absolute. If this is set to an empty string, no shared folder will be created. Returned in the C(deploy_helper.shared_path) fact.
releases_path: not required, default: releases. # the name of the folder that will hold the releases. This can be relative to C(path) or absolute. Returned in the C(deploy_helper.releases_path) fact.
clean: not required, default: true. # Whether to run the clean procedure in case of C(state=finalize).

release: not required, default: None. # the release version that is being deployed. Defaults to a timestamp format %Y%m%d%H%M%S (i.e. '20141119223359'). This parameter is optional during C(state=present), but needs to be set explicitly for C(state=finalize). You can use the generated fact C(release={{ deploy_helper.new_release }}).
path: required, default: undefined. # the root path of the project. Alias I(dest). Returned in the C(deploy_helper.project_path) fact.
digital_ocean

unique_name: not required, default: no. # Bool, require unique hostnames.  By default, DigitalOcean allows multiple hosts with the same name.  Setting this to "yes" allows only one host per name.  Useful for idempotence.
virtio: not required, default: yes. # Bool, turn on virtio driver in droplet for improved network and storage I/O.
region_id: not required, default: undefined. # This is the slug of the region you would like your server to be created in.
backups_enabled: not required, default: no. # Optional, Boolean, enables backups for your droplet.
user_data: not required, default: None. # opaque blob of data which is made available to the droplet
image_id: not required, default: undefined. # This is the slug of the image you would like the droplet created with.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
api_token: not required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean api token.
ssh_pub_key: not required, default: undefined. # The public SSH key you want to add to your account.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Wait for the droplet to be in state 'running' before returning.  If wait is "no" an ip_address may not be returned.
name: not required, default: undefined. # String, this is the name of the droplet - must be formatted by hostname rules, or the name of a SSH key.
size_id: not required, default: undefined. # This is the slug of the size you would like the droplet created with.
id: not required, default: undefined. # Numeric, the droplet id you want to operate on.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
command: not required, default: droplet. # Which target you want to operate on.
ssh_key_ids: not required, default: undefined. # Optional, array of SSH key (numeric) ID that you would like to be added to the server.
ipv6: not required, default: no. # Optional, Boolean, enable IPv6 for your droplet.
private_networking: not required, default: no. # Bool, add an additional, private network interface to droplet for inter-droplet communication.

digital_ocean_block_storage.description: Create/destroy or attach/detach Block Storage volumes in DigitalOcean
body: digital_ocean_block_storage
droplet_id: not required, default: undefined. # The droplet id you want to operate on. Required when command=attach.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the Block Storage volume.
region: required, default: undefined. # The slug of the region where your Block Storage volume should be located in.
volume_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Block Storage volume.
state: required, default: undefined. # Indicate desired state of the target.
command: required, default: undefined. # Which operation do you want to perform.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout in seconds used for polling DigitalOcean's API.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean api token.
block_size: not required, default: undefined. # The size of the Block Storage volume in gigabytes. Required when command=create and state=present.

digital_ocean_domain.description: Create/delete a DNS record in DigitalOcean
body: digital_ocean_domain
ip: not required, default: undefined. # The IP address to point a domain at.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
api_token: not required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean api token.
id: not required, default: undefined. # Numeric, the droplet id you want to operate on.
name: not required, default: undefined. # String, this is the name of the droplet - must be formatted by hostname rules, or the name of a SSH key, or the name of a domain.
digital_ocean_floating_ip
ip: not required, default: None. # Public IP address of the Floating IP. Used to remove an IP
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
oauth_token: required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean OAuth token.
region: not required, default: None. # The region that the Floating IP is reserved to.
droplet_id: not required, default: None. # The Droplet that the Floating IP has been assigned to.
digital_ocean_sshkey
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
fingerprint: not required, default: None. # This is a unique identifier for the SSH key used to delete a key
oauth_token: required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean OAuth token.
ssh_pub_key: not required, default: None. # The Public SSH key to add.
name: not required, default: None. # The name for the SSH key

digital_ocean_tag.description: Create and remove tag(s) to DigitalOcean resource.
body: digital_ocean_tag
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the tag should be present or absent on the resource.
resource_id: not required, default: undefined. # The ID of the resource to operate on.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the tag. The supported characters for names include alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
resource_type: not required, default: droplet. # The type of resource to operate on. Currently, only tagging of droplets is supported.
api_token: not required, default: undefined. # DigitalOcean api token.

dimensiondata_network.description: Create, update, and delete MCP 1.0 & 2.0 networks
body: dimensiondata_network
service_plan: not required, default: ESSENTIALS. # The service plan, either "ESSENTIALS" or "ADVANCED".,MCP 2.0 Only.

mcp_user: not required, default: undefined. # The username used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_USER) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).
wait_poll_interval: not required, default: 2. # The amount of time (in seconds) to wait between checks for task completion.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).

mcp_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_PASSWORD) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).,Required if I(mcp_user) is specified.
region: not required, default: na. # The target region.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Additional description of the network domain.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the network domain to create.
wait_time: not required, default: 600. # The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the task to complete.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).
state: not required, default: present. # Should the resource be present or absent.
location: required, default: undefined. # The target datacenter.

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only be used on private instances of the CloudControl API that use self-signed certificates.
wait: not required, default: false. # Should we wait for the task to complete before moving onto the next.
django_manage
virtualenv: not required, default: undefined. # An optional path to a I(virtualenv) installation to use while running the manage application.
app_path: required, default: undefined. # The path to the root of the Django application where B(manage.py) lives.
settings: not required, default: undefined. # The Python path to the application's settings module, such as 'myapp.settings'.
pythonpath: not required, default: undefined. # A directory to add to the Python path. Typically used to include the settings module if it is located external to the application directory.
database: not required, default: undefined. # The database to target. Used by the 'createcachetable', 'flush', 'loaddata', and 'syncdb' commands.
apps: not required, default: undefined. # A list of space-delimited apps to target. Used by the 'test' command.
cache_table: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the table used for database-backed caching. Used by the 'createcachetable' command.
merge: not required, default: undefined. # Will run out-of-order or missing migrations as they are not rollback migrations, you can only use this parameter with 'migrate' command

command: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Django management command to run. Built in commands are cleanup, collectstatic, flush, loaddata, migrate, runfcgi, syncdb, test, and validate.,Other commands can be entered, but will fail if they're unknown to Django.  Other commands that may prompt for user input should be run with the I(--noinput) flag.
skip: not required, default: undefined. # Will skip over out-of-order missing migrations, you can only use this parameter with I(migrate)
link: not required, default: undefined. # Will create links to the files instead of copying them, you can only use this parameter with 'collectstatic' command
fixtures: not required, default: undefined. # A space-delimited list of fixture file names to load in the database. B(Required) by the 'loaddata' command.
failfast: not required, default: no. # Fail the command immediately if a test fails. Used by the 'test' command.
dladm_etherstub
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete Solaris/illumos etherstub.
temporary: not required, default: false. # Specifies that the etherstub is temporary. Temporary etherstubs do not persist across reboots.
name: required, default: undefined. # Etherstub name.

dladm_iptun.description: Manage IP tunnel interfaces on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_iptun
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.
temporary: not required, default: false. # Specifies that the IP tunnel interface is temporary. Temporary IP tunnel interfaces do not persist across reboots.
name: required, default: undefined. # IP tunnel interface name.
local_address: not required, default: undefined. # Literat IP address or hostname corresponding to the tunnel source.
type: not required, default: ipv4. # Specifies the type of tunnel to be created.
remote_address: not required, default: undefined. # Literal IP address or hostname corresponding to the tunnel destination.

dladm_linkprop.description: Manage link properties on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_linkprop
link: required, default: undefined. # Link interface name.
state: not required, default: present. # Set or reset the property value.
property: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the name of the property we want to manage.
temporary: not required, default: false. # Specifies that lin property configuration is temporary. Temporary link property configuration does not persist across reboots.
value: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the value we want to set for the link property.

dladm_vlan.description: Manage VLAN interfaces on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_vlan
link: required, default: undefined. # VLAN underlying link name.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.
temporary: not required, default: false. # Specifies that the VLAN interface is temporary. Temporary VLANs do not persist across reboots.
name: required, default: undefined. # VLAN interface name.
vlan_id: not required, default: false. # VLAN ID value for VLAN interface.
dladm_vnic
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.
temporary: not required, default: false. # Specifies that the VNIC is temporary. Temporary VNICs do not persist across reboots.
name: required, default: undefined. # VNIC name.
link: required, default: undefined. # VNIC underlying link name.
vlan: not required, default: false. # Enable VLAN tagging for this VNIC. The VLAN tag will have id I(vlan).
mac: not required, default: false. # Sets the VNIC's MAC address. Must be valid unicast MAC address.

dnf.description: Manages packages with the I(dnf) package manager
body: dnf

autoremove: not required, default: undefined. # If C(yes), removes all "leaf" packages from the system that were originally installed as dependencies of user-installed packages but which are no longer required by any such package. Should be used alone or when state is I(absent)

name: required, default: null. # Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0). When using state=latest, this can be '*' which means run: dnf -y update. You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.
list: not required, default: null. # Various (non-idempotent) commands for usage with C(/usr/bin/ansible) and I(not) playbooks. See examples.
disable_gpg_check: not required, default: no. # Whether to disable the GPG checking of signatures of packages being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
conf_file: not required, default: null. # The remote dnf configuration file to use for the transaction.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.

disablerepo: not required, default: null. # I(Repoid) of repositories to disable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".

enablerepo: not required, default: null. # I(Repoid) of repositories to enable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".
installroot: not required, default: /. # Specifies an alternative installroot, relative to which all packages will be installed.

dnsimple.description: Interface with dnsimple.com (a DNS hosting service).
body: dnsimple
solo: not required, default: null. # Whether the record should be the only one for that record type and record name. Only use with state=present on a record

domain: not required, default: null. # Domain to work with. Can be the domain name (e.g. "mydomain.com") or the numeric ID of the domain in DNSimple. If omitted, a list of domains will be returned.,If domain is present but the domain doesn't exist, it will be created.

account_email: not required, default: null. # Account email. If omitted, the env variables DNSIMPLE_EMAIL and DNSIMPLE_API_TOKEN will be looked for. If those aren't found, a C(.dnsimple) file will be looked for, see: U(https://github.com/mikemaccana/dnsimple-python#getting-started)
record_ids: not required, default: null. # List of records to ensure they either exist or don't exist
value: not required, default: null. # Record value,Must be specified when trying to ensure a record exists
priority: not required, default: null. # Record priority
record: not required, default: null. # Record to add, if blank a record for the domain will be created, supports the wildcard (*)
state: not required, default: null. # whether the record should exist or not
ttl: not required, default: 3600 (one hour). # The TTL to give the new record
type: not required, default: null. # The type of DNS record to create
account_api_token: not required, default: null. # Account API token. See I(account_email) for info.

dnsmadeeasy.description: Interface with dnsmadeeasy.com (a DNS hosting service).
body: dnsmadeeasy
httpFqdn: not required, default: undefined. # The fully qualified domain name used by the monitor.
domain: required, default: null. # Domain to work with. Can be the domain name (e.g. "mydomain.com") or the numeric ID of the domain in DNS Made Easy (e.g. "839989") for faster resolution
protocol: required, default: HTTP. # Protocol used by the monitor.
autoFailover: required, default: no. # If true, fallback to the primary IP address is manual after a failover.,If false, fallback to the primary IP address is automatic after a failover.
record_ttl: not required, default: 1800. # record's "Time to live".  Number of seconds the record remains cached in DNS servers.
sensitivity: required, default: Medium. # Number of checks the monitor performs before a failover occurs where Low = 8, Medium = 5,and High = 3.
contactList: required, default: . # Name or id of the contact list that the monitor will notify.,The default C('') means the Account Owner.
account_key: required, default: null. # Account API Key.
ip2: not required, default: undefined. # Secondary IP address for the failover.,Required if adding or changing the failover.
record_type: not required, default: null. # Record type.
ip1: not required, default: undefined. # Primary IP address for the failover.,Required if adding or changing the monitor or failover.
ip4: not required, default: undefined. # Quaternary IP address for the failover.
ip5: not required, default: undefined. # Quinary IP address for the failover.

record_name: not required, default: null. # Record name to get/create/delete/update. If record_name is not specified; all records for the domain will be returned in "result" regardless of the state argument.
port: required, default: 80. # Port used by the monitor.
monitor: required, default: no. # If C(yes), add or change the monitor.  This is applicable only for A records.
ip3: not required, default: undefined. # Tertiary IP address for the failover.
httpQueryString: not required, default: undefined. # The string in the httpFile that the monitor queries for HTTP or HTTPS.
failover: required, default: no. # If C(yes), add or change the failover.  This is applicable only for A records.
maxEmails: required, default: 1. # Number of emails sent to the contact list by the monitor.
state: required, default: null. # whether the record should exist or not
systemDescription: required, default: . # Description used by the monitor.

record_value: not required, default: null. # Record value. HTTPRED: <redirection URL>, MX: <priority> <target name>, NS: <name server>, PTR: <target name>, SRV: <priority> <weight> <port> <target name>, TXT: <text value>"
,If record_value is not specified; no changes will be made and the record will be returned in 'result' (in other words, this module can be used to fetch a record's current id, type, and ttl)
httpFile: not required, default: undefined. # The file at the Fqdn that the monitor queries for HTTP or HTTPS.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
account_secret: required, default: null. # Account Secret Key.
docker
publish_all_ports: not required, default: false. # Publish all exposed ports to the host interfaces.
tty: not required, default: false. # Allocate a pseudo-tty within the container.

log_opt: not required, default: null. # Additional options to pass to the logging driver selected above. See Docker `log-driver <https://docs.docker.com/reference/logging/overview/>` documentation for more information. Requires docker >=1.7.0.
insecure_registry: not required, default: false. # Use insecure private registry by HTTP instead of HTTPS. Needed for docker-py >= 0.5.0.
links: not required, default: null. # List of other containers to link within this container with an optional,alias. Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(redis:myredis).
memory_limit: not required, default: 0. # RAM allocated to the container as a number of bytes or as a human-readable string like "512MB". Leave as "0" to specify no limit.
docker_url: not required, default: ${DOCKER_HOST} or unix://var/run/docker.sock. # URL of the host running the docker daemon. This will default to the env var DOCKER_HOST if unspecified.
image: required, default: undefined. # Container image used to match and launch containers.
labels: not required, default: null. # Set container labels. Requires docker >= 1.6 and docker-py >= 1.2.0.
pid: not required, default: None. # Set the PID namespace mode for the container (currently only supports 'host'). Requires docker-py >= 1.0.0 and docker >= 1.5.0
docker_api_version: not required, default: docker-py default remote API version. # Remote API version to use. This defaults to the current default as specified by docker-py.
stop_timeout: not required, default: 10. # How many seconds to wait for the container to stop before killing it.
tls_client_key: not required, default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/key.pem. # Path to the PEM-encoded key used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_cert must be valid
privileged: not required, default: false. # Whether the container should run in privileged mode or not.

env_file: not required, default: null. # Pass in a path to a file with environment variable (FOO=BAR). If a key value is present in both explicitly presented (i.e. as 'env') and in the environment file, the explicit value will override. Requires docker-py >= 1.4.0.
read_only: not required, default: null. # Mount the container's root filesystem as read only

use_tls: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to use tls to connect to the docker server.  "no" means not to use tls (and ignore any other tls related parameters). "encrypt" means to use tls to encrypt the connection to the server.  "verify" means to also verify that the server's certificate is valid for the server (this both verifies the certificate against the CA and that the certificate was issued for that host. If this is unspecified, tls will only be used if one of the other tls options require it.
password: not required, default: null. # Remote API password.
hostname: not required, default: null. # Container hostname.
lxc_conf: not required, default: null. # LXC configuration parameters, such as C(lxc.aa_profile:unconfined).
tls_ca_cert: not required, default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/ca.pem. # Path to a PEM-encoded certificate authority to secure the Docker connection. This has no effect if use_tls is encrypt.

state: not required, default: started. # Assert the container's desired state. "present" only asserts that the matching containers exist. "started" asserts that the matching containers both exist and are running, but takes no action if any configuration has changed. "reloaded" (added in Ansible 1.9) asserts that all matching containers are running and restarts any that have any images or configuration out of date. "restarted" unconditionally restarts (or starts) the matching containers. "stopped" and '"killed" stop and kill all matching containers. "absent" stops and then' removes any matching containers.
tls_client_cert: not required, default: ${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/cert.pem. # Path to the PEM-encoded certificate used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_key must be valid
entrypoint: not required, default: null. # Corresponds to ``--entrypoint`` option of ``docker run`` command and ``ENTRYPOINT`` directive of Dockerfile. Used to match and launch containers.
env: not required, default: null. # Pass a dict of environment variables to the container.
volumes_from: not required, default: null. # List of names of containers to mount volumes from.
net: not required, default: false. # Network mode for the launched container: bridge, none, container:<name|id>,or host. Requires docker >= 0.11.
email: not required, default: null. # Remote API email.
username: not required, default: null. # Remote API username.
docker_user: not required, default: null. # Username or UID to use within the container

log_driver: not required, default: json-file. # You can specify a different logging driver for the container than for the daemon. "json-file" Default logging driver for Docker. Writes JSON messages to file. docker logs command is available only for this logging driver. "none" disables any logging for the container. "syslog" Syslog logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to syslog. docker logs command is not available for this logging driver. "journald" Journald logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "journald". "gelf" Graylog Extended Log Format (GELF) logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to a GELF endpoint likeGraylog or Logstash. "fluentd" Fluentd logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "fluentd" (forward input). "awslogs" (added in 2.1) Awslogs logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to AWS Cloudwatch Logs. If not defined explicitly, the Docker daemon's default ("json-file") will apply. Requires docker >= 1.6.0.

expose: not required, default: null. # List of additional container ports to expose for port mappings or links. If the port is already exposed using EXPOSE in a Dockerfile, you don't need to expose it again.
stdin_open: not required, default: false. # Keep stdin open after a container is launched.

tls_hostname: not required, default: Taken from docker_url. # A hostname to check matches what's supplied in the docker server's certificate.  If unspecified, the hostname is taken from the docker_url.
domainname: not required, default: null. # Container domain name.
registry: not required, default: DockerHub. # Remote registry URL to pull images from.

volumes: not required, default: null. # List of volumes to mount within the container,Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(/host:/container[:mode]),You can specify a read mode for the mount with either C(ro) or C(rw). Starting at version 2.1, SELinux hosts can additionally use C(z) or C(Z) mount options to use a shared or private label for the volume.
detach: not required, default: true. # Enable detached mode to leave the container running in background. If disabled, fail unless the process exits cleanly.
cpu_set: not required, default: null. # CPUs in which to allow execution. Requires docker-py >= 0.6.0.

pull: not required, default: missing. # Control when container images are updated from the C(docker_url) registry. If "missing," images will be pulled only when missing from the host; if '"always," the registry will be checked for a newer version of the image' each time the task executes.
dns: not required, default: null. # List of custom DNS servers for the container.

name: not required, default: null. # Name used to match and uniquely name launched containers. Explicit names are used to uniquely identify a single container or to link among containers. Mutually exclusive with a "count" other than "1".
signal: not required, default: KILL. # With the state "killed", you can alter the signal sent to the container.
cap_add: not required, default: false. # Add capabilities for the container. Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.
restart_policy: not required, default: null. # Container restart policy.,The 'unless-stopped' choice is only available starting in Ansible 2.1 and for Docker 1.9 and above.
count: not required, default: 1. # Number of matching containers that should be in the desired state.
devices: not required, default: null. # List of host devices to expose to container
extra_hosts: not required, default: undefined. # Dict of custom host-to-IP mappings to be defined in the container
command: not required, default: null. # Command used to match and launch containers.
restart_policy_retry: not required, default: 0. # Maximum number of times to restart a container. Leave as "0" for unlimited retries.
timeout: not required, default: 60. # Docker daemon response timeout in seconds.
cap_drop: not required, default: false. # Drop capabilities for the container. Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.

ports: not required, default: null. # List containing private to public port mapping specification. Use docker 'CLI-style syntax: C(8000), C(9000:8000), or C(0.0.0.0:9000:8000)' where 8000 is a container port, 9000 is a host port, and 0.0.0.0 is - a host interface. The container ports need to be exposed either in the Dockerfile or via the C(expose) option.
ulimits: not required, default: null. # ulimits, list ulimits with name, soft and optionally hard limit separated by colons. e.g. nofile:1024:2048 Requires docker-py >= 1.2.0 and docker >= 1.6.0
cpu_shares: not required, default: 0. # CPU shares (relative weight). Requires docker-py >= 0.6.0.
docker_container
tty: not required, default: false. # Allocate a pseudo-TTY.
dns_servers: not required, default: null. # List of custom DNS servers.
auto_remove: not required, default: false. # enable auto-removal of the container on daemon side when the container's process exits

image: not required, default: null. # Repository path and tag used to create the container. If an image is not found or pull is true, the image will be pulled from the registry. If no tag is included, 'latest' will be used.
labels: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of key value pairs.

docker_host: not required, default: unix://var/run/docker.sock. # The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
cpuset_cpus: not required, default: null. # CPUs in which to allow execution C(1,3) or C(1-3).
force_kill: not required, default: false. # Use the kill command when stopping a running container.
pid_mode: not required, default: null. # Set the PID namespace mode for the container. Currently only supports 'host'.

networks: not required, default: null. # List of networks the container belongs to.,Each network is a dict with keys C(name), C(ipv4_address), C(ipv6_address), C(links), C(aliases).,For each network C(name) is required, all other keys are optional.,If included, C(links) or C(aliases) are lists.,For examples of the data structure and usage see EXAMPLES below.,To remove a container from one or more networks, use the C(purge_networks) option.
cpu_period: not required, default: 0. # Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) period
tmpfs: not required, default: null. # Mount a tmpfs directory
working_dir: not required, default: null. # Path to the working directory.
capabilities: not required, default: null. # List of capabilities to add to the container.
restart: not required, default: false. # Use with started state to force a matching container to be stopped and restarted.
mac_address: not required, default: null. # Container MAC address (e.g. 92:d0:c6:0a:29:33)
volumes_from: not required, default: null. # List of container names or Ids to get volumes from.
log_options: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of options specific to the chosen log_driver. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/admin/logging/overview/ for details.
memory_reservation: not required, default: 0. # Memory soft limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g
recreate: not required, default: false. # Use with present and started states to force the re-creation of an existing container.

ipc_mode: not required, default: null. # Set the IPC mode for the container. Can be one of 'container:<name|id>' to reuse another container's IPC namespace or 'host' to use the host's IPC namespace within the container.
memory: not required, default: 0. # Memory limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g
memory_swappiness: not required, default: 0. # Tune a container's memory swappiness behavior. Accepts an integer between 0 and 100.
network_mode: not required, default: null. # Connect the container to a network.

detach: not required, default: true. # Enable detached mode to leave the container running in background. If disabled, the task will reflect the status of the container run (failed if the command failed).
memory_swap: not required, default: 0. # Total memory limit (memory + swap, format:<number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g.
pull: not required, default: false. # If true, always pull the latest version of an image. Otherwise, will only pull an image when missing.
name: required, default: undefined. # Assign a name to a new container or match an existing container.,When identifying an existing container name may be a name or a long or short container ID.
stop_signal: not required, default: null. # Override default signal used to stop the container.

devices: not required, default: null. # List of host device bindings to add to the container. Each binding is a mapping expressed in the format: <path_on_host>:<path_in_container>:<cgroup_permissions>
uts: not required, default: null. # Set the UTS namespace mode for the container.

published_ports: not required, default: null. # List of ports to publish from the container to the host.,Use docker CLI syntax: C(8000), C(9000:8000), or C(0.0.0.0:9000:8000), where 8000 is a container port, 9000 is a host port, and 0.0.0.0 is a host interface.,Container ports must be exposed either in the Dockerfile or via the C(expose) option.,A value of all will publish all exposed container ports to random host ports, ignoring any other mappings.,If C(networks) parameter is provided, will inspect each network to see if there exists a bridge network with optional parameter com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. If such a network is found, then published ports where no host IP address is specified will be bound to the host IP pointed to by com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. Note that the first bridge network with a com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4 value encountered in the list of C(networks) is the one that will be used.
timeout: not required, default: 60. # The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.
dns_search_domains: not required, default: null. # List of custom DNS search domains.
ulimits: not required, default: null. # List of ulimit options. A ulimit is specified as C(nofile:262144:262144)
interactive: not required, default: false. # Keep stdin open after a container is launched, even if not attached.
links: not required, default: null. # List of name aliases for linked containers in the format C(container_name:alias)
oom_score_adj: not required, default: 0. # An integer value containing the score given to the container in order to tune OOM killer preferences.
restart_policy: not required, default: on-failure. # Container restart policy. Place quotes around I(no) option.
paused: not required, default: false. # Use with the started state to pause running processes inside the container.
tls_verify: not required, default: false. # Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
stop_timeout: not required, default: null. # Number of seconds to wait for the container to stop before sending SIGKILL.
kernel_memory: not required, default: 0. # Kernel memory limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g. Minimum is 4M.
env_file: not required, default: null. # Path to a file containing environment variables I(FOO=BAR).,If variable also present in C(env), then C(env) value will override.,Requires docker-py >= 1.4.0.
cpu_quota: not required, default: 0. # Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) quota
read_only: not required, default: false. # Mount the container's root file system as read-only.
cpuset_mems: not required, default: null. # Memory nodes (MEMs) in which to allow execution C(0-3) or C(0,1)
hostname: not required, default: null. # Container hostname.

state: not required, default: started. # I(absent) - A container matching the specified name will be stopped and removed. Use force_kill to kill the container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with the removed container.,I(present) - Asserts the existence of a container matching the name and any provided configuration parameters. If no container matches the name, a container will be created. If a container matches the name but the provided configuration does not match, the container will be updated, if it can be. If it cannot be updated, it will be removed and re-created with the requested config. Image version will be taken into account when comparing configuration. To ignore image version use the ignore_image option. Use the recreate option to force the re-creation of the matching container. Use force_kill to kill the container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with a removed container.,I(started) - Asserts there is a running container matching the name and any provided configuration. If no container matches the name, a container will be created and started. If a container matching the name is found but the configuration does not match, the container will be updated, if it can be. If it cannot be updated, it will be removed and a new container will be created with the requested configuration and started. Image version will be taken into account when comparing configuration. To ignore image version use the ignore_image option. Use recreate to always re-create a matching container, even if it is running. Use restart to force a matching container to be stopped and restarted. Use force_kill to kill a container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with a removed container.,I(stopped) - Asserts that the container is first I(present), and then if the container is running moves it to a stopped state. Use force_kill to kill a container rather than stopping it.
cleanup: not required, default: false. # Use with I(detach) to remove the container after successful execution.
entrypoint: not required, default: null. # Command that overwrites the default ENTRYPOINT of the image.
key_path: not required, default: null. # Path to the client's TLS key file.
env: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of key,value pairs.

blkio_weight: not required, default: null. # Block IO (relative weight), between 10 and 1000.

Unit is optional and can be `b` (bytes), `k` (kilobytes), `m` (megabytes), or `g` (gigabytes).,Omitting the unit defaults to bytes. If you omit the size entirely, the system uses `64m`.

cert_path: not required, default: null. # Path to the client's TLS certificate file.

purge_networks: not required, default: false. # Remove the container from ALL networks not included in C(networks) parameter.,Any default networks such as I(bridge), if not found in C(networks), will be removed as well.
tls: not required, default: false. # Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.

ignore_image: not required, default: false. # When C(state) is I(present) or I(started) the module compares the configuration of an existing container to requested configuration. The evaluation includes the image version. If the image version in the registry does not match the container, the container will be recreated. Stop this behavior by setting C(ignore_image) to I(True).
ssl_version: not required, default: 1.0. # Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
security_opts: not required, default: null. # List of security options in the form of C("label:user:User")
etc_hosts: not required, default: null. # Dict of host-to-IP mappings, where each host name is a key in the dictionary. Each host name will be added to the container's /etc/hosts file.
sysctls: not required, default: null. # Dictionary of key,value pairs.
command: not required, default: null. # Command to execute when the container starts. A command may be either a string or a list. Prior to version 2.4, strings were split on commas.

volumes: not required, default: null. # List of volumes to mount within the container.,Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(/host:/container[:mode]),You can specify a read mode for the mount with either C(ro) or C(rw).,SELinux hosts can additionally use C(z) or C(Z) to use a shared or private label for the volume.
cpu_shares: not required, default: null. # CPU shares (relative weight).
restart_retries: not required, default: 0. # Use with restart policy to control maximum number of restart attempts.

tags: not required, default: null. # a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new instance or for starting/stopping instance by tag; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
range_key_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the range key.
wait_for_active_timeout: not required, default: 60. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds. only used when tags is set

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
write_capacity: not required, default: 1. # Write throughput capacity (units) to provision.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the table.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

indexes: not required, default: . # list of dictionaries describing indexes to add to the table. global indexes can be updated. local indexes don't support updates or have throughput.,required options: ['name', 'type', 'hash_key_name'],valid types: ['all', 'global_all', 'global_include', 'global_keys_only', 'include', 'keys_only'],other options: ['hash_key_type', 'range_key_name', 'range_key_type', 'includes', 'read_capacity', 'write_capacity']
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete the table
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
hash_key_type: not required, default: STRING. # Type of the hash key.

dynamodb_ttl.description: set TTL for a given DynamoDB table.
body: dynamodb_ttl
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

attribute_name: required, default: undefined. # the name of the Time to Live attribute used to store the expiration time for items in the table,this appears to be required by the API even when disabling TTL.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: not required, default: enable. # state to set DynamoDB table to
table_name: required, default: undefined. # name of the DynamoDB table to work on

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
easy_install
virtualenv: not required, default: null. # an optional I(virtualenv) directory path to install into. If the I(virtualenv) does not exist, it is created automatically

virtualenv_site_packages: not required, default: no. # Whether the virtual environment will inherit packages from the global site-packages directory.  Note that if this setting is changed on an already existing virtual environment it will not have any effect, the environment must be deleted and newly created.
virtualenv_command: not required, default: virtualenv. # The command to create the virtual environment with. For example C(pyvenv), C(virtualenv), C(virtualenv2).
name: required, default: null. # A Python library name
state: not required, default: present. # The desired state of the library. C(latest) ensures that the latest version is installed.

executable: not required, default: null. # The explicit executable or a pathname to the executable to be used to run easy_install for a specific version of Python installed in the system. For example C(easy_install-3.3), if there are both Python 2.7 and 3.3 installations in the system and you want to run easy_install for the Python 3.3 installation.

ec2.description: create, terminate, start or stop an instance in ec2
body: ec2
kernel: not required, default: null. # kernel I(eki) to use for the instance
ramdisk: not required, default: null. # ramdisk I(eri) to use for the instance
image: required, default: null. # I(ami) ID to use for the instance
user_data: not required, default: null. # opaque blob of data which is made available to the ec2 instance
termination_protection: not required, default: false. # Enable or Disable the Termination Protection
private_ip: not required, default: null. # the private ip address to assign the instance (from the vpc subnet)
spot_type: not required, default: one-time. # Type of spot request; one of "one-time" or "persistent". Defaults to "one-time" if not supplied.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

id: not required, default: null. # identifier for this instance or set of instances, so that the module will be idempotent with respect to EC2 instances. This identifier is valid for at least 24 hours after the termination of the instance, and should not be reused for another call later on. For details, see the description of client token at U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Run_Instance_Idempotency.html).
source_dest_check: not required, default: true. # Enable or Disable the Source/Destination checks (for NAT instances and Virtual Routers)
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
spot_wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long to wait for the spot instance request to be fulfilled
monitoring: not required, default: false. # enable detailed monitoring (CloudWatch) for instance
zone: not required, default: null. # AWS availability zone in which to launch the instance

exact_count: not required, default: null. # An integer value which indicates how many instances that match the 'count_tag' parameter should be running. Instances are either created or terminated based on this value.
ebs_optimized: not required, default: false. # whether instance is using optimized EBS volumes, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/EBSOptimized.html)
state: not required, default: present. # create or terminate instances
placement_group: not required, default: null. # placement group for the instance when using EC2 Clustered Compute

count_tag: not required, default: null. # Used with 'exact_count' to determine how many nodes based on a specific tag criteria should be running. This can be expressed in multiple ways and is shown in the EXAMPLES section.  For instance, one can request 25 servers that are tagged with "class=webserver". The specified tag must already exist or be passed in as the 'instance_tags' option.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
key_name: not required, default: null. # key pair to use on the instance
spot_launch_group: not required, default: null. # Launch group for spot request, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/how-spot-instances-work.html#spot-launch-group)
vpc_subnet_id: not required, default: null. # the subnet ID in which to launch the instance (VPC)
instance_ids: not required, default: null. # list of instance ids, currently used for states: absent, running, stopped

spot_price: not required, default: null. # Maximum spot price to bid, If not set a regular on-demand instance is requested. A spot request is made with this maximum bid. When it is filled, the instance is started.

tenancy: not required, default: default. # An instance with a tenancy of "dedicated" runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC. Note that to use dedicated tenancy you MUST specify a vpc_subnet_id as well. Dedicated tenancy is not available for EC2 "micro" instances.
assign_public_ip: not required, default: false. # when provisioning within vpc, assign a public IP address. Boto library must be 2.13.0+
group: not required, default: null. # security group (or list of groups) to use with the instance
wait: not required, default: no. # wait for the instance to reach its desired state before returning.  Does not wait for SSH, see 'wait_for' example for details.
count: not required, default: 1. # number of instances to launch
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
instance_profile_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the IAM instance profile to use. Boto library must be 2.5.0+
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: null. # The AWS region to use.  Must be specified if ec2_url is not used. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

network_interfaces: not required, default: null. # A list of existing network interfaces to attach to the instance at launch. When specifying existing network interfaces, none of the assign_public_ip, private_ip, vpc_subnet_id, group, or group_id parameters may be used. (Those parameters are for creating a new network interface at launch.)

instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior: not required, default: stop. # Set whether AWS will Stop or Terminate an instance on shutdown. This parameter is ignored when using instance-store images (which require termination on shutdown).
instance_type: required, default: null. # instance type to use for the instance, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instance-types.html)
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds

volumes: not required, default: null. # a list of hash/dictionaries of volumes to add to the new instance; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - device_name (str; required), delete_on_termination (bool; False), device_type (deprecated), ephemeral (str), encrypted (bool; False), snapshot (str), volume_type (str), iops (int) - device_type is deprecated use volume_type, iops must be set when volume_type='io1', ephemeral and snapshot are mutually exclusive.
instance_tags: not required, default: null. # a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new instance or for starting/stopping instance by tag; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
group_id: not required, default: null. # security group id (or list of ids) to use with the instance
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

ec2_ami.description: create or destroy an image in ec2
body: ec2_ami
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
description: not required, default: null. # Human-readable string describing the contents and purpose of the AMI.
tags: not required, default: null. # A dictionary of tags to add to the new image; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
kernel_id: not required, default: null. # The target kernel id of the image to register

launch_permissions: not required, default: null. # Users and groups that should be able to launch the AMI. Expects dictionary with a key of user_ids and/or group_names. user_ids should be a list of account ids. group_name should be a list of groups, "all" is the only acceptable value currently.
image_id: not required, default: null. # Image ID to be deregistered.

no_reboot: not required, default: false. # Flag indicating that the bundling process should not attempt to shutdown the instance before bundling. If this flag is True, the responsibility of maintaining file system integrity is left to the owner of the instance.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long before wait gives up, in seconds.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
wait: not required, default: no. # Wait for the AMI to be in state 'available' before returning.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
root_device_name: not required, default: null. # The root device name of the image to register
name: not required, default: null. # The name of the new AMI.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
delete_snapshot: not required, default: no. # Delete snapshots when deregistering the AMI.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
instance_id: not required, default: null. # Instance ID to create the AMI from.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or deregister/delete AMI.
architecture: not required, default: null. # The target architecture of the image to register
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
virtualization_type: not required, default: null. # The virtualization type of the image to register

device_mapping: not required, default: null. # List of device hashes/dictionaries with custom configurations (same block-device-mapping parameters),Valid properties include: device_name, volume_type, size (in GB), delete_on_termination (boolean), no_device (boolean), snapshot_id, iops (for io1 volume_type)

ec2_ami_copy.description: copies AMI between AWS regions, return new image id
body: ec2_ami_copy
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
description: not required, default: null. # An optional human-readable string describing the contents and purpose of the new AMI.
tags: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new copied AMI; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
encrypted: not required, default: null. # Whether or not the destination snapshots of the copied AMI should be encrypted.
kms_key_id: not required, default: null. # KMS key id used to encrypt image. If not specified, uses default EBS Customer Master Key (CMK) for your account.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 1200. # How long before wait gives up, in seconds. (As of 2.3 this option is deprecated. See boto3 Waiters)

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
wait: not required, default: no. # Wait for the copied AMI to be in state 'available' before returning.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: not required, default: default. # The name of the new AMI to copy. (As of 2.3 the default is 'default', in prior versions it was 'null'.)
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
source_image_id: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the AMI in source region that should be copied.
source_region: required, default: undefined. # The source region the AMI should be copied from.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

ec2_ami_find.description: Searches for AMIs to obtain the AMI ID and other information
body: ec2_ami_find

sort: not required, default: null. # Optional attribute which with to sort the results.,If specifying 'tag', the 'tag_name' parameter is required.,Starting at version 2.1, additional sort choices of architecture, block_device_mapping, creationDate, hypervisor, is_public, location, owner_id, platform, root_device_name, root_device_type, state, and virtualization_type are supported.
no_result_action: not required, default: success. # What to do when no results are found.,'success' reports success and returns an empty array,'fail' causes the module to report failure
sort_end: not required, default: null. # Which result to end with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
sort_order: not required, default: ascending. # Order in which to sort results.,Only used when the 'sort' parameter is specified.

owner: not required, default: null. # Search AMIs owned by the specified owner,Can specify an AWS account ID, or one of the special IDs 'self', 'amazon' or 'aws-marketplace',If not specified, all EC2 AMIs in the specified region will be searched.,You can include wildcards in many of the search options. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\ searches for the literal string *amazon?\.
is_public: not required, default: null. # Whether or not the image(s) are public.
product_code: not required, default: null. # Marketplace product code to match.
ami_id: not required, default: null. # An AMI ID to match.
name: not required, default: null. # An AMI name to match.
ami_tags: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of tags to match for the AMI.
hypervisor: not required, default: null. # A hypervisor type type to match (e.g. xen).
region: required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use.
sort_tag: not required, default: null. # Tag name with which to sort results.,Required when specifying 'sort=tag'.
platform: not required, default: null. # Platform type to match.
state: not required, default: available. # AMI state to match.
sort_start: not required, default: null. # Which result to start with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
architecture: not required, default: null. # An architecture type to match (e.g. x86_64).
virtualization_type: not required, default: null. # Virtualization type to match (e.g. hvm).

ec2_ami_search.description: Retrieve AWS AMI information for a given operating system.
body: ec2_ami_search
stream: not required, default: server. # Type of release.
release: required, default: undefined. # short name of the release (e.g., C(precise))
virt: not required, default: paravirtual. # virutalization type
region: not required, default: us-east-1. # EC2 region
arch: not required, default: amd64. # CPU architecture
store: not required, default: ebs. # Back-end store for instance
distro: required, default: undefined. # Linux distribution (e.g., C(ubuntu))

ec2_asg.description: Create or delete AWS Autoscaling Groups
body: ec2_asg
target_group_arns: not required, default: undefined. # List of target group ARNs to use for the group
default_cooldown: not required, default: 300 seconds. # The number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before another can begin.
health_check_period: not required, default: 500 seconds. # Length of time in seconds after a new EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
lc_check: not required, default: true. # Check to make sure instances that are being replaced with replace_instances do not already have the current launch_config.

availability_zones: not required, default: undefined. # List of availability zone names in which to create the group.  Defaults to all the availability zones in the region if vpc_zone_identifier is not set.
replace_batch_size: not required, default: 1. # Number of instances you'd like to replace at a time.  Used with replace_all_instances.
vpc_zone_identifier: not required, default: None. # List of VPC subnets to use
suspend_processes: not required, default: . # A list of scaling processes to suspend.

replace_instances: not required, default: None. # List of instance_ids belonging to the named ASG that you would like to terminate and be replaced with instances matching the current launch configuration.
desired_capacity: not required, default: undefined. # Desired number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.
state: not required, default: present. # register or deregister the instance
max_size: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.
placement_group: not required, default: None. # Physical location of your cluster placement group created in Amazon EC2.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: not required, default: None. # A list of tags to add to the Auto Scale Group. Optional key is 'propagate_at_launch', which defaults to true.
min_size: not required, default: undefined. # Minimum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait instances to become viable when replaced.  Used in conjunction with instance_ids option.
load_balancers: not required, default: undefined. # List of ELB names to use for the group

launch_config_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the Launch configuration to use for the group. See the ec2_lc module for managing these. If unspecified then the current group value will be used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Unique name for group to be created or deleted
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
replace_all_instances: not required, default: false. # In a rolling fashion, replace all instances with an old launch configuration with one from the current launch configuration.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

termination_policies: not required, default: Default. # An ordered list of criteria used for selecting instances to be removed from the Auto Scaling group when reducing capacity.,For 'Default', when used to create a new autoscaling group, the "Default"i value is used. When used to change an existent autoscaling group, the current termination policies are maintained.
health_check_type: not required, default: EC2. # The service you want the health status from, Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancer.
notification_topic: not required, default: None. # A SNS topic ARN to send auto scaling notifications to.

notification_types: not required, default: autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH_ERROR,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE_ERROR. # A list of auto scaling events to trigger notifications on.

wait_for_instances: not required, default: true. # Wait for the ASG instances to be in a ready state before exiting.  If instances are behind an ELB, it will wait until the ELB determines all instances have a lifecycle_state of  "InService" and  a health_status of "Healthy".

ec2_asg_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs) in AWS
body: ec2_asg_facts
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

name: not required, default: undefined. # The prefix or name of the auto scaling group(s) you are searching for.,Note: This is a regular expression match with implicit '^' (beginning of string). Append '$' for a complete name match.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

tags: not required, default: undefined. # A dictionary/hash of tags in the format { tag1_name: 'tag1_value', tag2_name: 'tag2_value' } to match against the auto scaling group(s) you are searching for.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
ec2_customer_gateway
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the customer gateway.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

release_on_disassociation: not required, default: false. # whether or not to automatically release the EIP when it is disassociated
device_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the device for the EIP. Can be an EC2 Instance id or Elastic Network Interface (ENI) id.

body: ec2_eni
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

secondary_private_ip_addresses: not required, default: undefined. # A list of IP addresses to assign as secondary IP addresses to the network interface. This option is mutually exclusive of secondary_private_ip_address_count
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
subnet_id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of subnet in which to create the ENI.

force_detach: not required, default: false. # Force detachment of the interface. This applies either when explicitly detaching the interface by setting instance_id to None or when deleting an interface with state=absent.

instance_id: not required, default: null. # Instance ID that you wish to attach ENI to. Since version 2.2, use the 'attached' parameter to attach or detach an ENI. Prior to 2.2, to detach an ENI from an instance, use 'None'.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete ENI

source_dest_check: not required, default: undefined. # By default, interfaces perform source/destination checks. NAT instances however need this check to be disabled. You can only specify this flag when the interface is being modified, not on creation.
private_ip_address: not required, default: null. # Private IP address.

secondary_private_ip_address_count: not required, default: undefined. # The number of secondary IP addresses to assign to the network interface. This option is mutually exclusive of secondary_private_ip_addresses
eni_id: not required, default: null. # The ID of the ENI (to modify); if null and state is present, a new eni will be created.

delete_on_termination: not required, default: undefined. # Delete the interface when the instance it is attached to is terminated. You can only specify this flag when the interface is being modified, not on creation.

This allows to define multiple sources per source type as well as multiple source types per rule. Prior to 2.4 an individual source is allowed.

Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

volume_size: not required, default: null. # size of volume (in GB) to create.
state: not required, default: present. # whether to ensure the volume is present or absent, or to list existing volumes (The C(list) option was added in version 1.8).
snapshot: not required, default: null. # snapshot ID on which to base the volume
zone: not required, default: null. # zone in which to create the volume, if unset uses the zone the instance is in (if set)
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
delete_on_termination: not required, default: no. # When set to "yes", the volume will be deleted upon instance termination.

Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

ec2_vpc
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

subnets: not required, default: null. # A dictionary array of subnets to add of the form C({ cidr: ..., az: ... , resource_tags: ... }).,Where C(az) is the desired availability zone of the subnet, optional.,Tags C(resource_tags) use dictionary form C({ "Environment":"Dev", "Tier":"Web", ...}), optional.,C(resource_tags) see resource_tags for VPC below. The main difference is subnet tags not specified here will be deleted.,All VPC subnets not in this list will be removed as well.,As of 1.8, if the subnets parameter is not specified, no existing subnets will be modified.'
internet_gateway: not required, default: no. # Toggle whether there should be an Internet gateway attached to the VPC.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
dns_hostnames: not required, default: yes. # Toggles the "Enable DNS hostname support for instances" flag.

resource_tags: required, default: undefined. # A dictionary array of resource tags of the form C({ tag1: value1, tag2: value2 }). - Tags in this list are used in conjunction with CIDR block to uniquely identify a VPC in lieu of vpc_id. Therefore, if CIDR/Tag combination does not exist, a new VPC will be created.  VPC tags not on this list will be ignored. Prior to 1.7, specifying a resource tag was optional.
cidr_block: not required, default: undefined. # The cidr block representing the VPC, e.g. C(10.0.0.0/16), required when I(state=present).
wait: not required, default: no. # Wait for the VPC to be in state 'available' before returning.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

route_tables: not required, default: null. # A dictionary array of route tables to add of the form: C({ subnets: [172.22.2.0/24, 172.22.3.0/24,], routes: [{ dest: 0.0.0.0/0, gw: igw},], resource_tags: ... }). Where the subnets list is those subnets the route table should be associated with, and the routes list is a list of routes to be in the table.  The special keyword for the gw of igw specifies that you should the route should go through the internet gateway attached to the VPC. gw also accepts instance-ids, interface-ids, and vpc-peering-connection-ids in addition igw. resource_tags is optional and uses dictionary form: C({ "Name": "public", ... }). This module is currently unable to affect the "main" route table due to some limitations in boto, so you must explicitly define the associated subnets or they will be attached to the main table implicitly. As of 1.8, if the route_tables parameter is not specified, no existing routes will be modified.
dns_support: not required, default: yes. # Toggles the "Enable DNS resolution" flag.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
instance_tenancy: not required, default: default. # The supported tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC.
state: required, default: undefined. # Create or terminate the VPC.
vpc_id: not required, default: null. # A VPC id to terminate when I(state=absent).
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
