args: not required, default: null. # A dict of key-value pairs used in formatting the script using string.Template (see https://docs.python.org/2/library/string.html#template-strings).

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates as it avoids verifying the source site.

jira.description: create and modify issues in a JIRA instance
body: jira
username: required, default: undefined. # The username to log-in with.
comment: not required, default: undefined. # The comment text to add.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The issue description, where appropriate.
assignee: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the assignee on create or transition operations. Note not all transitions will allow this.
inwardissue: not required, default: undefined. # Set issue from which link will be created.
operation: required, default: undefined. # The operation to perform.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to log-in with.
linktype: not required, default: undefined. # Set type of link, when action 'link' selected.

fields: not required, default: undefined. # This is a free-form data structure that can contain arbitrary data. This is passed directly to the JIRA REST API (possibly after merging with other required data, as when passed to create). See examples for more information, and the JIRA REST API for the structure required for various fields.
outwardissue: not required, default: undefined. # Set issue to which link will be created.
uri: required, default: undefined. # Base URI for the JIRA instance.
summary: not required, default: undefined. # The issue summary, where appropriate.
project: not required, default: undefined. # The project for this operation. Required for issue creation.
status: not required, default: undefined. # The desired status; only relevant for the transition operation.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # Set timeout, in seconds, on requests to JIRA API.
issuetype: not required, default: undefined. # The issue type, for issue creation.
issue: not required, default: undefined. # An existing issue key to operate on.

junos_banner.description: Manage multiline banners on Juniper JUNOS devices
body: junos_banner
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

text: not required, default: null. # The banner text that should be present in the remote device running configuration.  This argument accepts a multiline string, with no empty lines. Requires I(state=present).
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is present in the current devices active running configuration.

banner: required, default: undefined. # Specifies which banner that should be configured on the remote device. Value C(login) indicates system login message prior to authenticating, C(motd) is login announcement after successful authentication.

junos_command.description: Run arbitrary commands on an Juniper JUNOS device
body: junos_command

retries: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the number of retries a command should be tried before it is considered failed.  The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

commands: not required, default: null. # The commands to send to the remote junos device over the configured provider.  The resulting output from the command is returned.  If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of I(retries) has been exceeded.

rpcs: not required, default: null. # The C(rpcs) argument accepts a list of RPCs to be executed over a netconf session and the results from the RPC execution is return to the playbook via the modules results dictionary.

interval: not required, default: 1. # Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command.  If the command does not pass the specified conditional, the interval indicates how to long to wait before trying the command again.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

wait_for: not required, default: null. # Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward.   If the conditional is not true by the configured retries, the task fails.  See examples.

display: not required, default: depends on input argument I(rpcs) or I(commands). # Encoding scheme to use when serializing output from the device. This handles how to properly understand the output and apply the conditionals path to the result set. For I(rpcs) argument default display is C(xml) and for I(commands) argument default display is C(text). Value C(set) is applicable only for fetching configuration from device.

match: not required, default: all. # The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the I(wait_for) must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

junos_config.description: Manage configuration on devices running Juniper JUNOS
body: junos_config

comment: not required, default: configured by junos_config. # The C(comment) argument specifies a text string to be used when committing the configuration.  If the C(confirm) argument is set to False, this argument is silently ignored.

src: not required, default: null. # The I(src) argument provides a path to the configuration file to load into the remote system. The path can either be a full system path to the configuration file if the value starts with / or relative to the root of the implemented role or playbook. This argument is mutually exclusive with the I(lines) argument.

rollback: not required, default: null. # The C(rollback) argument instructs the module to rollback the current configuration to the identifier specified in the argument.  If the specified rollback identifier does not exist on the remote device, the module will fail.  To rollback to the most recent commit, set the C(rollback) argument to 0.

confirm: not required, default: 0. # The C(confirm) argument will configure a time out value for the commit to be confirmed before it is automatically rolled back.  If the C(confirm) argument is set to False, this argument is silently ignored.  If the value for this argument is set to 0, the commit is confirmed immediately.

lines: not required, default: null. # This argument takes a list of C(set) or C(delete) configuration lines to push into the remote device.  Each line must start with either C(set) or C(delete).  This argument is mutually exclusive with the I(src) argument.

update: not required, default: merge. # This argument will decide how to load the configuration data particulary when the candidate configuration and loaded configuration contain conflicting statements. Following are accepted values. C(merge) combines the data in the loaded configuration with the candidate configuration. If statements in the loaded configuration conflict with statements in the candidate configuration, the loaded statements replace the candidate ones. C(override) discards the entire candidate configuration and replaces it with the loaded configuration. C(replace) substitutes each hierarchy level in the loaded configuration for the corresponding level.

replace: not required, default: false. # The C(replace) argument will instruct the remote device to replace the current configuration hierarchy with the one specified in the corresponding hierarchy of the source configuration loaded from this module.,Note this argument should be considered deprecated.  To achieve the equivalent, set the I(update) argument to C(replace). This argument will be removed in a future release. The C(replace) and C(update) argument is mutually exclusive.
confirm_commit: not required, default: false. # This argument will execute commit operation on remote device. It can be used to confirm a previous commit.

zeroize: not required, default: null. # The C(zeroize) argument is used to completely sanitize the remote device configuration back to initial defaults.  This argument will effectively remove all current configuration statements on the remote device.

src_format: not required, default: null. # The I(src_format) argument specifies the format of the configuration found int I(src).  If the I(src_format) argument is not provided, the module will attempt to determine the format of the configuration file specified in I(src).
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

backup: not required, default: false. # This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(running-config) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.

junos_facts.description: Collect facts from remote devices running Juniper Junos
body: junos_facts

config_format: not required, default: text. # The I(config_format) argument specifies the format of the configuration when serializing output from the device. This argument is applicable only when C(config) value is present in I(gather_subset). The I(config_format) should be supported by the junos version running on device.

gather_subset: not required, default: !config. # When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected. To maintain backward compatbility old style facts can be retrieved using all value, this reqires junos-eznc to be installed as a prerequisite.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

junos_interface.description: Manage Interface on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_interface
rx_rate: not required, default: undefined. # Receiver rate in bits per second (bps).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the Interface.
duplex: not required, default: auto. # Interface link status.
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Configure interface link status.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum size of transmit packet.

delay: not required, default: 10. # Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state argument which are I(state) with values C(up)/C(down), I(tx_rate) and I(rx_rate).
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of Interfaces definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the Interface configuration, C(up) idicates present and operationally up and C(down) indicates present and operationally C(down)
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated
speed: not required, default: undefined. # Interface link speed.
tx_rate: not required, default: undefined. # Transmit rate in bits per second (bps).
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of Interface.

junos_l3_interface.description: Manage L3 interfaces on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_l3_interface
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of L3 interfaces definitions
state: not required, default: present. # State of the L3 interface configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the L3 interface.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # IPv6 of the L3 interface.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated
unit: not required, default: 0. # Logical interface number.
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # IPv4 of the L3 interface.

junos_linkagg.description: Manage link aggregation groups on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_linkagg
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of Interface.
device_count: not required, default: undefined. # Number of aggregated ethernet devices that can be configured. Acceptable integer value is between 1 and 128.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of link aggregation definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the link aggregation group.

mode: not required, default: false. # Mode of the link aggregation group. A value of C(on) will enable LACP in C(passive) mode. C(active) configures the link to actively information about the state of the link, or it can be configured in C(passive) mode ie. send link state information only when received them from another link. A value of C(off) will disable LACP.
members: required, default: undefined. # List of members interfaces of the link aggregation group. The value can be single interface or list of interfaces.
min_links: not required, default: undefined. # Minimum members that should be up before bringing up the link aggregation group.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the link aggregation group.

junos_lldp.description: Manage LLDP configuration on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_lldp

state: not required, default: present. # Value of C(present) ensures given LLDP configuration is present on device and LLDP is enabled, for value of C(absent) LLDP configuration is deleted and LLDP is in disabled state. Value C(enabled) ensures LLDP protocol is enabled and LLDP configuration if any is configured on remote device, for value of C(disabled) it ensures LLDP protocol is disabled any LLDP configuration if any is still present.
enable: not required, default: present. # If value is C(True) it enable LLDP protocol on remote device, if value is C(False) it disables LLDP protocol.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated
interval: not required, default: undefined. # Frequency at which LLDP advertisements are sent (in seconds).

hold_multiplier: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the number of seconds that LLDP information is held before it is discarded. The multiplier value is used in combination with the C(interval) value.
transmit_delay: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the number of seconds the device waits before sending advertisements to neighbors after a change is made in local system.

junos_lldp_interface.description: Manage LLDP interfaces configuration on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_lldp_interface
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

state: not required, default: present. # Value of C(present) ensures given LLDP configured on given I(interfaces) and is enabled, for value of C(absent) LLDP configuration on given I(interfaces) deleted. Value C(enabled) ensures LLDP protocol is enabled on given I(interfaces) and for value of C(disabled) it ensures LLDP is disabled on given I(interfaces).
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface LLDP should be configured on.
junos_logging
files: not required, default: undefined. # Number of files to be archived, this is applicable if value of I(dest) is C(file). The acceptable value is in range from 1 to 1000.
name: not required, default: undefined. # If value of C(dest) is I(file) it indicates file-name, for I(user) it indicates username and for I(host) indicates the host name to be notified.
level: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging severity levels.
dest: not required, default: undefined. # Destination of the logs.
facility: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging facility.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of logging definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the logging configuration.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

rotate_frequency: not required, default: undefined. # Rotate log frequency in minutes, this is applicable if value of I(dest) is C(file). The acceptable value is in range of 1 to 59. This controls the frequency after which log file is rotated.
size: not required, default: undefined. # Size of the file in archive, this is applicable if value of I(dest) is C(file). The acceptable value is in range from 65536 to 1073741824 bytes.

junos_netconf.description: Configures the Junos Netconf system service
body: junos_netconf

state: not required, default: present. # Specifies the state of the C(junos_netconf) resource on the remote device.  If the I(state) argument is set to I(present) the netconf service will be configured.  If the I(state) argument is set to I(absent) the netconf service will be removed from the configuration.
netconf_port: not required, default: 830. # This argument specifies the port the netconf service should listen on for SSH connections.  The default port as defined in RFC 6242 is 830.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

junos_package.description: Installs packages on remote devices running Junos
body: junos_package

src: required, default: null. # The I(src) argument specifies the path to the source package to be installed on the remote device in the advent of a version mismatch. The I(src) argument can be either a localized path or a full path to the package file to install.

version: not required, default: null. # The I(version) argument can be used to explicitly specify the version of the package that should be installed on the remote device.  If the I(version) argument is not specified, then the version is extracts from the I(src) filename.
force: required, default: false. # The I(force) argument instructs the module to bypass the package version check and install the packaged identified in I(src) on the remote device.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

no_copy: not required, default: false. # The I(no_copy) argument is responsible for instructing the remote device on where to install the package from.  When enabled, the package is transferred to the remote device prior to installing.

reboot: required, default: true. # In order for a package to take effect, the remote device must be restarted.  When enabled, this argument will instruct the module to reboot the device once the updated package has been installed. If disabled or the remote package does not need to be changed, the device will not be started.

junos_rpc.description: Runs an arbitrary RPC over NetConf on an Juniper JUNOS device
body: junos_rpc

output: not required, default: xml. # The C(output) argument specifies the desired output of the return data.  This argument accepts one of C(xml), C(text), or C(json).  For C(json), the JUNOS device must be running a version of software that supports native JSON output.

rpc: required, default: undefined. # The C(rpc) argument specifies the RPC call to send to the remote devices to be executed.  The RPC Reply message is parsed and the contents are returned to the playbook.
args: not required, default: null. # The C(args) argument provides a set of arguments for the RPC call and are encoded in the request message.  This argument accepts a set of key=value arguments.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

junos_static_route.description: Manage static IP routes on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_static_route
qualified_next_hop: not required, default: undefined. # Qualified next hop IP of the static route. Qualified next hops allow to associate preference with a particular next-hop address.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of static route definitions
state: not required, default: present. # State of the static route configuration.
next_hop: required, default: undefined. # Next hop IP of the static route.
preference: not required, default: undefined. # Global admin preference of the static route.
qualified_preference: not required, default: undefined. # Assign preference for qualified next hop.
address: required, default: undefined. # Network address with prefix of the static route.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

junos_system.description: Manage the system attributes on Juniper JUNOS devices
body: junos_system
name_servers: not required, default: undefined. # List of DNS name servers by IP address to use to perform name resolution lookups.  This argument accepts either a list of DNS servers See examples.

state: not required, default: present. # State of the configuration values in the device's current active configuration.  When set to I(present), the values should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the values should not be in the device active configuration
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

domain_search: not required, default: undefined. # Provides the list of domain suffixes to append to the hostname for the purpose of doing name resolution. This argument accepts a list of names and will be reconciled with the current active configuration on the running node.
hostname: not required, default: undefined. # Configure the device hostname parameter. This option takes an ASCII string value.

domain_name: not required, default: undefined. # Configure the IP domain name on the remote device to the provided value. Value should be in the dotted name form and will be appended to the C(hostname) to create a fully-qualified domain name.

junos_user.description: Manage local user accounts on Juniper JUNOS devices
body: junos_user

name: not required, default: null. # The C(name) argument defines the username of the user to be created on the system.  This argument must follow appropriate usernaming conventions for the target device running JUNOS.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument.

purge: not required, default: false. # The C(purge) argument instructs the module to consider the users definition absolute.  It will remove any previously configured users on the device with the exception of the current defined set of aggregate.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

state: not required, default: present. # The C(state) argument configures the state of the user definitions as it relates to the device operational configuration.  When set to I(present), the user should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the user should not be in the device active configuration
role: not required, default: undefined. # The C(role) argument defines the role of the user account on the remote system.  User accounts can have more than one role configured.
full_name: not required, default: null. # The C(full_name) argument provides the full name of the user account to be created on the remote device.  This argument accepts any text string value.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

aggregate: not required, default: null. # The C(aggregate) argument defines a list of users to be configured on the remote device.  The list of users will be compared against the current users and only changes will be added or removed from the device configuration.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the name argument. alias C(users).
sshkey: not required, default: null. # The C(sshkey) argument defines the public SSH key to be configured for the user account on the remote system.  This argument must be a valid SSH key

junos_vlan.description: Manage VLANs on Juniper JUNOS network devices
body: junos_vlan
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of VLANs definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the VLAN configuration.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the VLAN.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated
interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # List of interfaces to check the VLAN has been configured correctly.
vlan_id: required, default: undefined. # ID of the VLAN.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Text description of VLANs.

junos_vrf.description: Manage the VRF definitions on Juniper JUNOS devices
body: junos_vrf
target: not required, default: undefined. # It configures VRF target community configuration. The target value takes the form of C(target:A:B) where C(A) and C(B) are both numeric values.
interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # Identifies the set of interfaces that should be configured in the VRF. Interfaces must be routed interfaces in order to be placed into a VRF.

name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the VRF definition to be managed on the remote IOS device.  The VRF definition name is an ASCII string name used to uniquely identify the VRF.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument

rd: not required, default: undefined. # The router-distinguisher value uniquely identifies the VRF to routing processes on the remote IOS system.  The RD value takes the form of C(A:B) where C(A) and C(B) are both numeric values.

table_label: not required, default: undefined. # Causes JUNOS to allocate a VPN label per VRF rather than per VPN FEC. This allows for forwarding of traffic to directly connected subnets, COS Egress filtering etc.

state: not required, default: present. # Configures the state of the VRF definition as it relates to the device operational configuration.  When set to I(present), the VRF should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the VRF should not be in the device active configuration

aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # The set of VRF definition objects to be configured on the remote JUNOS device.  Ths list entries can either be the VRF name or a hash of VRF definitions and attributes.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument.
active: not required, default: true. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

description: not required, default: undefined. # Provides a short description of the VRF definition in the current active configuration.  The VRF definition value accepts alphanumeric characters used to provide additional information about the VRF.
katello
username: required, default: undefined. # Username on Foreman server
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for user accessing Foreman server
params: required, default: undefined. # Parameters associated to the entity resource to set or edit in dictionary format (e.g. name, description)
server_url: required, default: undefined. # URL of Foreman server
entity: required, default: undefined. # The Foreman resource that the action will be performed on (e.g. organization, host)
kernel_blacklist
blacklist_file: not required, default: null. # If specified, use this blacklist file instead of C(/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-ansible.conf).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the module should be present in the blacklist or absent.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of kernel module to black- or whitelist.
kibana_plugin
force: not required, default: false. # Delete and re-install the plugin. Can be useful for plugins update
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the plugin to install
url: not required, default: None. # Set exact URL to download the plugin from. For local file, prefix its absolute path with file://
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of a plugin.
version: not required, default: None. # Version of the plugin to be installed. If plugin exists with previous version, it will NOT be updated if C(force) is not set to yes
timeout: not required, default: 1m. # Timeout setting: 30s, 1m, 1h...
plugin_dir: not required, default: /opt/kibana/installedPlugins/. # Your configured plugin directory specified in Kibana
plugin_bin: not required, default: /opt/kibana/bin/kibana. # Location of the plugin binary
kinesis_stream
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: None. # The name of the Kinesis Stream you are managing.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
tags: not required, default: null. # A dictionary of resource tags of the form: { tag1: value1, tag2: value2 }.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
shards: not required, default: None. # The number of shards you want to have with this stream.,This is required when state == present
retention_period: not required, default: None. # The default retention period is 24 hours and can not be less than 24 hours.,The retention period can be modified during any point in time.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or Delete the Kinesis Stream.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How many seconds to wait for an operation to complete before timing out.
wait: not required, default: true. # Wait for operation to complete before returning.

known_hosts.description: Add or remove a host from the C(known_hosts) file
body: known_hosts
path: not required, default: (homedir)+/.ssh/known_hosts. # The known_hosts file to edit
state: not required, default: present. # I(present) to add the host key, I(absent) to remove it.
hash_host: not required, default: false. # Hash the hostname in the known_hosts file
name: required, default: null. # The host to add or remove (must match a host specified in key). It will be converted to lowercase so that ssh-keygen can find it.

key: not required, default: null. # The SSH public host key, as a string (required if state=present, optional when state=absent, in which case all keys for the host are removed). The key must be in the right format for ssh (see sshd(8), section "SSH_KNOWN_HOSTS FILE FORMAT")
kubernetes
url_password: not required, default: null. # The HTTP Basic Auth password for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

certificate_authority_data: not required, default: null. # Certificate Authority data for Kubernetes server. Should be in either standard PEM format or base64 encoded PEM data. Note that certificate verification is broken until ansible supports a version of 'match_hostname' that can match the IP address against the CA data.
inline_data: required, default: null. # The Kubernetes YAML data to send to the API I(endpoint). This option is mutually exclusive with C('file_reference').

insecure: not required, default: undefined. # Reverts the connection to using HTTP instead of HTTPS. This option should only be used when execuing the M('kubernetes') module local to the Kubernetes cluster using the insecure local port (locahost:8080 by default).
file_reference: not required, default: null. # Specify full path to a Kubernets YAML file to send to API I(endpoint). This option is mutually exclusive with C('inline_data').
api_endpoint: required, default: null. # The IPv4 API endpoint of the Kubernetes cluster.
state: required, default: present. # The desired action to take on the Kubernetes data.
url_username: not required, default: admin. # The HTTP Basic Auth username for the API I(endpoint). This should be set unless using the C('insecure') option.

validate_certs: not required, default: false. # Enable/disable certificate validation. Note that this is set to C(false) until Ansible can support IP address based certificate hostname matching (exists in >= python3.5.0).

patch_operation: not required, default: Strategic Merge Patch. # - Specify patch operation for Kubernetes resource update. For details, see the description of PATCH operations at
  U(https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/release-1.5/docs/devel/api-conventions.md#patch-operations).
lambda
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
description: not required, default: null. # A short, user-defined function description. Lambda does not use this value. Assign a meaningful description as you see fit.
s3_key: not required, default: null. # The Amazon S3 object (the deployment package) key name you want to upload,s3_bucket and s3_key are required together
zip_file: not required, default: null. # A .zip file containing your deployment package,If C(state=present) then either zip_file or s3_bucket must be present.
s3_object_version: not required, default: null. # The Amazon S3 object (the deployment package) version you want to upload.
memory_size: not required, default: 128. # The amount of memory, in MB, your Lambda function is given

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
dead_letter_arn: not required, default: None. # The parent object that contains the target Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name you want to assign to the function you are uploading. Cannot be changed.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete Lambda function
handler: not required, default: null. # The function within your code that Lambda calls to begin execution

role: not required, default: undefined. # The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Lambda assumes when it executes your function to access any other Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources. You may use the bare ARN if the role belongs to the same AWS account.,Required when C(state=present)
timeout: not required, default: 3. # The function execution time at which Lambda should terminate the function.
environment_variables: not required, default: None. # A dictionary of environment variables the Lambda function is given.

runtime: not required, default: undefined. # The runtime environment for the Lambda function you are uploading. Required when creating a function. Use parameters as described in boto3 docs. Current example runtime environments are nodejs, nodejs4.3, java8 or python2.7,Required when C(state=present)
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

s3_bucket: not required, default: null. # Amazon S3 bucket name where the .zip file containing your deployment package is stored,If C(state=present) then either zip_file or s3_bucket must be present.,s3_bucket and s3_key are required together

vpc_subnet_ids: not required, default: None. # List of subnet IDs to run Lambda function in. Use this option if you need to access resources in your VPC. Leave empty if you don't want to run the function in a VPC.
vpc_security_group_ids: not required, default: None. # List of VPC security group IDs to associate with the Lambda function. Required when vpc_subnet_ids is used.

lambda_alias.description: Creates, updates or deletes AWS Lambda function aliases.
body: lambda_alias
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
description: not required, default: undefined. # A short, user-defined function alias description.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the function alias.
state: required, default: present. # Describes the desired state.
version: not required, default: undefined. # Version associated with the Lambda function alias. A value of 0 (or omitted parameter) sets the alias to the $LATEST version.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
function_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the function alias.

lambda_event.description: Creates, updates or deletes AWS Lambda function event mappings.
body: lambda_event
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
event_source: not required, default: stream. # Source of the event that triggers the lambda function.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

source_params: required, default: undefined. # Sub-parameters required for event source.,I(== stream event source ==),C(source_arn) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis or DynamoDB stream that is the event source.,C(enabled) Indicates whether AWS Lambda should begin polling the event source. Default is True.,C(batch_size) The largest number of records that AWS Lambda will retrieve from your event source at the time of invoking your function. Default is 100.,C(starting_position) The position in the stream where AWS Lambda should start reading. Choices are TRIM_HORIZON or LATEST.
lambda_function_arn: required, default: undefined. # The name or ARN of the lambda function.
alias: required, default: undefined. # Name of the function alias. Mutually exclusive with C(version).
state: required, default: present. # Describes the desired state.
version: not required, default: undefined. # Version of the Lambda function. Mutually exclusive with C(alias).

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

lambda_facts.description: Gathers AWS Lambda function details as Ansible facts
body: lambda_facts
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
event_source_arn: not required, default: null. # For query type 'mappings', this is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis or DynamoDB stream.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
query: required, default: all. # Specifies the resource type for which to gather facts.  Leave blank to retrieve all facts.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
function_name: not required, default: null. # The name of the lambda function for which facts are requested.

lambda_policy.description: Creates, updates or deletes AWS Lambda policy statements.
body: lambda_policy
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
event_source_token: not required, default: undefined. # Token string representing source ARN or account. Mutually exclusive with C(source_arn) or C(source_account).
statement_id: required, default: undefined. # A unique statement identifier.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

source_account: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS account ID (without a hyphen) of the source owner. For example, if the SourceArn identifies a bucket, then this is the bucket owner's account ID. You can use this additional condition to ensure the bucket you specify is owned by a specific account (it is possible the bucket owner deleted the bucket and some other AWS account created the bucket). You can also use this condition to specify all sources (that is, you don't specify the SourceArn ) owned by a specific account.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
alias: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the function alias. Mutually exclusive with C(version).
state: required, default: present. # Describes the desired state.
version: not required, default: undefined. # Version of the Lambda function. Mutually exclusive with C(alias).

action: required, default: undefined. # The AWS Lambda action you want to allow in this statement. Each Lambda action is a string starting with lambda: followed by the API name (see Operations ). For example, lambda:CreateFunction . You can use wildcard (lambda:* ) to grant permission for all AWS Lambda actions.

source_arn: not required, default: undefined. # This is optional; however, when granting Amazon S3 permission to invoke your function, you should specify this field with the bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN) as its value. This ensures that only events generated from the specified bucket can invoke the function.

principal: required, default: undefined. # The principal who is getting this permission. It can be Amazon S3 service Principal (s3.amazonaws.com ) if you want Amazon S3 to invoke the function, an AWS account ID if you are granting cross-account permission, or any valid AWS service principal such as sns.amazonaws.com . For example, you might want to allow a custom application in another AWS account to push events to AWS Lambda by invoking your function.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

function_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the Lambda function whose resource policy you are updating by adding a new permission.,You can specify a function name (for example, Thumbnail ) or you can specify Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the,function (for example, arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:account-id:function:ThumbNail ). AWS Lambda also allows you to,specify partial ARN (for example, account-id:Thumbnail ). Note that the length constraint applies only to the,ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 character in length.
layman

list_url: not required, default: undefined. # An URL of the alternative overlays list that defines the overlay to install. This list will be fetched and saved under C(${overlay_defs})/${name}.xml), where C(overlay_defs) is readed from the Layman's configuration.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to C(no) when no other option exists.  Prior to 1.9.3 the code defaulted to C(no).
name: required, default: undefined. # The overlay id to install, synchronize, or uninstall. Use 'ALL' to sync all of the installed overlays (can be used only when C(state=updated)).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install (C(present)), sync (C(updated)), or uninstall (C(absent)) the overlay.

ldap_attr.description: Add or remove LDAP attribute values.
body: ldap_attr
dn: required, default: undefined. # The DN of the entry to modify.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the attribute to modify.
server_uri: not required, default: ldapi:///. # A URI to the LDAP server. The default value lets the underlying LDAP client library look for a UNIX domain socket in its default location.
start_tls: not required, default: no. # If true, we'll use the START_TLS LDAP extension.
bind_dn: not required, default: null. # A DN to bind with. If this is omitted, we'll try a SASL bind with the EXTERNAL mechanism. If this is blank, we'll use an anonymous bind.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the attribute values. If C(present), all given values will be added if they're missing. If C(absent), all given values will be removed if present. If C(exact), the set of values will be forced to exactly those provided and no others. If I(state=exact) and I(value) is empty, all values for this attribute will be removed.

values: required, default: undefined. # The value(s) to add or remove. This can be a string or a list of strings. The complex argument format is required in order to pass a list of strings (see examples).
bind_pw: not required, default: null. # The password to use with I(bind_dn).
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on sites using self-signed certificates.
ldap_entry
dn: required, default: undefined. # The DN of the entry to add or remove.
objectClass: not required, default: null. # If I(state=present), value or list of values to use when creating the entry. It can either be a string or an actual list of strings.
start_tls: not required, default: no. # If true, we'll use the START_TLS LDAP extension.
bind_dn: not required, default: null. # A DN to bind with. If this is omitted, we'll try a SASL bind with the EXTERNAL mechanism. If this is blank, we'll use an anonymous bind.
server_uri: not required, default: ldapi:///. # A URI to the LDAP server. The default value lets the underlying LDAP client library look for a UNIX domain socket in its default location.
state: not required, default: present. # The target state of the entry.
params: not required, default: null. # List of options which allows to overwrite any of the task or the I(attributes) options. To remove an option, set the value of the option to C(null).
bind_pw: not required, default: null. # The password to use with I(bind_dn).

attributes: not required, default: null. # If I(state=present), attributes necessary to create an entry. Existing entries are never modified. To assert specific attribute values on an existing entry, use M(ldap_attr) module instead.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on sites using self-signed certificates.

letsencrypt.description: Create SSL certificates with Let's Encrypt
body: letsencrypt

acme_directory: not required, default: https://acme-staging.api.letsencrypt.org/directory. # The ACME directory to use. This is the entry point URL to access CA server API.,For safety reasons the default is set to the Let's Encrypt staging server. This will create technically correct, but untrusted certificates.
account_email: not required, default: null. # The email address associated with this account.,It will be used for certificate expiration warnings.
dest: required, default: undefined. # The destination file for the certificate.
data: not required, default: null. # The data to validate ongoing challenges.,The value that must be used here will be provided by a previous use of this module.
challenge: not required, default: http-01. # The challenge to be performed.
agreement: not required, default: https://letsencrypt.org/documents/LE-SA-v1.1.1-August-1-2016.pdf. # URI to a terms of service document you agree to when using the ACME service at C(acme_directory).
account_key: required, default: undefined. # File containing the Let's Encrypt account RSA key.,Can be created with C(openssl rsa ...).

remaining_days: not required, default: 10. # The number of days the certificate must have left being valid. If C(cert_days < remaining_days), then it will be renewed. If the certificate is not renewed, module return values will not include C(challenge_data).

csr: required, default: undefined. # File containing the CSR for the new certificate.,Can be created with C(openssl csr ...).,The CSR may contain multiple Subject Alternate Names, but each one will lead to an individual challenge that must be fulfilled for the CSR to be signed.
librato_annotation

description: not required, default: undefined. # The description contains extra meta-data about a particular annotation,The description should contain specifics on the individual annotation e.g. Deployed 9b562b2 shipped new feature foo!
links: required, default: undefined. # See examples
title: required, default: undefined. # The title of an annotation is a string and may contain spaces,The title should be a short, high-level summary of the annotation e.g. v45 Deployment
start_time: not required, default: undefined. # The unix timestamp indicating the time at which the event referenced by this annotation started
name: not required, default: undefined. # The annotation stream name,If the annotation stream does not exist, it will be created automatically
source: not required, default: undefined. # A string which describes the originating source of an annotation when that annotation is tracked across multiple members of a population

end_time: not required, default: undefined. # The unix timestamp indicating the time at which the event referenced by this annotation ended,For events that have a duration, this is a useful way to annotate the duration of the event
api_key: required, default: undefined. # Librato account api key
user: required, default: undefined. # Librato account username

lightsail.description: Create or delete a virtual machine instance in AWS Lightsail
body: lightsail
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: null. # Name of the instance
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
blueprint_id: not required, default: null. # ID of the instance blueprint image. Required when state='present'
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
user_data: not required, default: null. # Launch script that can configure the instance with additional data
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
key_pair_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the key pair to use with the instance

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
bundle_id: not required, default: null. # Bundle of specification info for the instance. Required when state='present'
zone: not required, default: null. # AWS availability zone in which to launch the instance. Required when state='present'
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning.  If wait is "no" an ip_address may not be returned

lineinfile.description: Ensure a particular line is in a file, or replace an existing line using a back-referenced regular expression.
body: lineinfile
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

backrefs: not required, default: no. # Used with C(state=present). If set, line can contain backreferences (both positional and named) that will get populated if the C(regexp) matches. This flag changes the operation of the module slightly; C(insertbefore) and C(insertafter) will be ignored, and if the C(regexp) doesn't match anywhere in the file, the file will be left unchanged. If the C(regexp) does match, the last matching line will be replaced by the expanded line parameter.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
others: not required, default: undefined. # All arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here.

insertafter: not required, default: EOF. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the line at the end of the file. If specified regular expression has no matches, EOF will be used instead. May not be used with C(backrefs).

regexp: not required, default: undefined. # The regular expression to look for in every line of the file. For C(state=present), the pattern to replace if found; only the last line found will be replaced. For C(state=absent), the pattern of the line(s) to remove.  Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).

validate: not required, default: None. # The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

line: not required, default: undefined. # Required for C(state=present). The line to insert/replace into the file. If C(backrefs) is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the C(regexp) capture groups if the regexp matches.
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

insertbefore: not required, default: undefined. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the line at the beginning of the file. If specified regular expression has no matches, the line will be inserted at the end of the file.  May not be used with C(backrefs).

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
create: not required, default: no. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. By default it will fail if the file is missing.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the line should be there or not.

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
path: required, default: undefined. # The file to modify.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

linode.description: create / delete / stop / restart an instance in Linode Public Cloud
body: linode
alert_diskio_enabled: not required, default: null. # Set status of receiving disk IO alerts.

additional_disks: not required, default: null. # List of dictionaries for creating additional disks that are added to the Linode configuration settings. Dictionary takes Size, Label, Type. Size is in MB.
alert_bwin_enabled: not required, default: null. # Set status of bandwidth in alerts.
payment_term: not required, default: 1. # payment term to use for the instance (payment term in months)
kernel_id: not required, default: null. # kernel to use for the instance (Linode Kernel)
alert_bwin_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set threshold in MB of bandwidth in alerts.
alert_cpu_enabled: not required, default: null. # Set status of receiving CPU usage alerts.
alert_bwquota_enabled: not required, default: null. # Set status of bandwidth quota alerts as percentage of network transfer quota.
linode_id: not required, default: null. # Unique ID of a linode server
alert_diskio_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set threshold for average IO ops/sec over 2 hour period.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
private_ip: not required, default: no. # Add private IPv4 address when Linode is created.
watchdog: not required, default: True. # Set status of Lassie watchdog.
password: not required, default: null. # root password to apply to a new server (auto generated if missing)
ssh_pub_key: not required, default: null. # SSH public key applied to root user
wait: not required, default: no. # wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
datacenter: not required, default: null. # datacenter to create an instance in (Linode Datacenter)
alert_bwquota_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set threshold in MB of bandwidth quota alerts.
backupweeklyday: not required, default: null. # Integer value for what day of the week to store weekly backups.
name: not required, default: null. # Name to give the instance (alphanumeric, dashes, underscore),To keep sanity on the Linode Web Console, name is prepended with LinodeID_
displaygroup: not required, default: null. # Add the instance to a Display Group in Linode Manager
alert_cpu_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set percentage threshold for receiving CPU usage alerts. Each CPU core adds 100% to total.
alert_bwout_enabled: not required, default: null. # Set status of bandwidth out alerts.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
swap: not required, default: 512. # swap size in MB
alert_bwout_threshold: not required, default: null. # Set threshold in MB of bandwidth out alerts.
distribution: not required, default: null. # distribution to use for the instance (Linode Distribution)
api_key: not required, default: null. # Linode API key
plan: not required, default: null. # plan to use for the instance (Linode plan)
lldp
locale_gen
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the locale shall be present.
name: required, default: null. # Name and encoding of the locale, such as "en_GB.UTF-8".

logentries.description: Module for tracking logs via logentries.com
body: logentries
path: required, default: undefined. # path to a log file
state: not required, default: present. # following state of the log
name: not required, default: undefined. # name of the log
logtype: not required, default: undefined. # type of the log

logicmonitor.description: Manage your LogicMonitor account through Ansible Playbooks
body: logicmonitor

displayname: not required, default: hostname -f. # The display name of a host in your LogicMonitor account or the desired display name of a device to manage.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host).

description: not required, default: . # The long text description of the object in your LogicMonitor account.,Optional for managing hosts and host groups (target=host or target=hostgroup; action=add or action=update).
company: required, default: null. # The LogicMonitor account company name. If you would log in to your account at "superheroes.logicmonitor.com" you would use "superheroes."
user: required, default: null. # A LogicMonitor user name. The module will authenticate and perform actions on behalf of this user.
groups: not required, default: . # A list of groups that the host should be a member of.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host; action=add or action=update).
duration: not required, default: 30. # The duration (minutes) of the Scheduled Down Time (SDT).,Optional for putting an object into SDT (action=sdt).
password: required, default: null. # The password of the specified LogicMonitor user

collector: not required, default: null. # The fully qualified domain name of a collector in your LogicMonitor account.,This is required for the creation of a LogicMonitor host (target=host action=add).,This is required for updating, removing or scheduling downtime for hosts if 'displayname' isn't specified (target=host action=update action=remove action=sdt).
id: not required, default: null. # ID of the datasource to target.,Required for management of LogicMonitor datasources (target=datasource).
alertenable: not required, default: true. # A boolean flag to turn alerting on or off for an object.,Optional for managing all hosts (action=add or action=update).

target: required, default: null. # The type of LogicMonitor object you wish to manage.,Collector: Perform actions on a LogicMonitor collector.,NOTE You should use Ansible service modules such as M(service) or M(supervisorctl) for managing the Collector 'logicmonitor-agent' and 'logicmonitor-watchdog' services. Specifically, you'll probably want to start these services after a Collector add and stop these services before a Collector remove.,Host: Perform actions on a host device.,Hostgroup: Perform actions on a LogicMonitor host group.,NOTE Host and Hostgroup tasks should always be performed via delegate_to: localhost. There are no benefits to running these tasks on the remote host and doing so will typically cause problems.
hostname: not required, default: hostname -f. # The hostname of a host in your LogicMonitor account, or the desired hostname of a device to manage.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host).

properties: not required, default: [object Object]. # A dictionary of properties to set on the LogicMonitor host or host group.,Optional for managing hosts and host groups (target=host or target=hostgroup; action=add or action=update).,This parameter will add or update existing properties in your LogicMonitor account.
starttime: not required, default: Now. # The time that the Scheduled Down Time (SDT) should begin.,Optional for managing SDT (action=sdt).,Y-m-d H:M

action: required, default: null. # The action you wish to perform on target.,Add: Add an object to your LogicMonitor account.,Remove: Remove an object from your LogicMonitor account.,Update: Update properties, description, or groups (target=host) for an object in your LogicMonitor account.,SDT: Schedule downtime for an object in your LogicMonitor account.

fullpath: not required, default: null. # The fullpath of the host group object you would like to manage.,Recommend running on a single Ansible host.,Required for management of LogicMonitor host groups (target=hostgroup).
logicmonitor_facts
displayname: not required, default: hostname -f. # The display name of a host in your LogicMonitor account or the desired display name of a device to add into monitoring.
target: required, default: null. # The LogicMonitor object you wish to manage.
company: required, default: null. # The LogicMonitor account company name. If you would log in to your account at "superheroes.logicmonitor.com" you would use "superheroes".

hostname: not required, default: hostname -f. # The hostname of a host in your LogicMonitor account, or the desired hostname of a device to add into monitoring.,Required for managing hosts (target=host).
user: required, default: null. # A LogicMonitor user name. The module will authenticate and perform actions on behalf of this user.

fullpath: not required, default: null. # The fullpath of the hostgroup object you would like to manage.,Recommend running on a single ansible host.,Required for management of LogicMonitor host groups (target=hostgroup).
password: required, default: null. # The password for the chosen LogicMonitor User.,If an md5 hash is used, the digest flag must be set to true.

collector: not required, default: null. # The fully qualified domain name of a collector in your LogicMonitor account.,This is optional for querying a LogicMonitor host when a displayname is specified.,This is required for querying a LogicMonitor host when a displayname is not specified.
logstash_plugin
proxy_port: not required, default: None. # Proxy port to use during plugin installation.
state: not required, default: present. # Apply plugin state.
version: not required, default: None. # Specify plugin Version of the plugin to install. If plugin exists with previous version, it will NOT be updated.
name: required, default: undefined. # Install plugin with that name.
proxy_host: not required, default: None. # Proxy host to use during plugin installation.
plugin_bin: not required, default: /usr/share/logstash/bin/logstash-plugin. # Specify logstash-plugin to use for plugin management.
lvg
vg_options: not required, default: null. # Additional options to pass to C(vgcreate) when creating the volume group.

pvs: not required, default: undefined. # List of comma-separated devices to use as physical devices in this volume group. Required when creating or resizing volume group.,The module will take care of running pvcreate if needed.
force: not required, default: no. # If yes, allows to remove volume group with logical volumes.
vg: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volume group.
pesize: not required, default: 4. # The size of the physical extent in megabytes. Must be a power of 2.
pv_options: not required, default: null. # Additional options to pass to C(pvcreate) when creating the volume group.
state: not required, default: present. # Control if the volume group exists.
lvol
pvs: not required, default: undefined. # Comma separated list of physical volumes e.g. /dev/sda,/dev/sdb
force: not required, default: no. # Shrink or remove operations of volumes requires this switch. Ensures that that filesystems get never corrupted/destroyed by mistake.
vg: required, default: undefined. # The volume group this logical volume is part of.
lv: required, default: undefined. # The name of the logical volume.
state: not required, default: present. # Control if the logical volume exists. If C(present) and the volume does not already exist then the C(size) option is required.
snapshot: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the snapshot volume
active: not required, default: yes. # Whether the volume is activate and visible to the host.
shrink: not required, default: true. # shrink if current size is higher than size requested
opts: not required, default: undefined. # Free-form options to be passed to the lvcreate command

size: not required, default: undefined. # The size of the logical volume, according to lvcreate(8) --size, by default in megabytes or optionally with one of [bBsSkKmMgGtTpPeE] units; or according to lvcreate(8) --extents as a percentage of [VG|PVS|FREE]; Float values must begin with a digit. Resizing using percentage values was not supported prior to 2.1.
lxc_container
archive_path: not required, default: null. # Path the save the archived container. If the path does not exist the archive method will attempt to create it.
zfs_root: not required, default: undefined. # Create zfs under given zfsroot.
container_log_level: not required, default: INFO. # Set the log level for a container where *container_log* was set.
template_options: not required, default: undefined. # Template options when building the container.
container_command: not required, default: undefined. # Run a command within a container.
clone_name: not required, default: false. # Name of the new cloned server. This is only used when state is clone.
lxc_path: not required, default: undefined. # Place container under PATH
container_config: not required, default: undefined. # list of 'key=value' options to use when configuring a container.
fs_type: not required, default: ext4. # Create fstype TYPE.
archive: not required, default: false. # Create an archive of a container. This will create a tarball of the running container.
vg_name: not required, default: lxc. # If Backend store is lvm, specify the name of the volume group.

clone_snapshot: not required, default: false. # Create a snapshot a container when cloning. This is not supported by all container storage backends. Enabling this may fail if the backing store does not support snapshots.
container_log: not required, default: false. # Enable a container log for host actions to the container.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a container.
lv_name: not required, default: $CONTAINER_NAME. # Name of the logical volume, defaults to the container name.
fs_size: not required, default: 5G. # File system Size.
archive_compression: not required, default: gzip. # Type of compression to use when creating an archive of a running container.
backing_store: not required, default: dir. # Backend storage type for the container.

state: not required, default: started. # Define the state of a container. If you clone a container using `clone_name` the newly cloned container created in a stopped state. The running container will be stopped while the clone operation is happening and upon completion of the clone the original container state will be restored.
thinpool: not required, default: undefined. # Use LVM thin pool called TP.
template: not required, default: ubuntu. # Name of the template to use within an LXC create.
directory: not required, default: undefined. # Place rootfs directory under DIR.
config: not required, default: null. # Path to the LXC configuration file.
lxd_container
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a container.

source: not required, default: undefined. # The source for the container (e.g. { "type": "image", "mode": "pull", "server": "https://images.linuxcontainers.org", "protocol": "lxd", "alias": "ubuntu/xenial/amd64" }). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)
url: not required, default: unix:/var/lib/lxd/unix.socket. # The unix domain socket path or the https URL for the LXD server.

config: not required, default: undefined. # The config for the container (e.g. {"limits.cpu": "2"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1),If the container already exists and its "config" value in metadata obtained from GET /1.0/containers/<name> U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#10containersname) are different, they this module tries to apply the configurations.,The key starts with 'volatile.' are ignored for this comparison.,Not all config values are supported to apply the existing container. Maybe you need to delete and recreate a container.
cert_file: not required, default: "{}/.config/lxc/client.crt" .format(os.environ["HOME"]). # The client certificate file path.
ephemeral: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not the container is ephemeral (e.g. true or false). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

devices: not required, default: undefined. # The devices for the container (e.g. { "rootfs": { "path": "/dev/kvm", "type": "unix-char" }). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

wait_for_ipv4_addresses: not required, default: false. # If this is true, the C(lxd_container) waits until IPv4 addresses are set to the all network interfaces in the container after starting or restarting.
state: not required, default: started. # Define the state of a container.
architecture: not required, default: undefined. # The architecture for the container (e.g. "x86_64" or "i686"). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

timeout: not required, default: 30. # A timeout for changing the state of the container.,This is also used as a timeout for waiting until IPv4 addresses are set to the all network interfaces in the container after starting or restarting.
key_file: not required, default: "{}/.config/lxc/client.key" .format(os.environ["HOME"]). # The client certificate key file path.

trust_password: not required, default: undefined. # The client trusted password.,You need to set this password on the LXD server before running this module using the following command. lxc config set core.trust_password <some random password> See U(https://www.stgraber.org/2016/04/18/lxd-api-direct-interaction/),If trust_password is set, this module send a request for authentication before sending any requests.
force_stop: not required, default: false. # If this is true, the C(lxd_container) forces to stop the container when it stops or restarts the container.
lxd_profile

new_name: not required, default: undefined. # A new name of a profile.,If this parameter is specified a profile will be renamed to this name. See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-11)
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of a profile.
url: not required, default: unix:/var/lib/lxd/unix.socket. # The unix domain socket path or the https URL for the LXD server.

config: not required, default: undefined. # The config for the container (e.g. {"limits.memory": "4GB"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#patch-3),If the profile already exists and its "config" value in metadata obtained from GET /1.0/profiles/<name> U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#get-19) are different, they this module tries to apply the configurations.,Not all config values are supported to apply the existing profile. Maybe you need to delete and recreate a profile.
cert_file: not required, default: "{}/.config/lxc/client.crt" .format(os.environ["HOME"]). # The client certificate file path.

devices: not required, default: undefined. # The devices for the profile (e.g. {"rootfs": {"path": "/dev/kvm", "type": "unix-char"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#patch-3)
state: not required, default: present. # Define the state of a profile.
key_file: not required, default: "{}/.config/lxc/client.key" .format(os.environ["HOME"]). # The client certificate key file path.

trust_password: not required, default: undefined. # The client trusted password.,You need to set this password on the LXD server before running this module using the following command. lxc config set core.trust_password <some random password> See U(https://www.stgraber.org/2016/04/18/lxd-api-direct-interaction/),If trust_password is set, this module send a request for authentication before sending any requests.
macports
state: not required, default: present. # state of the package
