update_cache: not required, default: no. # update the package db first
name: required, default: undefined. # name of package to install/remove
mail
body: not required, default: $subject. # The body of the email being sent.
username: not required, default: null. # If SMTP requires username

secure: not required, default: try. # If C(always), the connection will only send email if the connection is Encrypted. If the server doesn't accept the encrypted connection it will fail.,If C(try), the connection will attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before trying to send.,If C(never), the connection will not attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before sending,If C(starttls), the connection will try to upgrade to a secure SSL/TLS connection, before sending. If it is unable to do so it will fail.
cc: not required, default: undefined. # The email-address(es) the mail is being copied to. This is a comma-separated list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
host: not required, default: localhost. # The mail server
password: not required, default: null. # If SMTP requires password
port: not required, default: 25. # The mail server port.  This must be a valid integer between 1 and 65534
to: not required, default: root. # The email-address(es) the mail is being sent to. This is a comma-separated list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
subject: required, default: undefined. # The subject of the email being sent.
from: not required, default: root. # The email-address the mail is sent from. May contain address and phrase.
headers: not required, default: null. # A vertical-bar-separated list of headers which should be added to the message. Each individual header is specified as C(header=value) (see example below).
charset: not required, default: us-ascii. # The character set of email being sent
bcc: not required, default: undefined. # The email-address(es) the mail is being 'blind' copied to. This is a comma-separated list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
attach: not required, default: null. # A space-separated list of pathnames of files to attach to the message. Attached files will have their content-type set to C(application/octet-stream).
timeout: not required, default: 20. # Sets the Timeout in seconds for connection attempts
subtype: not required, default: plain. # The minor mime type, can be either text or html. The major type is always text.
make
chdir: required, default: undefined. # cd into this directory before running make
params: not required, default: none. # Any extra parameters to pass to make
target: not required, default: none. # The target to run
manageiq_provider
name: required, default: undefined. # The provider's name.
zone: not required, default: default. # The ManageIQ zone name that will manage the provider.
alerts: not required, default: null. # Alerts endpoint connection information.
metrics: not required, default: null. # Metrics endpoint connection information.
state: not required, default: present. # absent - provider should not exist, present - provider should be, valid - provider authentication should be valid.
provider: not required, default: null. # Default endpoint connection information, required if state is true.
manageiq_connection: required, default: undefined. # ManageIQ connection configuration information.
type: required, default: undefined. # The provider's type.
provider_region: not required, default: null. # The provider region name to connect to (e.g. AWS region for Amazon).
manageiq_user
state: not required, default: present. # absent - user should not exist, present - user should be.
group: not required, default: null. # The name of the group to which the user belongs.
name: not required, default: null. # The users' full name.
manageiq_connection: required, default: undefined. # ManageIQ connection configuration information.
password: not required, default: null. # The users' password.
userid: required, default: undefined. # The unique userid in manageiq, often mentioned as username.
email: not required, default: null. # The users' E-mail address.
mattermost
username: not required, default: Ansible. # This is the sender of the message (Username Override need to be enabled by mattermost admin, see mattermost doc.
icon_url: not required, default: https://www.ansible.com/favicon.ico. # Url for the message sender's icon.
url: required, default: undefined. # Mattermost url (i.e. http://mattermost.yourcompany.com).
text: required, default: undefined. # Text to send. Note that the module does not handle escaping characters.

api_key: required, default: undefined. # Mattermost webhook api key. Log into your mattermost site, go to Menu -> Integration -> Incoming Webhook -> Add Incoming Webhook. This will give you full URL. api_key is the last part. http://mattermost.example.com/hooks/C(API_KEY)
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
channel: not required, default: undefined. # Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the channel selected for the I(api_key).

maven_artifact.description: Downloads an Artifact from a Maven Repository
body: maven_artifact
username: not required, default: null. # The username to authenticate as to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret key of the repository is hosted on S3
artifact_id: required, default: undefined. # The maven artifactId coordinate
state: required, default: present. # The desired state of the artifact
dest: required, default: false. # The path where the artifact should be written to,If file mode or ownerships are specified and destination path already exists, they affect the downloaded file
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
repository_url: not required, default: http://repo1.maven.org/maven2. # The URL of the Maven Repository to download from.,Use s3://... if the repository is hosted on Amazon S3, added in version 2.2.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
password: not required, default: null. # The password to authenticate with to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret access key of the repository is hosted on S3

keep_name: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), the downloaded artifact's name is preserved, i.e the version number remains part of it.,This option only has effect when C(dest) is a directory and C(version) is set to C(latest).
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
extension: not required, default: jar. # The maven type/extension coordinate

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
version: not required, default: latest. # The maven version coordinate

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
timeout: not required, default: 10. # Specifies a timeout in seconds for the connection attempt

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
group_id: required, default: undefined. # The Maven groupId coordinate
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to C(no) when no other option exists.
classifier: not required, default: null. # The maven classifier coordinate
meta

free_form: required, default: undefined. # This module takes a free form command, as a string. There's not an actual option named "free form".  See the examples!,C(flush_handlers) makes Ansible run any handler tasks which have thus far been notified. Ansible inserts these tasks internally at certain points to implicitly trigger handler runs (after pre/post tasks, the final role execution, and the main tasks section of your plays).
,C(refresh_inventory) (added in 2.0) forces the reload of the inventory, which in the case of dynamic inventory scripts means they will be re-executed. This is mainly useful when additional hosts are created and users wish to use them instead of using the `add_host` module."
,C(noop) (added in 2.0) This literally does 'nothing'. It is mainly used internally and not recommended for general use.,C(clear_facts) (added in 2.1) causes the gathered facts for the hosts specified in the play's list of hosts to be cleared, including the fact cache.,C(clear_host_errors) (added in 2.1) clears the failed state (if any) from hosts specified in the play's list of hosts.,C(end_play) (added in 2.2) causes the play to end without failing the host.,C(reset_connection) (added in 2.3) interrupts a persistent connection (i.e. ssh + control persist)
modprobe
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the module should be present or absent.
params: not required, default: . # Modules parameters.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of kernel module to manage.

mongodb_parameter.description: Change an administrative parameter on a MongoDB server.
body: mongodb_parameter
login_port: not required, default: 27017. # The port to connect to
database: required, default: undefined. # The name of the database to add/remove the user from
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # The host running the database
login_database: not required, default: null. # The database where login credentials are stored
param: required, default: undefined. # MongoDB administrative parameter to modify
ssl: not required, default: false. # Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database
param_type: not required, default: str. # Define the parameter value (str, int)
value: required, default: undefined. # MongoDB administrative parameter value to set
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with
replica_set: not required, default: null. # Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

mongodb_user.description: Adds or removes a user from a MongoDB database.
body: mongodb_user
login_port: not required, default: 27017. # The port to connect to
update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
name: required, default: null. # The name of the user to add or remove

roles: not required, default: readWrite. # The database user roles valid values could either be one or more of the following strings: 'read', 'readWrite', 'dbAdmin', 'userAdmin', 'clusterAdmin', 'readAnyDatabase', 'readWriteAnyDatabase', 'userAdminAnyDatabase', 'dbAdminAnyDatabase'
,Or the following dictionary '{ db: DATABASE_NAME, role: ROLE_NAME }'.,This param requires pymongo 2.5+. If it is a string, mongodb 2.4+ is also required. If it is a dictionary, mongo 2.6+  is required.
database: required, default: undefined. # The name of the database to add/remove the user from
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # The host running the database
login_database: not required, default: null. # The database where login credentials are stored
ssl_cert_reqs: not required, default: CERT_REQUIRED. # Specifies whether a certificate is required from the other side of the connection, and whether it will be validated if provided.
ssl: not required, default: false. # Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database
state: not required, default: present. # The database user state
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with
password: not required, default: null. # The password to use for the user
replica_set: not required, default: null. # Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

monit.description: Manage the state of a program monitored via Monit
body: monit
state: required, default: null. # The state of service
name: required, default: null. # The name of the I(monit) program/process to manage

timeout: not required, default: 300. # If there are pending actions for the service monitored by monit, then Ansible will check for up to this many seconds to verify the requested action has been performed. Ansible will sleep for five seconds between each check.

mount.description: Control active and configured mount points
body: mount
src: not required, default: null. # Device to be mounted on I(path). Required when I(state) set to C(present) or C(mounted).

dump: not required, default: 0. # Dump (see fstab(5)). Note that if set to C(null) and I(state) set to C(present), it will cease to work and duplicate entries will be made with subsequent runs.,Has no effect on Solaris systems.

passno: not required, default: 0. # Passno (see fstab(5)). Note that if set to C(null) and I(state) set to C(present), it will cease to work and duplicate entries will be made with subsequent runs.,Deprecated on Solaris systems.

fstab: not required, default: /etc/fstab (/etc/vfstab on Solaris). # File to use instead of C(/etc/fstab). You shouldn't use this option unless you really know what you are doing. This might be useful if you need to configure mountpoints in a chroot environment.  OpenBSD does not allow specifying alternate fstab files with mount so do not use this on OpenBSD with any state that operates on the live filesystem.
boot: not required, default: true. # Determines if the filesystem should be mounted on boot.,Only applies to Solaris systems.
fstype: not required, default: null. # Filesystem type. Required when I(state) is C(present) or C(mounted).

state: required, default: undefined. # If C(mounted), the device will be actively mounted and appropriately configured in I(fstab).,If C(unmounted), the device will be unmounted without changing I(fstab).,C(absent) and C(present) only deal with I(fstab) but will not affect current mounting.,If specifying C(mounted) and the mount point is not present, the mount point will be created.,Similarly, specifying C(absent) will remove the mount point directory.
path: required, default: undefined. # Path to the mount point (e.g. C(/mnt/files)).,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).
opts: not required, default: null. # Mount options (see fstab(5), or vfstab(4) on Solaris).

mqtt.description: Publish a message on an MQTT topic for the IoT
body: mqtt
username: not required, default: undefined. # Username to authenticate against the broker.

certfile: not required, default: None. # The path pointing to the PEM encoded client certificate. If this is not None it will be used as client information for TLS based authentication. Support for this feature is broker dependent.
port: not required, default: 1883. # MQTT broker port number
server: not required, default: localhost. # MQTT broker address/name
topic: required, default: null. # MQTT topic name
client_id: not required, default: hostname + pid. # MQTT client identifier

ca_certs: not required, default: None. # The path to the Certificate Authority certificate files that are to be treated as trusted by this client. If this is the only option given then the client will operate in a similar manner to a web browser. That is to say it will require the broker to have a certificate signed by the Certificate Authorities in ca_certs and will communicate using TLS v1, but will not attempt any form of authentication. This provides basic network encryption but may not be sufficient depending on how the broker is configured.

retain: not required, default: false. # Setting this flag causes the broker to retain (i.e. keep) the message so that applications that subsequently subscribe to the topic can received the last retained message immediately.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password for C(username) to authenticate against the broker.

keyfile: not required, default: None. # The path pointing to the PEM encoded client private key. If this is not None it will be used as client information for TLS based authentication. Support for this feature is broker dependent.

payload: required, default: null. # Payload. The special string C("None") may be used to send a NULL (i.e. empty) payload which is useful to simply notify with the I(topic) or to clear previously retained messages.
qos: not required, default: 0. # QoS (Quality of Service)

mssql_db.description: Add or remove MSSQL databases from a remote host.
body: mssql_db

autocommit: not required, default: false. # Automatically commit the change only if the import succeed. Sometimes it is necessary to use autocommit=true, since some content can't be changed within a transaction.
login_port: not required, default: 1433. # Port of the MSSQL server. Requires login_host be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used
name: required, default: null. # name of the database to add or remove
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with
login_host: not required, default: undefined. # Host running the database
state: not required, default: present. # The database state
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with
target: not required, default: undefined. # Location, on the remote host, of the dump file to read from or write to. Uncompressed SQL files (C(.sql)) files are supported.

mysql_db.description: Add or remove MySQL databases from a remote host.
body: mysql_db
login_port: not required, default: 3306. # Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
ssl_cert: not required, default: null. # The path to a client public key certificate.
config_file: not required, default: ~/.my.cnf. # Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.

target: not required, default: undefined. # Location, on the remote host, of the dump file to read from or write to. Uncompressed SQL files (C(.sql)) as well as bzip2 (C(.bz2)), gzip (C(.gz)) and xz (Added in 2.0) compressed files are supported.

name: required, default: null. # name of the database to add or remove,name=all May only be provided if I(state) is C(dump) or C(import).,if name=all Works like --all-databases option for mysqldump (Added in 2.0)
ssl_key: not required, default: null. # The path to the client private key.
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with.
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database.
encoding: not required, default: null. # Encoding mode to use, examples include C(utf8) or C(latin1_swedish_ci)
ssl_ca: not required, default: null. # The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
state: not required, default: present. # The database state
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
collation: not required, default: null. # Collation mode (sorting). This only applies to new table/databases and does not update existing ones, this is a limitation of MySQL.
quick: not required, default: true. # Option used for dumping large tables
connect_timeout: not required, default: 30. # The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
single_transaction: not required, default: false. # Execute the dump in a single transaction
mysql_replication
ssl_key: not required, default: null. # The path to the client private key.
master_auto_position: not required, default: null. # does the host uses GTID based replication or not
config_file: not required, default: ~/.my.cnf. # Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
master_ssl_cert: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with.
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database.
master_port: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_host: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_ssl_ca: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
master_connect_retry: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_user: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
master_log_file: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_ssl_cipher: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_password: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
relay_log_file: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
login_port: not required, default: 3306. # Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
ssl_cert: not required, default: null. # The path to a client public key certificate.
master_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
ssl_ca: not required, default: null. # The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
master_ssl_key: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
master_ssl_capath: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable

mode: not required, default: getslave. # module operating mode. Could be getslave (SHOW SLAVE STATUS), getmaster (SHOW MASTER STATUS), changemaster (CHANGE MASTER TO), startslave (START SLAVE), stopslave (STOP SLAVE), resetslave (RESET SLAVE), resetslaveall (RESET SLAVE ALL)
master_log_pos: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable
connect_timeout: not required, default: 30. # The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
relay_log_pos: not required, default: undefined. # same as mysql variable

mysql_user.description: Adds or removes a user from a MySQL database.
body: mysql_user
login_port: not required, default: 3306. # Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
ssl_cert: not required, default: null. # The path to a client public key certificate.
config_file: not required, default: ~/.my.cnf. # Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
name: required, default: undefined. # name of the user (role) to add or remove
ssl_key: not required, default: null. # The path to the client private key.
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with.
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database.
append_privs: not required, default: no. # Append the privileges defined by priv to the existing ones for this user instead of overwriting existing ones.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the user should exist.  When C(absent), removes the user.
host_all: not required, default: no. # override the host option, making ansible apply changes to all hostnames for a given user.  This option cannot be used when creating users
ssl_ca: not required, default: null. # The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
sql_log_bin: not required, default: yes. # Whether binary logging should be enabled or disabled for the connection.
encrypted: not required, default: no. # Indicate that the 'password' field is a `mysql_native_password` hash
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
host: not required, default: localhost. # the 'host' part of the MySQL username
check_implicit_admin: not required, default: no. # Check if mysql allows login as root/nopassword before trying supplied credentials.
password: not required, default: null. # set the user's password.
connect_timeout: not required, default: 30. # The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.

priv: not required, default: null. # MySQL privileges string in the format: C(db.table:priv1,priv2).,Multiple privileges can be specified by separating each one using a forward slash: C(db.table:priv/db.table:priv).,The format is based on MySQL C(GRANT) statement.,Database and table names can be quoted, MySQL-style.,If column privileges are used, the C(priv1,priv2) part must be exactly as returned by a C(SHOW GRANT) statement. If not followed, the module will always report changes. It includes grouping columns by permission (C(SELECT(col1,col2)) instead of C(SELECT(col1),SELECT(col2))).
mysql_variables
login_port: not required, default: 3306. # Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
ssl_cert: not required, default: null. # The path to a client public key certificate.
config_file: not required, default: ~/.my.cnf. # Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
ssl_key: not required, default: null. # The path to the client private key.
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with.
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database.
value: not required, default: undefined. # If set, then sets variable value to this
ssl_ca: not required, default: null. # The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
variable: required, default: undefined. # Variable name to operate
connect_timeout: not required, default: 30. # The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
na_cdot_aggregate

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified aggregate should exist or not.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the aggregate to manage.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.

disk_count: not required, default: undefined. # Number of disks to place into the aggregate, including parity disks.,The disks in this newly-created aggregate come from the spare disk pool.,The smallest disks in this pool join the aggregate first, unless the C(disk-size) argument is provided.,Either C(disk-count) or C(disks) must be supplied. Range [0..2^31-1].,Required when C(state=present).

na_cdot_license.description: Manage NetApp cDOT protocol and feature licenses
body: na_cdot_license

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
licenses: not required, default: undefined. # List of licenses to add or remove.,Please note that trying to remove a non-existent license will throw an error.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
remove_unused: not required, default: undefined. # Remove licenses that have no controller affiliation in the cluster.
remove_expired: not required, default: undefined. # Remove licenses that have expired in the cluster.

serial_number: not required, default: None. # Serial number of the node associated with the license.,This parameter is used primarily when removing license for a specific service.,If this parameter is not provided, the cluster serial number is used by default.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.
na_cdot_lun

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
vserver: required, default: undefined. # The name of the vserver to use.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the lun to manage.
flexvol_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the FlexVol the lun should exist on.,Required when C(state=present).
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
size_unit: not required, default: gb. # The unit used to interpret the size parameter.
force_remove: not required, default: false. # If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed if it is online and mapped.,If "false", destroying an online and mapped LUN will fail.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified lun should exist or not.
force_resize: not required, default: false. # Forcibly reduce the size. This is required for reducing the size of the LUN to avoid accidentally reducing the LUN size.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.

force_remove_fenced: not required, default: false. # If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed while it is fenced.,If "false", attempting to destroy a fenced LUN will fail.,The default if not specified is "false". This field is available in Data ONTAP 8.2 and later.
size: not required, default: undefined. # The size of the lun in C(size_unit).,Required when C(state=present).
na_cdot_qtree

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
vserver: required, default: undefined. # The name of the vserver to use.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified Qtree should exist or not.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Qtree to manage.
flexvol_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the FlexVol the Qtree should exist on. Required when C(state=present).
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.
na_cdot_svm

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
root_volume_aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # The aggregate on which the root volume will be created.,Required when C(state=present).
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the SVM to manage.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

root_volume_security_style: not required, default: undefined. # Security Style of the root volume.,When specified as part of the vserver-create, this field represents the security style for the Vserver root volume.,When specified as part of vserver-get-iter call, this will return the list of matching Vservers.,Possible values are 'unix', 'ntfs', 'mixed'.,The 'unified' security style, which applies only to Infinite Volumes, cannot be applied to a Vserver's root volume.,Valid options are "unix" for NFS, "ntfs" for CIFS, "mixed" for Mixed, "unified" for Unified.,Required when C(state=present)
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified SVM should exist or not.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.
root_volume: not required, default: undefined. # Root volume of the SVM. Required when C(state=present).
na_cdot_user

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the user to manage.

authentication_method: required, default: undefined. # Authentication method for the application.,Not all authentication methods are valid for an application.,Valid authentication methods for each application are as denoted in I(authentication_choices_description).,password for console application,password, domain, nsswitch, cert for http application.,password, domain, nsswitch, cert for ontapi application.,community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 users).,usm and community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv3 users).,password for sp application.,password for rsh application.,password for telnet application.,password, publickey, domain, nsswitch for ssh application.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
vserver: required, default: undefined. # The name of the vserver to use.
application: required, default: undefined. # Applications to grant access to.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified user should exist or not.
role_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the role. Required when C(state=present)
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.

set_password: not required, default: None. # Password for the user account.,It is ignored for creating snmp users, but is required for creating non-snmp users.,For an existing user, this value will be used as the new password.
na_cdot_user_role

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the role to manage.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
vserver: required, default: undefined. # The name of the vserver to use.
access_level: not required, default: all. # The name of the role to manage.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified user should exist or not.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.
command_directory_name: required, default: undefined. # The command or command directory to which the role has an access.
na_cdot_volume

username: required, default: undefined. # This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
aggregate_name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the aggregate the flexvol should exist on. Required when C(state=present).
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volume to manage.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
size_unit: not required, default: gb. # The unit used to interpret the size parameter.
vserver: required, default: None. # Name of the vserver to use.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified volume should exist or not.
online: not required, default: True. # Whether the specified volume is online, or not.
infinite: not required, default: False. # Set True if the volume is an Infinite Volume.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password for the specified user.
size: not required, default: undefined. # The size of the volume in (size_unit). Required when C(state=present).

nagios.description: Perform common tasks in Nagios related to downtime and notifications.
body: nagios
comment: not required, default: Scheduling downtime. # Comment for C(downtime) action.

servicegroup: not required, default: undefined. # The Servicegroup we want to set downtimes/alerts for. B(Required) option when using the C(servicegroup_service_downtime) amd C(servicegroup_host_downtime).
author: not required, default: Ansible. # Author to leave downtime comments as. Only usable with the C(downtime) action.
action: required, default: undefined. # Action to take.,servicegroup options were added in 2.0.,delete_downtime options were added in 2.2.
host: not required, default: null. # Host to operate on in Nagios.
command: required, default: undefined. # The raw command to send to nagios, which should not include the submitted time header or the line-feed B(Required) option when using the C(command) action.

services: required, default: undefined. # What to manage downtime/alerts for. Separate multiple services with commas. C(service) is an alias for C(services). B(Required) option when using the C(downtime), C(enable_alerts), and C(disable_alerts) actions.
minutes: not required, default: 30. # Minutes to schedule downtime for.,Only usable with the C(downtime) action.
cmdfile: not required, default: auto-detected. # Path to the nagios I(command file) (FIFO pipe). Only required if auto-detection fails.
nclu
commands: not required, default: undefined. # A list of strings containing the net commands to run. Mutually exclusive with I(template).
abort: not required, default: false. # Boolean. When true, perform a 'net abort' before the block. This cleans out any uncommitted changes in the buffer. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).
description: not required, default: Ansible-originated commit. # Commit description that will be recorded to the commit log if I(commit) or I(atomic) are true.

template: not required, default: undefined. # A single, multi-line string with jinja2 formatting. This string will be broken by lines, and each line will be run through net. Mutually exclusive with I(commands).
commit: not required, default: false. # When true, performs a 'net commit' at the end of the block. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).
atomic: not required, default: false. # When true, equivalent to both I(commit) and I(abort) being true. Mutually exclusive with I(commit) and I(atomic).

net_banner.description: Manage multiline banners on network devices
body: net_banner

text: not required, default: null. # The banner text that should be present in the remote device running configuration.  This argument accepts a multiline string, with no empty lines. Requires I(state=present).
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is present in the current devices active running configuration.
banner: required, default: undefined. # Specifies which banner that should be configured on the remote device.
net_interface
rx_rate: not required, default: undefined. # Receiver rate in bits per second (bps).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the Interface.
duplex: not required, default: auto. # Interface link status
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Configure interface link status.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum size of transmit packet.

delay: not required, default: 10. # Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state argument which are I(state) with values C(up)/C(down), I(tx_rate) and I(rx_rate).
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge Interfaces not defined in the aggregate parameter. This applies only for logical interface.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the Interface configuration, C(up) indicates present and operationally up and C(down) indicates present and operationally C(down)
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of Interfaces definitions.
speed: not required, default: undefined. # Interface link speed.
tx_rate: not required, default: undefined. # Transmit rate in bits per second (bps).
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of Interface.

net_l2_interface.description: Manage Layer-2 interface on network devices
body: net_l2_interface
native_vlan: not required, default: undefined. # Native VLAN to be configured in trunk port.
access_vlan: not required, default: undefined. # Configure given VLAN in access port.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface excluding any logical unit number.
trunk_vlans: not required, default: undefined. # List of VLANs to be configured in trunk port.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the Layer-2 Interface configuration.
trunk_allowed_vlans: not required, default: undefined. # List of allowed VLAN's in a given trunk port.
mode: not required, default: access. # Mode in which interface needs to be configured.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of Layer-2 interface definitions.

net_l3_interface.description: Manage L3 interfaces on network devices
body: net_l3_interface
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge L3 interfaces not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the L3 interface configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the L3 interface.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # IPv6 of the L3 interface.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of L3 interfaces definitions
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # IPv4 of the L3 interface.

net_linkagg.description: Manage link aggregation groups on network devices
body: net_linkagg
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge link aggregation groups not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the link aggregation group.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the link aggregation group.
members: required, default: undefined. # List of members interfaces of the link aggregation group. The value can be single interface or list of interfaces.
min_links: not required, default: undefined. # Minimum members that should be up before bringing up the link aggregation group.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of link aggregation definitions.

mode: not required, default: true. # Mode of the link aggregation group. A value of C(on) will enable LACP. C(active) configures the link to actively information about the state of the link, or it can be configured in C(passive) mode ie. send link state information only when received them from another link.

net_lldp.description: Manage LLDP service configuration on network devices
body: net_lldp
state: not required, default: present. # State of the LLDP service configuration.

net_lldp_interface.description: Manage LLDP interfaces configuration on network devices
body: net_lldp_interface
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of interfaces LLDP should be configured on.
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge interfaces not defined in the aggregate parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the LLDP configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface LLDP should be configured on.
net_logging
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge logging not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of logging definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the logging configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # If value of C(dest) is I(host) it indicates file-name the host name to be notified.
level: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging severity levels.
dest: not required, default: undefined. # Destination of the logs.
facility: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging facility.

net_ping.description: Tests reachability using ping from a network device
body: net_ping
count: not required, default: 5. # Number of packets to send.
dest: required, default: undefined. # The IP Address or hostname (resolvable by switch) of the remote node.
state: not required, default: present. # Determines if the expected result is success or fail.
vrf: not required, default: default. # The VRF to use for forwarding.
source: not required, default: null. # The source IP Address.

net_static_route.description: Manage static IP routes on network devices
body: net_static_route
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge static routes not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the static route configuration.
next_hop: required, default: undefined. # Next hop IP of the static route.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of static route definitions
mask: required, default: undefined. # Network prefix mask of the static route.
prefix: required, default: undefined. # Network prefix of the static route.
admin_distance: not required, default: undefined. # Admin distance of the static route.

net_system.description: Manage the system attributes on network devices
body: net_system

state: not required, default: present. # State of the configuration values in the device's current active configuration.  When set to I(present), the values should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the values should not be in the device active configuration

lookup_source: not required, default: undefined. # Provides one or more source interfaces to use for performing DNS lookups.  The interface provided in C(lookup_source) must be a valid interface configured on the device.
name_servers: not required, default: undefined. # List of DNS name servers by IP address to use to perform name resolution lookups.  This argument accepts either a list of DNS servers See examples.

domain_search: not required, default: undefined. # Provides the list of domain suffixes to append to the hostname for the purpose of doing name resolution. This argument accepts a list of names and will be reconciled with the current active configuration on the running node.
hostname: not required, default: undefined. # Configure the device hostname parameter. This option takes an ASCII string value.

domain_name: not required, default: undefined. # Configure the IP domain name on the remote device to the provided value. Value should be in the dotted name form and will be appended to the C(hostname) to create a fully-qualified domain name.

net_user.description: Manage the aggregate of local users on network device
body: net_user

update_password: not required, default: always. # Since passwords are encrypted in the device running config, this argument will instruct the module when to change the password.  When set to C(always), the password will always be updated in the device and when set to C(on_create) the password will be updated only if the username is created.

configured_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password to be configured on the remote network device. The password needs to be provided in clear and it will be encrypted on the device. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider password).

aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # The set of username objects to be configured on the remote network device. The list entries can either be the username or a hash of username and properties. This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument.

name: not required, default: undefined. # The username to be configured on the remote network device. This argument accepts a string value and is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider username).

purge: not required, default: false. # Instructs the module to consider the resource definition absolute. It will remove any previously configured usernames on the device with the exception of the `admin` user (the current defined set of users).

privilege: not required, default: undefined. # The C(privilege) argument configures the privilege level of the user when logged into the system. This argument accepts integer values in the range of 1 to 15.

state: not required, default: present. # Configures the state of the username definition as it relates to the device operational configuration. When set to I(present), the username(s) should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the username(s) should not be in the device active configuration

role: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the role for the username in the device running configuration. The argument accepts a string value defining the role name. This argument does not check if the role has been configured on the device.
nopassword: not required, default: undefined. # Defines the username without assigning a password. This will allow the user to login to the system without being authenticated by a password.
sshkey: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the SSH public key to configure for the given username. This argument accepts a valid SSH key value.
net_vlan
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge VLANs not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the VLAN configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the VLAN.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of VLANs definitions.
interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # List of interfaces the VLAN should be configured on.
vlan_id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of the VLAN.
net_vrf
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of VRFs definitions
purge: not required, default: false. # Purge VRFs not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # List of interfaces the VRF should be configured on.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the VRF.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the VRF configuration.

netapp_e_amg.description: Create, Remove, and Update Asynchronous Mirror Groups
body: netapp_e_amg
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.
syncIntervalMinutes: not required, default: 10. # The synchronization interval in minutes
recoveryWarnThresholdMinutes: not required, default: 20. # Recovery point warning threshold (minutes). The user will be warned when the age of the last good failures point exceeds this value
secondaryArrayId: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the secondary array to be used in mirroing process
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the async array you wish to target, or create.,If C(state) is present and the name isn't found, it will attempt to create.
repoUtilizationWarnThreshold: not required, default: 80. # Recovery point warning threshold
state: required, default: undefined. # A C(state) of present will either create or update the async mirror group.,A C(state) of absent will remove the async mirror group.
interfaceType: not required, default: null. # The intended protocol to use if both Fibre and iSCSI are available.
manualSync: not required, default: false. # Setting this to true will cause other synchronization values to be ignored
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
syncWarnThresholdMinutes: not required, default: 10. # The threshold (in minutes) for notifying the user that periodic synchronization has taken too long to complete.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

netapp_e_amg_role.description: Update the role of a storage array within an Asynchronous Mirror Group (AMG).
body: netapp_e_amg_role
force: not required, default: false. # Whether to force the role reversal regardless of the online-state of the primary
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the primary storage array for the async mirror action
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
role: required, default: undefined. # Whether the array should be the primary or secondary array for the AMG
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
noSync: not required, default: false. # Whether to avoid synchronization prior to role reversal
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

netapp_e_amg_sync.description: Conduct synchronization actions on asynchronous mirror groups.
body: netapp_e_amg_sync
ssid: not required, default: undefined. # The ID of the storage array containing the AMG you wish to target
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

state: required, default: undefined. # The synchronization action you'd like to take.,If C(running) then it will begin syncing if there is no active sync or will resume a suspended sync. If there is already a sync in progress, it will return with an OK status.,If C(suspended) it will suspend any ongoing sync action, but return OK if there is no active sync or if the sync is already suspended
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

delete_recovery_point: not required, default: false. # Indicates whether the failures point can be deleted on the secondary if necessary to achieve the synchronization.,If true, and if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW repository capacity on the secondary for any member volume, the last failures point will be deleted and synchronization will continue.,If false, the synchronization will be suspended if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW Repository capacity on the secondary and the failures point will be preserved.,NOTE: This only has impact for newly launched syncs.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the async mirror group you wish to target

netapp_e_auth.description: Sets or updates the password for a storage array.
body: netapp_e_auth
ssid: not required, default: undefined. # the identifier of the storage array in the Web Services Proxy.
name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the storage array. Note that if more than one storage array with this name is detected, the task will fail and you'll have to use the ID instead.
new_password: required, default: undefined. # The password you would like to set. Cannot be more than 30 characters.
api_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password used to authenticate against the API,This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_PASSWORD
current_password: not required, default: undefined. # The current admin password. This is not required if the password hasn't been set before.
api_username: not required, default: undefined. # The username used to authenticate against the API,This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_USERNAME
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
set_admin: not required, default: false. # Boolean value on whether to update the admin password. If set to false then the RO account is updated.
api_url: not required, default: undefined. # The full API url.,Example: http://ENDPOINT:8080/devmgr/v2,This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_URL

netapp_e_facts.description: Get facts about NetApp E-Series arrays
body: netapp_e_facts
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
netapp_e_flashcache
cache_size_min: not required, default: undefined. # The minimum size (in size_units) of the ssd cache. The cache will be expanded if this exceeds the current size of the cache.
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage (as configured on the web services proxy).
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
io_type: not required, default: filesystem. # The type of workload to optimize the cache for.
disk_count: not required, default: undefined. # The minimum number of disks to use for building the cache. The cache will be expanded if this number exceeds the number of disks already in place
size_unit: not required, default: gb. # The unit to be applied to size arguments
state: required, default: present. # Whether the specified SSD cache should exist or not.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the SSD cache to manage
netapp_e_host
group: not required, default: undefined. # the group you want the host to be a member of
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

name: required, default: undefined. # If the host doesn't yet exist, the label to assign at creation time.,If the hosts already exists, this is what is used to identify the host to apply any desired changes
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

host_type_index: required, default: undefined. # The index that maps to host type you wish to create. It is recommended to use the M(netapp_e_facts) module to gather this information. Alternatively you can use the WSP portal to retrieve the information.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
ports: not required, default: undefined. # a list of of dictionaries of host ports you wish to associate with the newly created host
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

netapp_e_hostgroup.description: Manage NetApp Storage Array Host Groups
body: netapp_e_hostgroup
new_name: not required, default: undefined. # specify this when you need to update the name of a host group
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage (as configured on the web services proxy).
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
hosts:: not required, default: undefined. # a list of host names/labels to add to the group
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified host group should exist or not.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

netapp_e_lun_mapping
ssid: not required, default: undefined. # The storage system array identifier.
volume_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volume you wish to include in the mapping.
api_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password used to authenticate against the API. This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_PASSWORD
target_type: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the target is a host or group.,Required if supplying an explicit target.

state: required, default: undefined. # Present will ensure the mapping exists, absent will remove the mapping.,All parameters I(lun), I(target), I(target_type) and I(volume_name) must still be supplied.

target: not required, default: undefined. # The name of host or hostgroup you wish to assign to the mapping,If omitted, the default hostgroup is used.,If the supplied I(volume_name) is associated with a different target, it will be updated to what is supplied here.
api_username: not required, default: undefined. # The username used to authenticate against the API. This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_USERNAME
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
lun: not required, default: 0. # The LUN number you wish to give the mapping,If the supplied I(volume_name) is associated with a different LUN, it will be updated to what is supplied here.
api_url: not required, default: undefined. # The full API url. Example: http://ENDPOINT:8080/devmgr/v2,This can optionally be set via an environment variable, API_URL
netapp_e_snapshot_group
repo_pct: not required, default: 20. # The size of the repository in relation to the size of the base volume
warning_threshold: not required, default: 80. # The repository utilization warning threshold, as a percentage of the repository volume capacity.

rollback_priority: not required, default: medium. # The importance of the rollback operation.,This value is overridden by consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group

delete_limit: not required, default: 30. # The automatic deletion indicator.,If non-zero, the oldest snapshot image will be automatically deleted when creating a new snapshot image to keep the total number of snapshot images limited to the number specified.,This value is overridden by the consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group.
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name to give the snapshot group
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether to ensure the group is present or absent.
storage_pool_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the storage pool on which to allocate the repository volume.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

base_volume_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the base volume or thin volume to use as the base for the new snapshot group.,If a snapshot group with an identical C(name) already exists but with a different base volume an error will be returned.

full_policy: not required, default: purgepit. # The behavior on when the data repository becomes full.,This value is overridden by consistency group setting if this snapshot group is associated with a consistency group
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
