netapp_e_storage_system.description: Add/remove arrays from the Web Services Proxy
body: netapp_e_storage_system
meta_tags: not required, default: None. # Optional meta tags to associate to this storage system
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.

array_wwn: not required, default: undefined. # The WWN of the array to manage. Only necessary if in-band managing multiple arrays on the same agent host.  Mutually exclusive of controller_addresses parameter.
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified array should be configured on the Web Services Proxy or not.
array_password: not required, default: undefined. # The management password of the array to manage, if set.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
enable_trace: not required, default: false. # Enable trace logging for SYMbol calls to the storage system.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
controller_addresses: required, default: undefined. # The list addresses for the out-of-band management adapter or the agent host. Mutually exclusive of array_wwn parameter.

netapp_e_storagepool.description: Manage disk groups and disk pools
body: netapp_e_storagepool
criteria_min_usable_capacity: not required, default: undefined. # The minimum size of the storage pool (in size_unit). The pool will be expanded if this value exceeds itscurrent size.
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
criteria_drive_type: not required, default: undefined. # The type of disk (hdd or ssd) to use when searching for candidates to use.
remove_volumes: not required, default: false. # Prior to removing a storage pool, delete all volumes in the pool.
criteria_drive_min_size: not required, default: undefined. # The minimum individual drive size (in size_unit) to consider when choosing drives for the storage pool.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
reserve_drive_count: not required, default: undefined. # Set the number of drives reserved by the storage pool for reconstruction operations. Only valide on raid disk pools.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the storage pool to manage
criteria_size_unit: not required, default: gb. # The unit used to interpret size parameters
criteria_drive_require_fde: not required, default: undefined. # Whether full disk encryption ability is required for drives to be added to the storage pool
criteria_drive_interface_type: not required, default: undefined. # The interface type to use when selecting drives for the storage pool (no value means all interface types will be considered)
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage (as configured on the web services proxy).
secure_pool: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to convert to a secure storage pool. Will only work if all drives in the pool are security capable.
raid_level: required, default: undefined. # Only required when the requested state is 'present'.  The RAID level of the storage pool to be created.
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified storage pool should exist or not.,Note that removing a storage pool currently requires the removal of all defined volumes first.

criteria_drive_count: not required, default: undefined. # The number of disks to use for building the storage pool. The pool will be expanded if this number exceeds the number of disks already in place
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
erase_secured_drives: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to erase secured disks before adding to storage pool
netapp_e_volume
segment_size_kb: not required, default: 512. # The segment size of the new volume
thin_provision: not required, default: false. # Whether the volume should be thin provisioned.  Thin volumes can only be created on disk pools (raidDiskPool).
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
ssd_cache_enabled: not required, default: None (ignores existing SSD cache setting). # Whether an existing SSD cache should be enabled on the volume (fails if no SSD cache defined)
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.
data_assurance_enabled: not required, default: false. # If data assurance should be enabled for the volume
size_unit: not required, default: gb. # The unit used to interpret the size parameter
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volume to manage
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified volume should exist or not.
storage_pool_name: required, default: undefined. # Required only when requested state is 'present'.  The name of the storage pool the volume should exist on.
thin_volume_max_repo_size: not required, default: same as size (in size_unit). # Maximum size that the thin volume repository volume will automatically expand to
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
thin_volume_repo_size: required, default: undefined. # Initial size of the thin volume repository volume (in size_unit)
size: required, default: undefined. # Required only when state = 'present'.  The size of the volume in (size_unit).
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
netapp_e_volume_copy

source_volume_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the volume copy source.,If used, must be paired with destination_volume_id,Mutually exclusive with volume_copy_pair_id, and search_volume_id
api_password: required, default: undefined. # The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

destination_volume_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of the volume copy destination.,If used, must be paired with source_volume_id,Mutually exclusive with volume_copy_pair_id, and search_volume_id

start_stop_copy: not required, default: undefined. # starts a re-copy or stops a copy in progress,Note: If you stop the initial file copy before it it done the copy pair will be destroyed,Requires volume_copy_pair_id
api_url: required, default: undefined. # The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API, for example C(https://prod-1.wahoo.acme.com/devmgr/v2).
create_copy_pair_if_does_not_exist: not required, default: true. # Defines if a copy pair will be created if it does not exist.,If set to True destination_volume_id and source_volume_id are required.

search_volume_id: not required, default: undefined. # Searches for all valid potential target and source volumes that could be used in a copy_pair,Mutually exclusive with volume_copy_pair_id, destination_volume_id and source_volume_id
ssid: required, default: undefined. # The ID of the array to manage. This value must be unique for each array.

volume_copy_pair_id: not required, default: undefined. # The id of a given volume copy pair,Mutually exclusive with destination_volume_id, source_volume_id, and search_volume_id,Can use to delete or check presence of volume pairs,Must specify this or (destination_volume_id and source_volume_id)
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether the specified volume copy pair should exist or not.
api_username: required, default: undefined. # The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.
validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Should https certificates be validated?
netconf_config
username: required, default: undefined. # the username to authenticate with
xml: not required, default: undefined. # the XML content to send to the device
save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config if changed.
allow_agent: not required, default: true. # if true, enables querying SSH agent (if found) for keys,if false, disables querying the SSH agent for ssh keys

src: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the source path to the xml file that contains the configuration or configuration template to load.  The path to the source file can either be the full path on the Ansible control host or a relative path from the playbook or role root directory.  This argument is mutually exclusive with I(xml).
host: required, default: undefined. # the hostname or ip address of the netconf device
look_for_keys: not required, default: true. # if true, enables looking in the usual locations for ssh keys (e.g. ~/.ssh/id_*),if false, disables looking for ssh keys
hostkey_verify: not required, default: true. # if true, the ssh host key of the device must match a ssh key present on the host,if false, the ssh host key of the device is not checked
datastore: not required, default: auto. # auto, uses candidate and fallback to running,candidate, edit <candidate/> datastore and then commit,running, edit <running/> datastore directly
password: required, default: undefined. # password of the user to authenticate with
port: not required, default: 830. # the netconf port
netscaler
name: required, default: hostname. # name of the entity
type: not required, default: server. # type of the entity
nsc_protocol: not required, default: https. # protocol used to access netscaler
nsc_host: required, default: null. # hostname or ip of your netscaler
user: required, default: null. # username
action: not required, default: disable. # the action you want to perform on the entity
password: required, default: null. # password

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
netscaler_cs_action
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Comments associated with this cs action.

name: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the content switching action. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space C( ), colon C(:), at sign C(@), equal sign C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Can be changed after the content switching action is created.

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.
targetlbvserver: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the load balancing virtual server to which the content is switched.
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.
targetvserver: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the VPN virtual server to which the content is switched.
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
nitro_pass: required, default: undefined. # The password with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler
targetvserverexpr: not required, default: undefined. # Information about this content switching action.
netscaler_cs_policy

policyname: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the content switching policy. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore, hash C(#), period C(.), space C( ), colon C(:), at sign C(@), equal sign C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Cannot be changed after a policy is created.,The following requirement applies only to the NetScaler CLI:,If the name includes one or more spaces, enclose the name in double or single quotation marks (for example, my policy or my policy).,Minimum length = 1
domain: not required, default: undefined. # The domain name. The string value can range to 63 characters.,Minimum length = 1

url: not required, default: undefined. # URL string that is matched with the URL of a request. Can contain a wildcard character. Specify the string value in the following format: C([[prefix] [*]] [.suffix]).,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 208

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.

rule: not required, default: undefined. # Expression, or name of a named expression, against which traffic is evaluated. Written in the classic or default syntax.,Note:,Maximum length of a string literal in the expression is 255 characters. A longer string can be split into smaller strings of up to 255 characters each, and the smaller strings concatenated with the + operator. For example, you can create a 500-character string as follows: '"<string of 255 characters>" + "<string of 245 characters>"'
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
action: not required, default: undefined. # Content switching action that names the target load balancing virtual server to which the traffic is switched.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler
netscaler_cs_vserver
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Information about this virtual server.

precedence: not required, default: undefined. # Type of precedence to use for both RULE-based and URL-based policies on the content switching virtual server. With the default C(RULE) setting, incoming requests are evaluated against the rule-based content switching policies. If none of the rules match, the URL in the request is evaluated against the URL-based content switching policies.
mysqlcharacterset: not required, default: undefined. # The character set returned by the mysql vserver.
rtspnat: not required, default: undefined. # Enable network address translation (NAT) for real-time streaming protocol (RTSP) connections.
authn401: not required, default: undefined. # Enable HTTP 401-response based authentication.

disabled: not required, default: no. # When set to C(yes) the cs vserver will be disabled.,When set to C(no) the cs vserver will be enabled.,Note that due to limitations of the underlying NITRO API a C(disabled) state change alone does not cause the module result to report a changed status.

listenpolicy: not required, default: undefined. # String specifying the listen policy for the content switching virtual server. Can be either the name of an existing expression or an in-line expression.
ttl: not required, default: undefined. # .,Minimum value = C(1)

redirecturl: not required, default: undefined. # URL to which traffic is redirected if the virtual server becomes unavailable. The service type of the virtual server should be either C(HTTP) or C(SSL).,Caution: Make sure that the domain in the URL does not match the domain specified for a content switching policy. If it does, requests are continuously redirected to the unavailable virtual server.,Minimum length = 1

ipmask: not required, default: undefined. # IP mask, in dotted decimal notation, for the IP Pattern parameter. Can have leading or trailing non-zero octets (for example, C(255.255.240.0) or C(0.0.255.255)). Accordingly, the mask specifies whether the first n bits or the last n bits of the destination IP address in a client request are to be matched with the corresponding bits in the IP pattern. The former is called a forward mask. The latter is called a reverse mask.

insertvserveripport: not required, default: undefined. # Insert the virtual server's VIP address and port number in the request header. Available values function as follows:,C(VIPADDR) - Header contains the vserver's IP address and port number without any translation.,C(OFF) - The virtual IP and port header insertion option is disabled.,C(V6TOV4MAPPING) - Header contains the mapped IPv4 address corresponding to the IPv6 address of the vserver and the port number. An IPv6 address can be mapped to a user-specified IPv4 address using the set ns ip6 command.
redirectportrewrite: not required, default: undefined. # State of port rewrite while performing HTTP redirect.
clttimeout: not required, default: undefined. # Idle time, in seconds, after which the client connection is terminated. The default values are:,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(31536000)

authenticationhost: not required, default: undefined. # FQDN of the authentication virtual server. The service type of the virtual server should be either C(HTTP) or C(SSL).,Minimum length = 3,Maximum length = 252
servicetype: not required, default: undefined. # Protocol used by the virtual server.
mysqlservercapabilities: not required, default: undefined. # The server capabilities returned by the mysql vserver.
authentication: not required, default: undefined. # Authenticate users who request a connection to the content switching virtual server.
vipheader: not required, default: undefined. # Name of virtual server IP and port header, for use with the VServer IP Port Insertion parameter.,Minimum length = 1

pushvserver: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the load balancing virtual server, of type C(PUSH) or C(SSL_PUSH), to which the server pushes updates received on the client-facing load balancing virtual server.,Minimum length = 1

td: not required, default: undefined. # Integer value that uniquely identifies the traffic domain in which you want to configure the entity. If you do not specify an ID, the entity becomes part of the default traffic domain, which has an ID of 0.,Minimum value = 0,Maximum value = 4094
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler
cookietimeout: not required, default: undefined. # .,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(1440)
appflowlog: not required, default: undefined. # Enable logging appflow flow information.
dbprofilename: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the DB profile.,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 127
cookiedomain: not required, default: undefined. # .,Minimum length = 1

name: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the content switching virtual server. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space, colon C(:), at sign C(@), equal sign C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters.,Cannot be changed after the CS virtual server is created.,Minimum length = 1
tcpprofilename: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the TCP profile containing TCP configuration settings for the virtual server.,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 127

downstateflush: not required, default: undefined. # Flush all active transactions associated with a virtual server whose state transitions from UP to DOWN. Do not enable this option for applications that must complete their transactions.

httpprofilename: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the HTTP profile containing HTTP configuration settings for the virtual server. The service type of the virtual server should be either C(HTTP) or C(SSL).,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 127

casesensitive: not required, default: undefined. # Consider case in URLs (for policies that use URLs instead of RULES). For example, with the C(on) setting, the URLs /a/1.html and /A/1.HTML are treated differently and can have different targets (set by content switching policies). With the C(off) setting, /a/1.html and /A/1.HTML are switched to the same target.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

dnsprofilename: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the DNS profile to be associated with the VServer. DNS profile properties will applied to the transactions processed by a VServer. This parameter is valid only for DNS and DNS-TCP VServers.,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 127
icmpvsrresponse: not required, default: undefined. # Can be active or passive.
domainname: not required, default: undefined. # Domain name for which to change the time to live (TTL) and/or backup service IP address.,Minimum length = 1

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.

somethod: not required, default: undefined. # Type of spillover used to divert traffic to the backup virtual server when the primary virtual server reaches the spillover threshold. Connection spillover is based on the number of connections. Bandwidth spillover is based on the total Kbps of incoming and outgoing traffic.
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.
mysqlprotocolversion: not required, default: undefined. # The protocol version returned by the mysql vserver.
oracleserverversion: not required, default: undefined. # Oracle server version.

stateupdate: not required, default: undefined. # Enable state updates for a specific content switching virtual server. By default, the Content Switching virtual server is always UP, regardless of the state of the Load Balancing virtual servers bound to it. This parameter interacts with the global setting as follows:,Global Level | Vserver Level | Result,enabled enabled enabled,enabled disabled enabled,disabled enabled enabled,disabled disabled disabled,If you want to enable state updates for only some content switching virtual servers, be sure to disable the state update parameter.
authnprofile: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the authentication profile to be used when authentication is turned on.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Port number for content switching virtual server.,Minimum value = 1,Range C(1) - C(65535),* in CLI is represented as 65535 in NITRO API

cacheable: not required, default: undefined. # Use this option to specify whether a virtual server, used for load balancing or content switching, routes requests to the cache redirection virtual server before sending it to the configured servers.

backupvserver: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the backup virtual server that you are configuring. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space C( ), colon C(:), at sign C(@), equal sign C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Can be changed after the backup virtual server is created. You can assign a different backup virtual server or rename the existing virtual server.,Minimum length = 1
backupip: not required, default: undefined. # .,Minimum length = 1

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.

authnvsname: not required, default: undefined. # Name of authentication virtual server that authenticates the incoming user requests to this content switching virtual server. .,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 252
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
netprofile: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the network profile.,Minimum length = 1,Maximum length = 127
pushmulticlients: not required, default: undefined. # Allow multiple Web 2.0 connections from the same client to connect to the virtual server and expect updates.

rhistate: not required, default: undefined. # A host route is injected according to the setting on the virtual servers,* If set to C(PASSIVE) on all the virtual servers that share the IP address, the appliance always injects the hostroute.,* If set to C(ACTIVE) on all the virtual servers that share the IP address, the appliance injects even if one virtual server is UP.,* If set to C(ACTIVE) on some virtual servers and C(PASSIVE) on the others, the appliance, injects even if one virtual server set to C(ACTIVE) is UP.
targettype: not required, default: undefined. # Virtual server target type.

sothreshold: not required, default: undefined. # Depending on the spillover method, the maximum number of connections or the maximum total bandwidth (Kbps) that a virtual server can handle before spillover occurs.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(4294967287)
sopersistence: not required, default: undefined. # Maintain source-IP based persistence on primary and backup virtual servers.
sobackupaction: not required, default: undefined. # Action to be performed if spillover is to take effect, but no backup chain to spillover is usable or exists.
l2conn: not required, default: undefined. # Use L2 Parameters to identify a connection.

range: not required, default: undefined. # Number of consecutive IP addresses, starting with the address specified by the IP Address parameter, to include in a range of addresses assigned to this virtual server.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(254)
ipv46: not required, default: undefined. # IP address of the content switching virtual server.,Minimum length = 1

ippattern: not required, default: undefined. # IP address pattern, in dotted decimal notation, for identifying packets to be accepted by the virtual server. The IP Mask parameter specifies which part of the destination IP address is matched against the pattern. Mutually exclusive with the IP Address parameter.,For example, if the IP pattern assigned to the virtual server is C(198.51.100.0) and the IP mask is C(255.255.240.0) (a forward mask), the first 20 bits in the destination IP addresses are matched with the first 20 bits in the pattern. The virtual server accepts requests with IP addresses that range from 198.51.96.1 to 198.51.111.254. You can also use a pattern such as C(0.0.2.2) and a mask such as C(0.0.255.255) (a reverse mask).,If a destination IP address matches more than one IP pattern, the pattern with the longest match is selected, and the associated virtual server processes the request. For example, if the virtual servers, C(vs1) and C(vs2), have the same IP pattern, C(0.0.100.128), but different IP masks of C(0.0.255.255) and C(0.0.224.255), a destination IP address of 198.51.100.128 has the longest match with the IP pattern of C(vs1). If a destination IP address matches two or more virtual servers to the same extent, the request is processed by the virtual server whose port number matches the port number in the request.
disableprimaryondown: not required, default: undefined. # Continue forwarding the traffic to backup virtual server even after the primary server comes UP from the DOWN state.

pushlabel: not required, default: undefined. # Expression for extracting the label from the response received from server. This string can be either an existing rule name or an inline expression. The service type of the virtual server should be either C(HTTP) or C(SSL).
mssqlserverversion: not required, default: undefined. # The version of the MSSQL server.
sitedomainttl: not required, default: undefined. # .,Minimum value = C(1)
sopersistencetimeout: not required, default: undefined. # Time-out value, in minutes, for spillover persistence.,Minimum value = C(2),Maximum value = C(1440)
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.

push: not required, default: undefined. # Process traffic with the push virtual server that is bound to this content switching virtual server (specified by the Push VServer parameter). The service type of the push virtual server should be either C(HTTP) or C(SSL).
nitro_pass: required, default: undefined. # The password with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.

netscaler_gslb_service.description: Manage gslb service entities in Netscaler.
body: netscaler_gslb_service
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Any comments that you might want to associate with the GSLB service.
cnameentry: not required, default: undefined. # Canonical name of the GSLB service. Used in CNAME-based GSLB.,Minimum length = 1
servername: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the server hosting the GSLB service.,Minimum length = 1

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.

servicename: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the GSLB service. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space, colon C(:), at C(@), equals C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Can be changed after the GSLB service is created.,,Minimum length = 1
sitepersistence: not required, default: undefined. # Use cookie-based site persistence. Applicable only to C(HTTP) and C(SSL) GSLB services.
monitor_bindings: not required, default: undefined. # Bind monitors to this gslb service

maxbandwidth: not required, default: undefined. # Integer specifying the maximum bandwidth allowed for the service. A GSLB service whose bandwidth reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until its bandwidth consumption drops below the maximum.

publicport: not required, default: undefined. # The public port associated with the GSLB service's public IP address. The port is mapped to the service's private port number. Applicable to the local GSLB service. Optional.

port: not required, default: undefined. # Port on which the load balancing entity represented by this GSLB service listens.,Minimum value = 1,Range 1 - 65535,* in CLI is represented as 65535 in NITRO API

clttimeout: not required, default: undefined. # Idle time, in seconds, after which a client connection is terminated. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.,Minimum value = 0,Maximum value = 31536000
servicetype: not required, default: undefined. # Type of service to create.

monthreshold: not required, default: undefined. # Monitoring threshold value for the GSLB service. If the sum of the weights of the monitors that are bound to this GSLB service and are in the UP state is not equal to or greater than this threshold value, the service is marked as DOWN.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(65535)

maxaaausers: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of SSL VPN users that can be logged on concurrently to the VPN virtual server that is represented by this GSLB service. A GSLB service whose user count reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until the count drops below the maximum.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(65535)

maxclient: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of open connections that the service can support at any given time. A GSLB service whose connection count reaches the maximum is not considered when a GSLB decision is made, until the connection count drops below the maximum.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(4294967294)
sitename: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the GSLB site to which the service belongs.,Minimum length = 1
publicip: not required, default: undefined. # The public IP address that a NAT device translates to the GSLB service's private IP address. Optional.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler
appflowlog: not required, default: undefined. # Enable logging appflow flow information.
hashid: not required, default: undefined. # Unique hash identifier for the GSLB service, used by hash based load balancing methods.,Minimum value = C(1)

ipaddress: not required, default: undefined. # IP address for the GSLB service. Should represent a load balancing, content switching, or VPN virtual server on the NetScaler appliance, or the IP address of another load balancing device.

downstateflush: not required, default: undefined. # Flush all active transactions associated with the GSLB service when its state transitions from UP to DOWN. Do not enable this option for services that must complete their transactions. Applicable if connection proxy based site persistence is used.

cipheader: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the HTTP header that stores the client's IP address. Used with the Client IP option. If client IP header insertion is enabled on the service and a name is not specified for the header, the NetScaler appliance uses the name specified by the cipHeader parameter in the set ns param command or, in the GUI, the Client IP Header parameter in the Configure HTTP Parameters dialog box.,Minimum length = 1

siteprefix: not required, default: undefined. # The site's prefix string. When the service is bound to a GSLB virtual server, a GSLB site domain is generated internally for each bound service-domain pair by concatenating the site prefix of the service and the name of the domain. If the special string NONE is specified, the site-prefix string is unset. When implementing HTTP redirect site persistence, the NetScaler appliance redirects GSLB requests to GSLB services by using their site domains.
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.

cip: not required, default: undefined. # In the request that is forwarded to the GSLB service, insert a header that stores the client's IP address. Client IP header insertion is used in connection-proxy based site persistence.
healthmonitor: not required, default: undefined. # Monitor the health of the GSLB service.
nitro_pass: required, default: undefined. # The password with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

netscaler_gslb_site.description: Manage gslb site entities in Netscaler.
body: netscaler_gslb_site
naptrreplacementsuffix: not required, default: undefined. # The naptr replacement suffix configured here will be used to construct the naptr replacement field in NAPTR record.,Minimum length = 1

siteipaddress: not required, default: undefined. # IP address for the GSLB site. The GSLB site uses this IP address to communicate with other GSLB sites. For a local site, use any IP address that is owned by the appliance (for example, a SNIP or MIP address, or the IP address of the ADNS service).,Minimum length = 1

metricexchange: not required, default: undefined. # Exchange metrics with other sites. Metrics are exchanged by using Metric Exchange Protocol (MEP). The appliances in the GSLB setup exchange health information once every second.,If you disable metrics exchange, you can use only static load balancing methods (such as round robin, static proximity, or the hash-based methods), and if you disable metrics exchange when a dynamic load balancing method (such as least connection) is in operation, the appliance falls back to round robin. Also, if you disable metrics exchange, you must use a monitor to determine the state of GSLB services. Otherwise, the service is marked as DOWN.

nwmetricexchange: not required, default: undefined. # Exchange, with other GSLB sites, network metrics such as round-trip time (RTT), learned from communications with various local DNS (LDNS) servers used by clients. RTT information is used in the dynamic RTT load balancing method, and is exchanged every 5 seconds.

sitename: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the GSLB site. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space C( ), colon C(:), at C(@), equals C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Cannot be changed after the virtual server is created.,Minimum length = 1

sitetype: not required, default: undefined. # Type of site to create. If the type is not specified, the appliance automatically detects and sets the type on the basis of the IP address being assigned to the site. If the specified site IP address is owned by the appliance (for example, a MIP address or SNIP address), the site is a local site. Otherwise, it is a remote site.

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.
sessionexchange: not required, default: undefined. # Exchange persistent session entries with other GSLB sites every five seconds.
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.
publicclip: not required, default: undefined. # IP address to be used to globally access the remote cluster when it is deployed behind a NAT. It can be same as the normal cluster IP address.

publicip: not required, default: undefined. # Public IP address for the local site. Required only if the appliance is deployed in a private address space and the site has a public IP address hosted on an external firewall or a NAT device.,Minimum length = 1
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.
parentsite: not required, default: undefined. # Parent site of the GSLB site, in a parent-child topology.
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.

clip: not required, default: undefined. # Cluster IP address. Specify this parameter to connect to the remote cluster site for GSLB auto-sync. Note: The cluster IP address is defined when creating the cluster.

triggermonitor: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the conditions under which the GSLB service must be monitored by a monitor, if one is bound. Available settings function as follows:,* C(ALWAYS) - Monitor the GSLB service at all times.,* C(MEPDOWN) - Monitor the GSLB service only when the exchange of metrics through the Metrics Exchange Protocol (MEP) is disabled.,C(MEPDOWN_SVCDOWN) - Monitor the service in either of the following situations:,* The exchange of metrics through MEP is disabled.,* The exchange of metrics through MEP is enabled but the status of the service, learned through metrics exchange, is DOWN.
nitro_pass: required, default: undefined. # The password with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler

netscaler_gslb_vserver.description: Configure gslb vserver entities in Netscaler.
body: netscaler_gslb_vserver
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Any comments that you might want to associate with the GSLB virtual server.

save_config: not required, default: true. # If true the module will save the configuration on the netscaler node if it makes any changes.,The module will not save the configuration on the netscaler node if it made no changes.

disabled: not required, default: false. # When set to C(yes) the GSLB Vserver state will be set to C(disabled).,When set to C(no) the GSLB Vserver state will be set to C(enabled).,Note that due to limitations of the underlying NITRO API a C(disabled) state change alone does not cause the module result to report a changed status.
nitro_protocol: not required, default: http. # Which protocol to use when accessing the nitro API objects.
domain_bindings: not required, default: undefined. # List of bindings for domains for this glsb vserver.
service_bindings: not required, default: undefined. # List of bindings for gslb services bound to this gslb virtual server.

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the resource being configured by the module on the netscaler node.,When present the resource will be created if needed and configured according to the module's parameters.,When absent the resource will be deleted from the netscaler node.
nitro_user: required, default: undefined. # The username with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
mir: not required, default: undefined. # Include multiple IP addresses in the DNS responses sent to clients.

tolerance: not required, default: undefined. # Site selection tolerance, in milliseconds, for implementing the RTT load balancing method. If a site's RTT deviates from the lowest RTT by more than the specified tolerance, the site is not considered when the NetScaler appliance makes a GSLB decision. The appliance implements the round robin method of global server load balancing between sites whose RTT values are within the specified tolerance. If the tolerance is 0 (zero), the appliance always sends clients the IP address of the site with the lowest RTT.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(100)
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler

sothreshold: not required, default: undefined. # Threshold at which spillover occurs. Specify an integer for the CONNECTION spillover method, a bandwidth value in kilobits per second for the BANDWIDTH method (do not enter the units), or a percentage for the HEALTH method (do not enter the percentage symbol).,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(4294967287)
sopersistence: not required, default: undefined. # If spillover occurs, maintain source IP address based persistence for both primary and backup GSLB virtual servers.
appflowlog: not required, default: undefined. # Enable logging appflow flow information.

persistenceid: not required, default: undefined. # The persistence ID for the GSLB virtual server. The ID is a positive integer that enables GSLB sites to identify the GSLB virtual server, and is required if source IP address based or spill over based persistence is enabled on the virtual server.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(65535)
sobackupaction: not required, default: undefined. # Action to be performed if spillover is to take effect, but no backup chain to spillover is usable or exists.
servicetype: not required, default: undefined. # Protocol used by services bound to the virtual server.,
dnsrecordtype: not required, default: undefined. # DNS record type to associate with the GSLB virtual server's domain name.,Default value: A,Possible values = A, AAAA, CNAME, NAPTR

considereffectivestate: not required, default: undefined. # If the primary state of all bound GSLB services is DOWN, consider the effective states of all the GSLB services, obtained through the Metrics Exchange Protocol (MEP), when determining the state of the GSLB virtual server. To consider the effective state, set the parameter to STATE_ONLY. To disregard the effective state, set the parameter to NONE.,The effective state of a GSLB service is the ability of the corresponding virtual server to serve traffic. The effective state of the load balancing virtual server, which is transferred to the GSLB service, is UP even if only one virtual server in the backup chain of virtual servers is in the UP state.
netmask: not required, default: undefined. # IPv4 network mask for use in the SOURCEIPHASH load balancing method.,Minimum length = 1

v6netmasklen: not required, default: undefined. # Number of bits to consider, in an IPv6 source IP address, for creating the hash that is required by the C(SOURCEIPHASH) load balancing method.,Default value: C(128),Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(128)

persistencetype: not required, default: undefined. # Use source IP address based persistence for the virtual server.,After the load balancing method selects a service for the first packet, the IP address received in response to the DNS query is used for subsequent requests from the same client.

name: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the GSLB virtual server. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore C(_), hash C(#), period C(.), space, colon C(:), at C(@), equals C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters. Can be changed after the virtual server is created.,Minimum length = 1

disableprimaryondown: not required, default: undefined. # Continue to direct traffic to the backup chain even after the primary GSLB virtual server returns to the UP state. Used when spillover is configured for the virtual server.

backuplbmethod: not required, default: undefined. # Backup load balancing method. Becomes operational if the primary load balancing method fails or cannot be used. Valid only if the primary method is based on either round-trip time (RTT) or static proximity.

dynamicweight: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the appliance should consider the service count, service weights, or ignore both when using weight-based load balancing methods. The state of the number of services bound to the virtual server help the appliance to select the service.

somethod: not required, default: undefined. # Type of threshold that, when exceeded, triggers spillover. Available settings function as follows:,* C(CONNECTION) - Spillover occurs when the number of client connections exceeds the threshold.,* C(DYNAMICCONNECTION) - Spillover occurs when the number of client connections at the GSLB virtual server exceeds the sum of the maximum client (Max Clients) settings for bound GSLB services. Do not specify a spillover threshold for this setting, because the threshold is implied by the Max Clients settings of the bound GSLB services.,* C(BANDWIDTH) - Spillover occurs when the bandwidth consumed by the GSLB virtual server's incoming and outgoing traffic exceeds the threshold.,* C(HEALTH) - Spillover occurs when the percentage of weights of the GSLB services that are UP drops below the threshold. For example, if services gslbSvc1, gslbSvc2, and gslbSvc3 are bound to a virtual server, with weights 1, 2, and 3, and the spillover threshold is 50%, spillover occurs if gslbSvc1 and gslbSvc3 or gslbSvc2 and gslbSvc3 transition to DOWN.,* C(NONE) - Spillover does not occur.

lbmethod: not required, default: undefined. # Load balancing method for the GSLB virtual server.,Default value: LEASTCONNECTION,Possible values = ROUNDROBIN, LEASTCONNECTION, LEASTRESPONSETIME, SOURCEIPHASH, LEASTBANDWIDTH, LEASTPACKETS, STATICPROXIMITY, RTT, CUSTOMLOAD
sopersistencetimeout: not required, default: undefined. # Timeout for spillover persistence, in minutes.,Default value: C(2),Minimum value = C(2),Maximum value = C(1440)
nsip: required, default: undefined. # The ip address of the netscaler appliance where the nitro API calls will be made.,The port can be specified with the colon (:). E.g. 192.168.1.1:555.
persistmask: not required, default: undefined. # The optional IPv4 network mask applied to IPv4 addresses to establish source IP address based persistence.,Minimum length = 1
timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Idle time, in minutes, after which a persistence entry is cleared.,Default value: C(2),Minimum value = C(2),Maximum value = C(1440)

v6persistmasklen: not required, default: undefined. # Number of bits to consider in an IPv6 source IP address when creating source IP address based persistence sessions.,Default value: C(128),Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(128)
nitro_pass: required, default: undefined. # The password with which to authenticate to the netscaler node.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
netscaler_lb_monitor
lasversion: not required, default: undefined. # Version number of the Citrix Advanced Access Control Logon Agent. Required by the C(CITRIX-AAC-LAS) monitor.

secure: not required, default: undefined. # Use a secure SSL connection when monitoring a service. Applicable only to TCP based monitors. The secure option cannot be used with a C(CITRIX-AG) monitor, because a CITRIX-AG monitor uses a secure connection by default.

radnasip: not required, default: undefined. # Network Access Server (NAS) IP address to use as the source IP address when monitoring a RADIUS server. Applicable to monitors of type C(RADIUS) and C(RADIUS_ACCOUNTING).
Snmpoid: not required, default: undefined. # SNMP OID for C(SNMP) monitors.,Minimum length = 1

storefrontacctservice: not required, default: undefined. # Enable/Disable probing for Account Service. Applicable only to Store Front monitors. For multi-tenancy configuration users my skip account service.
radnasid: not required, default: undefined. # NAS-Identifier to send in the Access-Request packet. Applicable to monitors of type C(RADIUS).,Minimum length = 1
firmwarerevision: not required, default: undefined. # Firmware-Revision value for the Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) message to use for monitoring Diameter servers.
query: not required, default: undefined. # Domain name to resolve as part of monitoring the DNS service (for example, C(example.com)).

storedb: not required, default: undefined. # Store the database list populated with the responses to monitor probes. Used in database specific load balancing if C(MSSQL-ECV)/C(MYSQL-ECV) monitor is configured.
vendorid: not required, default: undefined. # Vendor-Id value for the Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) message to use for monitoring Diameter servers.

authapplicationid: not required, default: undefined. # List of Auth-Application-Id attribute value pairs (AVPs) for the Capabilities-Exchange-Request (CER) message to use for monitoring Diameter servers. A maximum of eight of these AVPs are supported in a monitoring CER message.,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(4294967295)

group: not required, default: undefined. # Name of a newsgroup available on the NNTP service that is to be monitored. The appliance periodically generates an NNTP query for the name of the newsgroup and evaluates the response. If the newsgroup is found on the server, the service is marked as UP. If the newsgroup does not exist or if the search fails, the service is marked as DOWN. Applicable to NNTP monitors.,Minimum length = 1
tos: not required, default: undefined. # Probe the service by encoding the destination IP address in the IP TOS (6) bits.

maxforwards: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of hops that the SIP request used for monitoring can traverse to reach the server. Applicable only to monitors of type C(SIP-UDP).,Minimum value = C(0),Maximum value = C(255)

querytype: not required, default: undefined. # Type of DNS record for which to send monitoring queries. Set to C(Address) for querying A records, C(AAAA) for querying AAAA records, and C(Zone) for querying the SOA record.
send: not required, default: undefined. # String to send to the service. Applicable to C(TCP-ECV), C(HTTP-ECV), and C(UDP-ECV) monitors.

transparent: not required, default: undefined. # The monitor is bound to a transparent device such as a firewall or router. The state of a transparent device depends on the responsiveness of the services behind it. If a transparent device is being monitored, a destination IP address must be specified. The probe is sent to the specified IP address by using the MAC address of the transparent device.
recv: not required, default: undefined. # String expected from the server for the service to be marked as UP. Applicable to C(TCP-ECV), C(HTTP-ECV), and C(UDP-ECV) monitors.

binddn: not required, default: undefined. # The distinguished name with which an LDAP monitor can perform the Bind operation on the LDAP server. Optional. Applicable to C(LDAP) monitors.,Minimum length = 1
rtsprequest: not required, default: undefined. # RTSP request to send to the server (for example, C("OPTIONS *")).
trofscode: not required, default: undefined. # Code expected when the server is under maintenance.
successretries: not required, default: undefined. # Number of consecutive successful probes required to transition a service's state from DOWN to UP.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(32)
iptunnel: not required, default: undefined. # Send the monitoring probe to the service through an IP tunnel. A destination IP address must be specified.

monitorname: not required, default: undefined. # Name for the monitor. Must begin with an ASCII alphanumeric or underscore C(_) character, and must contain only ASCII alphanumeric, underscore, hash C(#), period C(.), space C( ), colon C(:), at C(@), equals C(=), and hyphen C(-) characters.,Minimum length = 1
nitro_timeout: not required, default: 310. # Time in seconds until a timeout error is thrown when establishing a new session with Netscaler
units1: not required, default: undefined. # Unit of measurement for the Deviation parameter. Cannot be changed after the monitor is created.
units3: not required, default: undefined. # monitor interval units.
units2: not required, default: undefined. # Unit of measurement for the Down Time parameter. Cannot be changed after the monitor is created.
units4: not required, default: undefined. # monitor response timeout units.
scriptargs: not required, default: undefined. # String of arguments for the script. The string is copied verbatim into the request.

resptimeout: not required, default: undefined. # Amount of time for which the appliance must wait before it marks a probe as FAILED. Must be less than the value specified for the Interval parameter.,Note: For C(UDP-ECV) monitors for which a receive string is not configured, response timeout does not apply. For C(UDP-ECV) monitors with no receive string, probe failure is indicated by an ICMP port unreachable error received from the service.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(20939)

downtime: not required, default: undefined. # Time duration for which to wait before probing a service that has been marked as DOWN. Expressed in milliseconds, seconds, or minutes.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(20939)
tosid: not required, default: undefined. # The TOS ID of the specified destination IP. Applicable only when the TOS parameter is set.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(63)

password: not required, default: undefined. # Password that is required for logging on to the C(RADIUS), C(NNTP), C(FTP), C(FTP-EXTENDED), C(MYSQL), C(MSSQL), C(POP3), C(CITRIX-AG), C(CITRIX-XD-DDC), C(CITRIX-WI-EXTENDED), C(CITRIX-XNC-ECV) or C(CITRIX-XDM) server. Used in conjunction with the user name specified for the C(username) parameter.,Minimum length = 1
sipreguri: not required, default: undefined. # SIP user to be registered. Applicable only if the monitor is of type C(SIP-UDP) and the SIP Method parameter is set to C(REGISTER).,Minimum length = 1
retries: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of probes to send to establish the state of a service for which a monitoring probe failed.,Minimum value = C(1),Maximum value = C(127)

listenpolicy: not required, default: undefined. # Default syntax expression identifying traffic accepted by the virtual server. Can be either an expression (for example, C(CLIENT.IP.DST.IN_SUBNET(192.0.2.0/24)) or the name of a named expression. In the above example, the virtual server accepts all requests whose destination IP address is in the 192.0.2.0/24 subnet.

ipmask: not required, default: undefined. # IP mask, in dotted decimal notation, for the IP Pattern parameter. Can have leading or trailing non-zero octets (for example, C(255.255.240.0) or C(0.0.255.255)). Accordingly, the mask specifies whether the first n bits or the last n bits of the destination IP address in a client request are to be matched with the corresponding bits in the IP pattern. The former is called a forward mask. The latter is called a reverse mask.

insertvserveripport: not required, default: undefined. # Insert an HTTP header, whose value is the IP address and port number of the virtual server, before forwarding a request to the server. The format of the header is <vipHeader>: <virtual server IP address>_<port number >, where vipHeader is the name that you specify for the header. If the virtual server has an IPv6 address, the address in the header is enclosed in brackets ([ and ]) to separate it from the port number. If you have mapped an IPv4 address to a virtual server's IPv6 address, the value of this parameter determines which IP address is inserted in the header, as follows:,* C(VIPADDR) - Insert the IP address of the virtual server in the HTTP header regardless of whether the virtual server has an IPv4 address or an IPv6 address. A mapped IPv4 address, if configured, is ignored.,* C(V6TOV4MAPPING) - Insert the IPv4 address that is mapped to the virtual server's IPv6 address. If a mapped IPv4 address is not configured, insert the IPv6 address.,* C(OFF) - Disable header insertion.

somethod: not required, default: undefined. # Type of threshold that, when exceeded, triggers spillover. Available settings function as follows:,* C(CONNECTION) - Spillover occurs when the number of client connections exceeds the threshold.,* DYNAMICCONNECTION - Spillover occurs when the number of client connections at the virtual server exceeds the sum of the maximum client (Max Clients) settings for bound services. Do not specify a spillover threshold for this setting, because the threshold is implied by the Max Clients settings of bound services.,* C(BANDWIDTH) - Spillover occurs when the bandwidth consumed by the virtual server's incoming and outgoing traffic exceeds the threshold.,* C(HEALTH) - Spillover occurs when the percentage of weights of the services that are UP drops below the threshold. For example, if services svc1, svc2, and svc3 are bound to a virtual server, with weights 1, 2, and 3, and the spillover threshold is 50%, spillover occurs if svc1 and svc3 or svc2 and svc3 transition to DOWN.,* C(NONE) - Spillover does not occur.

rhistate: not required, default: undefined. # Route Health Injection (RHI) functionality of the NetSaler appliance for advertising the route of the VIP address associated with the virtual server. When Vserver RHI Level (RHI) parameter is set to VSVR_CNTRLD, the following are different RHI behaviors for the VIP address on the basis of RHIstate (RHI STATE) settings on the virtual servers associated with the VIP address:,* If you set C(rhistate) to C(PASSIVE) on all virtual servers, the NetScaler ADC always advertises the route for the VIP address.,* If you set C(rhistate) to C(ACTIVE) on all virtual servers, the NetScaler ADC advertises the route for the VIP address if at least one of the associated virtual servers is in UP state.,* If you set C(rhistate) to C(ACTIVE) on some and PASSIVE on others, the NetScaler ADC advertises the route for the VIP address if at least one of the associated virtual servers, whose C(rhistate) set to C(ACTIVE), is in UP state.
