nxos_user.description: Manage the collection of local users on Nexus devices
body: nxos_user

username: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the username to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This value is used to authenticate either the CLI login or the nxapi authentication depending on which transport is used. If the value is not specified in the task, the value of environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_USERNAME) will be used instead.

update_password: not required, default: always. # Since passwords are encrypted in the device running config, this argument will instruct the module when to change the password.  When set to C(always), the password will always be updated in the device and when set to C(on_create) the password will be updated only if the username is created.

ssh_keyfile: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the SSH key to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This argument is only used for the I(cli) transport. If the value is not specified in the task, the value of environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_SSH_KEYFILE) will be used instead.
name: not required, default: null. # The username to be configured on the remote Cisco Nexus device.  This argument accepts a stringv value and is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument.

state: not required, default: present. # The C(state) argument configures the state of the username definition as it relates to the device operational configuration.  When set to I(present), the username(s) should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the username(s) should not be in the device active configuration

purge: not required, default: false. # The C(purge) argument instructs the module to consider the resource definition absolute.  It will remove any previously configured usernames on the device with the exception of the `admin` user which cannot be deleted per nxos constraints.

host: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the DNS host name or address for connecting to the remote device over the specified transport.  The value of host is used as the destination address for the transport.

configured_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password to be configured on the network device. The password needs to be provided in cleartext and it will be encrypted on the device. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider password).

role: not required, default: null. # The C(role) argument configures the role for the username in the device running configuration.  The argument accepts a string value defining the role name.  This argument does not check if the role has been configured on the device.

timeout: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the timeout in seconds for communicating with the network device for either connecting or sending commands.  If the timeout is exceeded before the operation is completed, the module will error. NX-API can be slow to return on long-running commands (sh mac, sh bgp, etc).

provider: not required, default: null. # Convenience method that allows all I(nxos) arguments to be passed as a dict object.  All constraints (required, choices, etc) must be met either by individual arguments or values in this dict.

aggregate: not required, default: null. # The set of username objects to be configured on the remote Cisco Nexus device.  The list entries can either be the username or a hash of username and properties.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument. alias C(users).
use_ssl: not required, default: false. # Configures the I(transport) to use SSL if set to true only when the C(transport=nxapi), otherwise this value is ignored.

password: not required, default: null. # Specifies the password to use to authenticate the connection to the remote device.  This is a common argument used for either I(cli) or I(nxapi) transports. If the value is not specified in the task, the value of environment variable C(ANSIBLE_NET_PASSWORD) will be used instead.

pattern: not required, default: undefined. # If the service does not respond to the 'running' command, name a substring to look for as would be found in the output of the I(ps) command as a stand-in for a 'running' result.  If the string is found, the service will be assumed to be running.

state: not required, default: null. # C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary. C(restarted) will always bounce the service. C(reloaded) will always reload.
enabled: not required, default: null. # Whether the service should start on boot. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.)
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the service.
opkg
force: not required, default: absent. # opkg --force parameter used
state: not required, default: present. # state of the package
update_cache: not required, default: no. # update the package db first
name: required, default: undefined. # name of package to install/remove
ordnance_config

multiline_delimiter: not required, default: @. # This argument is used when pushing a multiline configuration element to the Ordnance router.  It specifies the character to use as the delimiting character.  This only applies to the configuration action

src: not required, default: null. # Specifies the source path to the file that contains the configuration or configuration template to load.  The path to the source file can either be the full path on the Ansible control host or a relative path from the playbook or role root directory.  This argument is mutually exclusive with I(lines).

commands: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

backup: not required, default: false. # This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(running-config) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.

after: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

replace: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

parents: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

defaults: not required, default: false. # This argument specifies whether or not to collect all defaults when getting the remote device running config.  When enabled, the module will get the current config by issuing the command C(show running-config all).

save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config at the conclusion of the module running.  If check mode is specified, this argument is ignored.

config: not required, default: null. # The C(config) argument allows the playbook designer to supply the base configuration to be used to validate configuration changes necessary.  If this argument is provided, the module will not download the running-config from the remote node.

match: not required, default: line. # Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the running configuration on the remote device.

before: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
domain: not required, default: None. # Name or ID of the domain containing the project if the cloud supports domains
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
filters: not required, default: None. # A dictionary of meta data to use for further filtering.  Elements of this dictionary may be additional dictionaries.
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name or ID of the project
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
os_quota

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
snapshots_lvm: not required, default: None. # Number of LVM snapshots to allow.
server_group_members: not required, default: None. # Number of server group members to allow.
server_groups: not required, default: None. # Number of server groups to allow.
ram: not required, default: None. # Maximum amount of ram in MB to allow.
snapshots: not required, default: None. # Number of snapshots to allow.
instances: not required, default: None. # Maximum number of instances allowed.
backups: not required, default: None. # Maximum number of backups allowed.
fixed_ips: not required, default: None. # Number of fixed IP's to allow.
port: not required, default: None. # Number of Network ports to allow, this needs to be greater than the instances limit.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
subnet: not required, default: None. # Number of subnets to allow.
per_volume_gigabytes: not required, default: None. # Maximum size in GB's of individual volumes.
network: not required, default: None. # Number of networks to allow.
floatingip: not required, default: None. # Number of floating IP's to allow in Network.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
volumes_lvm: not required, default: None. # Number of LVM volumes to allow.
floating_ips: not required, default: None. # Number of floating IP's to allow in Compute.
security_group_rule: not required, default: None. # Number of rules per security group to allow.
state: not required, default: present. # A value of present sets the quota and a value of absent resets the quota to system defaults.
injected_files: not required, default: None. # Number of injected files to allow.
gigabytes_lvm: not required, default: None. # Maximum size in GB's of individual lvm volumes.
subnetpool: not required, default: None. # Number of subnet pools to allow.
injected_path_size: not required, default: None. # Maximum path size.
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
gigabytes: not required, default: None. # Maximum volume storage allowed for project.
backup_gigabytes: not required, default: None. # Maximum size of backups in GB's.
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
rbac_policy: not required, default: None. # Number of policies to allow.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key_pairs: not required, default: None. # Number of key pairs to allow.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
router: not required, default: None. # Number of routers to allow.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
volumes: not required, default: None. # Number of volumes to allow.
properties: not required, default: None. # Number of properties to allow.
pool: not required, default: None. # Number of load balancer pools to allow.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the OpenStack Project to manage.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
security_group: not required, default: None. # Number of security groups to allow.
cores: not required, default: None. # Maximum number of CPU's per project.
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
loadbalancer: not required, default: None. # Number of load balancers to allow.
injected_file_size: not required, default: None. # Maximum file size in bytes.
os_recordset

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the resource be present or absent.
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
zone: required, default: undefined. # Zone managing the recordset
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
description: not required, default: None. # Description of the recordset
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the recordset
records: required, default: undefined. # List of recordset definitions
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
ttl: not required, default: None. # TTL (Time To Live) value in seconds
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
recordset_type: required, default: undefined. # Recordset type
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.

os_router.description: Create or delete routers from OpenStack
body: os_router

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
enable_snat: not required, default: true. # Enable Source NAT (SNAT) attribute.
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
admin_state_up: not required, default: true. # Desired admin state of the created or existing router.
interfaces: not required, default: None. # List of subnets to attach to the router internal interface.
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name to be give to the router
project: not required, default: None. # Unique name or ID of the project.
network: not required, default: None. # Unique name or ID of the external gateway network.,required I(interfaces) or I(enable_snat) are provided.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility

external_fixed_ips: not required, default: None. # The IP address parameters for the external gateway network. Each is a dictionary with the subnet name or ID (subnet) and the IP address to assign on the subnet (ip). If no IP is specified, one is automatically assigned from that subnet.
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

state: not required, default: present. # Should the resource be present or absent.
description: not required, default: None. # Long description of the purpose of the security group
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. name: required, default: undefined. # Name that has to be given to the security group. This module requires that security group names be unique.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.

wait: not required, default: yes. # Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

os_security_group_rule.description: Add/Delete rule from an existing security group
body: os_security_group_rule

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
direction: not required, default: ingress. # The direction in which the security group rule is applied. Not all providers support egress.
protocol: not required, default: None. # IP protocols TCP UDP ICMP 112 (VRRP)
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
port_range_max: not required, default: None. # Ending port
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
remote_ip_prefix: not required, default: undefined. # Source IP address(es) in CIDR notation (exclusive with remote_group)
remote_group: not required, default: undefined. # Name or ID of the Security group to link (exclusive with remote_ip_prefix)
state: not required, default: present. # Should the resource be present or absent.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
port_range_min: not required, default: None. # Starting port
timeout: not required, default: 180. # How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
ethertype: not required, default: IPv4. # Must be IPv4 or IPv6, and addresses represented in CIDR must match the ingress or egress rules. Not all providers support IPv6.
security_group: required, default: undefined. # Name or ID of the security group
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
os_server

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Availability zone in which to create the server.
image: required, default: undefined. # The name or id of the base image to boot.

image_exclude: not required, default: undefined. # Text to use to filter image names, for the case, such as HP, where there are multiple image names matching the common identifying portions. image_exclude is a negative match filter - it is text that may not exist in the image name. Defaults to "(deprecated)"

flavor_include: not required, default: undefined. # Text to use to filter flavor names, for the case, such as Rackspace, where there are multiple flavors that have the same ram count. flavor_include is a positive match filter - it must exist in the flavor name.

meta: not required, default: None. # A list of key value pairs that should be provided as a metadata to the new instance or a string containing a list of key-value pairs. Eg:  meta: "key1=value1,key2=value2"
flavor: not required, default: 1. # The name or id of the flavor in which the new instance has to be created. Mutually exclusive with flavor_ram

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
scheduler_hints: not required, default: None. # Arbitrary key/value pairs to the scheduler for custom use
boot_from_volume: not required, default: false. # Should the instance boot from a persistent volume created based on the image given. Mututally exclusive with boot_volume.
userdata: not required, default: None. # Opaque blob of data which is made available to the instance
network: not required, default: None. # Name or ID of a network to attach this instance to. A simpler version of the nics parameter, only one of network or nics should be supplied.
terminate_volume: not required, default: false. # If true, delete volume when deleting instance (if booted from volume)

nics: not required, default: None. # A list of networks to which the instance's interface should be attached. Networks may be referenced by net-id/net-name/port-id or port-name.,Also this accepts a string containing a list of (net/port)-(id/name) Eg: nics: "net-id=uuid-1,port-name=myport" Only one of network or nics should be supplied.
floating_ips: not required, default: None. # list of valid floating IPs that pre-exist to assign to this node
flavor_ram: not required, default: 1. # The minimum amount of ram in MB that the flavor in which the new instance has to be created must have. Mutually exclusive with flavor.
volume_size: not required, default: undefined. # The size of the volume to create in GB if booting from volume based on an image.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the resource be present or absent.
auto_ip: not required, default: yes. # Ensure instance has public ip however the cloud wants to do that
security_groups: not required, default: None. # Names of the security groups to which the instance should be added. This may be a YAML list or a comma separated string.
config_drive: not required, default: no. # Whether to boot the server with config drive enabled
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
key_name: not required, default: None. # The key pair name to be used when creating a instance
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
boot_volume: not required, default: None. # Volume name or id to use as the volume to boot from. Implies boot_from_volume. Mutually exclusive with image and boot_from_volume.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
volumes: not required, default: . # A list of preexisting volumes names or ids to attach to the instance
wait: not required, default: yes. # If the module should wait for the instance to be created.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name that has to be given to the instance
delete_fip: not required, default: false. # When I(state) is absent and this option is true, any floating IP associated with the instance will be deleted along with the instance.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to get into active state.
floating_ip_pools: not required, default: None. # Name of floating IP pool from which to choose a floating IP
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

reuse_ips: not required, default: true. # When I(auto_ip) is true and this option is true, the I(auto_ip) code will attempt to re-use unassigned floating ips in the project before creating a new one. It is important to note that it is impossible to safely do this concurrently, so if your use case involves concurrent server creation, it is highly recommended to set this to false and to delete the floating ip associated with a server when the server is deleted using I(delete_fip).

os_server_action.description: Perform actions on Compute Instances from OpenStack
body: os_server_action

auth_type: not required, default: password. # Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
region_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the region.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
image: not required, default: null. # Image the server should be rebuilt with
api_timeout: not required, default: None. # How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to perform the requested action.

auth: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
server: required, default: undefined. # Name or ID of the instance
action: not required, default: present. # Perform the given action. The lock and unlock actions always return changed as the servers API does not provide lock status.
cert: not required, default: None. # A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
endpoint_type: not required, default: public. # Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
key: not required, default: None. # A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: not required, default: None. # A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
validate_certs: not required, default: null. # Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

cloud: not required, default: undefined. # Named cloud to operate against. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: not required, default: yes. # If the module should wait for the instance action to be performed.

body: ovirt_affinity_group
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the affinity group.

host_rule: not required, default: undefined. # If I(positive) I(all) VMs in this group should run on the this host.,If I(negative) I(no) VMs in this group should run on the this host.,C(This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.)
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the cluster of the affinity group.

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

vm_rule: not required, default: undefined. # If I(positive) I(all) VMs in this group should run on the host defined by C(host_rule).,If I(negative) I(no) VMs in this group should run on the host defined by C(host_rule).,If I(disabled) this affinity group doesn't take effect.
host_enforcing: not required, default: undefined. # If I(true) VM cannot start on host if it does not satisfy the C(host_rule).,C(This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.)
vms: not required, default: undefined. # List of the VMs names, which should have assigned this affinity group.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
vm_enforcing: not required, default: undefined. # If I(true) VM cannot start if it does not satisfy the C(vm_rule).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the affinity group to manage.
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the affinity group be present or absent.
hosts: not required, default: undefined. # List of the hosts names, which should have assigned this affinity group.,C(This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.)
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

ovirt_auth.description: Module to manage authentication to oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_auth
username: required, default: undefined. # The name of the user. For example: I(admin@internal).

ca_file: not required, default: undefined. # A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If C(ca_file) parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used.
url: required, default: undefined. # A string containing the base URL of the server. For example: I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api).
insecure: not required, default: undefined. # A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.
kerberos: not required, default: undefined. # A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.

compress: not required, default: undefined. # A boolean flag indicating if the SDK should ask the server to send compressed responses. The default is I(True). Note that this is a hint for the server, and that it may return uncompressed data even when this parameter is set to I(True).
headers: not required, default: undefined. # A dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies if a token should be created or revoked.

timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum total time to wait for the response, in seconds. A value of zero (the default) means wait forever. If the timeout expires before the response is received an exception will be raised.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the user.

ovirt_cluster.description: Module to manage clusters in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_cluster
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Comment of the cluster.
ha_reservation: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enable the oVirt/RHV to monitor cluster capacity for highly available virtual machines.

fence_skip_if_connectivity_broken: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) fencing will be temporarily disabled if the percentage of hosts in the cluster that are experiencing connectivity issues is greater than or equal to the defined threshold.,The threshold can be specified by C(fence_connectivity_threshold).
mac_pool: not required, default: undefined. # MAC pool to be used by this cluster.,C(Note:),This is supported since oVirt version 4.1.
virt: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True), hosts in this cluster will be used to run virtual machines.
threads_as_cores: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the exposed host threads would be treated as cores which can be utilized by virtual machines.

gluster: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True), hosts in this cluster will be used as Gluster Storage server nodes, and not for running virtual machines.,By default the cluster is created for virtual machine hosts.

vm_reason: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enable an optional reason field when a virtual machine is shut down from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
migration_bandwidth_limit: not required, default: undefined. # Set the I(custom) migration bandwidth limit.,This parameter is used only when C(migration_bandwidth) is I(custom).
data_center: not required, default: undefined. # Datacenter name where cluster reside.
ksm_numa: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enables KSM C(ksm) for best berformance inside NUMA nodes.

migration_auto_converge: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) auto-convergence is used during live migration of virtual machines.,Used only when C(migration_policy) is set to I(legacy).,Following options are supported:,C(true) - Override the global setting to I(true).,C(false) - Override the global setting to I(false).,C(inherit) - Use value which is set globally.
cpu_arch: not required, default: undefined. # CPU architecture of cluster.
rng_sources: not required, default: undefined. # List that specify the random number generator devices that all hosts in the cluster will use.,Supported generators are: I(hwrng) and I(random).
compatibility_version: not required, default: undefined. # The compatibility version of the cluster. All hosts in this cluster must support at least this compatibility version.
network: not required, default: undefined. # Management network of cluster to access cluster hosts.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the cluster be present or absent
ksm: not required, default: undefined. # I I(True) MoM enables to run Kernel Same-page Merging I(KSM) when necessary and when it can yield a memory saving benefit that outweighs its CPU cost.

migration_compressed: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) compression is used during live migration of the virtual machine.,Used only when C(migration_policy) is set to I(legacy).,Following options are supported:,C(true) - Override the global setting to I(true).,C(false) - Override the global setting to I(false).,C(inherit) - Use value which is set globally.
ballooning: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enable memory balloon optimization. Memory balloon is used to re-distribute / reclaim the host memory based on VM needs in a dynamic way.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the cluster.
fence_enabled: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enables fencing on the cluster.,Fencing is enabled by default.

migration_policy: not required, default: undefined. # A migration policy defines the conditions for live migrating virtual machines in the event of host failure.,Following policies are supported:,C(legacy) - Legacy behavior of 3.6 version.,C(minimal_downtime) - Virtual machines should not experience any significant downtime.,C(suspend_workload) - Virtual machines may experience a more significant downtime.,C(post_copy) - Virtual machines should not experience any significant downtime. If the VM migration is not converging for a long time, the migration will be switched to post-copy. Added in version I(2.4).
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

resilience_policy: not required, default: undefined. # The resilience policy defines how the virtual machines are prioritized in the migration.,Following values are supported:,C(do_not_migrate) -  Prevents virtual machines from being migrated. ,C(migrate) - Migrates all virtual machines in order of their defined priority.,C(migrate_highly_available) - Migrates only highly available virtual machines to prevent overloading other hosts.
fence_connectivity_threshold: not required, default: undefined. # The threshold used by C(fence_skip_if_connectivity_broken).
spice_proxy: not required, default: undefined. # The proxy by which the SPICE client will connect to virtual machines.,The address must be in the following format: I(protocol://[host]:[port])

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

memory_policy: not required, default: undefined. # I(disabled) - Disables memory page sharing.,I(server) - Sets the memory page sharing threshold to 150% of the system memory on each host.,I(desktop) - Sets the memory page sharing threshold to 200% of the system memory on each host.

migration_bandwidth: not required, default: undefined. # The bandwidth settings define the maximum bandwidth of both outgoing and incoming migrations per host.,Following bandwidth options are supported:,C(auto) - Bandwidth is copied from the I(rate limit) [Mbps] setting in the data center host network QoS.,C(hypervisor_default) - Bandwidth is controlled by local VDSM setting on sending host.,C(custom) - Defined by user (in Mbps).
fence_skip_if_sd_active: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) any hosts in the cluster that are Non Responsive and still connected to storage will not be fenced.
scheduling_policy: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the scheduling policy to be used for cluster.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
switch_type: not required, default: undefined. # Type of switch to be used by all networks in given cluster. Either I(legacy) which is using linux brigde or I(ovs) using Open vSwitch.
serial_policy_value: not required, default: undefined. # Allows you to specify a custom serial number.,This parameter is used only when C(serial_policy) is I(custom).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the cluster to manage.

host_reason: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) enable an optional reason field when a host is placed into maintenance mode from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
cpu_type: not required, default: undefined. # CPU codename. For example I(Intel SandyBridge Family).
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

serial_policy: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a serial number policy for the virtual machines in the cluster.,Following options are supported:,C(vm) - Sets the virtual machine's UUID as its serial number.,C(host) - Sets the host's UUID as the virtual machine's serial number.,C(custom) - Allows you to specify a custom serial number in C(serial_policy_value).
trusted_service: not required, default: undefined. # If (True) enable integration with an OpenAttestation server.

ovirt_cluster_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV clusters

pattern: not required, default: undefined. # Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search cluster X from datacenter Y use following pattern: name=X and datacenter=Y

Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

ovirt_datacenter.description: Module to manage data centers in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_datacenter
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Comment of the data center.

name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the data center to manage.

quota_mode: not required, default: undefined. # Quota mode of the data center. One of I(disabled), I(audit) or I(enabled)

Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
local: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the data center should be local, I(False) if should be shared.,Default value is set by engine.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. ovirt_disk.description: Module to manage Virtual Machine and floating disks in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_disk
vm_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).
profile: not required, default: undefined. # Disk profile name to be attached to disk. By default profile is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.

storage_domains: not required, default: undefined. # Storage domain names where disk should be copied.,C(**IMPORTANT**),There is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so every time you specify this parameter the disks are copied, so please handle your playbook accordingly to not copy the disks all the time. This is valid only for VM and floating disks, template disks works as expected.
force: not required, default: undefined. # Please take a look at C(image_path) documentation to see the correct usage of this parameter.

format: not required, default: undefined. # Specify format of the disk.,If (cow) format is used, disk will by created as sparse, so space will be allocated for the volume as needed, also known as I(thin provision).,If (raw) format is used, disk storage will be allocated right away, also known as I(preallocated).,Note that this option isn't idempotent as it's not currently possible to change format of the disk via API.

upload_image_path: not required, default: undefined. # Path to disk image, which should be uploaded.,Note that currently we support only compatibility version 0.10 of the qcow disk.,Note that you must have an valid oVirt/RHV engine CA in your system trust store or you must provide it in C(ca_file) parameter.,Note that there is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so if you want to upload the disk even if the disk with C(id) or C(name) exists, then please use C(force) I(true). If you will use C(force) I(false), which is default, then the disk image won't be uploaded.

logical_unit: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary which describes LUN to be directly attached to VM:,C(address) - Address of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(port) - Port of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(target) - iSCSI target.,C(lun_id) - LUN id.,C(username) - CHAP Username to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(password) - CHAP Password of the user to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(storage_type) - Storage type either I(fcp) or I(iscsi).
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

download_image_path: not required, default: undefined. # Path on a file system where disk should be downloaded.,Note that you must have an valid oVirt/RHV engine CA in your system trust store or you must provide it in C(ca_file) parameter.,Note that the disk is not downloaded when the file already exists, but you can forcibly download the disk when using C(force) I (true).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
interface: not required, default: virtio. # Driver of the storage interface.
vm_id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).
id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name) is required.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
storage_domain: not required, default: undefined. # Storage domain name where disk should be created. By default storage is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
openstack_volume_type: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the openstack volume type. This is valid when working with cinder.
bootable: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the disk should be bootable. By default when disk is created it isn't bootable.

sparsify: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the disk should be sparsified.,Sparsification frees space in the disk image that is not used by its filesystem. As a result, the image will occupy less space on the storage.,Note that this parameter isn't idempotent, as it's not possible to check if the disk should be or should not be sparsified.
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name)/C(alias) is required.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the Virtual Machine disk be present/absent/attached/detached.
shareable: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the disk should be shareable. By default when disk is created it isn't shareable.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

image_provider: not required, default: undefined. # When C(state) is I(exported) disk is exported to given Glance image provider.,C(**IMPORTANT**),There is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so every time you specify this parameter the disk is exported, so please handle your playbook accordingly to not export the disk all the time. This option is valid only for template disks.
size: not required, default: undefined. # Size of the disk. Size should be specified using IEC standard units. For example 10GiB, 1024MiB, etc.,Size can be only increased, not decreased.

ovirt_external_provider.description: Module to manage external providers in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_external_provider
username: not required, default: undefined. # Username to be used for login to external provider.,Applicable for all types.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the external provider.
tenant_name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the tenant.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume) and I(network).

Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
read_only: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the network should be read only.,Applicable if C(type) is I(network).
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the external provider to manage.
url: not required, default: undefined. # URL where external provider is hosted.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume), I(network) and I(foreman).
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the external be present or absent
authentication_url: not required, default: undefined. # Keystone authentication URL of the openstack provider.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume) and I(network).
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
type: not required, default: undefined. # Type of the external provider.
network_type: not required, default: external. # Type of the external network provider either external (for example OVN) or neutron.,Applicable if C(type) is I(network).

ovirt_hosts.description: Module to manage hosts in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_hosts
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the host.

activate: not required, default: true. # If C(state) is I(present) activate the host.,This parameter is good to disable, when you don't want to change the state of host when using I(present) C(state).
force: not required, default: false. # If True host will be forcibly moved to desired state.

hosted_engine: not required, default: undefined. # If I(deploy) it means this host should deploy also hosted engine components.,If I(undeploy) it means this host should un-deploy hosted engine components and this host will not function as part of the High Availability cluster.
power_management_enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Enable or disable power management of the host.,For more comprehensive setup of PM use C(ovirt_host_pm) module.
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
address: not required, default: undefined. # Host address. It can be either FQDN (preferred) or IP address.
override_iptables: not required, default: undefined. # If True host iptables will be overridden by host deploy script.,Note that C(override_iptables) is I(false) by default in oVirt/RHV.
kdump_integration: not required, default: enabled. # Specify if host will have enabled Kdump integration.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
check_upgrade: not required, default: true. # If I(true) and C(state) is I(upgraded) run check for upgrade action before executing upgrade action.
public_key: not required, default: false. # I(True) if the public key should be used to authenticate to host.,It's required in case C(password) is not set.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password of the root. It's required in case C(public_key) is set to I(False).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the host to manage.
spm_priority: not required, default: undefined. # SPM priority of the host. Integer value from 1 to 10, where higher number means higher priority.

iscsi: not required, default: undefined. # If C(state) is I(iscsidiscover) it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to discover targets,If C(state) is I(iscsilogin) it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to login to the specified targets passed as part of the iscsi attribute
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.

kernel_params: not required, default: undefined. # List of kernel boot parameters.,Following are most common kernel parameters used for host:,Hostdev Passthrough & SR-IOV: intel_iommu=on,Nested Virtualization: kvm-intel.nested=1,Unsafe Interrupts: vfio_iommu_type1.allow_unsafe_interrupts=1,PCI Reallocation: pci=realloc,C(Note:),Modifying kernel boot parameters settings can lead to a host boot failure. Please consult the product documentation before doing any changes.,Kernel boot parameters changes require host deploy and restart. The host needs to be I(reinstalled) suceesfully and then to be I(rebooted) for kernel boot parameters to be applied.
state: not required, default: present. # State which should a host to be in after successful completion.,I(iscsilogin) and I(iscsidiscover) are supported since version 2.4.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
override_display: not required, default: undefined. # Override the display address of all VMs on this host with specified address.

id: not required, default: undefined. # Id of the storage connection to manage.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Port of the iSCSI storage server.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the storage connection be present or absent.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
vfs_type: not required, default: undefined. # Virtual File System type.
type: not required, default: undefined. # Storage type. For example: I(nfs), I(iscsi), etc.
mount_options: not required, default: undefined. # Option which will be passed when mounting storage.

glusterfs: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values for GlusterFS storage type:,C(address) - Address of the Gluster server. E.g.: myserver.mydomain.com,C(path) - Path of the mount point. E.g.: /path/to/my/data,C(mount_options) - Option which will be passed when mounting storage.,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.

Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of the template to be registered.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

image_provider: not required, default: undefined. # When C(state) is I(imported) this parameter specifies the name of the image provider to be used.

clone_permissions: not required, default: false. # If I(True) then the permissions of the VM (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created template.,This parameter is used only when C(state) I(present).
