ovirt_vmpools.description: Module to manage VM pools in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_vmpools
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the VM pool to manage.

type: not required, default: undefined. # Type of the VM pool. Either manual or automatic.,C(manual) - The administrator is responsible for explicitly returning the virtual machine to the pool. The virtual machine reverts to the original base image after the administrator returns it to the pool.,C(Automatic) - When the virtual machine is shut down, it automatically reverts to its base image and is returned to the virtual machine pool.,Default value is set by engine.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the VM pool.
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
state: not required, default: present. # Should the VM pool be present/absent.,Note that when C(state) is I(absent) all VMs in VM pool are stopped and removed.
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
vm_per_user: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of VMs a single user can attach to from this pool.,Default value is set by engine.
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the cluster, where VM pool should be created.

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
prestarted: not required, default: undefined. # Number of pre-started VMs defines the number of VMs in run state, that are waiting to be attached to Users.,Default value is set by engine.

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
vm_count: not required, default: undefined. # Number of VMs in the pool.,Default value is set by engine.
template: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the template, which will be used to create VM pool.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

ovirt_vmpools_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV vmpools
body: ovirt_vmpools_facts
pattern: not required, default: undefined. # Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search vmpool X: name=X

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

ovirt_vms.description: Module to manage Virtual Machines in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_vms
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Comment of the Virtual Machine.

memory_guaranteed: not required, default: undefined. # Amount of minimal guaranteed memory of the Virtual Machine. Prefix uses IEC 60027-2 standard (for example 1GiB, 1024MiB).,C(memory_guaranteed) parameter can't be lower than C(memory) parameter. Default value is set by engine.
force: not required, default: false. # Please check to I(Synopsis) to more detailed description of force parameter, it can behave differently in different situations.

cloud_init_nics: not required, default: undefined. # List of dictionaries representing network interafaces to be setup by cloud init.,This option is used, when user needs to setup more network interfaces via cloud init.,If one network interface is enough, user should use C(cloud_init) I(nic_*) parameters. C(cloud_init) I(nic_*) parameters are merged with C(cloud_init_nics) parameters.,Dictionary can contain following values:,C(nic_boot_protocol) - Set boot protocol of the network interface of Virtual Machine. Can be one of none, dhcp or static.,C(nic_ip_address) - If boot protocol is static, set this IP address to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_netmask) - If boot protocol is static, set this netmask to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_gateway) - If boot protocol is static, set this gateway to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_name) - Set name to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_on_boot) - If I(True) network interface will be set to start on boot.

xen: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary of values to be used to connect to XEN and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values:,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example: I(xen+ssh://root@zen.server). This is required paramater.,C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine: I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.
template_version: not required, default: undefined. # Version number of the template to be used for VM.,By default the latest available version of the template is used.
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the cluster, where Virtual Machine should be created. Required if creating VM.

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
timezone: not required, default: undefined. # Sets time zone offset of the guest hardware clock.,For example: Etc/GMT
id: not required, default: undefined. # ID of the Virtual Machine to manage.
cpu_sockets: not required, default: undefined. # Number of virtual CPUs sockets of the Virtual Machine. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

high_availability: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) Virtual Machine will be set as highly available.,If I(False) Virtual Machine won't be set as highly available.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

storage_domain: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the storage domain where all template disks should be created.,This parameter is considered only when C(template) is provided.,C(**IMPORTANT**),This parameter is not idempotent, if the VM exists and you specfiy different storage domain, disk won't move.
instance_type: not required, default: undefined. # Name of virtual machine's hardware configuration.,By default no instance type is used.

nics: not required, default: undefined. # List of NICs, which should be attached to Virtual Machine. NIC is described by following dictionary:,C(name) - Name of the NIC.,C(profile_name) - Profile name where NIC should be attached.,C(interface) -  Type of the network interface. One of following: I(virtio), I(e1000), I(rtl8139), default is I(virtio).,C(mac_address) - Custom MAC address of the network interface, by default it's obtained from MAC pool.,C(Note:),This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and is able to only create NICs. To manage NICs of the VM in more depth please use M(ovirt_nics) module instead.

disk_format: not required, default: cow. # Specify format of the disk.,If (cow) format is used, disk will by created as sparse, so space will be allocated for the volume as needed, also known as I(thin provision).,If (raw) format is used, disk storage will be allocated right away, also known as I(preallocated).,Note that this option isn't idempotent as it's not currently possible to change format of the disk via API.,This parameter is considered only when C(template) and C(storage domain) is provided.

sysprep: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values for Windows Virtual Machine initialization using sysprep:,C(host_name) - Hostname to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(active_directory_ou) - Active Directory Organizational Unit, to be used for login of user.,C(org_name) - Organization name to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(domain) - Domain to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(timezone) - Timezone to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(ui_language) - UI language of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(system_locale) - System localization of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(input_locale) - Input localization of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(windows_license_key) - License key to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(user_name) - Username to be used for set password to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(root_password) - Password to be set for username to Windows Virtual Machine.
cpu_cores: not required, default: undefined. # Number of virtual CPUs cores of the Virtual Machine. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

state: not required, default: present. # Should the Virtual Machine be running/stopped/present/absent/suspended/next_run/registered. When C(state) is I(registered) and the unregistered VM's name belongs to an already registered in engine VM in the same DC then we fail to register the unregistered template.,I(present) and I(running) are equal states.,I(next_run) state updates the VM and if the VM has next run configuration it will be rebooted.,Please check I(notes) to more detailed description of states.,I(registered) is supported since 2.4

vmware: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary of values to be used to connect to VMware and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values:,C(username) - The username to authenticate against the VMware.,C(password) - The password to authenticate against the VMware.,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example: I(vpx://wmware_user@vcenter-host/DataCenter/Cluster/esxi-host?no_verify=1),C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine: I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.

delete_protected: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) Virtual Machine will be set as delete protected.,If I(False) Virtual Machine won't be set as delete protected.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
memory: not required, default: undefined. # Amount of memory of the Virtual Machine. Prefix uses IEC 60027-2 standard (for example 1GiB, 1024MiB).,Default value is set by engine.

cd_iso: not required, default: undefined. # ISO file from ISO storage domain which should be attached to Virtual Machine.,If you pass empty string the CD will be ejected from VM.,If used with C(state) I(running) or I(present) and VM is running the CD will be attached to VM.,If used with C(state) I(running) or I(present) and VM is down the CD will be attached to VM persistently.

clone_permissions: not required, default: false. # If I(True) then the permissions of the template (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created virtual machine.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and VM didn't exist before.
type: not required, default: undefined. # Type of the Virtual Machine. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

initrd_path: not required, default: undefined. # Path to an initial ramdisk to be used with the kernel specified by C(kernel_path) option.,Ramdisk image must be stored on either the ISO domain or on the host's storage.
lease: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the storage domain this virtual machine lease reside on.,C(Note): Supported since oVirt 4.1.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the Virtual Machine.

clone: not required, default: false. # If I(True) then the disks of the created virtual machine will be cloned and independent of the template.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and VM didn't exist before.

kvm: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary of values to be used to connect to kvm and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values:,C(name) - The name of the KVM virtual machine.,C(username) - The username to authenticate against the KVM.,C(password) - The password to authenticate against the KVM.,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example: I(qemu:///system). This is required paramater.,C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine: I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.

boot_devices: not required, default: undefined. # List of boot devices which should be used to boot. Choices I(network), I(hd) and I(cdrom).,For example: ['cdrom', 'hd']. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

host: not required, default: undefined. # Specify host where Virtual Machine should be running. By default the host is chosen by engine scheduler.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present).

serial_policy: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a serial number policy for the Virtual Machine.,Following options are supported:,C(vm) - Sets the Virtual Machine's UUID as its serial number.,C(host) - Sets the host's UUID as the Virtual Machine's serial number.,C(custom) - Allows you to specify a custom serial number in C(serial_policy_value).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
wait: not required, default: undefined. # I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

use_latest_template_version: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if latest template version should be used, when running a stateless VM.,If this parameter is set to I(true) stateless VM is created.

stateless: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) Virtual Machine will be set as stateless.,If I(False) Virtual Machine will be unset as stateless.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
operating_system: not required, default: undefined. # Operating system of the Virtual Machine. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
serial_policy_value: not required, default: undefined. # Allows you to specify a custom serial number.,This parameter is used only when C(serial_policy) is I(custom).
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the Virtual Machine to manage. If VM don't exists C(name) is required. Otherwise C(id) or C(name) can be used.
kernel_path: not required, default: undefined. # Path to a kernel image used to boot the virtual machine.,Kernel image must be stored on either the ISO domain or on the host's storage.

cloud_init: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values for Unix-like Virtual Machine initialization using cloud init:,C(host_name) - Hostname to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(timezone) - Timezone to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(user_name) - Username to be used to set password to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(root_password) - Password to be set for user specified by C(user_name) parameter.,C(authorized_ssh_keys) - Use this SSH keys to login to Virtual Machine.,C(regenerate_ssh_keys) - If I(True) SSH keys will be regenerated on Virtual Machine.,C(custom_script) - Cloud-init script which will be executed on Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(dns_servers) - DNS servers to be configured on Virtual Machine.,C(dns_search) - DNS search domains to be configured on Virtual Machine.,C(nic_boot_protocol) - Set boot protocol of the network interface of Virtual Machine. Can be one of none, dhcp or static.,C(nic_ip_address) - If boot protocol is static, set this IP address to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_netmask) - If boot protocol is static, set this netmask to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_gateway) - If boot protocol is static, set this gateway to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_name) - Set name to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_on_boot) - If I(True) network interface will be set to start on boot.

disks: not required, default: undefined. # List of disks, which should be attached to Virtual Machine. Disk is described by following dictionary:,C(name) - Name of the disk. Either C(name) or C(id) is reuqired.,C(id) - ID of the disk. Either C(name) or C(id) is reuqired.,C(interface) - Interface of the disk, either I(virtio) or I(IDE), default is I(virtio).,C(bootable) - I(True) if the disk should be bootable, default is non bootable.,C(activate) - I(True) if the disk should be activated, default is activated.,C(Note:),This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and is able to only attach disks. To manage disks of the VM in more depth please use M(ovirt_disks) module instead.
poll_interval: not required, default: 3. # Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
kernel_params: not required, default: undefined. # Kernel command line parameters (formatted as string) to be used with the kernel specified by C(kernel_path) option.

template: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the template, which should be used to create Virtual Machine. Required if creating VM.,If template is not specified and VM doesn't exist, VM will be created from I(Blank) template.
timeout: not required, default: 180. # The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
allow_partial_import: not required, default: undefined. # Boolean indication whether to allow partial registration of Virtual Machine when C(state) is registered.
cpu_shares: not required, default: undefined. # Set a CPU shares for this Virtual Machine. Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

ovirt_vms_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV virtual machines
body: ovirt_vms_facts
all_content: not required, default: undefined. # If I(true) all the attributes of the virtual machines should be included in the response.

fetch_nested: not required, default: undefined. # If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

auth: required, default: undefined. # Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
max: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of results to return.
pattern: not required, default: undefined. # Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search VM X from cluster Y use following pattern: name=X and cluster=Y
nested_attributes: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
case_sensitive: not required, default: undefined. # If I(true) performed search will take case into account.
pacemaker_cluster
node: not required, default: None. # Specify which node of the cluster you want to manage. None == the cluster status itself, 'all' == check the status of all nodes.
state: required, default: undefined. # Indicate desired state of the cluster
force: not required, default: true. # Force the change of the cluster state
timeout: not required, default: 300. # Timeout when the module should considered that the action has failed
package
state: required, default: undefined. # Whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.

use: not required, default: auto. # The required package manager module to use (yum, apt, etc). The default 'auto' will use existing facts or try to autodetect it.,You should only use this field if the automatic selection is not working for some reason.

name: required, default: undefined. # Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0).,Be aware that packages are not always named the same and this module will not 'translate' them per distro.

packet_device.description: Manage a bare metal server in the Packet Host.
body: packet_device
features: not required, default: undefined. # Dict with "features" for device creation. See Packet API docs for details.
facility: not required, default: undefined. # Facility slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/facilities/).

wait_for_public_IPv: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to wait for the instance to be assigned a public IPv4/IPv6 address.,If set to 4, it will wait until IPv4 is assigned to the instance.,If set to 6, wait until public IPv6 is assigned to the instance.
auth_token: not required, default: undefined. # Packet api token. You can also supply it in env var C(PACKET_API_TOKEN).
count_offset: not required, default: 1. # From which number to start the count.
user_data: not required, default: undefined. # Userdata blob made available to the machine
always_pxe: not required, default: false. # Persist PXE as the first boot option.,Normally, the PXE process happens only on the first boot. Set this arg to have your device continuously boot to iPXE.

hostnames: not required, default: undefined. # A hostname of a device, or a list of hostnames.,If given string or one-item list, you can use the C("%d") Python string format to expand numbers from I(count).,If only one hostname, it might be expanded to list if I(count)>1.
plan: not required, default: undefined. # Plan slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/plans/).

ipxe_script_url: not required, default: undefined. # URL of custom iPXE script for provisioning.,More about custome iPXE for Packet devices at U(https://help.packet.net/technical/infrastructure/custom-ipxe).
count: not required, default: 1. # The number of devices to create. Count number can be included in hostname via the %d string formatter.
operating_system: not required, default: undefined. # OS slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/operatingsystems/).
locked: not required, default: false. # Whether to lock a created device.
device_ids: not required, default: undefined. # List of device IDs on which to operate.
wait: not required, default: false. # Whether to wait for the instance to be assigned IP address before returning.,This option has been deprecated in favor of C(wait_for_public_IPv).

state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the device.,If set to C(present) (the default), the module call will return immediately after the device-creating HTTP request successfully returns.,If set to C(active), the module call will block until all the specified devices are in state active due to the Packet API, or until I(wait_timeout).

wait_timeout: not required, default: 900. # How long (seconds) to wait either for automatic IP address assignment, or for the device to reach the C(active) I(state).,If I(wait_for_public_IPv) is set and I(state) is C(active), the module will wait for both events consequently, applying the timeout twice.
project_id: required, default: undefined. # ID of project of the device.

packet_sshkey.description: Create/delete an SSH key in Packet host.
body: packet_sshkey
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the target.
key: not required, default: undefined. # Public Key string ({type} {base64 encoded key} {description}).
fingerprint: not required, default: undefined. # Fingerprint of the key which you want to remove.
id: not required, default: undefined. # UUID of the key which you want to remove.
auth_token: not required, default: undefined. # Packet api token. You can also supply it in env var C(PACKET_API_TOKEN).
key_file: not required, default: undefined. # File with the public key.
label: not required, default: undefined. # Label for the key. If you keep it empty, it will be read from key string.
pacman
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the package.
upgrade: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to upgrade whole system
force: not required, default: false. # When removing package - force remove package, without any checks. When update_cache - force redownload repo databases.
name: not required, default: null. # Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.
update_cache: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to refresh the master package lists. This can be run as part of a package installation or as a separate step.
recurse: not required, default: false. # When removing a package, also remove its dependencies, provided that they are not required by other packages and were not explicitly installed by a user.
pagerduty
name: required, default: null. # PagerDuty unique subdomain.
service: not required, default: null. # A comma separated list of PagerDuty service IDs.
passwd: required, default: null. # PagerDuty user password.
minutes: not required, default: 0. # Maintenance window in minutes (this is added to the hours).
state: required, default: null. # Create a maintenance window or get a list of ongoing windows.
hours: not required, default: 1. # Length of maintenance window in hours.
token: required, default: null. # A pagerduty token, generated on the pagerduty site. Can be used instead of user/passwd combination.
user: required, default: null. # PagerDuty user ID.
requester_id: required, default: null. # ID of user making the request. Only needed when using a token and creating a maintenance_window.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
desc: not required, default: Created by Ansible. # Short description of maintenance window.

pagerduty_alert.description: Trigger, acknowledge or resolve PagerDuty incidents
body: pagerduty_alert
client_url: not required, default: undefined. # The URL of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.
name: required, default: undefined. # PagerDuty unique subdomain.

incident_key: not required, default: undefined. # Identifies the incident to which this I(state) should be applied.,For C(triggered) I(state) - If there's no open (i.e. unresolved) incident with this key, a new one will be created. If there's already an open incident with a matching key, this event will be appended to that incident's log. The event key provides an easy way to "de-dup" problem reports.,For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - This should be the incident_key you received back when the incident was first opened by a trigger event. Acknowledge events referencing resolved or nonexistent incidents will be discarded.
state: required, default: undefined. # Type of event to be sent.
client: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.
service_key: required, default: undefined. # The GUID of one of your "Generic API" services.,This is the "service key" listed on a Generic API's service detail page.
api_key: required, default: undefined. # The pagerduty API key (readonly access), generated on the pagerduty site.

desc: not required, default: Created via Ansible. # For C(triggered) I(state) - Required. Short description of the problem that led to this trigger. This field (or a truncated version) will be used when generating phone calls, SMS messages and alert emails. It will also appear on the incidents tables in the PagerDuty UI. The maximum length is 1024 characters.,For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - Text that will appear in the incident's log associated with this event.
pam_limits
comment: not required, default: . # Comment associated with the limit.

use_max: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes), the maximal value will be used or conserved. If the specified value is superior to the value in the file, file content is replaced with the new value, else content is not modified.
domain: required, default: undefined. # A username, @groupname, wildcard, uid/gid range.
dest: not required, default: /etc/security/limits.conf. # Modify the limits.conf path.
value: required, default: undefined. # The value of the limit.

use_min: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes), the minimal value will be used or conserved. If the specified value is inferior to the value in the file, file content is replaced with the new value, else content is not modified.
limit_item: required, default: undefined. # The limit to be set
limit_type: required, default: undefined. # Limit type, see C(man limits) for an explanation
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
pamd

control: required, default: undefined. # The control of the PAM rule being modified.  This may be a complicated control with brackets.  If this is the case, be sure to put "[bracketed controls]" in quotes.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.
new_module_path: not required, default: undefined. # The new module path to be assigned to the new rule.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name generally refers to the PAM service file to change, for example system-auth.
new_type: not required, default: undefined. # The new type to assign to the new rule.

state: not required, default: updated. # The default of 'updated' will modify an existing rule if type, control and module_path all match an existing rule.  With 'before', the new rule will be inserted before a rule matching type, control and module_path.  Similarly, with 'after', the new rule will be inserted after an existing rule matching type, control and module_path.  With either 'before' or 'after' new_type, new_control, and new_module_path must all be specified.  If state is 'args_absent' or 'args_present', new_type, new_control, and new_module_path will be ignored.  State 'absent' will remove the rule.  The 'absent' state was added in version 2.4 and is only available in Ansible versions >= 2.4.
new_control: not required, default: undefined. # The new control to assign to the new rule.
module_path: required, default: undefined. # The module path of the PAM rule being modified.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.
path: not required, default: /etc/pam.d/. # This is the path to the PAM service files
type: required, default: undefined. # The type of the PAM rule being modified.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.

module_arguments: not required, default: undefined. # When state is 'updated', the module_arguments will replace existing module_arguments.  When state is 'args_absent' args matching those listed in module_arguments will be removed.  When state is 'args_present' any args listed in module_arguments are added if missing from the existing rule.  Furthermore, if the module argument takes a value denoted by '=', the value will be changed to that specified in module_arguments.

panos_security_policy.description: Create security rule policy on PanOS devices.
body: panos_security_policy
wildfire_analysis: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined wildfire_analysis profile.
username: not required, default: admin. # Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
vulnerability: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined vulnerability profile.

devicegroup: not required, default: None. # Device groups are used for the Panorama interaction with Firewall(s). The group must exists on Panorama. If device group is not define we assume that we are contacting Firewall.
data_filtering: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined data_filtering profile.
spyware: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined spyware profile.

hip_profiles: not required, default: any. # If you are using GlobalProtect with host information profile (HIP) enabled, you can also base the policy on information collected by GlobalProtect. For example, the user access level can be determined HIP that notifies the firewall about the user's local configuration.
file_blocking: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined file_blocking profile.
tag: not required, default: None. # Administrative tags that can be added to the rule. Note, tags must be already defined.
antivirus: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined antivirus profile.
log_start: not required, default: false. # Whether to log at session start.
log_end: not required, default: true. # Whether to log at session end.
url_filtering: not required, default: None. # Name of the already defined url_filtering profile.
password: required, default: undefined. # Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
ip_address: required, default: undefined. # IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
description: not required, default: None. # Description for the security rule.
rule_type: not required, default: universal. # Type of security rule (version 6.1 of PanOS and above).
rule_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the security rule.
to_zone: not required, default: any. # List of destination zones.
service: not required, default: application-default. # List of services.
source: not required, default: any. # List of source addresses.
destination: not required, default: any. # List of destination addresses.
from_zone: not required, default: any. # List of source zones.
source_user: not required, default: any. # Use users to enforce policy for individual users or a group of users.
application: not required, default: any. # List of applications.

group_profile: not required, default: None. # Security profile group that is already defined in the system. This property supersedes antivirus, vulnerability, spyware, url_filtering, file_blocking, data_filtering, and wildfire_analysis properties.
action: not required, default: allow. # Action to apply once rules maches.
commit: not required, default: true. # Commit configuration if changed.
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.

destination_zone: not required, default: any. # List of destination zones.

group_profile: not required, default: None. # - Security profile group that is already defined in the system. This property supersedes antivirus, vulnerability, spyware, url_filtering, file_blocking, data_filtering, and wildfire_analysis properties.
action: not required, default: allow. # Action to apply once rules maches.
commit: not required, default: true. # Commit configuration if changed.
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
parted

part_start: not required, default: 0%. # Where the partition will start as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).

part_end: not required, default: 100%. # Where the partition will end as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).
name: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the name for the partition number (GPT, Mac, MIPS and PC98 only).
align: not required, default: optimal. # Set alignment for newly created partitions.

number: not required, default: undefined. # The number of the partition to work with or the number of the partition that will be created. Required when performing any action on the disk, except fetching information.
label: not required, default: msdos. # Creates a new disk label.
state: not required, default: info. # If to create or delete a partition. If set to C(info) the module will only return the device information.

part_type: not required, default: primary. # Is one of 'primary', 'extended' or 'logical' and may be specified only with 'msdos' or 'dvh' partition tables. A name must be specified for a 'gpt' partition table. Neither part-type nor name may be used with a 'sun' partition table.
flags: not required, default: undefined. # A list of the flags that has to be set on the partition.
device: required, default: undefined. # The block device (disk) where to operate.

unit: not required, default: KiB. # Selects the current default unit that Parted will use to display locations and capacities on the disk and to interpret those given by the user if they are not suffixed by an unit. When fetching information about a disk, it is always recommended to specify a unit.

patch.description: Apply patch files using the GNU patch tool
body: patch

strip: not required, default: 0. # Number that indicates the smallest prefix containing leading slashes that will be stripped from each file name found in the patch file. For more information see the strip parameter of the GNU patch tool.
src: required, default: undefined. # Path of the patch file as accepted by the GNU patch tool. If C(remote_src) is 'no', the patch source file is looked up from the module's I(files) directory.
remote_src: not required, default: no. # If C(no), it will search for src at originating/master machine, if C(yes) it will go to the remote/target machine for the C(src).

dest: not required, default: undefined. # Path of the file on the remote machine to be patched.,The names of the files to be patched are usually taken from the patch file, but if there's just one file to be patched it can specified with this option.

binary: not required, default: no. # Setting to C(yes) will disable patch's heuristic for transforming CRLF line endings into LF. Line endings of src and dest must match. If set to C(no), C(patch) will replace CRLF in C(src) files on POSIX.
basedir: not required, default: undefined. # Path of a base directory in which the patch file will be applied. May be omitted when C(dest) option is specified, otherwise required.
backup: not required, default: no. # Passes C(--backup --version-control=numbered) to patch, producing numbered backup copies.
pause
seconds: not required, default: null. # A positive number of seconds to pause for.
minutes: not required, default: null. # A positive number of minutes to pause for.
prompt: not required, default: null. # Optional text to use for the prompt message.
pear
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the package.
executable: not required, default: null. # Path to the pear executable
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.

ping.description: Try to connect to host, verify a usable python and return C(pong) on success
body: ping
data: not required, default: pong. # Data to return for the C(ping) return value.,If this parameter is set to C(crash), the module will cause an exception.
pingdom
checkid: required, default: null. # Pingdom ID of the check.
passwd: required, default: null. # Pingdom user password.
state: required, default: null. # Define whether or not the check should be running or paused.
uid: required, default: null. # Pingdom user ID.
key: required, default: null. # Pingdom API key.
pip

virtualenv: not required, default: null. # An optional path to a I(virtualenv) directory to install into. It cannot be specified together with the 'executable' parameter (added in 2.1). If the virtualenv does not exist, it will be created before installing packages. The optional virtualenv_site_packages, virtualenv_command, and virtualenv_python options affect the creation of the virtualenv.

virtualenv_site_packages: not required, default: no. # Whether the virtual environment will inherit packages from the global site-packages directory.  Note that if this setting is changed on an already existing virtual environment it will not have any effect, the environment must be deleted and newly created.

virtualenv_command: not required, default: virtualenv. # The command or a pathname to the command to create the virtual environment with. For example C(pyvenv), C(virtualenv), C(virtualenv2), C(~/bin/virtualenv), C(/usr/local/bin/virtualenv).
chdir: not required, default: null. # cd into this directory before running the command
requirements: not required, default: null. # The path to a pip requirements file, which should be local to the remote system. File can be specified as a relative path if using the chdir option.
name: not required, default: null. # The name of a Python library to install or the url of the remote package.,As of 2.2 you can supply a list of names.

virtualenv_python: not required, default: null. # The Python executable used for creating the virtual environment. For example C(python3.5), C(python2.7). When not specified, the Python version used to run the ansible module is used. This parameter should not be used when C(virtualenv_command) is using C(pyvenv) or the C(-m venv) module.
editable: not required, default: false. # Pass the editable flag.

umask: not required, default: null. # The system umask to apply before installing the pip package. This is useful, for example, when installing on systems that have a very restrictive umask by default (e.g., 0077) and you want to pip install packages which are to be used by all users. Note that this requires you to specify desired umask mode in octal, with a leading 0 (e.g., 0077).

executable: not required, default: null. # The explicit executable or a pathname to the executable to be used to run pip for a specific version of Python installed in the system. For example C(pip-3.3), if there are both Python 2.7 and 3.3 installations in the system and you want to run pip for the Python 3.3 installation. It cannot be specified together with the 'virtualenv' parameter (added in 2.1). By default, it will take the appropriate version for the python interpreter use by ansible, e.g. pip3 on python 3, and pip2 or pip on python 2.
extra_args: not required, default: null. # Extra arguments passed to pip.
state: not required, default: present. # The state of module,The 'forcereinstall' option is only available in Ansible 2.1 and above.
version: not required, default: null. # The version number to install of the Python library specified in the I(name) parameter

pkg5.description: Manages packages with the Solaris 11 Image Packaging System
body: pkg5
accept_licenses: not required, default: false. # Accept any licences.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install (I(present), I(latest)), or remove (I(absent)) a package.
name: required, default: undefined. # An FRMI of the package(s) to be installed/removed/updated.,Multiple packages may be specified, separated by C(,).

pkg5_publisher.description: Manages Solaris 11 Image Packaging System publishers
body: pkg5_publisher
origin: not required, default: null. # A path or URL to the repository.,Multiple values may be provided.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to ensure that a publisher is present or absent.
name: required, default: undefined. # The publisher's name.
mirror: not required, default: null. # A path or URL to the repository mirror.,Multiple values may be provided.
enabled: not required, default: null. # Is the repository enabled or disabled?
sticky: not required, default: null. # Packages installed from a sticky repository can only receive updates from that repository.

pkgin.description: Package manager for SmartOS, NetBSD, et al.
body: pkgin
state: not required, default: present. # Intended state of the package
upgrade: not required, default: false. # Upgrade main packages to their newer versions
force: not required, default: false. # Force package reinstall
name: not required, default: null. # Name of package to install/remove;,multiple names may be given, separated by commas
full_upgrade: not required, default: false. # Upgrade all packages to their newer versions
update_cache: not required, default: false. # Update repository database. Can be run with other steps or on it's own.
clean: not required, default: false. # Clean packages cache
pkgng
chroot: not required, default: undefined. # Pkg will chroot in the specified environment.,Can not be used together with I(rootdir) or I(jail) options.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of package to install/remove.
cached: not required, default: false. # Use local package base instead of fetching an updated one.

pkgsite: not required, default: undefined. # For pkgng versions before 1.1.4, specify packagesite to use for downloading packages. If not specified, use settings from C(/usr/local/etc/pkg.conf).,For newer pkgng versions, specify a the name of a repository configured in C(/usr/local/etc/pkg/repos).
state: not required, default: present. # State of the package.

rootdir: not required, default: undefined. # For pkgng versions 1.5 and later, pkg will install all packages within the specified root directory.,Can not be used together with I(chroot) or I(jail) options.
autoremove: not required, default: false. # Remove automatically installed packages which are no longer needed.
jail: not required, default: undefined. # Pkg will execute in the given jail name or id.,Can not be used together with I(chroot) or I(rootdir) options.

annotation: not required, default: undefined. # A comma-separated list of keyvalue-pairs of the form C(<+/-/:><key>[=<value>]). A C(+) denotes adding an annotation, a C(-) denotes removing an annotation, and C(:) denotes modifying an annotation. If setting or modifying annotations, a value must be provided.
pkgutil
site: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the repository path to install the package from.,Its global definition is done in C(/etc/opt/csw/pkgutil.conf).

state: required, default: undefined. # Whether to install (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.,The upgrade (C(latest)) operation will update/install the package to the latest version available.,Note: The module has a limitation that (C(latest)) only works for one package, not lists of them.
update_catalog: not required, default: false. # If you want to refresh your catalog from the mirror, set this to (C(yes)).
name: required, default: undefined. # Package name, e.g. (C(CSWnrpe))

pn_cluster.description: CLI command to create/delete a cluster.
body: pn_cluster
pn_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the cluster.
pn_cluster_node1: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the first switch in the cluster.,Required for 'cluster-create'.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_validate: not required, default: undefined. # Validate the inter-switch links and state of switches in the cluster.
state: required, default: undefined. # Specify action to perform. Use 'present' to create cluster and 'absent' to delete cluster.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch to run the cli on.
pn_cluster_node2: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the second switch in the cluster.,Required for 'cluster-create'.

pn_ospf.description: CLI command to add/remove ospf protocol to a vRouter.
body: pn_ospf
state: required, default: present. # Assert the state of the ospf. Use 'present' to add ospf and 'absent' to remove ospf.
pn_vrouter_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the vRouter.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_ospf_area: not required, default: undefined. # Stub area number for the configuration. Required for vrouter-ospf-add.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch to run the CLI on.
pn_network_ip: required, default: undefined. # Specify the network IP (IPv4 or IPv6) address.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_ospfarea.description: CLI command to add/remove ospf area to/from a vrouter.
body: pn_ospfarea
pn_ospf_area: required, default: undefined. # Specify the OSPF area number.
pn_clipassword: required, default: undefined. # Login password.
pn_vrouter_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the vRouter.
pn_cliusername: required, default: undefined. # Login username.
pn_prefix_listin: not required, default: undefined. # OSPF prefix list for filtering incoming packets.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add ospf-area, 'absent' to remove ospf-area and 'update' to modify ospf-area.
pn_prefix_listout: not required, default: undefined. # OSPF prefix list for filtering outgoing packets.
pn_stub_type: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the OSPF stub type.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the CLI on.
pn_quiet: not required, default: true. # Enable/disable system information.

pn_show.description: Run show commands on nvOS device.
body: pn_show
pn_parameters: not required, default: undefined. # Display output using a specific parameter. Use 'all' to display possible output. List of comma separated parameters.
pn_options: not required, default: undefined. # Specify formatting options.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_command: required, default: undefined. # The C(pn_command) takes a CLI show command as value.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_trunk.description: CLI command to create/delete/modify a trunk.
body: pn_trunk
pn_unknown_mcast_level: not required, default: undefined. # Specify an unknown multicast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_jumbo: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the port can receive jumbo frames.
pn_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name for the trunk configuration.
pn_lacp_fallback_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP fallback timeout in seconds. The range is between 30 and 60 seconds with a default value of 50 seconds.
pn_unknown_ucast_level: not required, default: undefined. # Specify an unknown unicast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_lacp_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP time out as slow (30 seconds) or fast (4seconds). The default value is slow.
pn_loopback: not required, default: undefined. # Specify loopback if you want to use loopback.
pn_speed: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the port speed or disable the port.
pn_edge_switch: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the switch is an edge switch.
pn_host: not required, default: undefined. # Host facing port control setting.
pn_port_macaddr: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the MAC address of the port.
pn_lacp_fallback: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP fallback mode as bundles or individual.
pn_routing: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the port participates in routing on the network.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_mirror_receive: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the configuration receives mirrored traffic.
pn_egress_rate_limit: not required, default: undefined. # Specify an egress port data rate limit for the configuration.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_lacp_mode: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP mode for the configuration.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create trunk, 'absent' to delete trunk and 'update' to modify trunk.
pn_ports: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the port number(s) for the link(s) to aggregate into the trunk.,Required for trunk-create.
pn_lacp_priority: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP priority. This is a number between 1 and 65535 with a default value of 32768.
pn_broadcast_level: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a broadcast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_pause: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if pause frames are sent.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_loopvlans: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a list of looping vlans.
pn_description: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a description for the trunk configuration.
pn_vlag
pn_name: required, default: undefined. # The C(pn_name) takes a valid name for vlag configuration.
pn_lacp_fallback: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP fallback mode as bundles or individual.
pn_lacp_fallback_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP fallback timeout in seconds. The range is between 30 and 60 seconds with a default value of 50 seconds.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_lacp_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP timeout as slow(30 seconds) or fast(4 seconds).
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vlag, 'absent' to delete vlag and 'update' to modify vlag.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_lacp_mode: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the LACP mode.
pn_failover_action: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the failover action as move or ignore.
pn_peer_port: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the peer VLAG port.,Required for vlag-create.
pn_peer_switch: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the fabric-name of the peer switch.
pn_port: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the local VLAG port.,Required for vlag-create.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run this command on.

pn_mode: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the mode for the VLAG. Active-standby indicates one side is active and the other side is in standby mode. Active-active indicates that both sides of the vlag are up by default.

pn_vlan.description: CLI command to create/delete a VLAN.
body: pn_vlan
pn_scope: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a scope for the VLAN.,Required for vlan-create.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_vlanid: required, default: undefined. # Specify a VLAN identifier for the VLAN. This is a value between 2 and 4092.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vlan and 'absent' to delete vlan.
pn_ports: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the switch network data port number, list of ports, or range of ports. Port numbers must ne in the range of 1 to 64.

pn_untagged_ports: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the ports that should have untagged packets mapped to the VLAN. Untagged packets are packets that do not contain IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tags.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_stats: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want to collect statistics for a VLAN. Statistic collection is enabled by default.
pn_description: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a description for the VLAN.

pn_vrouter.description: CLI command to create/delete/modify a vrouter.
body: pn_vrouter
pn_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the vRouter.
pn_rip_redistribute: not required, default: undefined. # Specify how RIP routes are redistributed.
pn_bgp_options: not required, default: undefined. # Specify other BGP options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.
pn_router_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the vRouter IP address.
pn_ospf_options: not required, default: undefined. # Specify other OSPF options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.
pn_bgp_as: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the Autonomous System Number(ASN) if the vRouter runs Border Gateway Protocol(BGP).
pn_ospf_redistribute: not required, default: undefined. # Specify how OSPF routes are redistributed.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_bgp_redistribute: not required, default: undefined. # Specify how BGP routes are redistributed.

pn_router_type: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the vRouter uses software or hardware.,Note that if you specify hardware as router type, you cannot assign IP addresses using DHCP. You must specify a static IP address.
pn_hw_vrrp_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the VRRP ID for a hardware vrouter.
pn_vnet: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the VNET.,Required for vrouter-create.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_service_state: not required, default: undefined. # Specify to enable or disable vRouter service.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vrouter, 'absent' to delete vrouter and 'update' to modify vrouter.
pn_service_type: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the vRouter is a dedicated or shared VNET service.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the CLI on.
pn_bgp_max_paths: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the maximum number of paths for BGP. This is a number between 1 and 255 or 0 to unset.
pn_vrouterbgp
pn_max_prefix: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the maximum number of prefixes.
pn_route_mapout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify outbound route map for neighbor.
pn_neighbor: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a neighbor IP address to use for BGP.,Required for vrouter-bgp-add.
pn_vrouter_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify a name for the vRouter service.
pn_override_capability: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want to override capability.
pn_route_mapin: not required, default: undefined. # Specify inbound route map for neighbor.
pn_soft_reconfig: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want a soft reconfiguration of inbound traffic.

pn_ebgp: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a value for external BGP to accept or attempt BGP connections to external peers, not directly connected, on the network. This is a value between 1 and 255.
pn_prefix_listin: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the prefix list to filter traffic inbound.
pn_bfd: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want BFD protocol support for fault detection.
pn_password: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a password, if desired.
pn_route_reflector: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if a route reflector client is used.
pn_keepalive: not required, default: undefined. # Specify BGP neighbor keepalive interval in seconds.
pn_max_prefix_warn: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want a warning message when the maximum number of prefixes is exceeded.
pn_multiprotocol: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a multi-protocol for BGP.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_default_originate: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if you want announce default routes to the neighbor or not.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_weight: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a default weight value between 0 and 65535 for the neighbor routes.
pn_prefix_listout: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the prefix list to filter traffic outbound.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add bgp, 'absent' to remove bgp and 'update' to modify bgp.
pn_remote_as: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the remote Autonomous System(AS) number. This value is between 1 and 4294967295.,Required for vrouter-bgp-add.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_holdtime: not required, default: undefined. # Specify BGP neighbor holdtime in seconds.
pn_next_hop_self: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the next-hop is the same router or not.
pn_vrouterif
pn_nic_enable: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the NIC is enabled or not
pn_vrouter_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the vRouter interface.
pn_vrrp_adv_int: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a VRRP advertisement interval in milliseconds. The range is from 30 to 40950 with a default value of 1000.
pn_vrrp_priority: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the priority for the VRRP interface. This is a value between 1 (lowest) and 255 (highest).
pn_alias: not required, default: undefined. # Specify an alias for the interface.
pn_secondary_macs: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a secondary MAC address for the interface.
pn_interface_ip: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the IP address of the interface in x.x.x.x/n format.
pn_vlan: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the VLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 4092.
pn_vxlan: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the VXLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 16777215.

pn_exclusive: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the interface is exclusive to the configuration. Exclusive means that other configurations cannot use the interface. Exclusive is specified when you configure the interface as span interface and allows higher throughput through the interface.
pn_nic_str: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the type of NIC. Used for vrouter-interface remove/modify.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_vrrp_id: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the ID for the VRRP interface. The IDs on both vRouters must be the same IS number.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter interface, 'absent' to remove vrouter interface and 'update' to modify vrouter interface.
pn_interface: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if the interface is management, data or span interface.
pn_l3port: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a Layer 3 port for the interface.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch to run the cli on.
pn_assignment: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the DHCP method for IP address assignment.
pn_vrouterlbif
pn_interface_ip: required, default: undefined. # Specify the IP address.
state: required, default: undefined. # State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter loopback interface and 'absent' to remove vrouter loopback interface.
pn_vrouter_name: required, default: undefined. # Specify the name of the vRouter.
pn_clipassword: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_cliusername: not required, default: undefined. # Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_cliswitch: not required, default: undefined. # Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_index: not required, default: undefined. # Specify the interface index from 1 to 255.
portage
nodeps: not required, default: false. # Only merge packages but not their dependencies (--nodeps)
onlydeps: not required, default: false. # Only merge packages' dependencies but not the packages (--onlydeps)
newuse: not required, default: false. # Include installed packages where USE flags have changed (--newuse)
oneshot: not required, default: false. # Do not add the packages to the world file (--oneshot)
update: not required, default: false. # Update packages to the best version available (--update)
deep: not required, default: false. # Consider the entire dependency tree of packages (--deep)
sync: not required, default: null. # Sync package repositories first,If yes, perform "emerge --sync",If web, perform "emerge-webrsync"
keepgoing: not required, default: false. # Continue as much as possible after an error.

depclean: not required, default: false. # Remove packages not needed by explicitly merged packages (--depclean),If no package is specified, clean up the world's dependencies,Otherwise, --depclean serves as a dependency aware version of --unmerge
jobs: not required, default: None. # Specifies the number of packages to build simultaneously.
noreplace: not required, default: false. # Do not re-emerge installed packages (--noreplace)
loadavg: not required, default: None. # Specifies that no new builds should be started if there are,other builds running and the load average is at least LOAD
verbose: not required, default: false. # Run emerge in verbose mode (--verbose)
getbinpkg: not required, default: false. # Prefer packages specified at PORTAGE_BINHOST in make.conf
package: not required, default: null. # Package atom or set, e.g. C(sys-apps/foo) or C(>foo-2.13) or C(@world)
quiet: not required, default: false. # Run emerge in quiet mode (--quiet)
state: not required, default: present. # State of the package atom
changed_use: not required, default: false. # Include installed packages where USE flags have changed, except when,flags that the user has not enabled are added or removed,(--changed-use)
usepkgonly: not required, default: false. # Merge only binaries (no compiling). This sets getbinpkg=yes.

portinstall.description: Installing packages from FreeBSD's ports system
body: portinstall
state: not required, default: present. # state of the package
use_packages: not required, default: true. # use packages instead of ports whenever available
name: required, default: undefined. # name of package to install/remove

postgresql_db.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL databases from a remote host.
body: postgresql_db

ssl_rootcert: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s).,If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.

ssl_mode: not required, default: prefer. # Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.
encoding: not required, default: null. # Encoding of the database
login_user: not required, default: postgres. # The username used to authenticate with
login_host: not required, default: null. # Host running the database
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the role to set as owner of the database
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.
target: not required, default: undefined. # File to back up or restore from. Used when state is "dump" or "restore"
name: required, default: null. # name of the database to add or remove
target_opts: not required, default: undefined. # Further arguments for pg_dump or pg_restore. Used when state is "dump" or "restore"

lc_ctype: not required, default: null. # Character classification (LC_CTYPE) to use in the database (e.g. lower, upper, ...) Must match LC_CTYPE of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.

state: not required, default: present. # The database state. present implies that the database should be created if necessary.
absent implies that the database should be removed if present.
dump requires a target definition to which the database will be backed up.
(Added in 2.4) restore also requires a target definition from which the database will be restored.
(Added in 2.4) The format of the backup will be detected based on the target name.
Supported compression formats for dump and restore are: .bz2, .gz, and .xz
Supported formats for dump and restore are: .sql and .tar
template: not required, default: null. # Template used to create the database
lc_collate: not required, default: null. # Collation order (LC_COLLATE) to use in the database. Must match collation order of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.

postgresql_ext.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL extensions from a database.
body: postgresql_ext
state: not required, default: present. # The database extension state
name: required, default: null. # name of the extension to add or remove
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database
db: required, default: null. # name of the database to add or remove the extension to/from
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.

postgresql_lang.description: Adds, removes or changes procedural languages with a PostgreSQL database.
body: postgresql_lang
lang: required, default: null. # name of the procedural language to add, remove or change
force_trust: not required, default: false. # marks the language as trusted, even if it's marked as untrusted in pg_pltemplate.,use with care!
login_user: not required, default: postgres. # User used to authenticate with PostgreSQL
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running PostgreSQL where you want to execute the actions.
db: not required, default: null. # name of database where the language will be added, removed or changed
cascade: not required, default: false. # when dropping a language, also delete object that depend on this language.,only used when C(state=absent).
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the language for the selected database
login_password: not required, default: null. # Password used to authenticate with PostgreSQL (must match C(login_user))
trust: not required, default: false. # make this language trusted for the selected db

fail_on_drop: not required, default: yes. # if C(yes), fail when removing a language. Otherwise just log and continue,in some cases, it is not possible to remove a language (used by the db-system). When         dependencies block the removal, consider using C(cascade).
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.

postgresql_privs.description: Grant or revoke privileges on PostgreSQL database objects.
body: postgresql_privs

objs: not required, default: undefined. # Comma separated list of database objects to set privileges on.,If I(type) is C(table) or C(sequence), the special value C(ALL_IN_SCHEMA) can be provided instead to specify all database objects of type I(type) in the schema specified via I(schema). (This also works with PostgreSQL < 9.0.),If I(type) is C(database), this parameter can be omitted, in which case privileges are set for the database specified via I(database).,If I(type) is I(function), colons (":") in object names will be replaced with commas (needed to specify function signatures, see examples),Alias: I(obj)

ssl_rootcert: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s). If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.

ssl_mode: not required, default: prefer. # Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.

roles: required, default: undefined. # Comma separated list of role (user/group) names to set permissions for.,The special value C(PUBLIC) can be provided instead to set permissions for the implicitly defined PUBLIC group.,Alias: I(role)
privs: not required, default: undefined. # Comma separated list of privileges to grant/revoke.,Alias: I(priv)
database: required, default: undefined. # Name of database to connect to.,Alias: I(db)
state: not required, default: present. # If C(present), the specified privileges are granted, if C(absent) they are revoked.
unix_socket: not required, default: null. # Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.,Alias: I(login_unix_socket)
host: not required, default: null. # Database host address. If unspecified, connect via Unix socket.,Alias: I(login_host)
login: not required, default: postgres. # The username to authenticate with.,Alias: I(login_user)
password: not required, default: null. # The password to authenticate with.,Alias: I(login_password))
type: not required, default: table. # Type of database object to set privileges on.
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.

grant_option: not required, default: undefined. # Whether C(role) may grant/revoke the specified privileges/group memberships to others.,Set to C(no) to revoke GRANT OPTION, leave unspecified to make no changes.,I(grant_option) only has an effect if I(state) is C(present).,Alias: I(admin_option)

schema: not required, default: undefined. # Schema that contains the database objects specified via I(objs).,May only be provided if I(type) is C(table), C(sequence) or C(function). Defaults to  C(public) in these cases.

postgresql_schema.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL schema from a remote host
body: postgresql_schema
