name: required, default: null. # Name of the schema to add or remove.
database: not required, default: postgres. # Name of the database to connect to.
login_user: not required, default: null. # The username used to authenticate with.
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running the database.
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
state: not required, default: present. # The schema state.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the role to set as owner of the schema.
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.

postgresql_user.description: Adds or removes a users (roles) from a PostgreSQL database.
body: postgresql_user

ssl_rootcert: not required, default: null. # Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s). If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.

ssl_mode: not required, default: prefer. # Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.
login_user: not required, default: postgres. # User (role) used to authenticate with PostgreSQL
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # Host running PostgreSQL.
expires: not required, default: null. # sets the user's password expiration.
db: not required, default: null. # name of database where permissions will be granted
conn_limit: not required, default: null. # Specifies the user connection limit.
login_unix_socket: not required, default: null. # Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections
login_password: not required, default: null. # Password used to authenticate with PostgreSQL

password: not required, default: null. # set the user's password, before 1.4 this was required.,When passing an encrypted password, the encrypted parameter must also be true, and it must be generated with the format C('str[\"md5\"] + md5[ password + username ]'), resulting in a total of 35 characters.  An easy way to do this is: C(echo \"md5`echo -n \"verysecretpasswordJOE\" | md5`\"). Note that if the provided password string is already in MD5-hashed format, then it is used as-is, regardless of encrypted parameter.
port: not required, default: 5432. # Database port to connect to.
fail_on_user: not required, default: yes. # if C(yes), fail when user can't be removed. Otherwise just log and continue
priv: not required, default: null. # PostgreSQL privileges string in the format: C(table:priv1,priv2)
name: required, default: null. # name of the user (role) to add or remove

no_password_changes: not required, default: no. # if C(yes), don't inspect database for password changes. Effective when C(pg_authid) is not accessible (such as AWS RDS). Otherwise, make password changes as necessary.
state: not required, default: present. # The user (role) state

encrypted: not required, default: false. # whether the password is stored hashed in the database. boolean. Passwords can be passed already hashed or unhashed, and postgresql ensures the stored password is hashed when encrypted is set.
role_attr_flags: not required, default: . # PostgreSQL role attributes string in the format: CREATEDB,CREATEROLE,SUPERUSER

profitbricks.description: Create, destroy, start, stop, and reboot a ProfitBricks virtual machine.
body: profitbricks
lan: not required, default: 1. # The ID of the LAN you wish to add the servers to.
image_password: not required, default: undefined. # Password set for the administrative user.
bus: not required, default: VIRTIO. # The bus type for the volume.
image: required, default: undefined. # The system image ID for creating the virtual machine, e.g. a3eae284-a2fe-11e4-b187-5f1f641608c8.
ram: not required, default: 2048. # The amount of memory to allocate to the virtual machine.
instance_ids: not required, default: undefined. # list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances.
subscription_password: not required, default: null. # THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
assign_public_ip: not required, default: false. # This will assign the machine to the public LAN. If no LAN exists with public Internet access it is created.
wait: not required, default: yes. # wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
count: not required, default: 1. # The number of virtual machines to create.
datacenter: not required, default: null. # The datacenter to provision this virtual machine.
remove_boot_volume: not required, default: yes. # remove the bootVolume of the virtual machine you're destroying.
ssh_keys: not required, default: undefined. # Public SSH keys allowing access to the virtual machine.
subscription_user: not required, default: null. # The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
cpu_family: not required, default: AMD_OPTERON. # The CPU family type to allocate to the virtual machine.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the virtual machine.
volume_size: not required, default: 10. # The size in GB of the boot volume.
state: not required, default: present. # create or terminate instances
location: not required, default: us/las. # The datacenter location. Use only if you want to create the Datacenter or else this value is ignored.
auto_increment: not required, default: true. # Whether or not to increment a single number in the name for created virtual machines.
cores: not required, default: 2. # The number of CPU cores to allocate to the virtual machine.

profitbricks_datacenter.description: Create or destroy a ProfitBricks Virtual Datacenter.
body: profitbricks_datacenter
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the virtual datacenter.
subscription_user: not required, default: undefined. # The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
subscription_password: not required, default: undefined. # THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
state: not required, default: present. # create or terminate datacenters
wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
location: not required, default: us/las. # The datacenter location.
wait: not required, default: yes. # wait for the datacenter to be created before returning
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description of the virtual datacenter.
profitbricks_nic
datacenter: required, default: undefined. # The datacenter in which to operate.
lan: required, default: undefined. # The LAN to place the NIC on. You can pass a LAN that doesn't exist and it will be created. Required on create.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name or ID of the NIC. This is only required on deletes, but not on create.
subscription_user: not required, default: undefined. # The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
server: required, default: undefined. # The server name or ID.
subscription_password: not required, default: undefined. # THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
wait: not required, default: yes. # wait for the operation to complete before returning
profitbricks_volume
image_password: not required, default: undefined. # Password set for the administrative user.
licence_type: not required, default: UNKNOWN. # The licence type for the volume. This is used when the image is non-standard.
bus: not required, default: VIRTIO. # The bus type.
image: required, default: undefined. # The system image ID for the volume, e.g. a3eae284-a2fe-11e4-b187-5f1f641608c8. This can also be a snapshot image ID.
instance_ids: not required, default: undefined. # list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances.
subscription_password: not required, default: undefined. # THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
disk_type: not required, default: HDD. # The disk type of the volume.
wait: not required, default: yes. # wait for the datacenter to be created before returning
count: not required, default: 1. # The number of volumes you wish to create.
datacenter: required, default: undefined. # The datacenter in which to create the volumes.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volumes. You can enumerate the names using auto_increment.
subscription_user: not required, default: undefined. # The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
state: not required, default: present. # create or terminate datacenters
auto_increment: not required, default: true. # Whether or not to increment a single number in the name for created virtual machines.
size: not required, default: 10. # The size of the volume.
ssh_keys: not required, default: undefined. # Public SSH keys allowing access to the virtual machine.
profitbricks_volume_attachments
datacenter: required, default: undefined. # The datacenter in which to operate.
subscription_user: not required, default: undefined. # The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
server: required, default: undefined. # The name of the server you wish to detach or attach the volume.
volume: required, default: undefined. # The volume name or ID.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
wait_timeout: not required, default: 600. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
subscription_password: not required, default: undefined. # THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait: not required, default: yes. # wait for the operation to complete before returning

proxmox.description: management of instances in Proxmox VE cluster
body: proxmox
node: not required, default: null. # Proxmox VE node, when new VM will be created,required only for C(state=present),for another states will be autodiscovered

force: not required, default: false. # forcing operations,can be used only with states C(present), C(stopped), C(restarted),with C(state=present) force option allow to overwrite existing container,with states C(stopped) , C(restarted) allow to force stop instance
cpuunits: not required, default: 1000. # CPU weight for a VM
vmid: not required, default: null. # the instance id,if not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.,if not set, will be fetched from PromoxAPI based on the hostname
api_password: not required, default: null. # the password to authenticate with,you can use PROXMOX_PASSWORD environment variable
cpus: not required, default: 1. # numbers of allocated cpus for instance
ostemplate: not required, default: null. # the template for VM creating,required only for C(state=present)
unprivileged: not required, default: false. # Indicate if the container should be unprivileged
disk: not required, default: 3. # hard disk size in GB for instance
ip_address: not required, default: null. # specifies the address the container will be assigned
pool: not required, default: null. # Proxmox VE resource pool
api_host: required, default: undefined. # the host of the Proxmox VE cluster
password: not required, default: null. # the instance root password,required only for C(state=present)
searchdomain: not required, default: null. # sets DNS search domain for a container
netif: not required, default: null. # specifies network interfaces for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining interfaces.
api_user: required, default: undefined. # the user to authenticate with
validate_certs: not required, default: false. # enable / disable https certificate verification
hostname: not required, default: null. # the instance hostname,required only for C(state=present),must be unique if vmid is not passed
storage: not required, default: local. # target storage
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the instance
swap: not required, default: 0. # swap memory size in MB for instance
timeout: not required, default: 30. # timeout for operations
memory: not required, default: 512. # memory size in MB for instance
mounts: not required, default: null. # specifies additional mounts (separate disks) for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining mount points
cores: not required, default: 1. # Specify number of cores per socket.
nameserver: not required, default: null. # sets DNS server IP address for a container
pubkey: not required, default: null. # Public key to add to /root/.ssh/authorized_keys. This was added on Proxmox 4.2, it is ignored for earlier versions
onboot: not required, default: false. # specifies whether a VM will be started during system bootup

proxmox_kvm.description: Management of Qemu(KVM) Virtual Machines in Proxmox VE cluster.
body: proxmox_kvm
revert: not required, default: null. # Revert a pending change.
boot: not required, default: cnd. # Specify the boot order -> boot on floppy C(a), hard disk C(c), CD-ROM C(d), or network C(n).,You can combine to set order.
migrate_speed: not required, default: null. # Sets maximum speed (in MB/s) for migrations.,A value of 0 is no limit.
vga: not required, default: std. # Select VGA type. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) then you should use option 'std' or 'vmware'.
keyboard: not required, default: null. # Sets the keyboard layout for VNC server.
watchdog: not required, default: null. # Creates a virtual hardware watchdog device.
sockets: not required, default: 1. # Sets the number of CPU sockets. (1 - N).
digest: not required, default: null. # Specify if to prevent changes if current configuration file has different SHA1 digest.,This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.
tablet: not required, default: no. # Enables/disables the USB tablet device.
bios: not required, default: null. # Specify the BIOS implementation.

hostpci: not required, default: null. # Specify a hash/dictionary of map host pci devices into guest. C(hostpci='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(hostpci[n]) where 0  n  N.,Values allowed are -  C("host="HOSTPCIID[;HOSTPCIID2...]",pcie="1|0",rombar="1|0",x-vga="1|0"").,The C(host) parameter is Host PCI device pass through. HOSTPCIID syntax is C(bus:dev.func) (hexadecimal numbers).,C(pcie=boolean) I(default=0) Choose the PCI-express bus (needs the q35 machine model).,C(rombar=boolean) I(default=1) Specify whether or not the device's ROM will be visible in the guest's memory map.,C(x-vga=boolean) I(default=0) Enable vfio-vga device support.,/!\ This option allows direct access to host hardware. So it is no longer possible to migrate such machines - use with special care.
autostart: not required, default: no. # Specify, if the VM should be automatically restarted after crash (currently ignored in PVE API).
memory: not required, default: 512. # Memory size in MB for instance.
migrate_downtime: not required, default: null. # Sets maximum tolerated downtime (in seconds) for migrations.
localtime: not required, default: null. # Sets the real time clock to local time.,This is enabled by default if ostype indicates a Microsoft OS.

virtio: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of volume used as VIRTIO hard disk. C(virtio='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(virto[n]) where 0  n  15.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
format: not required, default: qcow2. # Target drive's backing file's data format.,Used only with clone
snapname: not required, default: null. # The name of the snapshot. Used only with clone.

hotplug: not required, default: null. # Selectively enable hotplug features.,This is a comma separated list of hotplug features C('network', 'disk', 'cpu', 'memory' and 'usb').,Value 0 disables hotplug completely and value 1 is an alias for the default C('network,disk,usb').
name: not required, default: null. # Specifies the VM name. Only used on the configuration web interface.,Required only for C(state=present).
target: not required, default: null. # Target node. Only allowed if the original VM is on shared storage.,Used only with clone
vmid: not required, default: null. # Specifies the VM ID. Instead use I(name) parameter.,If vmid is not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.
bootdisk: not required, default: null. # Enable booting from specified disk. C((ide|sata|scsi|virtio)\d+)
vcpus: not required, default: null. # Sets number of hotplugged vcpus.
newid: not required, default: null. # VMID for the clone. Used only with clone.,If newid is not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.
timeout: not required, default: 30. # Timeout for operations.
skiplock: not required, default: null. # Ignore locks,Only root is allowed to use this option.
validate_certs: not required, default: no. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
onboot: not required, default: yes. # Specifies whether a VM will be started during system bootup.
delete: not required, default: null. # Specify a list of settings you want to delete.
force: not required, default: null. # Allow to force stop VM.,Can be used only with states C(stopped), C(restarted).
lock: not required, default: null. # Lock/unlock the VM.

startup: not required, default: null. # Startup and shutdown behavior. C([[order=]\d+] [,up=\d+] [,down=\d+]).,Order is a non-negative number defining the general startup order.,Shutdown in done with reverse ordering.
agent: not required, default: null. # Specify if the QEMU GuestAgent should be enabled/disabled.
freeze: not required, default: null. # Specify if PVE should freeze CPU at startup (use 'c' monitor command to start execution).

serial: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of serial device to create inside the VM. C('{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - serial[n](str; required) where 0  n  3.,Values allowed are - C((/dev/.+|socket)).,/!\ If you pass through a host serial device, it is no longer possible to migrate such machines - use with special care.
startdate: not required, default: null. # Sets the initial date of the real time clock.,Valid format for date are C('now') or C('2016-09-25T16:01:21') or C('2016-09-25').
balloon: not required, default: 0. # Specify the amount of RAM for the VM in MB.,Using zero disables the balloon driver.
cpuunits: not required, default: 1000. # Specify CPU weight for a VM.,You can disable fair-scheduler configuration by setting this to 0
storage: not required, default: null. # Target storage for full clone.
reboot: not required, default: null. # Allow reboot. If set to yes, the VM exit on reboot.

shares: not required, default: null. # Rets amount of memory shares for auto-ballooning. (0 - 50000).,The larger the number is, the more memory this VM gets.,The number is relative to weights of all other running VMs.,Using 0 disables auto-ballooning, this means no limit.
machine: not required, default: null. # Specifies the Qemu machine type.,type => C((pc|pc(-i440fx)?-\d+\.\d+(\.pxe)?|q35|pc-q35-\d+\.\d+(\.pxe)?))

sata: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of volume used as sata hard disk or CD-ROM. C(sata='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(sata[n]) where 0  n  5.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
state: not required, default: present. # Indicates desired state of the instance.,If C(current), the current state of the VM will be fecthed. You can access it with C(results.status)
template: not required, default: no. # Enables/disables the template.

net: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of network interfaces for the VM. C(net='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(net[n]) where 0  n  N.,Values allowed are - C("model="XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX",brigde="value",rate="value",tag="value",firewall="1|0",trunks="vlanid"").,Model is one of C(e1000 e1000-82540em e1000-82544gc e1000-82545em i82551 i82557b i82559er ne2k_isa ne2k_pci pcnet rtl8139 virtio vmxnet3).,C(XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX) should be an unique MAC address. This is automatically generated if not specified.,The C(bridge) parameter can be used to automatically add the interface to a bridge device. The Proxmox VE standard bridge is called 'vmbr0'.,Option C(rate) is used to limit traffic bandwidth from and to this interface. It is specified as floating point number, unit is 'Megabytes per second'.,If you specify no bridge, we create a kvm 'user' (NATed) network device, which provides DHCP and DNS services.
acpi: not required, default: yes. # Specify if ACPI should be enables/disabled.
node: not required, default: null. # Proxmox VE node, where the new VM will be created.,Only required for C(state=present).,For other states, it will be autodiscovered.
full: not required, default: true. # Create a full copy of all disk. This is always done when you clone a normal VM.,For VM templates, we try to create a linked clone by default.,Used only with clone
description: not required, default: null. # Specify the description for the VM. Only used on the configuration web interface.,This is saved as comment inside the configuration file.
scsihw: not required, default: null. # Specifies the SCSI controller model.
clone: not required, default: null. # Name of VM to be cloned. If C(vmid) is setted, C(clone) can take arbitrary value but required for intiating the clone.
args: not required, default: -serial unix:/var/run/qemu-server/VMID.serial,server,nowait. # Pass arbitrary arguments to kvm.,This option is for experts only!
api_password: not required, default: null. # Specify the password to authenticate with.,You can use C(PROXMOX_PASSWORD) environment variable.
tdf: not required, default: null. # Enables/disables time drift fix.

update: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), the VM will be update with new value.,Cause of the operations of the API and security reasons, I have disabled the update of the following parameters,C(net, virtio, ide, sata, scsi). Per example updating C(net) update the MAC address and C(virtio) create always new disk...
kvm: not required, default: yes. # Enable/disable KVM hardware virtualization.
ostype: not required, default: l26. # Specifies guest operating system. This is used to enable special optimization/features for specific operating systems.,The l26 is Linux 2.6/3.X Kernel.
protection: not required, default: null. # Enable/disable the protection flag of the VM. This will enable/disable the remove VM and remove disk operations.

numa: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionaries of NUMA topology. C(numa='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(numa[n]) where 0  n  N.,Values allowed are - C("cpu="<id[-id];...>",hostnodes="<id[-id];...>",memory="number",policy="(bind|interleave|preferred)"").,C(cpus) CPUs accessing this NUMA node.,C(hostnodes) Host NUMA nodes to use.,C(memory) Amount of memory this NUMA node provides.,C(policy) NUMA allocation policy.

parallel: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of map host parallel devices. C(parallel='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - (parallel[n]) where 0  n  2.,Values allowed are - C("/dev/parport\d+|/dev/usb/lp\d+").
pool: not required, default: null. # Add the new VM to the specified pool.
api_host: required, default: undefined. # Specify the target host of the Proxmox VE cluster.
cpulimit: not required, default: null. # Specify if CPU usage will be limited. Value 0 indicates no CPU limit.,If the computer has 2 CPUs, it has total of '2' CPU time
api_user: required, default: undefined. # Specify the user to authenticate with.
hugepages: not required, default: null. # Enable/disable hugepages memory.
smbios: not required, default: null. # Specifies SMBIOS type 1 fields.
cores: not required, default: 1. # Specify number of cores per socket.

scsi: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of volume used as SCSI hard disk or CD-ROM. C(scsi='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(sata[n]) where 0  n  13.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).

ide: not required, default: null. # A hash/dictionary of volume used as IDE hard disk or CD-ROM. C(ide='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(ide[n]) where 0  n  3.,Values allowed are - C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
cpu: not required, default: kvm64. # Specify emulated CPU type.

proxmox_template.description: management of OS templates in Proxmox VE cluster
body: proxmox_template
node: required, default: null. # Proxmox VE node, when you will operate with template
src: not required, default: null. # path to uploaded file,required only for C(state=present)
force: not required, default: false. # can be used only with C(state=present), exists template will be overwritten
api_host: required, default: undefined. # the host of the Proxmox VE cluster
api_user: required, default: undefined. # the user to authenticate with
api_password: not required, default: null. # the password to authenticate with,you can use PROXMOX_PASSWORD environment variable
storage: not required, default: local. # target storage
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the template
content_type: not required, default: vztmpl. # content type,required only for C(state=present)
timeout: not required, default: 30. # timeout for operations
validate_certs: not required, default: false. # enable / disable https certificate verification
template: not required, default: null. # the template name,required only for states C(absent), C(info)

proxysql_backend_servers.description: Adds or removes mysql hosts from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_backend_servers

status: not required, default: undefined. # ONLINE - Backend server is fully operational. OFFLINE_SOFT - When a server is put into C(OFFLINE_SOFT) mode, connections are kept in use until the current transaction is completed. This allows to gracefully detach a backend. OFFLINE_HARD - When a server is put into C(OFFLINE_HARD) mode, the existing connections are dropped, while new incoming connections aren't accepted either.
If omitted the proxysql database default for I(status) is C(ONLINE).

comment: not required, default: . # Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user. Could be a description of what the host stores, a reminder of when the host was added or disabled, or a JSON processed by some checker script.
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.

weight: not required, default: undefined. # The bigger the weight of a server relative to other weights, the higher the probability of the server being chosen from the hostgroup. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(weight) is 1.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

use_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # If I(use_ssl) is set to C(True), connections to this server will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is C(False).
port: not required, default: 3306. # The port at which the mysqld instance can be contacted.

max_connections: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of connections ProxySQL will open to this backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_connections) is 1000.
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

compression: not required, default: undefined. # If the value of I(compression) is greater than 0, new connections to that server will use compression. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(compression) is 0.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The ip address at which the mysqld instance can be contacted.
hostgroup_id: not required, default: 0. # The hostgroup in which this mysqld instance is included. An instance can be part of one or more hostgroups.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) - adds the host, when C(absent) - removes the host.

max_latency_ms: not required, default: undefined. # Ping time is monitored regularly. If a host has a ping time greater than I(max_latency_ms) it is excluded from the connection pool (although the server stays ONLINE). If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_latency_ms) is 0.

max_replication_lag: not required, default: undefined. # If greater than 0, ProxySQL will reguarly monitor replication lag. If replication lag goes above I(max_replication_lag), proxysql will temporarily shun the server until replication catches up. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_replication_lag) is 0.

proxysql_global_variables.description: Gets or sets the proxysql global variables.
body: proxysql_global_variables
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
value: not required, default: undefined. # Defines a value the variable specified using I(variable) should be set to.
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
variable: required, default: undefined. # Defines which variable should be returned, or if I(value) is specified which variable should be updated.

proxysql_manage_config.description: Writes the proxysql configuration settings between layers.
body: proxysql_manage_config
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

direction: required, default: undefined. # FROM - denotes we're reading values FROM the supplied I(config_layer) and writing to the next layer. TO - denotes we're reading from the previous layer and writing TO the supplied I(config_layer)."
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.
config_settings: required, default: undefined. # The I(config_settings) specifies which configuration we're writing.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

action: required, default: undefined. # The supplied I(action) combines with the supplied I(direction) to provide the semantics of how we want to move the I(config_settings) between the I(config_layers).
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

config_layer: required, default: undefined. # RUNTIME - represents the in-memory data structures of ProxySQL used by the threads that are handling the requests. MEMORY - (sometimes also referred as main) represents the in-memory SQLite3 database. DISK - represents the on-disk SQLite3 database. CONFIG - is the classical config file. You can only LOAD FROM the config file.

proxysql_mysql_users.description: Adds or removes mysql users from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_mysql_users
username: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.

default_hostgroup: not required, default: undefined. # If there is no matching rule for the queries sent by this user, the traffic it generates is sent to the specified hostgroup. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is 0.
frontend: not required, default: true. # If I(frontend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the mysqld servers against any hostgroup.
default_schema: not required, default: undefined. # The schema to which the connection should change to by default.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.

fast_forward: not required, default: undefined. # If I(fast_forward) is set to C(True), I(fast_forward) will bypass the query processing layer (rewriting, caching) and pass through the query directly as is to the backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(fast_forward) is C(False).
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

active: not required, default: undefined. # A user with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(active) is C(True).
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.

max_connections: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of connections ProxySQL will open to the backend for this user. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_connections) is 10000.
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

transaction_persistent: not required, default: undefined. # If this is set for the user with which the MySQL client is connecting to ProxySQL (thus a "frontend" user), transactions started within a hostgroup will remain within that hostgroup regardless of any other rules. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(transaction_persistent) is C(False).
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) - adds the user, when C(absent) - removes the user.

use_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # If I(use_ssl) is set to C(True), connections by this user will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is C(False).
backend: not required, default: true. # If I(backend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the ProxySQL instance.

proxysql_query_rules.description: Modifies query rules using the proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_query_rules
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Free form text field, usable for a descriptive comment of the query rule.

flagOUT: not required, default: undefined. # Used in combination with I(flagIN) and apply to create chains of rules. When set, I(flagOUT) signifies the I(flagIN) to be used in the next chain of rules.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
match_pattern: not required, default: undefined. # Regular expression that matches the query text. The dialect of regular expressions used is that of re2 - https://github.com/google/re2
mirror_flagOUT: not required, default: undefined. # Enables query mirroring. If set I(mirror_flagOUT) can be used to evaluates the mirrored query against the specified chain of rules.
apply: not required, default: undefined. # Used in combination with I(flagIN) and I(flagOUT) to create chains of rules. Setting apply to True signifies the last rule to be applied.
schemaname: not required, default: undefined. # Filtering criteria matching schemaname. If I(schemaname) is non-NULL, a query will match only if the connection uses schemaname as its default schema.

replace_pattern: not required, default: undefined. # This is the pattern with which to replace the matched pattern. Note that this is optional, and when omitted, the query processor will only cache, route, or set other parameters without rewriting.
digest: not required, default: undefined. # Match queries with a specific digest, as returned by stats_mysql_query_digest.digest.
match_digest: not required, default: undefined. # Regular expression that matches the query digest. The dialect of regular expressions used is that of re2 - https://github.com/google/re2
mirror_hostgroup: not required, default: undefined. # Enables query mirroring. If set I(mirror_hostgroup) can be used to mirror queries to the same or different hostgroup.
log: not required, default: undefined. # Query will be logged.

delay: not required, default: undefined. # Number of milliseconds to delay the execution of the query. This is essentially a throttling mechanism and QoS, and allows a way to give priority to queries over others. This value is added to the mysql-default_query_delay global variable that applies to all queries.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) - adds the rule, when C(absent) - removes the rule.
proxy_addr: not required, default: undefined. # Match incoming traffic on a specific local IP.
username: not required, default: undefined. # Filtering criteria matching username.  If I(username) is non-NULL, a query will match only if the connection is made with the correct username.
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.

retries: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum number of times a query needs to be re-executed in case of detected failure during the execution of the query. If retries is not specified, the global variable mysql-query_retries_on_failure applies.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

destination_hostgroup: not required, default: undefined. # Route matched queries to this hostgroup. This happens unless there is a started transaction and the logged in user has I(transaction_persistent) set to C(True) (see M(proxysql_mysql_users)).
proxy_port: not required, default: undefined. # Match incoming traffic on a specific local port.
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
active: not required, default: undefined. # A rule with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures.
cache_ttl: not required, default: undefined. # The number of milliseconds for which to cache the result of the query. Note in ProxySQL 1.1 I(cache_ttl) was in seconds.
error_msg: not required, default: undefined. # Query will be blocked, and the specified error_msg will be returned to the client.
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

negate_match_pattern: not required, default: undefined. # If I(negate_match_pattern) is set to C(True), only queries not matching the query text will be considered as a match. This acts as a NOT operator in front of the regular expression matching against match_pattern.
flagIN: not required, default: undefined. # Used in combination with I(flagOUT) and I(apply) to create chains of rules.
client_addr: not required, default: undefined. # Match traffic from a specific source.

timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum timeout in milliseconds with which the matched or rewritten query should be executed. If a query run for longer than the specific threshold, the query is automatically killed. If timeout is not specified, the global variable mysql-default_query_timeout applies.

force_delete: not required, default: false. # By default we avoid deleting more than one schedule in a single batch, however if you need this behaviour and you're not concerned about the schedules deleted, you can set I(force_delete) to C(True).
rule_id: not required, default: undefined. # The unique id of the rule. Rules are processed in rule_id order.

proxysql_replication_hostgroups.description: Manages replication hostgroups using the proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_replication_hostgroups
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user.
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
reader_hostgroup: required, default: undefined. # Id of the reader hostgroup.
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
writer_hostgroup: required, default: undefined. # Id of the writer hostgroup.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) - adds the replication hostgroup, when C(absent) - removes the replication hostgroup.
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

proxysql_scheduler.description: Adds or removes schedules from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_scheduler
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user.
config_file: not required, default: . # Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.
login_user: not required, default: None. # The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
arg2: not required, default: undefined. # Argument that can be passed to the job.
arg3: not required, default: undefined. # Argument that can be passed to the job.
arg4: not required, default: undefined. # Argument that can be passed to the job.
arg5: not required, default: undefined. # Argument that can be passed to the job.
interval_ms: not required, default: 10000. # How often (in millisecond) the job will be started. The minimum value for I(interval_ms) is 100 milliseconds.
load_to_runtime: not required, default: true. # Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.
login_password: not required, default: None. # The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
active: not required, default: true. # A schedule with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures.
login_port: not required, default: 6032. # The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

force_delete: not required, default: false. # By default we avoid deleting more than one schedule in a single batch, however if you need this behaviour and you're not concerned about the schedules deleted, you can set I(force_delete) to C(True).
save_to_disk: not required, default: true. # Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
filename: required, default: undefined. # Full path of the executable to be executed.
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present) - adds the schedule, when C(absent) - removes the schedule.
arg1: not required, default: undefined. # Argument that can be passed to the job.
login_host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
pubnub_blocks
account: not required, default: undefined. # Name of PubNub account for from which C(application) will be used to manage blocks.,User's account will be used if value not set or empty.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of managed block which will be later visible on admin.pubnub.com.
keyset: required, default: undefined. # Name of application's keys set which is bound to managed blocks.
changes: not required, default: [object Object]. # List of fields which should be changed by block itself (doesn't affect any event handlers).,Possible options for change is: C(name).

cache: not required, default: [object Object]. # In case if single play use blocks management module few times it is preferred to enabled 'caching' by making previous module to share gathered artifacts and pass them to this parameter.
application: required, default: undefined. # Name of target PubNub application for which blocks configuration on specific C(keyset) will be done.
state: not required, default: started. # Intended block state after event handlers creation / update process will be completed.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password which match to account to which specified C(email) belong.,Not required if C(cache) contains result of previous module call (in same play).

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # This key allow to try skip certificates check when performing REST API calls. Sometimes host may have issues with certificates on it and this will cause problems to call PubNub REST API.,If check should be ignored C(False) should be passed to this parameter.
email: not required, default: undefined. # Email from account for which new session should be started.,Not required if C(cache) contains result of previous module call (in same play).

event_handlers: not required, default: . # List of event handlers which should be updated for specified block C(name).,Each entry for new event handler should contain: C(name), C(src), C(channels), C(event). C(name) used as event handler name which can be used later to make changes to it.,C(src) is full path to file with event handler code.,C(channels) is name of channel from which event handler is waiting for events.,C(event) is type of event which is able to trigger event handler: I(js-before-publish), I(js-after-publish), I(js-after-presence).,Each entry for existing handlers should contain C(name) (so target handler can be identified). Rest parameters (C(src), C(channels) and C(event)) can be added if changes required for them.,It is possible to rename event handler by adding C(changes) key to event handler payload and pass dictionary, which will contain single key C(name), where new name should be passed.,To remove particular event handler it is possible to set C(state) for it to C(absent) and it will be removed.

description: not required, default: New block. # Short block description which will be later visible on admin.pubnub.com. Used only if block doesn't exists and won't change description for existing block.

pulp_repo.description: Add or remove Pulp repos from a remote host.
body: pulp_repo
feed: not required, default: null. # Upstream feed URL to receive updates from.
repo_type: not required, default: rpm. # Repo plugin type to use (i.e. C(rpm), C(docker)).
pulp_host: not required, default: http://127.0.0.1. # URL of the pulp server to connect to.
relative_url: required, default: null. # Relative URL for the local repository.

force_basic_auth: not required, default: no. # httplib2, the library used by the M(uri) module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.

importer_ssl_client_cert: not required, default: null. # Certificate used as the client certificate when synchronizing the repository. This is used to communicate authentication information to the feed source. The value to this option must be the full path to the certificate. The specified file may be the certificate itself or a single file containing both the certificate and private key. This can be the file content or the path to the file.
proxy_port: not required, default: null. # Proxy port setting for the pulp repository importer.
serve_http: not required, default: false. # Make the repo available over HTTP.
wait_for_completion: not required, default: no. # Wait for asynchronous tasks to complete before returning.
add_export_distributor: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to add the export distributor to new C(rpm) repositories.

url_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API. If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

importer_ssl_client_key: not required, default: null. # Private key to the certificate specified in I(importer_ssl_client_cert), assuming it is not included in the certificate file itself. This can be the file content or the path to the file.
publish_distributor: not required, default: undefined. # Distributor to use when state is C(publish). The default is to publish all distributors.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the repo to add or remove. This correlates to repo-id in Pulp.
proxy_host: not required, default: null. # Proxy url setting for the pulp repository importer. This is in the format scheme://host.

state: not required, default: present. # The repo state. A state of C(sync) will queue a sync of the repo. This is asynchronous but not delayed like a scheduled sync. A state of C(publish) will use the repository's distributor to publish the content.
serve_https: not required, default: true. # Make the repo available over HTTPS.
importer_ssl_ca_cert: not required, default: null. # CA certificate string used to validate the feed source SSL certificate. This can be the file content or the path to the file.
url_username: not required, default: undefined. # The username for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
puppet
logdest: not required, default: stdout. # Where the puppet logs should go, if puppet apply is being used
execute: not required, default: None. # Execute a specific piece of Puppet code. It has no effect with a puppetmaster.
facter_basename: not required, default: ansible. # Basename of the facter output file
tags: not required, default: None. # A comma-separated list of puppet tags to be used.
puppetmaster: not required, default: None. # The hostname of the puppetmaster to contact.
certname: not required, default: None. # The name to use when handling certificates.
manifest: not required, default: None. # Path to the manifest file to run puppet apply on.
environment: not required, default: None. # Puppet environment to be used.
timeout: not required, default: 30m. # How long to wait for I(puppet) to finish.
facts: not required, default: None. # A dict of values to pass in as persistent external facter facts
modulepath: not required, default: None. # Path to an alternate location for puppet modules

purefa_hg.description: Manage hostgroups on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_hg
volume: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing volumes to add to hostgroup.
state: not required, default: present. # Define whether the hostgroup should exist or not.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
host: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing hosts to add to hostgroup.
hostgroup: required, default: undefined. # The name of the hostgroup.
fa_url: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.

purefa_host.description: Manage hosts on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_host
protocol: not required, default: iscsi. # Defines the host connection protocol for volumes.
host: required, default: undefined. # The name of the host.
volume: not required, default: undefined. # Volume name to map to the host.
state: not required, default: present. # Define whether the host should exist or not.,When removing host all connected volumes will be disconnected.
iqn: not required, default: undefined. # List of IQNs of the host if protocol is iscsi.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
wwns: not required, default: undefined. # List of wwns of the host if protocol is fc.
fa_url: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.

purefa_pg.description: Manage protection groups on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_pg
pgroup: required, default: undefined. # The name of the protection group.
enabled: not required, default: yes. # Define whether to enabled snapshots for the protection group.
state: not required, default: present. # Define whether the protection group should exist or not.
hostgroup: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing hostgroups to add to protection group.
volume: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing volumes to add to protection group.
host: not required, default: undefined. # List of existing hosts to add to protection group.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
eradicate: not required, default: no. # Define whether to eradicate the protection group on delete and leave in trash.
fa_url: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.

purefa_snap.description: Manage volume snapshots on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_snap
suffix: not required, default: undefined. # Suffix of snapshot name.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the source volume.
state: not required, default: present. # Define whether the volume snapshot should exist or not.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
eradicate: not required, default: no. # Define whether to eradicate the snapshot on delete or leave in trash.
target: not required, default: undefined. # Name of target volume if creating from snapshot.
overwrite: not required, default: no. # Define whether to overwrite existing volume when creating from snapshot.
fa_url: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.

purefa_volume.description: Manage volumes on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_volume
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the volume.
eradicate: not required, default: no. # Define whether to eradicate the volume on delete or leave in trash.
state: not required, default: present. # Define whether the volume should exist or not.
api_token: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
size: not required, default: undefined. # Volume size in M, G, T or P units.
target: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the target volume, if copying.
overwrite: not required, default: no. # Define whether to overwrite a target volume if it already exisits.
fa_url: required, default: undefined. # FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
pushbullet
body: not required, default: undefined. # Body of the notification, e.g. Details of the fault you're alerting.
title: required, default: undefined. # Title of the notification.
device: not required, default: null. # The device NAME you wish to send a push notification, as seen on the Pushbullet main page.
push_type: not required, default: note. # Thing you wish to push.
api_key: required, default: undefined. # Push bullet API token
channel: not required, default: null. # The channel TAG you wish to broadcast a push notification, as seen on the "My Channels" > "Edit your channel" at Pushbullet page.
pushover
msg: required, default: undefined. # What message you wish to send.
user_key: required, default: undefined. # Pushover issued authentication key for your user.
app_token: required, default: undefined. # Pushover issued token identifying your pushover app.
pri: not required, default: undefined. # Message priority (see U(https://pushover.net) for details.)
rabbitmq_binding
login_port: not required, default: 15672. # rabbitMQ management api port
name: required, default: undefined. # source exchange to create binding on
login_user: not required, default: guest. # rabbitMQ user for connection
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # rabbitMQ host for connection
destination: required, default: undefined. # destination exchange or queue for the binding
routing_key: not required, default: #. # routing key for the binding,default is
vhost: not required, default: /. # rabbitMQ virtual host,default vhost is /
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the exchange should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
arguments: not required, default: [object Object]. # extra arguments for exchange. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
login_password: not required, default: false. # rabbitMQ password for connection
destination_type: required, default: undefined. # Either queue or exchange
rabbitmq_exchange
login_port: not required, default: 15672. # rabbitMQ management api port
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the exchange to create
login_user: not required, default: guest. # rabbitMQ user for connection
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # rabbitMQ host for connection
durable: not required, default: true. # whether exchange is durable or not
exchange_type: not required, default: direct. # type for the exchange
vhost: not required, default: /. # rabbitMQ virtual host
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the exchange should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
internal: not required, default: false. # exchange is available only for other exchanges
arguments: not required, default: [object Object]. # extra arguments for exchange. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
login_password: not required, default: false. # rabbitMQ password for connection
auto_delete: not required, default: false. # if the exchange should delete itself after all queues/exchanges unbound from it

rabbitmq_parameter.description: Adds or removes parameters to RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_parameter
node: not required, default: rabbit. # erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure
vhost: not required, default: /. # vhost to apply access privileges.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify if user is to be added or removed
name: required, default: null. # Name of the parameter being set
component: required, default: null. # Name of the component of which the parameter is being set
value: not required, default: null. # Value of the parameter, as a JSON term
rabbitmq_plugin
state: not required, default: enabled. # Specify if plugins are to be enabled or disabled.
new_only: not required, default: no. # Only enable missing plugins.,Does not disable plugins that are not in the names list.
prefix: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a custom install prefix to a Rabbit.
names: required, default: undefined. # Comma-separated list of plugin names.

rabbitmq_policy.description: Manage the state of policies in RabbitMQ.
body: rabbitmq_policy
node: not required, default: rabbit. # Erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure.
name: required, default: null. # The name of the policy to manage.
tags: required, default: null. # A dict or string describing the policy.
pattern: required, default: null. # A regex of queues to apply the policy to.
priority: not required, default: 0. # The priority of the policy.
vhost: not required, default: /. # The name of the vhost to apply to.
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the policy.
apply_to: not required, default: all. # What the policy applies to. Requires RabbitMQ 3.2.0 or later.
rabbitmq_queue
login_port: not required, default: 15672. # rabbitMQ management api port
dead_letter_exchange: not required, default: None. # Optional name of an exchange to which messages will be republished if they,are rejected or expire
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the queue to create
durable: not required, default: true. # whether queue is durable or not
login_user: not required, default: guest. # rabbitMQ user for connection
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # rabbitMQ host for connection
login_password: not required, default: false. # rabbitMQ password for connection
vhost: not required, default: /. # rabbitMQ virtual host
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the queue should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
max_length: not required, default: no limit. # How many messages can the queue contain before it starts rejecting
arguments: not required, default: [object Object]. # extra arguments for queue. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
message_ttl: not required, default: forever. # How long a message can live in queue before it is discarded (milliseconds)
auto_expires: not required, default: forever. # How long a queue can be unused before it is automatically deleted (milliseconds)
dead_letter_routing_key: not required, default: None. # Optional replacement routing key to use when a message is dead-lettered.,Original routing key will be used if unset
auto_delete: not required, default: false. # if the queue should delete itself after all queues/queues unbound from it

rabbitmq_user.description: Adds or removes users to RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_user
node: not required, default: rabbit. # erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure
force: not required, default: no. # Deletes and recreates the user.
tags: not required, default: null. # User tags specified as comma delimited

read_priv: not required, default: ^$. # Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.

write_priv: not required, default: ^$. # Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify if user is to be added or removed
user: required, default: null. # Name of user to add

configure_priv: not required, default: ^$. # Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
vhost: not required, default: /. # vhost to apply access privileges.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
password: not required, default: null. # Password of user to add.,To change the password of an existing user, you must also specify C(force=yes).

permissions: not required, default: . # a list of dicts, each dict contains vhost, configure_priv, write_priv, and read_priv, and represents a permission rule for that vhost.,This option should be preferable when you care about all permissions of the user.,You should use vhost, configure_priv, write_priv, and read_priv options instead if you care about permissions for just some vhosts.

rabbitmq_vhost.description: Manage the state of a virtual host in RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_vhost
node: not required, default: rabbit. # erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure
tracing: not required, default: no. # Enable/disable tracing for a vhost
state: not required, default: present. # The state of vhost
name: required, default: null. # The name of the vhost to manage

raw.description: Executes a low-down and dirty SSH command
body: raw
free_form: required, default: undefined. # the raw module takes a free form command to run. There is no parameter actually named 'free form'; see the examples!

executable: not required, default: undefined. # change the shell used to execute the command. Should be an absolute path to the executable.,when using privilege escalation (C(become)), a default shell will be assigned if one is not provided as privilege escalation requires a shell.

rax.description: create / delete an instance in Rackspace Public Cloud
body: rax
files: not required, default: null. # Files to insert into the instance. remotefilename:localcontent
tenant_name: not required, default: undefined. # The tenant name used for authentication.
image: not required, default: null. # image to use for the instance. Can be an C(id), C(human_id) or C(name). With I(boot_from_volume), a Cloud Block Storage volume will be created with this image
user_data: not required, default: undefined. # Data to be uploaded to the servers config drive. This option implies I(config_drive). Can be a file path or a string
verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
meta: not required, default: null. # A hash of metadata to associate with the instance
boot_volume_terminate: not required, default: false. # Whether the I(boot_volume) or newly created volume from I(image) will be terminated when the server is terminated
flavor: not required, default: null. # flavor to use for the instance

networks: not required, default: public,private. # The network to attach to the instances. If specified, you must include ALL networks including the public and private interfaces. Can be C(id) or C(label).
auth_endpoint: not required, default: https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/. # The URI of the authentication service.

boot_from_volume: not required, default: no. # Whether or not to boot the instance from a Cloud Block Storage volume. If C(yes) and I(image) is specified a new volume will be created at boot time. I(boot_volume_size) is required with I(image) to create a new volume at boot time.
group: not required, default: undefined. # host group to assign to server, is also used for idempotent operations to ensure a specific number of instances

exact_count: not required, default: false. # Explicitly ensure an exact count of instances, used with state=active/present. If specified as C(yes) and I(count) is less than the servers matched, servers will be deleted to match the count. If the number of matched servers is fewer than specified in I(count) additional servers will be added.
disk_config: not required, default: auto. # Disk partitioning strategy
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
env: not required, default: undefined. # Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
key_name: not required, default: null. # key pair to use on the instance
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
config_drive: not required, default: false. # Attach read-only configuration drive to server as label config-2
username: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
auto_increment: not required, default: true. # Whether or not to increment a single number with the name of the created servers. Only applicable when used with the I(group) attribute or meta key.
count_offset: not required, default: 1. # number count to start at
boot_volume: not required, default: undefined. # Cloud Block Storage ID or Name to use as the boot volume of the instance
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
instance_ids: not required, default: undefined. # list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances
credentials: not required, default: null. # File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
wait: not required, default: no. # wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
count: not required, default: 1. # number of instances to launch
boot_volume_size: not required, default: 100. # Size of the volume to create in Gigabytes. This is only required with I(image) and I(boot_from_volume).
name: not required, default: null. # Name to give the instance
identity_type: not required, default: rackspace. # Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
tenant_id: not required, default: undefined. # The tenant ID used for authentication.
region: not required, default: DFW. # Region to create an instance in.

extra_client_args: not required, default: undefined. # A hash of key/value pairs to be used when creating the cloudservers client. This is considered an advanced option, use it wisely and with caution.
extra_create_args: not required, default: undefined. # A hash of key/value pairs to be used when creating a new server. This is considered an advanced option, use it wisely and with caution.

rax_cbs.description: Manipulate Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Volumes

username: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).

meta: not required, default: null. # A hash of metadata to associate with the volume
snapshot_id: not required, default: null. # The id of the snapshot to create the volume from

image: not required, default: null. # image to use for bootable volumes. Can be an C(id), C(human_id) or C(name). This option requires C(pyrax>=1.9.3)
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
auth_endpoint: not required, default: https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/. # The URI of the authentication service.

rax_clb_ssl.description: Manage SSL termination for a Rackspace Cloud Load Balancer.
body: rax_clb_ssl
username: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
private_key: not required, default: undefined. # The private SSL key as a string in PEM format.

https_redirect: not required, default: undefined. # If "true", the load balancer will redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS.,Requires "secure_traffic_only" to be true. Incurs an implicit wait if SSL,termination is also applied or removed.
verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long before "wait" gives up, in seconds.
credentials: not required, default: null. # File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
wait: not required, default: false. # Wait for the balancer to be in state "running" before turning.
certificate: not required, default: undefined. # The public SSL certificates as a string in PEM format.
region: not required, default: DFW. # Region to create an instance in.
enabled: not required, default: true. # If set to "false", temporarily disable SSL termination without discarding,existing credentials.
state: not required, default: present. # If set to "present", SSL termination will be added to this load balancer.,If "absent", SSL termination will be removed instead.
intermediate_certificate: not required, default: undefined. # One or more intermediate certificate authorities as a string in PEM,format, concatenated into a single string.
secure_port: not required, default: 443. # The port to listen for secure traffic.
secure_traffic_only: not required, default: false. # If "true", the load balancer will *only* accept secure traffic.
env: not required, default: undefined. # Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
loadbalancer: required, default: undefined. # Name or ID of the load balancer on which to manage SSL termination.

rax_dns_record.description: Manage DNS records on Rackspace Cloud DNS
body: rax_dns_record
username: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Brief description of the domain. Maximum length of 160 characters
domain: not required, default: undefined. # Domain name to create the record in. This is an invalid option when type=PTR
verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.

overwrite: not required, default: true. # Add new records if data doesn't match, instead of updating existing record with matching name. If there are already multiple records with matching name and overwrite=true, this module will fail.
name: required, default: undefined. # FQDN record name to create

priority: not required, default: undefined. # Required for MX and SRV records, but forbidden for other record types. If specified, must be an integer from 0 to 65535.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource
env: not required, default: undefined. # Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
type: required, default: undefined. # DNS record type
loadbalancer: not required, default: undefined. # Load Balancer ID to create a PTR record for. Only used with type=PTR

body: rax_mon_alarm

criteria: not required, default: undefined. # Alarm DSL that describes alerting conditions and their output states. Must be between 1 and 16384 characters long. See http://docs.rackspace.com/cm/api/v1.0/cm-devguide/content/alerts-language.html for a reference on the alerting language.
state: not required, default: present. # Ensure that the alarm with this C(label) exists or does not exist.
label: required, default: undefined. # Friendly name for this alarm, used to achieve idempotence. Must be a String between 1 and 255 characters long.
disabled: not required, default: undefined. # If yes, create this alarm, but leave it in an inactive state. Defaults to no.
check_id: required, default: undefined. # ID of the check that should be alerted on. May be acquired by registering the value of a rax_mon_check task.
verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
env: not required, default: undefined. # Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
tenant_name: not required, default: undefined. # The tenant name used for authentication.

auth_endpoint: not required, default: https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/. # The URI of the authentication service.

rax_mon_check.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring check for an existing entity.
body: rax_mon_check
username: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
entity_id: required, default: undefined. # ID of the rax_mon_entity to target with this check.

check_type: required, default: undefined. # The type of check to create. C(remote.) checks may be created on any rax_mon_entity. C(agent.) checks may only be created on rax_mon_entities that have a non-null C(agent_id).
tenant_name: not required, default: undefined. # The tenant name used for authentication.
period: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds between each time the check is performed. Must be greater than the minimum period set on your account.
disabled: not required, default: undefined. # If "yes", ensure the check is created, but don't actually use it yet.
verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
credentials: not required, default: null. # File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
auth_endpoint: not required, default: https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/. # The URI of the authentication service.
timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds this check will wait when attempting to collect results. Must be less than the period.

target_alias: not required, default: undefined. # One of `target_alias` and `target_hostname` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. Use the corresponding key in the entity's `ip_addresses` hash to resolve an IP address to target.
identity_type: not required, default: rackspace. # Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
tenant_id: not required, default: undefined. # The tenant ID used for authentication.
region: not required, default: DFW. # Region to create an instance in.

target_hostname: not required, default: undefined. # One of `target_hostname` and `target_alias` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. The hostname this check should target. Must be a valid IPv4, IPv6, or FQDN.
label: required, default: undefined. # Defines a label for this check, between 1 and 64 characters long.
state: not required, default: undefined. # Ensure that a check with this C(label) exists or does not exist.

details: not required, default: undefined. # Additional details specific to the check type. Must be a hash of strings between 1 and 255 characters long, or an array or object containing 0 to 256 items.
env: not required, default: undefined. # Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).

monitoring_zones_poll: not required, default: undefined. # Comma-separated list of the names of the monitoring zones the check should run from. Available monitoring zones include mzdfw, mzhkg, mziad, mzlon, mzord and mzsyd. Required for remote.* checks; prohibited for agent.* checks.
api_key: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
metadata: not required, default: undefined. # Hash of arbitrary key-value pairs to accompany this check if it fires. Keys and values must be strings between 1 and 255 characters long.
