verify_ssl: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
cooldown: not required, default: undefined. # The period of time, in seconds, that must pass before any scaling can occur after the previous scaling. Must be an integer between 0 and 86400 (24 hrs).
at: not required, default: undefined. # The UTC time when this policy will be executed. The time must be formatted according to C(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS) such as C(2013-05-19T08:07:08Z)
credentials: not required, default: null. # File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.

is_percent: not required, default: false. # Whether the value in I(change) is a percent value
name: required, default: undefined. # Name to give the policy
region: not required, default: DFW. # Region to create an instance in.
desired_capacity: not required, default: undefined. # The desired server capacity of the scaling the group; that is, how many servers should be in the scaling group.
state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the resource

api_key: not required, default: undefined. # Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).

rds.description: create, delete, or modify an Amazon rds instance
body: rds
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
db_engine: not required, default: null. # The type of database.  Used only when command=create.,mariadb was added in version 2.2
iops: not required, default: null. # Specifies the number of IOPS for the instance.  Used only when command=create or command=modify. Must be an integer greater than 1000.
backup_window: not required, default: null. # Backup window in format of hh24:mi-hh24:mi.  If not specified then a random backup window is assigned. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

backup_retention: not required, default: null. # Number of days backups are retained.  Set to 0 to disable backups.  Default is 1 day.  Valid range: 0-35. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

port: not required, default: 3306 for mysql, 1521 for Oracle, 1433 for SQL Server, 5432 for PostgreSQL.. # Port number that the DB instance uses for connections. Used only when command=create or command=replicate.,Prior to 2.0 it always defaults to null and the API would use 3306, it had to be set to other DB default values when not using MySql. Starting at 2.0 it automatically defaults to what is expected for each C(db_engine).
security_groups: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of one or more security groups.  Used only when command=create or command=modify.
size: not required, default: null. # Size in gigabytes of the initial storage for the DB instance. Used only when command=create or command=modify.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: undefined. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
subnet: not required, default: null. # VPC subnet group.  If specified then a VPC instance is created. Used only when command=create.

vpc_security_groups: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of one or more vpc security group ids. Also requires `subnet` to be specified. Used only when command=create or command=modify.
upgrade: not required, default: false. # Indicates that minor version upgrades should be applied automatically. Used only when command=create or command=replicate.
zone: not required, default: null. # availability zone in which to launch the instance. Used only when command=create, command=replicate or command=restore.

instance_type: not required, default: null. # The instance type of the database.  Must be specified when command=create. Optional when command=replicate, command=modify or command=restore. If not specified then the replica inherits the same instance type as the source instance.
source_instance: not required, default: null. # Name of the database to replicate. Used only when command=replicate.

parameter_group: not required, default: null. # Name of the DB parameter group to associate with this instance.  If omitted then the RDS default DBParameterGroup will be used. Used only when command=create or command=modify.
command: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the action to take. The 'reboot' option is available starting at version 2.0

multi_zone: not required, default: null. # Specifies if this is a Multi-availability-zone deployment. Can not be used in conjunction with zone parameter. Used only when command=create or command=modify.
new_instance_name: not required, default: null. # Name to rename an instance to. Used only when command=modify.
username: not required, default: null. # Master database username. Used only when command=create.
tags: not required, default: null. # tags dict to apply to a resource. Used with command=create, command=replicate, command=restore. Requires boto >= 2.26.0
db_name: not required, default: null. # Name of a database to create within the instance.  If not specified then no database is created. Used only when command=create.
license_model: not required, default: null. # The license model for this DB instance. Used only when command=create or command=restore.
password: not required, default: null. # Password for the master database username. Used only when command=create or command=modify.

apply_immediately: not required, default: false. # Used only when command=modify.  If enabled, the modifications will be applied as soon as possible rather than waiting for the next preferred maintenance window.

wait: not required, default: no. # When command=create, replicate, modify or restore then wait for the database to enter the 'available' state.  When command=delete wait for the database to be terminated.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
force_failover: not required, default: no. # Used only when command=reboot.  If enabled, the reboot is done using a MultiAZ failover.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
region: required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.
option_group: not required, default: null. # The name of the option group to use.  If not specified then the default option group is used. Used only when command=create.
engine_version: not required, default: null. # Version number of the database engine to use. Used only when command=create. If not specified then the current Amazon RDS default engine version is used
instance_name: not required, default: null. # Database instance identifier. Required except when using command=facts or command=delete on just a snapshot
character_set_name: not required, default: null. # Associate the DB instance with a specified character set. Used with command=create.
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds

snapshot: not required, default: null. # Name of snapshot to take. When command=delete, if no snapshot name is provided then no snapshot is taken. If used with command=delete with no instance_name, the snapshot is deleted. Used with command=facts, command=delete or command=snapshot.
publicly_accessible: not required, default: null. # explicitly set whether the resource should be publicly accessible or not. Used with command=create, command=replicate. Requires boto >= 2.26.0

maint_window: not required, default: null. # Maintenance window in format of ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi.  (Example: Mon:22:00-Mon:23:15) If not specified then a random maintenance window is assigned. Used only when command=create or command=modify.
rds_param_group
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Database parameter group identifier.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
tags: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary of tags to attach to the parameter group
purge_tags: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not to remove tags that do not appear in the I(tags) list. Defaults to false.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
immediate: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to apply the changes immediately, or after the next reboot of any associated instances.
engine: not required, default: undefined. # The type of database for this group. Required for state=present.
state: required, default: present. # Specifies whether the group should be present or absent.

params: not required, default: undefined. # Map of parameter names and values. Numeric values may be represented as K for kilo (1024), M for mega (1024^2), G for giga (1024^3), or T for tera (1024^4), and these values will be expanded into the appropriate number before being set in the parameter group.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Database parameter group description. Only set when a new group is added.
rds_subnet_group
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: null. # Database subnet group identifier.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
subnets: not required, default: null. # List of subnet IDs that make up the database subnet group.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: required, default: present. # Specifies whether the subnet should be present or absent.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
description: not required, default: null. # Database subnet group description. Only set when a new group is added.

redhat_subscription.description: Manage registration and subscriptions to RHSM using the C(subscription-manager) command
body: redhat_subscription
username: not required, default: null. # access.redhat.com or Sat6  username
server_hostname: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify an alternative Red Hat Subscription Management or Sat6 server

pool_ids: not required, default: . # Specify subscription pool IDs to consume. Prefer over I(pool) when possible as it is much faster.
A pool ID may be specified as a C(string) - just the pool ID (ex. C(0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef)),
or as a C(dict) with the pool ID as the key, and a quantity as the value (ex.
C(0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef: 2). If the quantity is provided, it is used to consume multiple
entitlements from a pool (the pool must support this). Mutually exclusive with I(pool).

consumer_id: not required, default: null. # References an existing consumer ID to resume using a previous registration
for this system. If the  system's identity certificate is lost or corrupted,
this option allows it to resume using its previous identity and subscriptions.
The default is to not specify a consumer ID so a new ID is created.
server_insecure: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Enable or disable https server certificate verification when connecting to C(server_hostname)
activationkey: not required, default: null. # supply an activation key for use with registration
server_proxy_password: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify a password for HTTP proxy with basic authentication
consumer_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the system to register, defaults to the hostname
rhsm_baseurl: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify CDN baseurl

pool: not required, default: ^$. # Specify a subscription pool name to consume.  Regular expressions accepted. Use I(pool_ids) instead if
possible, as it is much faster. Mutually exclusive with I(pool_ids).
server_proxy_port: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify a HTTP proxy port
password: not required, default: null. # access.redhat.com or Sat6 password
consumer_type: not required, default: null. # The type of unit to register, defaults to system
org_id: not required, default: null. # Organization ID to use in conjunction with activationkey
environment: not required, default: null. # Register with a specific environment in the destination org. Used with Red Hat Satellite 6.x or Katello
force_register: not required, default: false. # Register the system even if it is already registered
state: not required, default: present. # whether to register and subscribe (C(present)), or unregister (C(absent)) a system
server_proxy_user: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify a user for HTTP proxy with basic authentication
server_proxy_hostname: not required, default: Current value from C(/etc/rhsm/rhsm.conf) is the default. # Specify a HTTP proxy hostname
autosubscribe: not required, default: false. # Upon successful registration, auto-consume available subscriptions

redis.description: Various redis commands, slave and flush
body: redis
login_port: not required, default: 6379. # The port to connect to
name: not required, default: null. # A redis config key.
flush_mode: not required, default: all. # Type of flush (all the dbs in a redis instance or a specific one) [flush command]
master_host: not required, default: null. # The host of the master instance [slave command]
login_host: not required, default: localhost. # The host running the database
master_port: not required, default: null. # The port of the master instance [slave command]
db: not required, default: null. # The database to flush (used in db mode) [flush command]
value: not required, default: null. # A redis config value.
command: required, default: null. # The selected redis command
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with (usually not used)
slave_mode: not required, default: slave. # the mode of the redis instance [slave command]

redshift.description: create, delete, or modify an Amazon Redshift instance
body: redshift
cluster_parameter_group_name: not required, default: null. # name of the cluster parameter group
username: not required, default: undefined. # Master database username. Used only when command=create.
availability_zone: not required, default: undefined. # availability zone in which to launch cluster
encrypted: not required, default: false. # if the cluster is encrypted or not
node_type: not required, default: undefined. # The node type of the cluster. Must be specified when command=create.
publicly_accessible: not required, default: false. # if the cluster is accessible publicly or not

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
port: not required, default: null. # which port the cluster is listining
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
allow_version_upgrade: not required, default: true. # flag to determinate if upgrade of version is possible
cluster_type: not required, default: single-node. # The type of cluster.

final_cluster_snapshot_identifier: not required, default: null. # identifier of the final snapshot to be created before deleting the cluster. If this parameter is provided, final_cluster_snapshot_identifier must be false. Used only when command=delete.
vpc_security_group_ids: not required, default: null. # VPC security group
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
new_cluster_identifier: not required, default: null. # Only used when command=modify.
number_of_nodes: not required, default: null. # Number of nodes. Only used when cluster_type=multi-node.
cluster_version: not required, default: null. # which version the cluster should have
db_name: not required, default: null. # Name of the database.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Master database password. Used only when command=create.
cluster_subnet_group_name: not required, default: undefined. # which subnet to place the cluster
wait: not required, default: no. # When command=create, modify or restore then wait for the database to enter the 'available' state. When command=delete wait for the database to be terminated.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
cluster_security_groups: not required, default: null. # in which security group the cluster belongs
elastic_ip: not required, default: null. # if the cluster has an elastic IP or not
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # how long before wait gives up, in seconds
command: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the action to take.
automated_snapshot_retention_period: not required, default: null. # period when the snapshot take place
identifier: required, default: undefined. # Redshift cluster identifier.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
skip_final_cluster_snapshot: not required, default: false. # skip a final snapshot before deleting the cluster. Used only when command=delete.
preferred_maintenance_window: not required, default: null. # maintenance window
redshift_facts
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

cluster_identifier: not required, default: undefined. # The prefix of cluster identifier of the Redshift cluster you are searching for.,This is a regular expression match with implicit '^'. Append '$' for a complete match.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
tags: not required, default: undefined. # A dictionary/hash of tags in the format { tag1_name: 'tag1_value', tag2_name: 'tag2_value' } to match against the security group(s) you are searching for.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
redshift_subnet_group
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
group_subnets: not required, default: null. # List of subnet IDs that make up the cluster subnet group.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

replace.description: Replace all instances of a particular string in a file using a back-referenced regular expression.
body: replace
encoding: not required, default: utf-8. # The character encoding for reading and writing the file.
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

after: not required, default: undefined. # If specified, the line after the replace/remove will start. Can be used in combination with C(before). Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).

replace: not required, default: undefined. # The string to replace regexp matches. May contain backreferences that will get expanded with the regexp capture groups if the regexp matches. If not set, matches are removed entirely.

regexp: required, default: undefined. # The regular expression to look for in the contents of the file. Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html). Uses MULTILINE mode, which means C(^) and C($) match the beginning and end of the file, as well as the beginning and end respectively of I(each line) of the file.,Does not use DOTALL, which means the C(.) special character matches any character I(except newlines). A common mistake is to assume that a negated character set like C([^#]) will also not match newlines. In order to exclude newlines, they must be added to the set like C([^#\n]).,Note that, as of ansible 2, short form tasks should have any escape sequences backslash-escaped in order to prevent them being parsed as string literal escapes. See the examples.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
follow: not required, default: no. # This flag indicates that filesystem links, if they exist, should be followed.

validate: not required, default: None. # The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

before: not required, default: undefined. # If specified, the line before the replace/remove will occur. Can be used in combination with C(after). Uses Python regular expressions; see U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
path: required, default: undefined. # The file to modify.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
others: not required, default: undefined. # All arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here.
rhevm
vmhost: not required, default: undefined. # The host you wish your VM to run on.
vmmem: not required, default: 1. # The amount of memory you want your VM to use (in GB).
cd_drive: not required, default: null. # The CD you wish to have mounted on the VM when I(state = 'CD').
image: not required, default: null. # The template to use for the VM.
cpu_share: not required, default: 0. # This parameter is used to configure the cpu share.
insecure_api: not required, default: false. # A boolean switch to make a secure or insecure connection to the server.
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # The rhev/ovirt cluster in which you want you VM to start.
user: not required, default: admin@internal. # The user to authenticate with.
port: not required, default: 443. # The port on which the API is reacheable.
vm_ha: not required, default: true. # To make your VM High Available.
disks: not required, default: undefined. # This option uses complex arguments and is a list of disks with the options name, size and domain.
datacenter: not required, default: Default. # The rhev/ovirt datacenter in which you want you VM to start.
name: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the VM.
ifaces: not required, default: undefined. # This option uses complex arguments and is a list of interfaces with the options name and vlan.
server: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # The name/ip of your RHEV-m/oVirt instance.
state: not required, default: present. # This serves to create/remove/update or powermanage your VM.
osver: not required, default: rhel_6x64. # The operationsystem option in RHEV/oVirt.
mempol: not required, default: 1. # The minimum amount of memory you wish to reserve for this system.
timeout: not required, default: null. # The timeout you wish to define for power actions.,When I(state = 'up'),When I(state = 'down'),When I(state = 'restarted')
del_prot: not required, default: true. # This option sets the delete protection checkbox.
boot_order: not required, default: network,hd. # This option uses complex arguments and is a list of items that specify the bootorder.
type: not required, default: server. # To define if the VM is a server or desktop.
vmcpu: not required, default: 2. # The number of CPUs you want in your VM.

riak.description: This module handles some common Riak operations
body: riak
target_node: not required, default: riak@127.0.0.1. # The target node for certain operations (join, ping)
config_dir: not required, default: /etc/riak. # The path to the riak configuration directory
wait_for_service: not required, default: None. # Waits for a riak service to come online before continuing.
http_conn: not required, default: 127.0.0.1:8098. # The ip address and port that is listening for Riak HTTP queries
wait_for_ring: not required, default: null. # Number of seconds to wait for all nodes to agree on the ring.
wait_for_handoffs: not required, default: null. # Number of seconds to wait for handoffs to complete.
command: not required, default: null. # The command you would like to perform against the cluster.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
rocketchat
username: not required, default: Ansible. # This is the sender of the message.
domain: required, default: undefined. # The domain for your environment without protocol. (i.e. C(example.com) or C(chat.example.com))
protocol: not required, default: https. # Specify the protocol used to send notification messages before the webhook url. (i.e. http or https)
attachments: not required, default: None. # Define a list of attachments.
color: not required, default: normal. # Allow text to use default colors - use the default of 'normal' to not send a custom color bar at the start of the message
icon_url: not required, default: https://www.ansible.com/favicon.ico. # URL for the message sender's icon.
token: required, default: undefined. # Rocket Chat Incoming Webhook integration token.  This provides authentication to Rocket Chat's Incoming webhook for posting messages.

icon_emoji: not required, default: None. # Emoji for the message sender. The representation for the available emojis can be got from Rocket Chat. (for example :thumbsup:) (if I(icon_emoji) is set, I(icon_url) will not be used)
link_names: not required, default: 1. # Automatically create links for channels and usernames in I(msg).
msg: not required, default: None. # Message to be sent.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
channel: not required, default: None. # Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the channel selected for the I(token) specified during the creation of webhook.
rollbar_deployment
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Deploy comment (e.g. what is being deployed).
rollbar_user: not required, default: undefined. # Rollbar username of the user who deployed.
url: not required, default: https://api.rollbar.com/api/1/deploy/. # Optional URL to submit the notification to.
environment: required, default: undefined. # Name of the environment being deployed, e.g. 'production'.
token: required, default: undefined. # Your project access token.
user: not required, default: undefined. # User who deployed.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
revision: required, default: undefined. # Revision number/sha being deployed.

route53.description: add or delete entries in Amazons Route53 DNS service
body: route53
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
health_check: not required, default: null. # Health check to associate with this record

weight: not required, default: null. # Weighted resource record sets only. Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines what portion of traffic for the current resource record set is routed to the associated location.
ttl: not required, default: 3600 (one hour). # The TTL to give the new record
hosted_zone_id: not required, default: null. # The Hosted Zone ID of the DNS zone to modify
wait_timeout: not required, default: 300. # How long to wait for the changes to be replicated, in seconds.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
overwrite: not required, default: null. # Whether an existing record should be overwritten on create if values do not match
wait: not required, default: false. # Wait until the changes have been replicated to all Amazon Route 53 DNS servers.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

identifier: not required, default: null. # Have to be specified for Weighted, latency-based and failover resource record sets only. An identifier that differentiates among multiple resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type.
alias_hosted_zone_id: not required, default: null. # The hosted zone identifier.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
alias: not required, default: false. # Indicates if this is an alias record.
type: required, default: undefined. # The type of DNS record to create

region: not required, default: null. # Latency-based resource record sets only Among resource record sets that have the same combination of DNS name and type, a value that determines which region this should be associated with for the latency-based routing

retry_interval: not required, default: 500. # In the case that route53 is still servicing a prior request, this module will wait and try again after this many seconds. If you have many domain names, the default of 500 seconds may be too long.

private_zone: not required, default: false. # If set to true, the private zone matching the requested name within the domain will be used if there are both public and private zones. The default is to use the public zone.

value: not required, default: null. # The new value when creating a DNS record.  YAML lists or multiple comma-spaced values are allowed for non-alias records.,When deleting a record all values for the record must be specified or Route53 will not delete it.
record: required, default: undefined. # The full DNS record to create or delete

state: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the state of the resource record. As of Ansible 2.4, the I(command) option has been changed to I(state) as default and the choices 'present' and 'absent' have been added, but I(command) still works as well.
alias_evaluate_target_health: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to evaluate an alias target health. Useful for aliases to Elastic Load Balancers.

vpc_id: not required, default: null. # When used in conjunction with private_zone: true, this will only modify records in the private hosted zone attached to this VPC.,This allows you to have multiple private hosted zones, all with the same name, attached to different VPCs.
zone: required, default: undefined. # The DNS zone to modify
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
failover: not required, default: null. # Failover resource record sets only. Whether this is the primary or secondary resource record set. Allowed values are PRIMARY and SECONDARY

route53_facts.description: Retrieves route53 details using AWS methods
body: route53_facts
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
resource_id: not required, default: undefined. # The ID/s of the specified resource/s
hosted_zone_method: not required, default: list. # This is used in conjunction with query: hosted_zone. It allows for listing details, counts or tags of various hosted zone details.
health_check_method: not required, default: list. # This is used in conjunction with query: health_check. It allows for listing details, counts or tags of various health check details.
delegation_set_id: not required, default: undefined. # The DNS Zone delegation set ID
hosted_zone_id: not required, default: undefined. # The Hosted Zone ID of the DNS zone
health_check_id: not required, default: undefined. # The ID of the health check

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
query: required, default: undefined. # specifies the query action to take
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
start_record_name: not required, default: undefined. # The first name in the lexicographic ordering of domain names that you want the list_command: record_sets to start listing from
type: not required, default: undefined. # The type of DNS record
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
dns_name: not required, default: undefined. # The first name in the lexicographic ordering of domain names that you want the list_command to start listing from
max_items: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of items to return for various get/list requests

change_id: not required, default: undefined. # The ID of the change batch request. The value that you specify here is the value that ChangeResourceRecordSets returned in the Id element when you submitted the request.

next_marker: not required, default: undefined. # Some requests such as list_command: hosted_zones will return a maximum number of entries - EG 100 or the number specified by max_items. If the number of entries exceeds this maximum another request can be sent using the NextMarker entry from the first response to get the next page of results
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

route53_health_check.description: add or delete health-checks in Amazons Route53 DNS service
body: route53_health_check
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
request_interval: required, default: 30. # The number of seconds between the time that Amazon Route 53 gets a response from your endpoint and the time that it sends the next health-check request.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
ip_address: not required, default: null. # IP address of the end-point to check. Either this or `fqdn` has to be provided.
port: not required, default: null. # The port on the endpoint on which you want Amazon Route 53 to perform health checks. Required for TCP checks.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

fqdn: not required, default: undefined. # Domain name of the endpoint to check. Either this or `ip_address` has to be provided. When both are given the `fqdn` is used in the `Host:` header of the HTTP request.
state: required, default: undefined. # Specifies the action to take.

resource_path: not required, default: null. # The path that you want Amazon Route 53 to request when performing health checks. The path can be any value for which your endpoint will return an HTTP status code of 2xx or 3xx when the endpoint is healthy, for example the file /docs/route53-health-check.html.,Required for all checks except TCP.,The path must begin with a /,Maximum 255 characters.

failure_threshold: required, default: 3. # The number of consecutive health checks that an endpoint must pass or fail for Amazon Route 53 to change the current status of the endpoint from unhealthy to healthy or vice versa.
type: required, default: undefined. # The type of health check that you want to create, which indicates how Amazon Route 53 determines whether an endpoint is healthy.

string_match: not required, default: null. # If the check type is HTTP_STR_MATCH or HTTP_STR_MATCH, the string that you want Amazon Route 53 to search for in the response body from the specified resource. If the string appears in the first 5120 bytes of the response body, Amazon Route 53 considers the resource healthy.
route53_zone
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
vpc_region: not required, default: null. # The VPC Region the zone should be a part of (if this is going to be a private zone)

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
comment: not required, default: . # Comment associated with the zone

hosted_zone_id: not required, default: null. # The unique zone identifier you want to delete or "all" if there are many zones with the same domain name. Required if there are multiple zones identified with the above options
state: not required, default: true. # whether or not the zone should exist or not

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
vpc_id: not required, default: null. # The VPC ID the zone should be a part of (if this is going to be a private zone)
zone: required, default: undefined. # The DNS zone record (eg: foo.com.)
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

rpm_key.description: Adds or removes a gpg key from the rpm db
body: rpm_key
state: not required, default: present. # If the key will be imported or removed from the rpm db.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no) and the C(key) is a url starting with https, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
key: required, default: null. # Key that will be modified. Can be a url, a file, or a keyid if the key already exists in the database.
rundeck_acl_policy
project: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the project which receive the ACL policy.,If unset, it's a system ACL policy.

policy: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the ACL policy content.,ACL policy content is a YAML object as described in http://rundeck.org/docs/man5/aclpolicy.html.,It can be a YAML string or a pure Ansible inventory YAML object.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove Rundeck project.
name: required, default: undefined. # Sets the project name.
url: required, default: undefined. # Sets the rundeck instance URL.
token: required, default: undefined. # Sets the token to authenticate against Rundeck API.
api_version: not required, default: 14. # Sets the API version used by module.,API version must be at least 14.
rundeck_project
url: required, default: undefined. # Sets the rundeck instance URL.
token: required, default: undefined. # Sets the token to authenticate against Rundeck API.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove Rundeck project.
api_version: not required, default: 14. # Sets the API version used by module.,API version must be at least 14.
name: required, default: undefined. # Sets the project name.
runit

state: not required, default: undefined. # C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.  C(restarted) will always bounce the service (sv restart) and C(killed) will always bounce the service (sv force-stop). C(reloaded) will send a HUP (sv reload). C(once) will run a normally downed sv once (sv once), not really an idempotent operation.
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Wheater the service is enabled or not, if disabled it also implies stopped.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the service to manage.
service_dir: not required, default: /var/service. # directory runsv watches for services
service_src: not required, default: /etc/sv. # directory where services are defined, the source of symlinks to service_dir.

s3_bucket.description: Manage S3 buckets in AWS, Ceph, Walrus and FakeS3
body: s3_bucket
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
force: not required, default: false. # When trying to delete a bucket, delete all keys in the bucket first (an s3 bucket must be empty for a successful deletion)
tags: not required, default: null. # tags dict to apply to bucket
ceph: not required, default: undefined. # Enable API compatibility with Ceph. It takes into account the S3 API subset working with Ceph in order to provide the same module behaviour where possible.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
requester_pays: not required, default: false. # With Requester Pays buckets, the requester instead of the bucket owner pays the cost of the request and the data download from the bucket.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: null. # Name of the s3 bucket
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove the s3 bucket
policy: not required, default: null. # The JSON policy as a string.
s3_url: not required, default: null. # S3 URL endpoint for usage with Ceph, Eucalypus, fakes3, etc. Otherwise assumes AWS
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
versioning: not required, default: null. # Whether versioning is enabled or disabled (note that once versioning is enabled, it can only be suspended)

s3_lifecycle.description: Manage s3 bucket lifecycle rules in AWS
body: s3_lifecycle
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
status: not required, default: enabled. # If 'enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'disabled', the rule is not currently being applied.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
prefix: not required, default: null. # Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.  If no prefix is specified, the rule will apply to the whole bucket.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
expiration_days: not required, default: null. # Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
transition_days: not required, default: null. # Indicates when, in days, an object transitions to a different storage class. If transition_date is not specified, this parameter is required.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the s3 bucket
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

expiration_date: not required, default: null. # Indicates the lifetime of the objects that are subject to the rule by the date they will expire. The value must be ISO-8601 format, the time must be midnight and a GMT timezone must be specified.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove the lifecycle rule

storage_class: not required, default: glacier. # The storage class to transition to. Currently there are two supported values - 'glacier' or 'standard_ia'.,The 'standard_ia' class is only being available from Ansible version 2.2.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
rule_id: not required, default: null. # Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255 characters. A unique value for the rule will be generated if no value is provided.

transition_date: not required, default: null. # Indicates the lifetime of the objects that are subject to the rule by the date they will transition to a different storage class. The value must be ISO-8601 format, the time must be midnight and a GMT timezone must be specified. If transition_days is not specified, this parameter is required."

s3_logging.description: Manage logging facility of an s3 bucket in AWS
body: s3_logging
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the s3 bucket.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
target_prefix: not required, default: . # The prefix that should be prepended to the generated log files written to the target_bucket.
target_bucket: not required, default: null. # The bucket to log to. Required when state=present.
state: not required, default: present. # Enable or disable logging.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

s3_sync.description: Efficiently upload multiple files to S3
body: s3_sync
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

file_change_strategy: not required, default: date_size. # Difference determination method to allow changes-only syncing. Unlike rsync, files are not patched- they are fully skipped or fully uploaded.,date_size will upload if file sizes don't match or if local file modified date is newer than s3's version,checksum will compare etag values based on s3's implementation of chunked md5s.,force will always upload all files.
permission: not required, default: undefined. # Canned ACL to apply to synced files.,Changing this ACL only changes newly synced files, it does not trigger a full reupload.

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
exclude: not required, default: .*. # Shell pattern-style file matching.,Used after include to remove files (for instance, skip "*.txt"),For multiple patterns, comma-separate them.
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

mime_map: not required, default: undefined. # Dict entry from extension to MIME type. This will override any default/sniffed MIME type. For example C({".txt": "application/text", ".yml": "appication/text"})
file_root: required, default: undefined. # File/directory path for synchronization. This is a local path.,This root path is scrubbed from the key name, so subdirectories will remain as keys.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: undefined. # The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
bucket: required, default: undefined. # Bucket name.
mode: required, default: push. # sync direction.
include: not required, default: *. # Shell pattern-style file matching.,Used before exclude to determine eligible files (for instance, only "*.gif"),For multiple patterns, comma-separate them.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
cache_control: not required, default: undefined. # This is a string.,Cache-Control header set on uploaded objects.,Directives are separated by commmas.
key_prefix: not required, default: undefined. # In addition to file path, prepend s3 path with this prefix. Module will add slash at end of prefix if necessary.
delete: not required, default: false. # Remove remote files that exist in bucket but are not present in the file root.

s3_website.description: Configure an s3 bucket as a website
body: s3_website
aws_secret_key: not required, default: null. # AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: not required, default: null. # Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: not required, default: null. # AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

suffix: not required, default: index.html. # Suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the website endpoint (e.g. if the suffix is index.html and you make a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be for the object with the key name images/index.html). The suffix must not include a slash character.
security_token: not required, default: null. # AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: not required, default: null. # AWS region to create the bucket in. If not set then the value of the AWS_REGION and EC2_REGION environment variables are checked, followed by the aws_region and ec2_region settings in the Boto config file.  If none of those are set the region defaults to the S3 Location: US Standard.
redirect_all_requests: not required, default: null. # Describes the redirect behavior for every request to this s3 bucket website endpoint
error_key: not required, default: null. # The object key name to use when a 4XX class error occurs. To remove an error key, set to None.
state: not required, default: present. # Add or remove s3 website configuration

ec2_url: not required, default: null. # Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
name: required, default: null. # Name of the s3 bucket

script.description: Runs a local script on a remote node after transferring it
body: script
creates: not required, default: null. # a filename, when it already exists, this step will B(not) be run.
removes: not required, default: null. # a filename, when it does not exist, this step will B(not) be run.
free_form: required, default: null. # path to the local script file followed by optional arguments. There is no parameter actually named 'free form'; see the examples!
chdir: not required, default: null. # cd into this directory on the remote node before running the script
decrypt: not required, default: Yes. # This option controls the autodecryption of source files using vault.
seboolean
state: required, default: null. # Desired boolean value
name: required, default: null. # Name of the boolean to configure
persistent: not required, default: false. # Set to C(yes) if the boolean setting should survive a reboot

sefcontext.description: Manages SELinux file context mapping definitions
body: sefcontext
reload: not required, default: yes. # Reload SELinux policy after commit.
setype: required, default: undefined. # SELinux type for the specified target.
ftype: not required, default: a. # File type.
target: required, default: undefined. # Target path (expression).
selevel: not required, default: undefined. # SELinux range for the specified target.
seuser: not required, default: undefined. # SELinux user for the specified target.
state: not required, default: present. # Desired boolean value.

selinux.description: Change policy and state of SELinux
body: selinux
policy: not required, default: null. # name of the SELinux policy to use (example: C(targeted)) will be required if state is not C(disabled)
state: required, default: null. # The SELinux mode
conf: not required, default: /etc/selinux/config. # path to the SELinux configuration file, if non-standard

selinux_permissive.description: Change permissive domain in SELinux policy
body: selinux_permissive
domain: required, default: undefined. # the domain that will be added or removed from the list of permissive domains

no_reload: not required, default: false. # automatically reload the policy after a change,default is set to 'false' as that's what most people would want after changing one domain,Note that this doesn't work on older version of the library (example EL 6), the module will silently ignore it in this case
store: not required, default: null. # name of the SELinux policy store to use
permissive: required, default: undefined. # indicate if the domain should or should not be set as permissive

sendgrid.description: Sends an email with the SendGrid API
body: sendgrid
username: not required, default: null. # username for logging into the SendGrid account.,Since 2.2 it is only required if api_key is not supplied.
from_name: not required, default: null. # the name you want to appear in the from field, i.e 'John Doe'
from_address: required, default: undefined. # the address in the "from" field for the email
cc: not required, default: null. # a list of email addresses to cc
subject: required, default: undefined. # the desired subject for the email
bcc: not required, default: null. # a list of email addresses to bcc
headers: not required, default: null. # a dict to pass on as headers
to_addresses: required, default: undefined. # a list with one or more recipient email addresses
html_body: not required, default: false. # whether the body is html content that should be rendered
api_key: not required, default: null. # sendgrid API key to use instead of username/password
password: not required, default: null. # password that corresponds to the username,Since 2.2 it is only required if api_key is not supplied.
attachments: not required, default: null. # a list of relative or explicit paths of files you want to attach (7MB limit as per SendGrid docs)
sensu_check
interval: not required, default: null. # Check interval in seconds
handle: not required, default: true. # Whether the check should be handled or not
subscribers: not required, default: . # List of subscribers/channels this check should run for,See sensu_subscribers to subscribe a machine to a channel
metric: not required, default: false. # Whether the check is a metric
subdue_begin: not required, default: null. # When to disable handling of check failures
dependencies: not required, default: . # Other checks this check depends on, if dependencies fail,,handling of this check will be disabled
occurrences: not required, default: 1. # Number of event occurrences before the handler should take action
low_flap_threshold: not required, default: null. # The low threshold for flap detection
ttl: not required, default: null. # Time to live in seconds until the check is considered stale
aggregate: not required, default: false. # Classifies the check as an aggregate check,,making it available via the aggregate API

path: not required, default: /etc/sensu/conf.d/checks.json. # Path to the json file of the check to be added/removed.,Will be created if it does not exist (unless I(state=absent)).,The parent folders need to exist when I(state=present), otherwise an error will be thrown
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the check,This is the key that is used to determine whether a check exists
standalone: not required, default: false. # Whether the check should be scheduled by the sensu client or server,This option obviates the need for specifying the I(subscribers) option
backup: not required, default: false. # Create a backup file (if yes), including the timestamp information so,you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
handlers: not required, default: . # List of handlers to notify when the check fails
publish: not required, default: true. # Whether the check should be scheduled at all.,You can still issue it via the sensu api
custom: not required, default: [object Object]. # A hash/dictionary of custom parameters for mixing to the configuration.,You can't rewrite others module parameters using this
source: not required, default: null. # The check source, used to create a JIT Sensu client for an external resource (e.g. a network switch).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the check should be present or not
command: required, default: undefined. # Path to the sensu check to run (not required when I(state=absent))
high_flap_threshold: not required, default: null. # The high threshold for flap detection
timeout: not required, default: 10. # Timeout for the check
subdue_end: not required, default: null. # When to enable handling of check failures
refresh: not required, default: null. # Number of seconds handlers should wait before taking second action
sensu_client

subscriptions: required, default: null. # An array of client subscriptions, a list of roles and/or responsibilities assigned to the system (e.g. webserver).,These subscriptions determine which monitoring checks are executed by the client, as check requests are sent to subscriptions.,The subscriptions array items must be strings.

address: not required, default: Non-loopback IPv4 address as determined by Ruby Socket.ip_address_list (provided by Sensu). # An address to help identify and reach the client. This is only informational, usually an IP address or hostname.
chef: not required, default: null. # The chef definition scope, used to configure the Sensu Enterprise Chef integration (Sensu Enterprise users only).
redact: not required, default: null. # Client definition attributes to redact (values) when logging and sending client keepalives.
socket: not required, default: null. # The socket definition scope, used to configure the Sensu client socket.
puppet: not required, default: null. # The puppet definition scope, used to configure the Sensu Enterprise Puppet integration (Sensu Enterprise users only).
ec2: not required, default: null. # The ec2 definition scope, used to configure the Sensu Enterprise AWS EC2 integration (Sensu Enterprise users only).
safe_mode: not required, default: false. # If safe mode is enabled for the client. Safe mode requires local check definitions in order to accept a check request and execute the check.
registration: not required, default: null. # The registration definition scope, used to configure Sensu registration event handlers.
deregistration: not required, default: null. # The deregistration definition scope, used to configure automated Sensu client de-registration.
keepalive: not required, default: null. # The keepalive definition scope, used to configure Sensu client keepalives behavior (e.g. keepalive thresholds, etc).
deregister: not required, default: false. # If a deregistration event should be created upon Sensu client process stop.
name: not required, default: System hostname as determined by Ruby Socket.gethostname (provided by Sensu). # A unique name for the client. The name cannot contain special characters or spaces.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the client should be present or not
keepalives: not required, default: true. # If Sensu should monitor keepalives for this client.
servicenow: not required, default: null. # The servicenow definition scope, used to configure the Sensu Enterprise ServiceNow integration (Sensu Enterprise users only).
sensu_handler
filter: not required, default: null. # The Sensu event filter (name) to use when filtering events for the handler.
name: required, default: null. # A unique name for the handler. The name cannot contain special characters or spaces.

handlers: required, default: null. # An array of Sensu event handlers (names) to use for events using the handler set.,Each array item must be a string.,NOTE: the handlers attribute is only required for handler sets (i.e. handlers configured with "type": "set").
filters: not required, default: null. # An array of Sensu event filters (names) to use when filtering events for the handler.,Each array item must be a string.
severities: not required, default: null. # An array of check result severities the handler will handle.,NOTE: event resolution bypasses this filtering.

pipe: not required, default: null. # The pipe definition scope, used to configure the Sensu transport pipe.,NOTE: the pipe attribute is only required for Transport handlers (i.e. handlers configured with "type": "transport").
mutator: not required, default: null. # The Sensu event mutator (name) to use to mutate event data for the handler.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the handler should be present or not

command: not required, default: null. # The handler command to be executed.,The event data is passed to the process via STDIN.,NOTE: the command attribute is only required for Pipe handlers (i.e. handlers configured with "type": "pipe").
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The handler execution duration timeout in seconds (hard stop).,Only used by pipe and tcp handler types.
handle_flapping: not required, default: false. # If events in the flapping state should be handled.
handle_silenced: not required, default: false. # If events matching one or more silence entries should be handled.
type: required, default: null. # The handler type

socket: not required, default: null. # The socket definition scope, used to configure the TCP/UDP handler socket.,NOTE: the socket attribute is only required for TCP/UDP handlers (i.e. handlers configured with "type": "tcp" or "type": "udp").
sensu_silence
expire_on_resolve: not required, default: undefined. # If specified as true, the silence entry will be automatically cleared once the condition it is silencing is resolved.
url: not required, default: http://127.0.01:4567. # Specifies the URL of the Sensu monitoring host server.
creator: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the entity responsible for this entry.
state: required, default: present. # Specifies to create or clear (delete) a silence entry via the Sensu API
reason: not required, default: undefined. # If specified, this free-form string is used to provide context or rationale for the reason this silence entry was created.
expire: not required, default: undefined. # If specified, the silence entry will be automatically cleared after this number of seconds.
check: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the check which the silence entry applies to.

subscription: required, default: . # Specifies the subscription which the silence entry applies to.,To create a silence entry for a client append C(client:) to client name. Example - C(client:server1.example.dev)
sensu_subscription
path: not required, default: /etc/sensu/conf.d/subscriptions.json. # Path to the subscriptions json file
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the machine should subscribe or unsubscribe from the channel
backup: not required, default: false. # Create a backup file (if yes), including the timestamp information so you,can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the channel

seport.description: Manages SELinux network port type definitions
body: seport
reload: not required, default: true. # Reload SELinux policy after commit.
setype: required, default: null. # SELinux type for the specified port.
proto: required, default: null. # Protocol for the specified port.
state: required, default: present. # Desired boolean value.
ports: required, default: null. # Ports or port ranges, separated by a comma
serverless
functions: not required, default: . # A list of specific functions to deploy. If this is not provided, all functions in the service will be deployed.

deploy: not required, default: true. # Whether or not to deploy artifacts after building them. When this option is `false` all the functions will be built, but no stack update will be run to send them out. This is mostly useful for generating artifacts to be stored/deployed elsewhere.
serverless_bin_path: not required, default: undefined. # The path of a serverless framework binary relative to the 'service_path' eg. node_module/.bin/serverless
region: not required, default: us-east-1. # AWS region to deploy the service to
stage: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the serverless framework project stage to deploy to. This uses the serverless framework default "dev".
state: not required, default: present. # Goal state of given stage/project
service_path: required, default: undefined. # The path to the root of the Serverless Service to be operated on.
service

use: not required, default: auto. # The service module actually uses system specific modules, normally through auto detection, this setting can force a specific module.,Normally it uses the value of the 'ansible_service_mgr' fact and falls back to the old 'service' module when none matching is found.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the service.

pattern: not required, default: undefined. # If the service does not respond to the status command, name a substring to look for as would be found in the output of the I(ps) command as a stand-in for a status result.  If the string is found, the service will be assumed to be running.
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the service should start on boot. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.)

state: not required, default: undefined. # C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.  C(restarted) will always bounce the service.  C(reloaded) will always reload. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.) Note that reloaded will start the service if it is not already started, even if your chosen init system wouldn't normally.

sleep: not required, default: undefined. # If the service is being C(restarted) then sleep this many seconds between the stop and start command. This helps to workaround badly behaving init scripts that exit immediately after signaling a process to stop.
arguments: not required, default: undefined. # Additional arguments provided on the command line
runlevel: not required, default: default. # For OpenRC init scripts (ex: Gentoo) only.  The runlevel that this service belongs to.

set_fact.description: Set host facts from a task
body: set_fact
key_value: required, default: null. # The C(set_fact) module takes key=value pairs as variables to set in the playbook scope. Or alternatively, accepts complex arguments using the C(args:) statement.
cacheable: not required, default: false. # This boolean indicates if the facts set will also be added to the fact cache, if fact caching is enabled.

set_stats.description: Set stats for the current ansible run
body: set_stats
aggregate: not required, default: true. # boolean that indicates if the provided value is aggregated to the existing stat C(yes) or will replace it C(no)
data: required, default: undefined. # A dictionary of which each key represents a stat (or variable) you want to keep track of
per_host: not required, default: false. # boolean that indicates if the stats is per host or for all hosts in the run.
setup
filter: not required, default: *. # if supplied, only return facts that match this shell-style (fnmatch) wildcard.

gather_subset: not required, default: all. # if supplied, restrict the additional facts collected to the given subset. Possible values: all, min, hardware, network, virtual, ohai, and facter Can specify a list of values to specify a larger subset.
