organization: not required, default: null. # Primary key of organization for project.

tower_role.description: create, update, or destroy Ansible Tower role.
body: tower_role
credential: not required, default: null. # Credential the role acts on.
job_template: not required, default: null. # The job_template the role acts on.
tower_host: not required, default: null. # URL to your Tower instance.
team: not required, default: null. # Team that receives the permissions specified by the role.
project: not required, default: null. # Project the role acts on.
tower_username: not required, default: null. # Username for your Tower instance.
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the resource.
role: required, default: undefined. # The role type to grant/revoke.
inventory: not required, default: null. # Inventory the role acts on.
tower_password: not required, default: null. # Password for your Tower instance.
tower_config_file: not required, default: null. # Path to the Tower config file. See notes.
organization: not required, default: null. # Organiation the role acts on.
target_team: not required, default: null. # Team that the role acts on.

tower_verify_ssl: not required, default: true. # Dis/allow insecure connections to Tower. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
user: not required, default: null. # User that receives the permissions specified by the role.

tower_team.description: create, update, or destroy Ansible Tower team.
body: tower_team
name: required, default: null. # Name to use for the team.
tower_host: not required, default: null. # URL to your Tower instance.
tower_username: not required, default: null. # Username for your Tower instance.
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the resource.
tower_password: not required, default: null. # Password for your Tower instance.
tower_config_file: not required, default: null. # Path to the Tower config file. See notes.
organization: required, default: null. # Organization the team should be made a member of.

tower_verify_ssl: not required, default: true. # Dis/allow insecure connections to Tower. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

tower_user.description: create, update, or destroy Ansible Tower user.
body: tower_user
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the user.
superuser: not required, default: false. # User is a system wide administator.
first_name: not required, default: null. # First name of the user.
last_name: not required, default: null. # Last name of the user.
tower_host: not required, default: null. # URL to your Tower instance.
email: required, default: undefined. # Email address of the user.
tower_username: not required, default: null. # Username for your Tower instance.
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the resource.
auditor: not required, default: false. # User is a system wide auditor.
tower_password: not required, default: null. # Password for your Tower instance.
tower_config_file: not required, default: null. # Path to the Tower config file. See notes.
password: not required, default: null. # Password of the user.

tower_verify_ssl: not required, default: true. # Dis/allow insecure connections to Tower. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

twilio.description: Sends a text message to a mobile phone through Twilio.
body: twilio
from_number: required, default: undefined. # the Twilio number to send the text message from, format +15551112222
msg: required, default: undefined. # the body of the text message
auth_token: required, default: undefined. # user's Twilio authentication token
media_url: not required, default: undefined. # a URL with a picture, video or sound clip to send with an MMS (multimedia message) instead of a plain SMS
to_number: required, default: undefined. # one or more phone numbers to send the text message to, format +15551112222
account_sid: required, default: undefined. # user's Twilio account token found on the account page
typetalk
topic: required, default: undefined. # topic id to post message
client_secret: required, default: undefined. # OAuth2 client secret
client_id: required, default: undefined. # OAuth2 client ID
msg: required, default: undefined. # message body

udm_dns_record.description: Manage dns entries on a univention corporate server
body: udm_dns_record

type: required, default: undefined. # Define the record type. C(host_record) is a A or AAAA record, C(alias) is a CNAME, C(ptr_record) is a PTR record, C(srv_record) is a SRV record and C(txt_record) is a TXT record.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the dns record is present or not.
data: not required, default: . # Additional data for this record, e.g. ['a': '192.0.2.1']. Required if C(state=present).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the record, this is also the DNS record. E.g. www for www.example.com.
zone: required, default: undefined. # Corresponding DNS zone for this record, e.g. example.com.

udm_dns_zone.description: Manage dns zones on a univention corporate server
body: udm_dns_zone
retry: not required, default: 1800. # Interval that should elapse before a failed refresh should be retried.
zone: required, default: undefined. # DNS zone name, e.g. C(example.com).
interfaces: not required, default: undefined. # List of interface IP addresses, on which the server should response this zone. Required if C(state=present).
refresh: not required, default: 3600. # Interval before the zone should be refreshed.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the dns zone is present or not.
contact: not required, default: . # Contact person in the SOA record.
expire: not required, default: 604800. # Specifies the upper limit on the time interval that can elapse before the zone is no longer authoritative.
ttl: not required, default: 600. # Minimum TTL field that should be exported with any RR from this zone.
nameserver: not required, default: undefined. # List of appropriate name servers. Required if C(state=present).
type: required, default: undefined. # Define if the zone is a forward or reverse DNS zone.
mx: not required, default: . # List of MX servers. (Must declared as A or AAAA records).
udm_group
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the group is present or not.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the posix group.
position: not required, default: undefined. # define the whole ldap position of the group, e.g. C(cn=g123m-1A,cn=classes,cn=schueler,cn=groups,ou=schule,dc=example,dc=com).
ou: not required, default: undefined. # LDAP OU, e.g. school for LDAP OU C(ou=school,dc=example,dc=com).
subpath: not required, default: undefined. # Subpath inside the OU, e.g. C(cn=classes,cn=students,cn=groups).
description: not required, default: undefined. # Group description.

udm_share.description: Manage samba shares on a univention corporate server
body: udm_share
samba_name: not required, default: None. # Windows name. Required if C(state=present).
samba_hide_files: not required, default: None. # Hide files.
samba_blocking_locks: not required, default: 1. # Blocking locks.
samba_directory_mode: not required, default: 0755. # Directory mode.
samba_dos_filemode: not required, default: 0. # Users with write access may modify permissions.
samba_postexec: not required, default: None. # Postexec script.
owner: not required, default: 0. # Directory owner of the share's root directory.
samba_fake_oplocks: not required, default: 0. # Fake oplocks.
samba_strict_locking: not required, default: Auto. # Strict locking.
samba_public: not required, default: 0. # Allow anonymous read-only access with a guest user.
samba_force_directory_security_mode: not required, default: 0. # Force directory security mode.
group: not required, default: 0. # Directory owner group of the share's root directory.
samba_writeable: not required, default: 1. # Samba write access.
samba_nt_acl_support: not required, default: 1. # NT ACL support.
samba_write_list: not required, default: None. # Restrict write access to these users/groups.
samba_preexec: not required, default: None. # Preexec script.
samba_browseable: not required, default: 1. # Show in Windows network environment.
samba_inherit_acls: not required, default: 1. # Inherit ACLs.
samba_msdfs_root: not required, default: 0. # MSDFS root.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the share is present or not.
samba_valid_users: not required, default: None. # Valid users or groups.
samba_force_create_mode: not required, default: 0. # Force file mode.
root_squash: not required, default: 1. # Modify user ID for root user (root squashing).
samba_directory_security_mode: not required, default: 0777. # Directory security mode.
samba_force_group: not required, default: None. # Force group.
samba_vfs_objects: not required, default: None. # VFS objects.
samba_force_directory_mode: not required, default: 0. # Force directory mode.
writeable: not required, default: 1. # NFS write access.
samba_locking: not required, default: 1. # Locking.
samba_security_mode: not required, default: 0777. # Security mode.
samba_inherit_owner: not required, default: 0. # Create files/directories with the owner of the parent directory.
samba_csc_policy: not required, default: manual. # Client-side caching policy.
sync: not required, default: sync. # NFS synchronisation.
nfs_hosts: not required, default: . # Only allow access for this host, IP address or network.
path: not required, default: None. # Directory on the providing server, e.g. C(/home). Required if C(state=present).
nfs_custom_settings: not required, default: . # Option name in exports file.
samba_force_user: not required, default: None. # Force user.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name
samba_invalid_users: not required, default: None. # Invalid users or groups.
samba_create_mode: not required, default: 0744. # File mode.
samba_force_security_mode: not required, default: 0. # Force security mode.
samba_level_2_oplocks: not required, default: 1. # Level 2 oplocks.
samba_custom_settings: not required, default: . # Option name in smb.conf and its value.
samba_hide_unreadable: not required, default: 0. # Hide unreadable files/directories.
host: not required, default: None. # Host FQDN (server which provides the share), e.g. C({{ ansible_fqdn }}). Required if C(state=present).
samba_block_size: not required, default: None. # Blocking size.
samba_oplocks: not required, default: 1. # Oplocks.
samba_hosts_allow: not required, default: . # Allowed host/network.
samba_inherit_permissions: not required, default: 0. # Create files/directories with permissions of the parent directory.
subtree_checking: not required, default: 1. # Subtree checking.
directorymode: not required, default: 00755. # Permissions for the share's root directory.
ou: required, default: undefined. # Organisational unit, inside the LDAP Base DN.
samba_hosts_deny: not required, default: . # Denied host/network.

udm_user.description: Manage posix users on a univention corporate server
body: udm_user
update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ. C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
samba_user_workstations: not required, default: . # Allow the authentication only on this Microsoft Windows host.
homedrive: not required, default: None. # Windows home drive, e.g. C("H:").
room_number: not required, default: None. # Room number of users business address.
primary_group: not required, default: cn=Domain Users,cn=groups,$LDAP_BASE_DN. # Primary group. This must be the group LDAP DN.
postcode: not required, default: None. # Postal code of users business address.
scriptpath: not required, default: None. # Windows logon script.
home_share: not required, default: None. # Home NFS share. Must be a LDAP DN, e.g. C(cn=home,cn=shares,ou=school,dc=example,dc=com).
override_pw_history: not required, default: false. # Override password history
city: not required, default: None. # City of users business address.
display_name: not required, default: None. # Display name (not gecos)
pager_telephonenumber: not required, default: . # List of pager telephone numbers.
employee_number: not required, default: None. # Employee number
serviceprovider: not required, default: . # Enable user for the following service providers.
organisation: not required, default: None. # Organisation
subpath: not required, default: cn=users. # LDAP subpath inside the organizational unit, e.g. C(cn=teachers,cn=users) for LDAP container C(cn=teachers,cn=users,dc=example,dc=com).
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the user is present or not.
home_share_path: not required, default: None. # Path to home NFS share, inside the homeShare.
userexpiry: not required, default: Today + 1 year. # Account expiry date, e.g. C(1999-12-31).
unixhome: not required, default: /home/$USERNAME. # Unix home directory
mail_home_server: not required, default: None. # FQDN of mail server
email: not required, default: . # A list of e-mail addresses.
sambahome: not required, default: None. # Windows home path, e.g. C('\\$FQDN\$USERNAME').
username: required, default: undefined. # User name
home_telephone_number: not required, default: . # List of private telephone numbers.
shell: not required, default: /bin/bash. # Login shell
description: not required, default: None. # Description (not gecos)
firstname: not required, default: undefined. # First name. Required if C(state=present).
lastname: not required, default: undefined. # Last name. Required if C(state=present).
mail_alternative_address: not required, default: . # List of alternative e-mail addresses.
phone: not required, default: . # List of telephone numbers.
birthday: not required, default: None. # Birthday
groups: not required, default: . # POSIX groups, the LDAP DNs of the groups will be found with the LDAP filter for each group as $GROUP: C((&(objectClass=posixGroup)(cn=$GROUP))).
profilepath: not required, default: None. # Windows profile directory
employee_type: not required, default: None. # Employee type
password: not required, default: None. # Password. Required if C(state=present).
pwd_change_next_login: not required, default: None. # Change password on next login.
mail_primary_address: not required, default: None. # Primary e-mail address
country: not required, default: None. # Country of users business address.
title: not required, default: None. # Title, e.g. C(Prof.).
override_pw_length: not required, default: false. # Override password check
street: not required, default: None. # Street of users business address.
gecos: not required, default: None. # GECOS
mobile_telephone_number: not required, default: . # Mobile phone number
position: not required, default: . # Define the whole position of users object inside the LDAP tree, e.g. C(cn=employee,cn=users,ou=school,dc=example,dc=com).
ou: not required, default: . # Organizational Unit inside the LDAP Base DN, e.g. C(school) for LDAP OU C(ou=school,dc=example,dc=com).
department_number: not required, default: None. # Department number of users business address.
samba_privileges: not required, default: . # Samba privilege, like allow printer administration, do domain join.
secretary: not required, default: . # A list of superiors as LDAP DNs.
ufw
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Add a comment to the rule. Requires UFW version >=0.35.
direction: not required, default: undefined. # Select direction for a rule or default policy command.
from_port: not required, default: undefined. # Source port.
to_ip: not required, default: any. # Destination IP address.
to_port: not required, default: undefined. # Destination port.
from_ip: not required, default: any. # Source IP address.
interface: not required, default: undefined. # Specify interface for rule.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Use profile located in C(/etc/ufw/applications.d)
insert: not required, default: undefined. # Insert the corresponding rule as rule number NUM
logging: not required, default: undefined. # Toggles logging. Logged packets use the LOG_KERN syslog facility.
log: not required, default: undefined. # Log new connections matched to this rule
proto: not required, default: undefined. # TCP/IP protocol.
route: not required, default: undefined. # Apply the rule to routed/forwarded packets.
rule: not required, default: undefined. # Add firewall rule

state: not required, default: undefined. # C(enabled) reloads firewall and enables firewall on boot.,C(disabled) unloads firewall and disables firewall on boot.,C(reloaded) reloads firewall.,C(reset) disables and resets firewall to installation defaults.
policy: not required, default: undefined. # Change the default policy for incoming or outgoing traffic.
delete: not required, default: undefined. # Delete rule.

unarchive.description: Unpacks an archive after (optionally) copying it from the local machine.
body: unarchive
exclude: not required, default: undefined. # List the directory and file entries that you would like to exclude from the unarchive action.

src: required, default: undefined. # If C(remote_src=no) (default), local path to archive file to copy to the target server; can be absolute or relative. If C(remote_src=yes), path on the target server to existing archive file to unpack.,If C(remote_src=yes) and C(src) contains C(://), the remote machine will download the file from the URL first. (version_added 2.0). This is only for simple cases, for full download support use the M(get_url) module.
keep_newer: not required, default: no. # Do not replace existing files that are newer than files from the archive.
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

remote_src: not required, default: no. # Set to C(yes) to indicate the archived file is already on the remote system and not local to the Ansible controller.,This option is mutually exclusive with C(copy).

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
list_files: not required, default: no. # If set to True, return the list of files that are contained in the tarball.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
decrypt: not required, default: Yes. # This option controls the autodecryption of source files using vault.
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
creates: not required, default: undefined. # A filename, when it already exists, this step will B(not) be run.
dest: required, default: undefined. # Remote absolute path where the archive should be unpacked.
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
extra_opts: not required, default: . # Specify additional options by passing in an array.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).

copy: not required, default: yes. # If true, the file is copied from local 'master' to the target machine, otherwise, the plugin will look for src archive at the target machine.,This option has been deprecated in favor of C(remote_src).,This option is mutually exclusive with C(remote_src).

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # This only applies if using a https URL as the source of the file.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificate.,Prior to 2.2 the code worked as if this was set to C(yes).

uptimerobot.description: Pause and start Uptime Robot monitoring
body: uptimerobot
monitorid: required, default: null. # ID of the monitor to check.
state: required, default: null. # Define whether or not the monitor should be running or paused.
apikey: required, default: null. # Uptime Robot API key.
uri

body: not required, default: undefined. # The body of the http request/response to the web service. If C(body_format) is set to 'json' it will take an already formatted JSON string or convert a data structure into JSON.
dest: not required, default: undefined. # path of where to download the file to (if desired). If I(dest) is a directory, the basename of the file on the remote server will be used.

follow_redirects: not required, default: safe. # Whether or not the URI module should follow redirects. C(all) will follow all redirects. C(safe) will follow only "safe" redirects, where "safe" means that the client is only doing a GET or HEAD on the URI to which it is being redirected. C(none) will not follow any redirects. Note that C(yes) and C(no) choices are accepted for backwards compatibility, where C(yes) is the equivalent of C(all) and C(no) is the equivalent of C(safe). C(yes) and C(no) are deprecated and will be removed in some future version of Ansible.

force_basic_auth: not required, default: no. # The library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.
removes: not required, default: undefined. # a filename, when it does not exist, this step will not be run.
user: not required, default: undefined. # username for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.
others: not required, default: undefined. # all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here

body_format: not required, default: raw. # The serialization format of the body. When set to json, encodes the body argument, if needed, and automatically sets the Content-Type header accordingly. As of C(2.3) it is possible to override the `Content-Type` header, when set to json via the I(headers) option.
password: not required, default: undefined. # password for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.

HEADER_: not required, default: undefined. # Any parameter starting with "HEADER_" is a sent with your request as a header. For example, HEADER_Content-Type="application/json" would send the header "Content-Type" along with your request with a value of "application/json". This option is deprecated as of C(2.1) and may be removed in a future release. Use I(headers) instead.

client_key: not required, default: undefined. # PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If I(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
url: required, default: undefined. # HTTP or HTTPS URL in the form (http|https)://host.domain[:port]/path
method: not required, default: GET. # The HTTP method of the request or response. It MUST be uppercase.
creates: not required, default: undefined. # a filename, when it already exists, this step will not be run.

headers: not required, default: undefined. # Add custom HTTP headers to a request in the format of a YAML hash. As of C(2.3) supplying C(Content-Type) here will override the header generated by supplying C(json) for I(body_format).
timeout: not required, default: 30. # The socket level timeout in seconds
status_code: not required, default: 200. # A valid, numeric, HTTP status code that signifies success of the request. Can also be comma separated list of status codes.

return_content: not required, default: no. # Whether or not to return the body of the response as a "content" key in the dictionary result. If the reported Content-type is "application/json", then the JSON is additionally loaded into a key called C(json) in the dictionary results.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.  Prior to 1.9.2 the code defaulted to C(no).

client_cert: not required, default: undefined. # PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, I(client_key) is not required
urpmi
no-recommends: not required, default: true. # Corresponds to the C(--no-recommends) option for I(urpmi).
force: not required, default: true. # Assume "yes" is the answer to any question urpmi has to ask. Corresponds to the C(--force) option for I(urpmi).
pkg: required, default: null. # name of package to install, upgrade or remove.
update_cache: not required, default: false. # update the package database first C(urpmi.update -a).
root: not required, default: /. # Specifies an alternative install root, relative to which all packages will be installed. Corresponds to the C(--root) option for I(urpmi).
state: not required, default: present. # Indicates the desired package state
user
comment: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally sets the description (aka I(GECOS)) of user account.
ssh_key_bits: not required, default: default set by ssh-keygen. # Optionally specify number of bits in SSH key to create.
update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
non_unique: not required, default: no. # Optionally when used with the -u option, this option allows to change the user ID to a non-unique value.
force: not required, default: no. # When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --force).
ssh_key_type: not required, default: rsa. # Optionally specify the type of SSH key to generate. Available SSH key types will depend on implementation present on target host.
expires: not required, default: None. # An expiry time for the user in epoch, it will be ignored on platforms that do not support this. Currently supported on Linux and FreeBSD.
ssh_key_passphrase: not required, default: undefined. # Set a passphrase for the SSH key.  If no passphrase is provided, the SSH key will default to having no passphrase.

groups: not required, default: undefined. # Puts the user in  list of groups. When set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups except the primary group.,Before version 2.3, the only input format allowed was a 'comma separated string', now it should be able to accept YAML lists also.
home: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set the user's home directory.
move_home: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes) when used with C(home=), attempt to move the user's home directory to the specified directory if it isn't there already.

password: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set the user's password to this crypted value.  See the user example in the github examples directory for what this looks like in a playbook. See U(http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/faq.html#how-do-i-generate-crypted-passwords-for-the-user-module) for details on various ways to generate these password values. Note on Darwin system, this value has to be cleartext. Beware of security issues.
skeleton: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set a home skeleton directory. Requires createhome option!
generate_ssh_key: not required, default: no. # Whether to generate a SSH key for the user in question. This will B(not) overwrite an existing SSH key.
append: not required, default: no. # If C(yes), will only add groups, not set them to just the list in I(groups).
uid: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally sets the I(UID) of the user.
ssh_key_comment: not required, default: ansible-generated on $HOSTNAME. # Optionally define the comment for the SSH key.
group: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally sets the user's primary group (takes a group name).
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user to create, remove or modify.
createhome: not required, default: yes. # Unless set to C(no), a home directory will be made for the user when the account is created or if the home directory does not exist.
system: not required, default: no. # When creating an account, setting this to C(yes) makes the user a system account.  This setting cannot be changed on existing users.
remove: not required, default: no. # When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --remove).
seuser: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally sets the seuser type (user_u) on selinux enabled systems.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the account should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.
ssh_key_file: not required, default: .ssh/id_rsa. # Optionally specify the SSH key filename. If this is a relative filename then it will be relative to the user's home directory.
login_class: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally sets the user's login class for FreeBSD, OpenBSD and NetBSD systems.
shell: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set the user's shell.

local: not required, default: False. # Forces the use of "local" command alternatives on platforms that implement it. This is useful in environments that use centralized authentification when you want to manipulate the local users. I.E. it uses `luseradd` instead of `useradd`.,This requires that these commands exist on the targeted host, otherwise it will be a fatal error.

vca_fw.description: add remove firewall rules in a gateway  in a vca
body: vca_fw
username: not required, default: None. # The vca username or email address, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_USER) is checked for the username.
gateway_name: not required, default: gateway. # The name of the gateway of the vdc where the rule should be added.
host: not required, default: None. # The authentication host to be used when service type is vcd.
instance_id: not required, default: None. # The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp.
state: not required, default: present. # If the object should be added or removed.
fw_rules: required, default: false. # A list of firewall rules to be added to the gateway, Please see examples on valid entries
service_type: not required, default: vca. # The type of service we are authenticating against.
org: not required, default: None. # The org to login to for creating vapp. This option is required when the C(service_type) is I(vdc).
password: not required, default: None. # The vca password, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_PASS) is checked for the password.
vdc_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the vdc where the gateway is located.
api_version: not required, default: 5.7. # The api version to be used with the vca.
verify_certs: not required, default: true. # If the certificates of the authentication is to be verified.

vca_nat.description: add remove nat rules in a gateway  in a vca
body: vca_nat
username: not required, default: None. # The vca username or email address, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_USER) is checked for the username.
gateway_name: not required, default: gateway. # The name of the gateway of the vdc where the rule should be added.
purge_rules: not required, default: false. # If set to true, it will delete all rules in the gateway that are not given as parameter to this module.
nat_rules: required, default: false. # A list of rules to be added to the gateway, Please see examples on valid entries
host: not required, default: None. # The authentication host to be used when service type is vcd.
instance_id: not required, default: None. # The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp.
state: not required, default: present. # If the object should be added or removed.
service_type: not required, default: vca. # The type of service we are authenticating against.
org: not required, default: None. # The org to login to for creating vapp. This option is required when the C(service_type) is I(vdc).
password: not required, default: None. # The vca password, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_PASS) is checked for the password.
vdc_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the vdc where the gateway is located.
api_version: not required, default: 5.7. # The api version to be used with the vca.
verify_certs: not required, default: true. # If the certificates of the authentication is to be verified.
vca_vapp
vm_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the virtual machine instance in the vApp to manage.
username: not required, default: None. # The vCloud Air username to use during authentication

vm_memory: not required, default: None. # The amount of memory in MB to allocate to VMs in the vApp.  If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.

template_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the vApp template to use to create the vApp instance.  If the I(state) is not `absent` then the I(template_name) value must be provided.  The I(template_name) must be previously uploaded to the catalog specified by I(catalog_name)
network_mode: not required, default: pool. # Configures the mode of the network connection.
vapp_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the vCloud Air vApp instance
org: not required, default: None. # The org to login to for creating vapp, mostly set when the service_type is vdc.
operation: not required, default: noop. # Specifies an operation to be performed on the vApp.
password: not required, default: None. # The vCloud Air password to use during authentication

vm_cpus: not required, default: None. # The number of vCPUs to configure for the VM in the vApp.   If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherwise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.
vdc_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the virtual data center (VDC) where the vm should be created or contains the vAPP.

network_name: not required, default: None. # The name of the network that should be attached to the virtual machine in the vApp.  The virtual network specified must already be created in the vCloud Air VDC.  If the I(state) is not 'absent' then the I(network_name) argument must be provided.
host: not required, default: None. # The authentication host to be used when service type  is vcd.
instance_id: not required, default: None. # The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp
state: not required, default: present. # Configures the state of the vApp.
service_type: not required, default: vca. # The type of service we are authenticating against
api_version: not required, default: 5.7. # The api version to be used with the vca
vcenter_license
username: required, default: undefined. # The username to log into the vSphere vCenter.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to add (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) the license key.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
license: required, default: undefined. # The license key to manage in vSphere vCenter.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password to log into to the vSphere vCenter.
labels: not required, default: undefined. # The optional labels of the license key to manage in vSphere vCenter.,This is dictionary with key/value pair.

vdirect_file.description: Uploads a new or updates an existing runnable file into Radware vDirect server
body: vdirect_file
vdirect_user: required, default: None. # vDirect server username, may be set as VDIRECT_USER environment variable.
vdirect_wait: not required, default: yes. # Wait for async operation to complete, may be set as VDIRECT_WAIT environment variable.
vdirect_https_port: not required, default: 2189. # vDirect server HTTPS port number, may be set as VDIRECT_HTTPS_PORT environment variable.

vdirect_validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated,,may be set as VDIRECT_VALIDATE_CERTS or VDIRECT_VERIFY environment variable.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
file_name: required, default: undefined. # vDirect runnable file name to be uploaded.,May be velocity configuration template (.vm) or workflow template zip file (.zip).
vdirect_timeout: not required, default: 60. # Amount of time to wait for async operation completion [seconds],,may be set as VDIRECT_TIMEOUT environment variable.
vdirect_http_port: not required, default: 2188. # vDirect server HTTP port number, may be set as VDIRECT_HTTP_PORT environment variable.
vdirect_ip: required, default: undefined. # Primary vDirect server IP address, may be set as VDIRECT_IP environment variable.
vdirect_secondary_ip: not required, default: None. # Secondary vDirect server IP address, may be set as VDIRECT_SECONDARY_IP environment variable.
vdirect_use_ssl: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection,,may be set as VDIRECT_HTTPS or VDIRECT_USE_SSL environment variable.
vdirect_password: required, default: None. # vDirect server password, may be set as VDIRECT_PASSWORD environment variable.
vertica_configuration
cluster: not required, default: localhost. # Name of the Vertica cluster.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the parameter to update.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
login_user: not required, default: dbadmin. # The username used to authenticate with.
db: not required, default: null. # Name of the Vertica database.
port: not required, default: 5433. # Vertica cluster port to connect to.
value: required, default: undefined. # Value of the parameter to be set.
vertica_facts
login_user: not required, default: dbadmin. # The username used to authenticate with.
cluster: not required, default: localhost. # Name of the cluster running the schema.
db: not required, default: null. # Name of the database running the schema.
port: not required, default: 5433. # Database port to connect to.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.

vertica_role.description: Adds or removes Vertica database roles and assigns roles to them.
body: vertica_role
assigned_roles: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of roles to assign to the role.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the role to add or remove.
login_user: not required, default: dbadmin. # The username used to authenticate with.
db: not required, default: null. # Name of the Vertica database.
cluster: not required, default: localhost. # Name of the Vertica cluster.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a role.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
port: not required, default: 5433. # Vertica cluster port to connect to.

vertica_schema.description: Adds or removes Vertica database schema and roles.
body: vertica_schema
create_roles: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of roles to create and grant usage and create access to the schema.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the schema to add or remove.
login_user: not required, default: dbadmin. # The username used to authenticate with.
db: not required, default: null. # Name of the Vertica database.
usage_roles: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of roles to create and grant usage access to the schema.
cluster: not required, default: localhost. # Name of the Vertica cluster.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create C(present), or drop C(absent) a schema.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user to set as owner of the schema.
port: not required, default: 5433. # Vertica cluster port to connect to.

vertica_user.description: Adds or removes Vertica database users and assigns roles.
body: vertica_user
profile: not required, default: null. # Sets the user's profile.
resource_pool: not required, default: null. # Sets the user's resource pool.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user to add or remove.
roles: not required, default: null. # Comma separated list of roles to assign to the user.
login_user: not required, default: dbadmin. # The username used to authenticate with.
ldap: not required, default: null. # Set to true if users are authenticated via LDAP.,The user will be created with password expired and set to I($ldap$).
db: not required, default: null. # Name of the Vertica database.
cluster: not required, default: localhost. # Name of the Vertica cluster.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a user.
login_password: not required, default: null. # The password used to authenticate with.

password: not required, default: null. # The user's password encrypted by the MD5 algorithm.,The password must be generated with the format C("md5" + md5[password + username]), resulting in a total of 35 characters. An easy way to do this is by querying the Vertica database with select 'md5'||md5('<user_password><user_name>').
expired: not required, default: null. # Sets the user's password expiration.
port: not required, default: 5433. # Vertica cluster port to connect to.

virt.description: Manages virtual machines supported by libvirt
body: virt
xml: not required, default: null. # XML document used with the define command

state: not required, default: no. # Note that there may be some lag for state requests like C(shutdown) since these refer only to VM states. After starting a guest, it may not be immediately accessible.
command: not required, default: undefined. # in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples
name: required, default: null. # name of the guest VM being managed. Note that VM must be previously defined with xml.
autostart: not required, default: null. # start VM at host startup
uri: not required, default: qemu:///system. # libvirt connection uri
virt_net
xml: not required, default: undefined. # XML document used with the define command.

state: not required, default: undefined. # specify which state you want a network to be in. If 'active', network will be started. If 'present', ensure that network is present but do not change its state; if it's missing, you need to specify xml argument. If 'inactive', network will be stopped. If 'undefined' or 'absent', network will be removed from I(libvirt) configuration.
command: not required, default: undefined. # in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples. Modify was added in version 2.1
name: required, default: undefined. # name of the network being managed. Note that network must be previously defined with xml.
autostart: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if a given storage pool should be started automatically on system boot.
uri: not required, default: qemu:///system. # libvirt connection uri.
virt_pool
xml: not required, default: undefined. # XML document used with the define command.

state: not required, default: undefined. # specify which state you want a storage pool to be in. If 'active', pool will be started. If 'present', ensure that pool is present but do not change its state; if it's missing, you need to specify xml argument. If 'inactive', pool will be stopped. If 'undefined' or 'absent', pool will be removed from I(libvirt) configuration. If 'deleted', pool contents will be deleted and then pool undefined.
command: not required, default: undefined. # in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples.
name: not required, default: undefined. # name of the storage pool being managed. Note that pool must be previously defined with xml.
autostart: not required, default: undefined. # Specify if a given storage pool should be started automatically on system boot.
uri: not required, default: qemu:///system. # I(libvirt) connection uri.
mode: not required, default: undefined. # Pass additional parameters to 'build' or 'delete' commands.

vmadm.description: Manage SmartOS virtual machines and zones.
body: vmadm
customer_metadata: not required, default: undefined. # Metadata to be set and associated with this VM, this contain customer modifiable keys.
disk_driver: not required, default: undefined. # Default value for a virtual disk model for KVM guests.
force: not required, default: undefined. # Force a particular action (i.e. stop or delete a VM).
zfs_root_compression: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies compression algorithm used for this VMs root dataset. This option only has effect on the zoneroot dataset.
virtio_txtimer: not required, default: undefined. # Timeout (in nanoseconds) for the TX timer of virtio NICs.
spice_password: not required, default: undefined. # Password required to connect to SPICE. By default no password is set. Please note this can be read from the Global Zone.
zfs_io_priority: not required, default: undefined. # IO throttle priority value relative to other VMs.
ram: not required, default: undefined. # Amount of virtual RAM for a KVM guest (in MiBs).
dns_domain: not required, default: undefined. # Domain value for C(/etc/hosts).
max_physical_memory: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum amount of memory (in MiBs) on the host that the VM is allowed to use.
nic_driver: not required, default: undefined. # Default value for a virtual NIC model for KVM guests.
zfs_data_compression: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies compression algorithm used for this VMs data dataset. This option only has effect on delegated datasets.
image_uuid: not required, default: undefined. # Image UUID.
fs_allowed: not required, default: undefined. # Comma separated list of filesystem types this zone is allowed to mount.
indestructible_delegated: not required, default: undefined. # Adds an C(@indestructible) snapshot to delegated datasets.
qemu_opts: not required, default: undefined. # Additional qemu arguments for KVM guests. This overwrites the default arguments provided by vmadm(1M) and should only be used for debugging.
delegate_dataset: not required, default: undefined. # Whether to delegate a ZFS dataset to an OS VM.
firewall_enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Enables the firewall, allowing fwadm(1M) rules to be applied.
mdata_exec_timeout: not required, default: undefined. # Timeout in seconds (or 0 to disable) for the C(svc:/smartdc/mdata:execute) service that runs user-scripts in the zone.
archive_on_delete: not required, default: undefined. # When enabled, the zone dataset will be mounted on C(/zones/archive) upon removal.
nics: not required, default: undefined. # A list of nics to add, valid properties are documented in vmadm(1M).
hostname: not required, default: undefined. # Zone/VM hostname.
boot: not required, default: undefined. # Set the boot order for KVM VMs.
vga: not required, default: undefined. # Specify VGA emulation used by KVM VMs.
zfs_snapshot_limit: not required, default: undefined. # Number of snapshots the VM can have.

state: required, default: undefined. # States for the VM to be in. Please note that C(present), C(stopped) and C(restarted) operate on a VM that is currently provisioned. C(present) means that the VM will be created if it was absent, and that it will be in a running state. C(absent) will shutdown the zone before removing it. C(stopped) means the zone will be created if it doesn't exist already, before shutting it down.
limit_priv: not required, default: undefined. # Set (comma separated) list of privileges the zone is allowed to use.
cpu_cap: not required, default: undefined. # Sets a limit on the amount of CPU time that can be used by a VM. Use C(0) for no cap.
maintain_resolvers: not required, default: undefined. # Resolvers in C(/etc/resolv.conf) will be updated when updating the I(resolvers) property.
indestructible_zoneroot: not required, default: undefined. # Adds an C(@indestructible) snapshot to zoneroot.
vnc_password: not required, default: undefined. # Password required to connect to VNC. By default no password is set. Please note this can be read from the Global Zone.
vcpus: not required, default: undefined. # Number of virtual CPUs for a KVM guest.
disks: not required, default: undefined. # A list of disks to add, valid properties are documented in vmadm(1M).
max_swap: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum amount of virtual memory (in MiBs) the VM is allowed to use.
zfs_root_recsize: not required, default: undefined. # Suggested block size (power of 2) for files in the zoneroot dataset's filesystem.
brand: required, default: joyent. # Type of virtual machine.
zfs_filesystem_limit: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of filesystems the VM can have.
quota: not required, default: undefined. # Quota on zone filesystems (in MiBs).
filesystems: not required, default: undefined. # Mount additional filesystems into an OS VM.
autoboot: not required, default: undefined. # Whether or not a VM is booted when the system is rebooted.
tmpfs: not required, default: undefined. # Amount of memory (in MiBs) that will be available in the VM for the C(/tmp) filesystem.
qemu_extra_opts: not required, default: undefined. # Additional qemu cmdline arguments for KVM guests.
resolvers: not required, default: undefined. # List of resolvers to be put into C(/etc/resolv.conf).
max_lwps: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum number of lightweight processes this VM is allowed to have running.
nowait: not required, default: undefined. # Consider the provisioning complete when the VM first starts, rather than when the VM has rebooted.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the VM. vmadm(1M) uses this as an optional name.
kernel_version: not required, default: undefined. # Kernel version to emulate for LX VMs.
max_locked_memory: not required, default: undefined. # Total amount of memory (in MiBs) on the host that can be locked by this VM.
vnc_port: not required, default: undefined. # TCP port to listen of the VNC server. Or set C(0) for random, or C(-1) to disable.
uuid: not required, default: undefined. # UUID of the VM. Can either be a full UUID or C(*) for all VMs.

internal_metadata_namespace: not required, default: undefined. # List of namespaces to be set as I(internal_metadata-only); these namespaces will come from I(internal_metadata) rather than I(customer_metadata).
virtio_txburst: not required, default: undefined. # Number of packets that can be sent in a single flush of the tx queue of virtio NICs.
spice_opts: not required, default: undefined. # Addition options for SPICE-enabled KVM VMs.
zfs_data_recsize: not required, default: undefined. # Suggested block size (power of 2) for files in the delegated dataset's filesystem.
internal_metadata: not required, default: undefined. # Metadata to be set and associated with this VM, this contains operator generated keys.
cpu_type: not required, default: qemu64. # Control the type of virtual CPU exposed to KVM VMs.
routes: not required, default: undefined. # Dictionary that maps destinations to gateways, these will be set as static routes in the VM.
zpool: not required, default: undefined. # ZFS pool the VM's zone dataset will be created in.
cpu_shares: not required, default: undefined. # Sets a limit on the number of fair share scheduler (FSS) CPU shares for a VM. This limit is relative to all other VMs on the system.
vmware_cluster
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
enable_ha: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes) will enable HA when the cluster is created.
enable_vsan: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes) will enable vSAN when the cluster is created.
datacenter_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the datacenter the cluster will be created in.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the cluster that will be created.
state: not required, default: present. # Create (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) a VMware vSphere cluster.
enable_drs: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes) will enable DRS when the cluster is created.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
vmware_datacenter
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter
datacenter_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the datacenter the cluster will be created in.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter API server
state: not required, default: present. # If the datacenter should be present or absent
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
vmware_dns_config
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
domainname: required, default: undefined. # The domain the ESXi host should be apart of.
dns_servers: required, default: undefined. # The DNS servers that the host should be configured to use.
change_hostname_to: required, default: undefined. # The hostname that an ESXi host should be changed to.
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

vmware_dvs_host.description: Add or remove a host from distributed virtual switch
body: vmware_dvs_host
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
vmnics: required, default: undefined. # The ESXi hosts vmnics to use with the Distributed vSwitch
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
state: required, default: undefined. # If the host should be present or absent attached to the vSwitch
esxi_hostname: required, default: undefined. # The ESXi hostname
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
switch_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the Distributed vSwitch

vmware_dvs_portgroup.description: Create or remove a Distributed vSwitch portgroup
body: vmware_dvs_portgroup
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
portgroup_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the portgroup that is to be created or deleted
portgroup_type: required, default: undefined. # See VMware KB 1022312 regarding portgroup types
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
num_ports: required, default: undefined. # The number of ports the portgroup should contain
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
switch_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the distributed vSwitch the port group should be created on.
vlan_id: required, default: undefined. # The VLAN ID that should be configured with the portgroup

vmware_dvswitch.description: Create or remove a distributed vSwitch
body: vmware_dvswitch
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
datacenter_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the datacenter that will contain the dvSwitch
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
discovery_proto: required, default: undefined. # Link discovery protocol between Cisco and Link Layer discovery
mtu: required, default: undefined. # The switch maximum transmission unit
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove dvSwitch
discovery_operation: not required, default: undefined. # Select the discovery operation
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
switch_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the switch to create or remove
uplink_quantity: required, default: undefined. # Quantity of uplink per ESXi host added to the switch
vmware_guest
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.
resource_pool: not required, default: undefined. # Affect machine to the given resource pool.,Resource pool should be child of the selected host parent.
snapshot_src: not required, default: undefined. # Name of an existing snapshot to use to create a clone of a VM.
force: not required, default: no. # Ignore warnings and complete the actions.
template: not required, default: undefined. # Template used to create VM.,If this value is not set, VM is created without using a template.,If the VM exists already this setting will be ignored.
state: required, default: undefined. # What state should the virtual machine be in?,If C(state) is set to C(present) and VM exists, ensure the VM configuration conforms to task arguments.

hardware: not required, default: undefined. # Manage some VM hardware attributes.,Valid attributes are:, - C(memory_mb) (integer): Amount of memory in MB., - C(num_cpus) (integer): Number of CPUs., - C(scsi) (string): Valid values are C(buslogic), C(lsilogic), C(lsilogicsas) and C(paravirtual) (default).
cluster: not required, default: undefined. # The cluster name where the VM will run.
name_match: not required, default: first. # If multiple VMs matching the name, use the first or last found.

customization: not required, default: undefined. # Parameters for OS customization when cloning from template.,Common parameters (Linux/Windows):, - C(dns_servers) (list): List of DNS servers to configure., - C(dns_suffix) (list): List of domain suffixes, aka DNS search path (default: C(domain) parameter)., - C(domain) (string): DNS domain name to use., - C(hostname) (string): Computer hostname (default: shorted C(name) parameter).,Parameters related to Windows customization:, - C(autologon) (bool): Auto logon after VM customization (default: False)., - C(autologoncount) (int): Number of autologon after reboot (default: 1)., - C(domainadmin) (string): User used to join in AD domain (mandatory with C(joindomain))., - C(domainadminpassword) (string): Password used to join in AD domain (mandatory with C(joindomain))., - C(fullname) (string): Server owner name (default: Administrator)., - C(joindomain) (string): AD domain to join (Not compatible with C(joinworkgroup))., - C(joinworkgroup) (string): Workgroup to join (Not compatible with C(joindomain), default: WORKGROUP)., - C(orgname) (string): Organisation name (default: ACME)., - C(password) (string): Local administrator password., - C(productid) (string): Product ID., - C(runonce) (list): List of commands to run at first user logon., - C(timezone) (int): Timezone (See U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms912391.aspx)).
password: required, default: undefined. # The password of the vSphere vCenter.

networks: not required, default: undefined. # A list of networks (in the order of the NICs).,One of the below parameters is required per entry:, - C(name) (string): Name of the portgroup for this interface., - C(vlan) (integer): VLAN number for this interface.,Optional parameters per entry (used for virtual hardware):, - C(device_type) (string): Virtual network device (one of C(e1000), C(e1000e), C(pcnet32), C(vmxnet2), C(vmxnet3) (default), C(sriov))., - C(mac) (string): Customize mac address.,Optional parameters per entry (used for OS customization):, - C(type) (string): Type of IP assignment (either C(dhcp) or C(static))., - C(ip) (string): Static IP address (implies C(type: static))., - C(netmask) (string): Static netmask required for C(ip)., - C(gateway) (string): Static gateway., - C(dns_servers) (string): DNS servers for this network interface (Windows)., - C(domain) (string): Domain name for this network interface (Windows).
wait_for_ip_address: not required, default: no. # Wait until vCenter detects an IP address for the VM.,This requires vmware-tools (vmtoolsd) to properly work after creation.
datacenter: not required, default: ha-datacenter. # Destination datacenter for the deploy operation.

disk: not required, default: undefined. # A list of disks to add.,Valid attributes are:, - C(size_[tb,gb,mb,kb]) (integer): Disk storage size in specified unit., - C(type) (string): Valid value is C(thin) (default: None)., - C(datastore) (string): Datastore to use for the disk. If C(autoselect_datastore) is enabled, filter datastore selection., - C(autoselect_datastore) (bool): select the less used datastore.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the VM to work with.,VM names in vCenter are not necessarily unique, which may be problematic, see C(name_match).
customvalues: not required, default: undefined. # Define a list of customvalues to set on VM.,A customvalue object takes 2 fields C(key) and C(value).

guest_id: not required, default: undefined. # Set the guest ID (Debian, RHEL, Windows...).,This field is required when creating a VM.,Valid values are referenced here: https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/converter-sdk/conv55_apireference/vim.vm.GuestOsDescriptor.GuestOsIdentifier.html
hostname: required, default: undefined. # The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
uuid: not required, default: undefined. # UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if name is not supplied.
annotation: not required, default: undefined. # A note or annotation to include in the VM.
is_template: not required, default: no. # Flag the instance as a template.
esxi_hostname: not required, default: undefined. # The ESXi hostname where the VM will run.
linked_clone: not required, default: no. # Whether to create a Linked Clone from the snapshot specified.

folder: not required, default: /vm. # Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest or create the new guest.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2
validate_certs: not required, default: True. # Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

vmware_guest_snapshot.description: Manages virtual machines snapshots in vcenter
body: vmware_guest_snapshot
username: required, default: undefined. # The username of the vSphere vCenter.

vsphere_guest.description: Create/delete/manage a guest VM through VMware vSphere.
body: vsphere_guest
username: required, default: null. # Username to connect to vcenter as.
resource_pool: not required, default: None. # The name of the resource_pool to create the VM in.
force: not required, default: no. # Boolean. Allows you to run commands which may alter the running state of a guest. Also used to reconfigure and destroy.
vm_disk: not required, default: null. # A key, value list of disks and their sizes and which datastore to keep it in.

vm_hw_version: not required, default: null. # Desired hardware version identifier (for example, "vmx-08" for vms that needs to be managed with vSphere Client). Note that changing hardware version of existing vm is not supported.
cluster: not required, default: None. # The name of the cluster to create the VM in. By default this is derived from the host you tell the module to build the guest on.
vmware_guest_facts: not required, default: null. # Gather facts from vCenter on a particular VM
vm_extra_config: not required, default: null. # A key, value pair of any extra values you want set or changed in the vmx file of the VM. Useful to set advanced options on the VM.
vcenter_hostname: required, default: null. # The hostname of the vcenter server the module will connect to, to create the guest.
template_src: not required, default: None. # Name of the source template to deploy from
password: required, default: null. # Password of the user to connect to vcenter as.
power_on_after_clone: not required, default: true. # Specifies if the VM should be powered on after the clone.
guest: required, default: undefined. # The virtual server name you wish to manage.
vm_nic: not required, default: null. # A key, value list of nics, their types and what network to put them on.

esxi: not required, default: null. # Dictionary which includes datacenter and hostname on which the VM should be created. For standalone ESXi hosts, ha-datacenter should be used as the datacenter name
vm_hardware: not required, default: null. # A key, value list of VM config settings. Must include ['memory_mb', 'num_cpus', 'osid', 'scsi'].

validate_certs: not required, default: true. # Validate SSL certs.  Note, if running on python without SSLContext support (typically, python < 2.7.9) you will have to set this to C(no) as pysphere does not support validating certificates on older python. Prior to 2.1, this module would always validate on python >= 2.7.9 and never validate on python <= 2.7.8.

state: not required, default: present. # Indicate desired state of the vm. 'reconfigured' only applies changes to 'vm_cdrom', 'memory_mb', and 'num_cpus' in vm_hardware parameter. The 'memory_mb' and 'num_cpus' changes are applied to powered-on vms when hot-plugging is enabled for the guest.

from_template: not required, default: false. # Specifies if the VM should be deployed from a template (mutually exclusive with 'state' parameter). No guest customization changes to hardware such as CPU, RAM, NICs or Disks can be applied when launching from template.
snapshot_to_clone: not required, default: none. # A string that when specified, will create a linked clone copy of the VM. Snapshot must already be taken in vCenter.

vyos_banner.description: Manage multiline banners on VyOS devices
body: vyos_banner

text: not required, default: null. # The banner text that should be present in the remote device running configuration. This argument accepts a multiline string, with no empty lines. Requires I(state=present).
state: not required, default: present. # Specifies whether or not the configuration is present in the current devices active running configuration.
banner: required, default: null. # Specifies which banner that should be configured on the remote device.

vyos_command.description: Run one or more commands on VyOS devices
body: vyos_command

retries: not required, default: 10. # Specifies the number of retries a command should be tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

commands: required, default: undefined. # The ordered set of commands to execute on the remote device running VyOS.  The output from the command execution is returned to the playbook.  If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries has been exceeded.

interval: not required, default: 1. # Configures the interval in seconds to wait between I(retries) of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

wait_for: not required, default: null. # Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward.  If the conditional is not true by the configured I(retries), the task fails. See examples.

match: not required, default: all. # The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy. Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the wait_for must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

vyos_config.description: Manage VyOS configuration on remote device
body: vyos_config

comment: not required, default: configured by vyos_config. # Allows a commit description to be specified to be included when the configuration is committed.  If the configuration is not changed or committed, this argument is ignored.

src: not required, default: null. # The C(src) argument specifies the path to the source config file to load.  The source config file can either be in bracket format or set format.  The source file can include Jinja2 template variables.

backup: not required, default: false. # The C(backup) argument will backup the current devices active configuration to the Ansible control host prior to making any changes.  The backup file will be located in the backup folder in the root of the playbook
lines: not required, default: null. # The ordered set of configuration lines to be managed and compared with the existing configuration on the remote device.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

save: not required, default: false. # The C(save) argument controls whether or not changes made to the active configuration are saved to disk.  This is independent of committing the config.  When set to True, the active configuration is saved.

config: not required, default: null. # The C(config) argument specifies the base configuration to use to compare against the desired configuration.  If this value is not specified, the module will automatically retrieve the current active configuration from the remote device.

match: not required, default: line. # The C(match) argument controls the method used to match against the current active configuration.  By default, the desired config is matched against the active config and the deltas are loaded.  If the C(match) argument is set to C(none) the active configuration is ignored and the configuration is always loaded.

vyos_facts.description: Collect facts from remote devices running VyOS
body: vyos_facts

gather_subset: not required, default: !config. # When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, default, config, and neighbors.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.

vyos_interface.description: Manage Interface on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_interface
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the Interface.
duplex: not required, default: auto. # Interface link status.
enabled: not required, default: undefined. # Interface link status.
mtu: not required, default: undefined. # Maximum size of transmit packet.

delay: not required, default: 10. # Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state argument which are I(state) with values C(up)/C(down) and I(neighbors).
state: not required, default: present. # State of the Interface configuration, C(up) means present and operationally up and C(down) means present and operationally C(down)
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of Interfaces definitions.
speed: not required, default: undefined. # Interface link speed.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of Interface.

vyos_l3_interface.description: Manage L3 interfaces on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_l3_interface
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of L3 interfaces definitions
state: not required, default: present. # State of the L3 interface configuration.
ipv4: not required, default: undefined. # IPv4 of the L3 interface.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the L3 interface.
ipv6: not required, default: undefined. # IPv6 of the L3 interface.

vyos_linkagg.description: Manage link aggregation groups on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_linkagg
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of link aggregation definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the link aggregation group.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the link aggregation group.
members: not required, default: undefined. # List of members of the link aggregation group.
mode: not required, default: undefined. # Mode of the link aggregation group.

vyos_lldp.description: Manage LLDP configuration on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_lldp
state: not required, default: present. # State of the LLDP configuration.

vyos_lldp_interface.description: Manage LLDP interfaces configuration on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_lldp_interface
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of interfaces LLDP should be configured on.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the LLDP configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the interface LLDP should be configured on.
vyos_logging
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of logging definitions.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the logging configuration.
name: not required, default: undefined. # If value of C(dest) is I(file) it indicates file-name, for I(user) it indicates username and for I(host) indicates the host name to be notified.
level: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging severity levels.
dest: not required, default: undefined. # Destination of the logs.
facility: not required, default: undefined. # Set logging facility.

vyos_static_route.description: Manage static IP routes on Cisco VyOS network devices
body: vyos_static_route
state: not required, default: present. # State of the static route configuration.
next_hop: not required, default: undefined. # Next hop IP of the static route.
aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # List of static route definitions
mask: not required, default: undefined. # Network prefix mask of the static route.
prefix: not required, default: undefined. # Network prefix of the static route. C(mask) param should be ignored if C(prefix) is provided with C(mask) value C(prefix/mask).
admin_distance: not required, default: undefined. # Admin distance of the static route.

vyos_system.description: Run `set system` commands on VyOS devices
body: vyos_system
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to apply (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) the settings.
name_server: not required, default: null. # A list of name servers to use with the device. Mutually exclusive with I(domain_search)
provider: not required, default: null. # A dict object containing connection details.
domain_search: not required, default: undefined. # A list of domain names to search. Mutually exclusive with I(name_server)
hostname: not required, default: undefined. # Configure the device hostname parameter. This option takes an ASCII string value.
domain_name: not required, default: undefined. # The new domain name to apply to the device.

vyos_user.description: Manage the collection of local users on VyOS device
body: vyos_user

update_password: not required, default: always. # Since passwords are encrypted in the device running config, this argument will instruct the module when to change the password.  When set to C(always), the password will always be updated in the device and when set to C(on_create) the password will be updated only if the username is created.

configured_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password to be configured on the VyOS device. The password needs to be provided in clear and it will be encrypted on the device. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider password).

name: not required, default: undefined. # The username to be configured on the VyOS device. This argument accepts a string value and is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider username).
level: not required, default: undefined. # The C(level) argument configures the level of the user when logged into the system. This argument accepts string values admin or operator.

purge: not required, default: false. # Instructs the module to consider the resource definition absolute. It will remove any previously configured usernames on the device with the exception of the `admin` user (the current defined set of users).

state: not required, default: present. # Configures the state of the username definition as it relates to the device operational configuration. When set to I(present), the username(s) should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the username(s) should not be in the device active configuration
full_name: not required, default: undefined. # The C(full_name) argument provides the full name of the user account to be created on the remote device. This argument accepts any text string value.

aggregate: not required, default: undefined. # The set of username objects to be configured on the remote VyOS device. The list entries can either be the username or a hash of username and properties. This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument. alias C(users).

wait_for.description: Waits for a condition before continuing
body: wait_for
