active_connection_states: not required, default: ESTABLISHED,FIN_WAIT1,FIN_WAIT2,SYN_RECV,SYN_SENT,TIME_WAIT. # The list of TCP connection states which are counted as active connections.
host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # A resolvable hostname or IP address to wait for.
connect_timeout: not required, default: 5. # Maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.
delay: not required, default: 0. # Number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
search_regex: not required, default: undefined. # Can be used to match a string in either a file or a socket connection.,Defaults to a multiline regex.

state: not required, default: started. # Either C(present), C(started), or C(stopped), C(absent), or C(drained).,When checking a port C(started) will ensure the port is open, C(stopped) will check that it is closed, C(drained) will check for active connections.,When checking for a file or a search string C(present) or C(started) will ensure that the file or string is present before continuing, C(absent) will check that file is absent or removed.
sleep: not required, default: 1. # Number of seconds to sleep between checks, before 2.3 this was hardcoded to 1 second.

timeout: not required, default: 300. # Maximum number of seconds to wait for, when used with another condition it will force an error.,When used without other conditions it is equivalent of just sleeping.
exclude_hosts: not required, default: undefined. # List of hosts or IPs to ignore when looking for active TCP connections for C(drained) state.
msg: not required, default: null. # This overrides the normal error message from a failure to meet the required conditions.
path: not required, default: undefined. # Path to a file on the filesystem that must exist before continuing.
port: not required, default: undefined. # Port number to poll.

wait_for_connection.description: Waits until remote system is reachable/usable
body: wait_for_connection
delay: not required, default: 0. # Number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
sleep: not required, default: 1. # Number of seconds to sleep between checks.
connect_timeout: not required, default: 5. # Maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.
timeout: not required, default: 600. # Maximum number of seconds to wait for.

wakeonlan.description: Send a magic Wake-on-LAN (WoL) broadcast packet
body: wakeonlan
broadcast: not required, default: 255.255.255.255. # Network broadcast address to use for broadcasting magic Wake-on-LAN packet.
mac: required, default: undefined. # MAC address to send Wake-on-LAN broadcast packet for.
port: not required, default: 7. # UDP port to use for magic Wake-on-LAN packet.

webfaction_app.description: Add or remove applications on a Webfaction host
body: webfaction_app
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the application
port_open: not required, default: false. # IF the port should be opened
machine: not required, default: undefined. # The machine name to use (optional for accounts with only one machine)
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the application should exist
autostart: not required, default: no. # Whether the app should restart with an autostart.cgi script
login_password: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction password to use
type: required, default: undefined. # The type of application to create. See the Webfaction docs at http://docs.webfaction.com/xmlrpc-api/apps.html for a list.
login_name: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction account to use
extra_info: not required, default: null. # Any extra parameters required by the app

webfaction_db.description: Add or remove a database on Webfaction
body: webfaction_db
machine: not required, default: undefined. # The machine name to use (optional for accounts with only one machine)
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the database should exist
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the database
login_password: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction password to use
password: not required, default: None. # The password for the new database user.
type: required, default: undefined. # The type of database to create.
login_name: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction account to use

webfaction_domain.description: Add or remove domains and subdomains on Webfaction
body: webfaction_domain
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the domain should exist
subdomains: not required, default: null. # Any subdomains to create.
login_name: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction account to use
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the domain
login_password: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction password to use

webfaction_mailbox.description: Add or remove mailboxes on Webfaction
body: webfaction_mailbox
mailbox_password: required, default: null. # The password for the mailbox
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the mailbox should exist
login_name: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction account to use
mailbox_name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the mailbox
login_password: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction password to use

webfaction_site.description: Add or remove a website on a Webfaction host
body: webfaction_site
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the website
host: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction host on which the site should be created.
subdomains: not required, default: null. # A list of subdomains associated with this site.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the website should exist
https: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to use HTTPS
login_password: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction password to use
login_name: required, default: undefined. # The webfaction account to use
site_apps: not required, default: undefined. # A mapping of URLs to apps

win_acl.description: Set file/directory/registry permissions for a system user or group
body: win_acl

propagation: not required, default: None. # Propagation flag on the ACL rules.,For more information on the choices see MSDN PropagationFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.propagationflags.aspx).
state: not required, default: present. # Specify whether to add C(present) or remove C(absent) the specified access rule.
user: required, default: undefined. # User or Group to add specified rights to act on src file/folder or registry key.

rights: required, default: undefined. # The rights/permissions that are to be allowed/denied for the specified user or group for the item at C(path).,If C(path) is a file or directory, rights can be any right under MSDN FileSystemRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.filesystemrights=.aspx).,If C(path) is a registry key, rights can be any right under MSDN RegistryRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.registryrights.aspx).
path: required, default: undefined. # The path to the file or directory.
type: required, default: undefined. # Specify whether to allow or deny the rights specified.

inherit: not required, default: For Leaf File, 'None'; For Directory, 'ContainerInherit, ObjectInherit';. # Inherit flags on the ACL rules.,Can be specified as a comma separated list, e.g. C(ContainerInherit), C(ObjectInherit).,For more information on the choices see MSDN InheritanceFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.inheritanceflags.aspx).
win_acl_inheritance
path: required, default: undefined. # Path to be used for changing inheritance
state: not required, default: absent. # Specify whether to enable I(present) or disable I(absent) ACL inheritance

reorganize: not required, default: false. # For P(state) = I(absent), indicates if the inherited ACE's should be copied from the parent directory. This is necessary (in combination with removal) for a simple ACL instead of using multiple ACE deny entries.,For P(state) = I(present), indicates if the inherited ACE's should be deduplicated compared to the parent directory. This removes complexity of the ACL structure.
win_chocolatey
force: not required, default: no. # Forces install of the package (even if it already exists).,Using C(force) will cause ansible to always report that a change was made.
proxy_password: not required, default: undefined. # Proxy password used to install chocolatey and the package.,See notes in C(proxy_username) when dealing with double quotes in a password.
install_args: not required, default: undefined. # Arguments to pass to the native installer.
ignore_dependencies: not required, default: no. # Ignore dependencies, only install/upgrade the package itself.

upgrade: not required, default: no. # If package is already installed it, try to upgrade to the latest version or to the specified version.,As of Ansible v2.3 this is deprecated, set parameter C(state) to C(latest) for the same result.
skip_scripts: not required, default: no. # Do not run I(chocolateyInstall.ps1) or I(chocolateyUninstall.ps1) scripts.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the package to be installed.,This must be a single package name.
ignore_checksums: not required, default: no. # Ignore checksums altogether.
proxy_url: not required, default: undefined. # Proxy url used to install chocolatey and the package.
allow_empty_checksums: not required, default: no. # Allow empty checksums to be used.
source: not required, default: undefined. # Specify source rather than using default chocolatey repository.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the package on the system.
version: not required, default: undefined. # Specific version of the package to be installed.,Ignored when C(state) is set to C(absent).
params: not required, default: undefined. # Parameters to pass to the package

proxy_username: not required, default: undefined. # Proxy username used to install chocolatey and the package.,When dealing with a username with double quote characters C("), they need to be escaped with C(\) beforehand. See examples for more details.
timeout: not required, default: 2700. # The time to allow chocolatey to finish before timing out.

win_command.description: Executes a command on a remote Windows node
body: win_command
creates: not required, default: undefined. # a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path exists on the target host, the task will be skipped.
free_form: required, default: undefined. # the C(win_command) module takes a free form command to run.  There is no parameter actually named 'free form'. See the examples!
chdir: not required, default: undefined. # set the specified path as the current working directory before executing a command
removes: not required, default: undefined. # a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path B(does not) exist on the target host, the task will be skipped.

win_copy.description: Copies files to remote locations on windows hosts
body: win_copy

content: not required, default: undefined. # When used instead of C(src), sets the contents of a file directly to the specified value. This is for simple values, for anything complex or with formatting please switch to the template module.

src: required, default: undefined. # Local path to a file to copy to the remote server; can be absolute or relative.,If path is a directory, it is copied (including the source folder name) recursively to C(dest).,If path is a directory and ends with "/", only the inside contents of that directory are copied to the destination. Otherwise, if it does not end with "/", the directory itself with all contents is copied.,If path is a file and dest ends with "\", the file is copied to the folder with the same filename.

force: not required, default: yes. # If set to C(yes), the file will only be transferred if the content is different than destination.,If set to C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.,If set to C(no), no checksuming of the content is performed which can help improve performance on larger files.
remote_src: not required, default: no. # If False, it will search for src at originating/master machine, if True it will go to the remote/target machine for the src.

dest: required, default: undefined. # Remote absolute path where the file should be copied to. If src is a directory, this must be a directory too.,Use \ for path separators or \\ when in "double quotes".,If C(dest) ends with \ then source or the contents of source will be copied to the directory without renaming.,If C(dest) is a nonexistent path, it will only be created if C(dest) ends with "/" or "\", or C(src) is a directory.,If C(src) and C(dest) are files and if the parent directory of C(dest) doesn't exist, then the task will fail.
local_follow: not required, default: yes. # This flag indicates that filesystem links in the source tree, if they exist, should be followed.

win_defrag.description: Consolidate fragmented files on local volumes.
body: win_defrag
priority: not required, default: low. # Run the operation at low or normal priority.
excluded_volumes: not required, default: undefined. # A list of drive letters or mount point paths to exclude from defragmentation.

included_volumes: not required, default: undefined. # A list of drive letters or mount point paths of the volumes to be defragmented.,If this parameter is omitted, all volumes (not excluded) will be fragmented.
freespace_consolidation: not required, default: undefined. # Perform free space consolidation on the specified volumes.
parallel: not required, default: no. # Run the operation on each volume in parallel in the background.

win_disk_image.description: Manage ISO/VHD/VHDX mounts on Windows hosts
body: win_disk_image
state: not required, default: present. # whether the image should be present as a drive-letter mount or not.
image_path: required, default: undefined. # path to an ISO, VHD, or VHDX image on the target Windows host (the file cannot reside on a network share)

win_dns_client.description: Configures DNS lookup on Windows hosts
body: win_dns_client

adapter_names: required, default: undefined. # Adapter name or list of adapter names for which to manage DNS settings ('*' is supported as a wildcard value). The adapter name used is the connection caption in the Network Control Panel or via C(Get-NetAdapter), eg C(Local Area Connection).

ipv4_addresses: required, default: undefined. # Single or ordered list of DNS server IPv4 addresses to configure for lookup. An empty list will configure the adapter to use the DHCP-assigned values on connections where DHCP is enabled, or disable DNS lookup on statically-configured connections.

win_domain.description: Ensures the existence of a Windows domain.
body: win_domain
dns_domain_name: required, default: undefined. # the DNS name of the domain which should exist and be reachable or reside on the target Windows host
safe_mode_password: required, default: undefined. # safe mode password for the domain controller

win_domain_controller.description: Manage domain controller/member server state for a Windows host
body: win_domain_controller
state: not required, default: undefined. # whether the target host should be a domain controller or a member server
local_admin_password: not required, default: undefined. # password to be assigned to the local C(Administrator) user (required when C(state) is C(member_server))
domain_admin_user: required, default: undefined. # username of a domain admin for the target domain (necessary to promote or demote a domain controller)
dns_domain_name: not required, default: undefined. # when C(state) is C(domain_controller), the DNS name of the domain for which the targeted Windows host should be a DC
safe_mode_password: not required, default: undefined. # safe mode password for the domain controller (required when C(state) is C(domain_controller))
domain_admin_password: required, default: undefined. # password for the specified C(domain_admin_user)

win_domain_group.description: creates, modifies or removes domain groups
body: win_domain_group

category: not required, default: undefined. # The category of the group, this is the value to assign to the LDAP C(groupType) attribute.,If a new group is created then C(security) will be used by default.
protect: not required, default: undefined. # Will set the C(ProtectedFromAccidentalDeletion) flag based on this value.,This flag stops a user from deleting or moving a group to a different path.
display_name: not required, default: undefined. # The value to assign to the LDAP C(displayName) attribute.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The value to be assigned to the LDAP C(description) attribute.
domain_username: not required, default: undefined. # The username to use when interacting with AD.,If this is not set then the user Ansible used to log in with will be used instead.

ignore_protection: not required, default: no. # Will ignore the C(ProtectedFromAccidentalDeletion) flag when deleting or moving a group.,The module will fail if one of these actions need to occur and this value is set to no.

state: not required, default: present. # If C(state=present) this module will ensure the group is created and is configured accordingly.,If C(state=absent) this module will delete the group if it exists
domain_password: not required, default: undefined. # The password for C(username).

organizational_unit: not required, default: undefined. # The full LDAP path to create or move the group to.,This should be the path to the parent object to create or move the group to.,See examples for details of how this path is formed.

attributes: not required, default: undefined. # A dict of custom LDAP attributes to set on the group.,This can be used to set custom attributes that are not exposed as module parameters, e.g. C(mail).,See the examples on how to format this parameter.

managed_by: not required, default: undefined. # The value to be assigned to the LDAP C(managedBy) attribute.,This value can be in the forms C(Distinguished Name), C(objectGUID), C(objectSid) or C(sAMAccountName), see examples for more details.
scope: not required, default: undefined. # The scope of the group.,If C(state=present) and the group doesn't exist then this must be set.

name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the group to create, modify or remove.,This value can be in the forms C(Distinguished Name), C(objectGUID), C(objectSid) or C(sAMAccountName), see examples for more details.

win_domain_membership.description: Manage domain/workgroup membership for a Windows host
body: win_domain_membership
workgroup_name: not required, default: undefined. # when C(state) is C(workgroup), the name of the workgroup that the Windows host should be in

domain_ou_path: not required, default: undefined. # The desired OU path for adding the computer object.,This is only used when adding the target host to a domain, if it is already a member then it is ignored.
state: not required, default: undefined. # whether the target host should be a member of a domain or workgroup
domain_admin_user: required, default: undefined. # username of a domain admin for the target domain (required to join or leave the domain)
dns_domain_name: not required, default: undefined. # when C(state) is C(domain), the DNS name of the domain to which the targeted Windows host should be joined
hostname: not required, default: undefined. # the desired hostname for the Windows host
domain_admin_password: not required, default: undefined. # password for the specified C(domain_admin_user)

win_domain_user.description: Manages Windows Active Directory user accounts
body: win_domain_user

upn: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the User Principal Name (UPN) for the account. This is not required, but is best practice to configure for modern versions of Active Directory. The format is "<username>@<domain>".

update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users. Note that C(always) will always report an Ansible status of 'changed' because we cannot determine whether the new password differs from the old password.
surname: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's last name (surname)
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description of the user
firstname: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's first name (given name)
company: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's company name

groups_action: not required, default: replace. # If C(replace), the user is added as a member of each group in I(groups) and removed from any other groups.  If C(add), the user is added to each group in I(groups) where not already a member.  If C(remove), the user is removed from each group in I(groups).

password_expired: not required, default: undefined. # C(yes) will require the user to change their password at next login. C(no) will clear the expired password flag. This is mutually exclusive with I(password_never_expires).
street: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's street address
postal_code: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's postal code / zip code

groups: not required, default: undefined. # Adds or removes the user from this list of groups, depending on the value of I(groups_action). To remove all but the Principal Group, set C(groups=<principal group name>) and I(groups_action=replace). Note that users cannot be removed from their principal group (for example, "Domain Users").

path: not required, default: undefined. # Container or OU for the new user; if you do not specify this, the user will be placed in the default container for users in the domain. Setting the path is only available when a new user is created; if you specify a path on an existing user, the user's path will not be updated - you must delete (e.g., state=absent) the user and then re-add the user with the appropriate path.
password_never_expires: not required, default: undefined. # C(yes) will set the password to never expire.  C(no) will allow the password to expire. This is mutually exclusive with I(password_expired)

account_locked: not required, default: undefined. # C(no) will unlock the user account if locked. Note that there is not a way to lock an account as an administrator. Accounts are locked due to user actions; as an admin, you may only unlock a locked account. If you wish to administratively disable an account, set 'enabled' to 'no'.
state_province: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's state or province
city: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's city

password: not required, default: undefined. # Optionally set the user's password to this (plain text) value. In order to enable an account - I(enabled) - a password must already be configured on the account, or you must provide a password here.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user to create, remove or modify.
country: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's country code. Note that this is a two-character ISO 3166 code.
enabled: not required, default: yes. # C(yes) will enable the user account. C(no) will disable the account.

state: not required, default: present. # When C(present), creates or updates the user account.  When C(absent), removes the user account if it exists.  When C(query), retrieves the user account details without making any changes.
email: not required, default: undefined. # Configures the user's email address. This is a record in AD and does not do anything to configure any email servers or systems.
user_cannot_change_password: not required, default: undefined. # C(yes) will prevent the user from changing their password.  C(no) will allow the user to change their password.

win_dotnet_ngen.description: Runs ngen to recompile DLLs after .NET  updates
body: win_dotnet_ngen
win_dsc

module_version: not required, default: latest. # Can be used to configure the exact version of the dsc resource to be invoked.,Useful if the target node has multiple versions installed of the module containing the DSC resource.,If not specified, the module will follow standard Powershell convention and use the highest version available.
resource_name: required, default: undefined. # The DSC Resource to use. Must be accessible to PowerShell using any of the default paths.

win_environment.description: Modifies environment variables on windows hosts.
body: win_environment
state: not required, default: present. # present to ensure environment variable is set, or absent to ensure it is removed
name: required, default: no default. # The name of the environment variable
value: not required, default: no default. # The value to store in the environment variable. Can be omitted for state=absent

level: required, default: no default. # The level at which to set the environment variable.,Use 'machine' to set for all users.,Use 'user' to set for the current user that ansible is connected as.,Use 'process' to set for the current process.  Probably not that useful.
win_eventlog
parameter_file: not required, default: undefined. # For one or more sources specified, the path to a custom parameter resource file.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the event log to manage.

overflow_action: not required, default: undefined. # The action for the log to take once it reaches its maximum size.,For C(OverwriteOlder), new log entries overwrite those older than the C(retention_days) value.,For C(OverwriteAsNeeded), each new entry overwrites the oldest entry.,For C(DoNotOverwrite), all existing entries are kept and new entries are not retained.
retention_days: not required, default: undefined. # The minimum number of days event entries must remain in the log.,This option is only used when C(overflow_action) is C(OverwriteOlder).

sources: not required, default: undefined. # A list of one or more sources to ensure are present/absent in the log.,When C(category_file), C(message_file) and/or C(parameter_file) are specified, these values are applied across all sources.

state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the log and/or sources.,When C(sources) is populated, state is checked for sources.,When C(sources) is not populated, state is checked for the specified log itself.,If C(state) is C(clear), event log entries are cleared for the target log.
message_file: not required, default: undefined. # For one or more sources specified, the path to a custom event message resource file.

maximum_size: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum size of the event log.,Value must be between 64KB and 4GB, and divisible by 64KB.,Size can be specified in KB, MB or GB (e.g. 128KB, 16MB, 2.5GB).
category_file: not required, default: undefined. # For one or more sources specified, the path to a custom category resource file.

win_eventlog_entry.description: Write entries to Windows event logs
body: win_eventlog_entry
category: not required, default: undefined. # A numeric task category associated with the category message file for the log source.
source: required, default: undefined. # Name of the log source to indicate where the entry is from.
log: required, default: undefined. # Name of the event log to write an entry to.
raw_data: not required, default: undefined. # Binary data associated with the log entry.,Value must be a comma-separated array of 8-bit unsigned integers (0 to 255).
event_id: required, default: undefined. # The numeric event identifier for the entry.,Value must be between 0 and 65535.
entry_type: not required, default: undefined. # Indicates the entry being written to the log is of a specific type.
message: required, default: undefined. # The message for the given log entry.

win_feature.description: Installs and uninstalls Windows Features on Windows Server
body: win_feature
source: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a source to install the feature from.,Not supported in Windows 2008. If present when using Windows 2008 this option will be ignored.
state: not required, default: present. # State of the features or roles on the system
name: required, default: undefined. # Names of roles or features to install as a single feature or a comma-separated list of features

include_management_tools: not required, default: undefined. # Adds the corresponding management tools to the specified feature.,Not supported in Windows 2008. If present when using Windows 2008 this option will be ignored.
include_sub_features: not required, default: undefined. # Adds all subfeatures of the specified feature

restart: not required, default: undefined. # Restarts the computer automatically when installation is complete, if restarting is required by the roles or features installed.,DEPRECATED in Ansible 2.4, as unmanaged reboots cause numerous issues under Ansible. Check the C(reboot_required) return value from this module to determine if a reboot is necessary, and if so, use the M(win_reboot) action to perform it.

win_file.description: Creates, touches or removes files or directories.
body: win_file
path: required, default: undefined. # path to the file being managed.  Aliases: I(dest), I(name)

state: not required, default: undefined. # If C(directory), all immediate subdirectories will be created if they do not exist. If C(file), the file will NOT be created if it does not exist, see the M(copy) or M(template) module if you want that behavior.  If C(absent), directories will be recursively deleted, and files will be removed. If C(touch), an empty file will be created if the C(path) does not exist, while an existing file or directory will receive updated file access and modification times (similar to the way C(touch) works from the command line).

win_file_version.description: Get DLL or EXE file build version
body: win_file_version
path: required, default: undefined. # File to get version(provide absolute path)

win_find.description: return a list of files based on specific criteria
body: win_find
paths: required, default: undefined. # List of paths of directories to search for files or folders in. This can be supplied as a single path or a list of paths.
file_type: not required, default: file. # Type of file to search for
checksum_algorithm: not required, default: sha1. # Algorithm to determine the checksum of a file. Will throw an error if the host is unable to use specified algorithm.

age: not required, default: undefined. # Select files or folders whose age is equal to or greater than the specified time. Use a negative age to find files equal to or less than the specified time. You can choose seconds, minutes, hours, days or weeks by specifying the first letter of an of those words (e.g., "2s", "10d", 1w").
recurse: not required, default: false. # Will recursively descend into the directory looking for files or folders
age_stamp: not required, default: mtime. # Choose the file property against which we compare C(age). The default attribute we compare with is the last modification time.

patterns: not required, default: undefined. # One or more (powershell or regex) patterns to compare filenames with. The type of pattern matching is controlled by C(use_regex) option. The patterns retrict the list of files or folders to be returned based on the filenames. For a file to be matched it only has to match with one pattern in a list provided.
get_checksum: not required, default: true. # Whether to return a checksum of the file in the return info (default sha1), use C(checksum_algorithm) to change from the default.
use_regex: not required, default: false. # Will set patterns to run as a regex check if true
follow: not required, default: false. # Set this to true to follow symlinks in the path. This needs to be used in conjunction with C(recurse).
hidden: not required, default: false. # Set this to include hidden files or folders

size: not required, default: false. # Select files or folders whose size is equal to or greater than the specified size. Use a negative value to find files equal to or less than the specified size. You can specify the size with a suffix of the byte type i.e. kilo = k, mega = m... Size is not evaluated for symbolic links.

win_firewall.description: Enable or disable the Windows Firewall
body: win_firewall
state: not required, default: undefined. # Set state of firewall for given profile.
profiles: not required, default: Domain,Private,Public. # Specify one or more profiles to change.
win_firewall_rule
remoteport: not required, default: undefined. # The remote port this rule applies to.
direction: required, default: undefined. # Is this rule for inbound or outbound traffic.
protocol: not required, default: any. # The protocol this rule applies to.
name: required, default: undefined. # The rules name
service: not required, default: undefined. # The service this rule applies to.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the firewall rule.
enabled: not required, default: yes. # Is this firewall rule enabled or disabled.
profiles: not required, default: domain,private,public. # The profile this rule applies to.
localip: not required, default: any. # The local ip address this rule applies to.
state: not required, default: present. # Should this rule be added or removed.
program: not required, default: undefined. # The program this rule applies to.
remoteip: not required, default: any. # The remote ip address/range this rule applies to.
action: required, default: undefined. # What to do with the items this rule is for.
localport: not required, default: undefined. # The local port this rule applies to.

win_get_url.description: Fetches a file from a given URL
body: win_get_url
url_password: not required, default: undefined. # Basic authentication password.

force: not required, default: yes. # If C(yes), will always download the file. If C(no), will only download the file if it does not exist or the remote file has been modified more recently than the local file.,This works by sending an http HEAD request to retrieve last modified time of the requested resource, so for this to work, the remote web server must support HEAD requests.
use_proxy: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
url: required, default: undefined. # The full URL of a file to download.

skip_certificate_validation: not required, default: no. # This option is deprecated since v2.4, please use C(validate_certs) instead.,If C(yes), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
proxy_url: not required, default: undefined. # The full URL of the proxy server to download through.
proxy_password: not required, default: undefined. # Proxy authentication password.
dest: required, default: undefined. # The location to save the file at the URL.,Be sure to include a filename and extension as appropriate.
headers: not required, default: undefined. # Add custom HTTP headers to a request (as a dictionary).
proxy_username: not required, default: undefined. # Proxy authentication username.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # Timeout in seconds for URL request.
url_username: not required, default: undefined. # Basic authentication username.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.,If C(skip_certificate_validation) was set, it overrides this option.
win_group
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove the group
name: required, default: null. # Name of the group
description: not required, default: null. # Description of the group
win_group_membership
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the members in the group.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the local group to manage membership on.

members: required, default: undefined. # A list of members to ensure are present/absent from the group.,Accepts local users as username, .\username, and SERVERNAME\username.,Accepts domain users and groups as DOMAIN\username and username@DOMAIN.,Accepts service users as NT AUTHORITY\username.
win_hotfix

hotfix_identifier: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the hotfix as shown in DISM, see examples for details.,This or C(hotfix_kb) MUST be set when C(state=absent).,If C(state=present) then the hotfix at C(source) will be validated against this value, if it does not match an error will occur.,You can get the identifier by running 'Get-WindowsPackage -Online -PackagePath path-to-cab-in-msu' after expanding the msu file.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install or uninstall the hotfix.,When C(present), C(source) MUST be set.,When C(absent), C(hotfix_identifier) or C(hotfix_kb) MUST be set.

hotfix_kb: not required, default: undefined. # The name of the KB the hotfix relates to, see examples for details.,This of C(hotfix_identifier) MUST be set when C(state=absent).,If C(state=present) then the hotfix at C(source) will be validated against this value, if it does not match an error will occur.,Because DISM uses the identifier as a key and doesn't refer to a KB in all cases it is recommended to use C(hotfix_identifier) instead.
source: not required, default: undefined. # The path to the downloaded hotfix .msu file.,This MUST be set if C(state=present) and MUST be a .msu hotfix file.

win_iis_virtualdirectory.description: Configures a virtual directory in IIS.
body: win_iis_virtualdirectory
application: not required, default: null. # The application under which the virtual directory is created or exists.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to add or remove the specified virtual directory
name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the virtual directory to create or remove
physical_path: not required, default: null. # The physical path to the folder in which the new virtual directory is created. The specified folder must already exist.
site: required, default: undefined. # The site name under which the virtual directory is created or exists.
win_iis_webapplication
state: not required, default: present. # State of the web application.
application_pool: not required, default: undefined. # The application pool in which the new site executes.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the web application.
physical_path: not required, default: undefined. # The physical path on the remote host to use for the new application.,The specified folder must already exist.
site: required, default: undefined. # Name of the site on which the application is created.

win_iis_webapppool.description: configures an IIS Web Application Pool
body: win_iis_webapppool

attributes: not required, default: undefined. # As of Ansible 2.4, this field can take in dict entries to set the application pool attributes.,These attributes are based on the naming standard at U(https://www.iis.net/configreference/system.applicationhost/applicationpools/add#005), see the examples section for more details on how to set this.,You can also set the attributes of child elements like cpu and processModel, see the examples to see how it is done.,While you can use the numeric values for enums it is recommended to use the enum name itself, e.g. use SpecificUser instead of 3 for processModel.identityType.,managedPipelineMode may be either "Integrated" or "Classic".,startMode may be either "OnDemand" or "AlwaysRunning".,Use C(state) module parameter to modify the state of the app pool.,When trying to set 'processModel.password' and you receive a 'Value does fall within the expected range' error, you have a corrupted keystore. Please follow U(http://structuredsight.com/2014/10/26/im-out-of-range-youre-out-of-range/) to help fix your host.,DEPRECATED As of Ansible 2.4 this field should be set using a dict form, in older versions of Ansible this field used to be a string.,This string has attributes that are separated by a pipe '|' and attribute name/values by colon ':' Ex. "startMode:OnDemand|managedPipelineMode:Classic".

state: not required, default: present. # The state of the application pool.,If C(present) will ensure the app pool is configured and exists.,If C(absent) will ensure the app pool is removed.,If C(stopped) will ensure the app pool exists and is stopped.,If C(started) will ensure the app pool exists and is started.,If C(restarted) will ensure the app pool exists and will restart, this is never idempotent.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the application pool.
win_iis_webbinding
protocol: not required, default: null. # The protocol to be used for the Web binding (usually HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP).
name: required, default: null. # Names of web site
certificate_hash: not required, default: null. # Certificate hash for the SSL binding. The certificate hash is the unique identifier for the certificate.
ip: not required, default: null. # The IP address to bind to / use for the new site.
host_header: not required, default: null. # The host header to bind to / use for the new site.
state: not required, default: null. # State of the binding
port: not required, default: null. # The port to bind to / use for the new site.
certificate_store_name: not required, default: My. # Name of the certificate store where the certificate for the binding is located.
win_iis_website
application_pool: not required, default: null. # The application pool in which the new site executes.
name: required, default: null. # Names of web site
parameters: not required, default: null. # Custom site Parameters from string where properties are separated by a pipe and property name/values by colon Ex. "foo:1|bar:2"
ip: not required, default: null. # The IP address to bind to / use for the new site.
physical_path: not required, default: null. # The physical path on the remote host to use for the new site. The specified folder must already exist.
hostname: not required, default: null. # The host header to bind to / use for the new site.
site_id: not required, default: null. # Explicitly set the IIS numeric ID for a site. Note that this value cannot be changed after the website has been created.
ssl: not required, default: null. # Enables HTTPS binding on the site..
state: not required, default: null. # State of the web site
port: not required, default: null. # The port to bind to / use for the new site.

win_lineinfile.description: Ensure a particular line is in a file, or replace an existing line using a back-referenced regular expression.
body: win_lineinfile

insertbefore: not required, default: undefined. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the line at the beginning of the file.,If specified regular expression has no matches, the line will be inserted at the end of the file. May not be used with C(backrefs).

encoding: not required, default: auto. # Specifies the encoding of the source text file to operate on (and thus what the output encoding will be). The default of C(auto) will cause the module to auto-detect the encoding of the source file and ensure that the modified file is written with the same encoding.,An explicit encoding can be passed as a string that is a valid value to pass to the .NET framework System.Text.Encoding.GetEncoding() method - see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.text.encoding%28v=vs.110%29.aspx).
,This is mostly useful with C(create=yes) if you want to create a new file with a specific encoding. If C(create=yes) is specified without a specific encoding, the default encoding (UTF-8, no BOM) will be used.
create: not required, default: no. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. By default it will fail if the file is missing.

newline: not required, default: windows. # Specifies the line separator style to use for the modified file. This defaults to the windows line separator (C(\r\n)). Note that the indicated line separator will be used for file output regardless of the original line separator that appears in the input file.

backrefs: not required, default: no. # Used with C(state=present). If set, line can contain backreferences (both positional and named) that will get populated if the C(regexp) matches. This flag changes the operation of the module slightly; C(insertbefore) and C(insertafter) will be ignored, and if the C(regexp) doesn't match anywhere in the file, the file will be left unchanged.,If the C(regexp) does match, the last matching line will be replaced by the expanded line parameter.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the line should be there or not.

path: required, default: undefined. # The path of the file to modify.,Note that the Windows path delimiter C(\) must be escaped as C(\\) when the line is double quoted.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

insertafter: not required, default: EOF. # Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the line at the end of the file.,If specified regular expression has no matches, EOF will be used instead. May not be used with C(backrefs).

regexp: not required, default: undefined. # The regular expression to look for in every line of the file. For C(state=present), the pattern to replace if found; only the last line found will be replaced. For C(state=absent), the pattern of the line to remove. Uses .NET compatible regular expressions; see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hs600312%28v=vs.110%29.aspx).

line: not required, default: undefined. # Required for C(state=present). The line to insert/replace into the file. If C(backrefs) is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the C(regexp) capture groups if the regexp matches.
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

validate: not required, default: None. # Validation to run before copying into place. Use %s in the command to indicate the current file to validate.,The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

win_mapped_drive.description: maps a network drive for a user
body: win_mapped_drive
username: not required, default: undefined. # Credentials to map the drive with.,The username MUST include the domain or servername like SERVER\user, see the example for more information.

path: not required, default: undefined. # The UNC path to map the drive to.,This is required if C(state=present).,If C(state=absent) and path is not set, the module will delete the mapped drive regardless of the target.,If C(state=absent) and the path is set, the module will throw an error if path does not match the target of the mapped drive.
state: not required, default: present. # If C(state=present) will ensure the mapped drive exists.,If C(state=absent) will ensure the mapped drive does not exist.
password: not required, default: undefined. # The password for C(username).
letter: required, default: undefined. # The letter of the network path to map to.,This letter must not already be in use with Windows.

win_msg.description: Sends a message to logged in users on Windows hosts.
body: win_msg
msg: not required, default: Hello world!. # The text of the message to be displayed.,The message must be less than 256 characters.
to: not required, default: *. # Who to send the message to. Can be a username, sessionname or sessionid.
display_seconds: not required, default: 10. # How long to wait for receiver to acknowledge message, in seconds.

wait: not required, default: no. # Whether to wait for users to respond.  Module will only wait for the number of seconds specified in display_seconds or 10 seconds if not specified. However, if I(wait) is true, the message is sent to each logged on user in turn, waiting for the user to either press 'ok' or for the timeout to elapse before moving on to the next user.

win_msi.description: Installs and uninstalls Windows MSI files
body: win_msi
creates: not required, default: undefined. # Path to a file created by installing the MSI to prevent from attempting to reinstall the package on every run.
extra_args: not required, default: undefined. # Additional arguments to pass to the msiexec.exe command.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether the MSI file should be installed or uninstalled.
path: required, default: undefined. # File system path to the MSI file to install
removes: not required, default: undefined. # Path to a file removed by uninstalling the MSI to prevent from attempting to re-uninstall the package on every run.
wait: not required, default: no. # Specify whether to wait for install or uninstall to complete before continuing.
win_nssm
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the service to operate on

start_mode: not required, default: auto. # If C(auto) is selected, the service will start at bootup. C(manual) means that the service will start only when another service needs it. C(disabled) means that the service will stay off, regardless if it is needed or not.

state: not required, default: started. # State of the service on the system,Note that NSSM actions like "pause", "continue", "rotate" do not fit the declarative style of ansible, so these should be implemented via the ansible command module
app_parameters_free_form: not required, default: undefined. # Single string of parameters to be passed to the service.,Use either this or C(app_parameters), not both

application: not required, default: undefined. # The application binary to run as a service,Specify this whenever the service may need to be installed (state: present, started, stopped, restarted),Note that the application name must look like the following, if the directory includes spaces:,nssm install service "c:\\Program Files\\app.exe\\" "C:\\Path with spaces\\",See commit 0b386fc1984ab74ee59b7bed14b7e8f57212c22b in the nssm.git project for more info: U(https://git.nssm.cc/?p=nssm.git;a=commit;h=0b386fc1984ab74ee59b7bed14b7e8f57212c22b)
stderr_file: not required, default: undefined. # Path to receive error output
dependencies: not required, default: undefined. # Service dependencies that has to be started to trigger startup, separated by comma.
user: not required, default: undefined. # User to be used for service startup
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password to be used for service startup
stdout_file: not required, default: undefined. # Path to receive output
app_parameters: not required, default: undefined. # Parameters to be passed to the application when it starts.,Use either this or C(app_parameters_free_form), not both
win_owner
path: required, default: undefined. # Path to be used for changing owner
recurse: not required, default: no. # Indicates if the owner should be changed recursively
user: required, default: undefined. # Name to be used for changing owner
win_package

username: not required, default: undefined. # Username of an account with access to the package if it is located on a file share.,This is only needed if the WinRM transport is over an auth method that does not support credential delegation like Basic or NTLM.

creates_path: not required, default: undefined. # Will check the existance of the path specified and use the result to determine whether the package is already installed.,You can use this in conjunction with C(product_id) and other C(creates_*).
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the package, if name isn't specified the path will be used for log messages.,As of Ansible 2.4 this is deprecated and no longer required.

creates_service: not required, default: undefined. # Will check the existing of the service specified and use the result to determine whether the package is already installed.,You can use this in conjunction with C(product_id) and other C(creates_*).

expected_return_code: not required, default: 0,3010. # One or more return codes from the package installation that indicates success.,Before Ansible 2.4 this was just 0 but since 2.4 this is both C(0) and C(3010).,A return code of C(3010) usually means that a reboot is required, the C(reboot_required) return value is set if the return code is C(3010).

state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install or uninstall the package.,The module uses C(product_id) and whether it exists at the registry path to see whether it needs to install or uninstall the package.

arguments: not required, default: undefined. # Any arguments the installer needs to either install or uninstall the package.,If the package is an MSI do not supply the C(/qn), C(/log) or C(/norestart) arguments.

creates_version: not required, default: undefined. # Will check the file version property of the file at C(creates_path) and use the result to determine whether the package is already installed.,C(creates_path) MUST be set and is a file.,You can use this in conjunction with C(product_id) and other C(creates_*).

path: not required, default: undefined. # Location of the package to be installed or uninstalled.,This package can either be on the local file system, network share or a url.,If the path is on a network share and the current WinRM transport doesn't support credential delegation, then C(user_name) and C(user_password) must be set to access the file.,There are cases where this file will be copied locally to the server so it can access it, see the notes for more info.,If C(state=present) then this value MUST be set.,If C(state=absent) then this value does not need to be set if C(product_id) is.
password: not required, default: undefined. # The password for C(user_name), must be set when C(user_name) is.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.,Before Ansible 2.4 this defaulted to C(no).

product_id: not required, default: undefined. # The product id of the installed packaged.,This is used for checking whether the product is already installed and getting the uninstall information if C(state=absent).,You can find product ids for installed programs in the Windows registry editor either at C(HKLM:Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall) or for 32 bit programs at C(HKLM:Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall).,This SHOULD be set when the package is not an MSI, or the path is a url or a network share and credential delegation is not being used. The C(creates_*) options can be used instead but is not recommended.
win_pagefile
test_path: not required, default: yes. # Use Test-Path on the drive to make sure the drive is accessible before creating the pagefile.
initial_size: not required, default: undefined. # The initial size of the pagefile in megabytes.
drive: not required, default: undefined. # The drive of the pagefile.
state: not required, default: query. # State of the pagefile.
system_managed: not required, default: no. # Configures current pagefile to be managed by the system.
remove_all: not required, default: no. # Remove all pagefiles in the system, not including automatic managed.
override: not required, default: yes. # Override the current pagefile on the drive.
maximum_size: not required, default: undefined. # The maximum size of the pagefile in megabytes.
automatic: not required, default: undefined. # Configures AutomaticManagedPagefile for the entire system.
win_path
scope: not required, default: machine. # The level at which the environment variable specified by C(name) should be managed (either for the current user or global machine scope).
state: not required, default: undefined. # Whether the path elements specified in C(elements) should be present or absent.

elements: required, default: undefined. # A single path element, or a list of path elements (ie, directories) to add or remove.,When multiple elements are included in the list (and C(state) is C(present)), the elements are guaranteed to appear in the same relative order in the resultant path value.,Variable expansions (eg, C(%VARNAME%)) are allowed, and are stored unexpanded in the target path element.,Any existing path elements not mentioned in C(elements) are always preserved in their current order.,New path elements are appended to the path, and existing path elements may be moved closer to the end to satisfy the requested ordering.,Paths are compared in a case-insensitive fashion, and trailing backslashes are ignored for comparison purposes. However, note that trailing backslashes in YAML require quotes.
name: not required, default: PATH. # Target path environment variable name

win_ping.description: A windows version of the classic ping module
body: win_ping
data: not required, default: pong. # Alternate data to return instead of 'pong'.,If this parameter is set to C(crash), the module will cause an exception.

win_power_plan.description: Changes the power plan of a Windows system
body: win_power_plan

name: required, default: undefined. # String value that indicates the desired power plan. The power plan must already be present on the system. Commonly there will be options for C(balanced) and C(high performance).
win_psexec
username: not required, default: undefined. # The (remote) user to run the command as.,If not provided, the current user is used.
limited: not required, default: no. # Run the command as limited user (strips the Administrators group and allows only privileges assigned to the Users group).
executable: not required, default: psexec.exe. # The location of the PsExec utility (in case it is not located in your PATH).
chdir: not required, default: undefined. # Run the command from this (remote) directory.
interactive: not required, default: no. # Run the program so that it interacts with the desktop on the remote system.
noprofile: not required, default: no. # Run the command without loading the account's profile.
system: not required, default: no. # Run the remote command in the System account.
elevated: not required, default: no. # Run the command with elevated privileges.
priority: not required, default: undefined. # Used to run the command at a different priority.
password: not required, default: undefined. # The password for the (remote) user to run the command as.,This is mandatory in order authenticate yourself.
hostnames: not required, default: undefined. # The hostnames to run the command.,If not provided, the command is run locally.
command: required, default: undefined. # The command line to run through PsExec (limited to 260 characters).
timeout: not required, default: undefined. # The connection timeout in seconds
nobanner: not required, default: no. # Do not display the startup banner and copyright message.,This only works for specific versions of the PsExec binary.
wait: not required, default: yes. # Wait for the application to terminate.,Only use for non-interactive applications.

win_psmodule.description: Adds or removes a Powershell Module.
body: win_psmodule
url: not required, default: undefined. # Url of the custom repository.
allow_clobber: not required, default: false. # If yes imports all commands, even if they have the same names as commands that already exists. Available only in Powershell 5.1 or higher.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the powershell module that has to be installed.
repository: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the custom repository to register.
state: not required, default: present. # If present a new module is installed. If absent a module is removed.
win_rabbitmq_plugin
state: not required, default: enabled. # Specify if plugins are to be enabled or disabled.
new_only: not required, default: no. # Only enable missing plugins.,Does not disable plugins that are not in the names list.
prefix: not required, default: undefined. # Specify a custom install prefix to a Rabbit.
names: required, default: undefined. # Comma-separated list of plugin names.
win_reboot
pre_reboot_delay: not required, default: 2. # Seconds for shutdown to wait before requesting reboot

post_reboot_delay: not required, default: 0. # Seconds to wait after the reboot was successful and the connection was re-established,This is useful if you want wait for something to settle despite your connection already working
test_command: not required, default: whoami. # Command to expect success for to determine the machine is ready for management
shutdown_timeout: not required, default: 600. # Maximum seconds to wait for shutdown to occur,Increase this timeout for very slow hardware, large update applications, etc

reboot_timeout: not required, default: 600. # Maximum seconds to wait for machine to re-appear on the network and respond to a test command,This timeout is evaluated separately for both network appearance and test command success (so maximum clock time is actually twice this value)
msg: not required, default: Reboot initiated by Ansible. # Message to display to users
connect_timeout: not required, default: 5. # Maximum seconds to wait for a single successful TCP connection to the WinRM endpoint before trying again

win_reg_stat.description: returns information about a Windows registry key or property of a key
body: win_reg_stat
path: required, default: undefined. # The full registry key path including the hive to search for.
name: not required, default: undefined. # The registry property name to get information for, the return json will not include the sub_keys and properties entries for the I(key) specified.

win_regedit.description: Add, change, or remove registry keys and values
body: win_regedit
state: not required, default: present. # The state of the registry entry.
delete_key: not required, default: yes. # When C(state) is 'absent' then this will delete the entire key.,If this is False then it will only clear out the '(Default)' property for that key.
name: not required, default: undefined. # Name of the registry entry in the above C(path) parameters.,If not provided, or empty then the '(Default)' property for the key will be used.
path: required, default: undefined. # Name of the registry path.,Should be in one of the following registry hives: HKCC, HKCR, HKCU, HKLM, HKU.
type: not required, default: string. # The registry value data type.

data: not required, default: undefined. # Value of the registry entry C(name) in C(path).,If not specified then the value for the property will be null for the corresponding C(type).,Binary and None data should be expressed in a yaml byte array or as comma separated hex values.,An easy way to generate this is to run C(regedit.exe) and use the I(export) option to save the registry values to a file.,In the exported file, binary value will look like C(hex:be,ef,be,ef), the C(hex:) prefix is optional.,DWORD and QWORD values should either be represented as a decimal number or a hex value.,Multistring values should be passed in as a list.,See the examples for more details on how to format this data.

win_region.description: Set the region and format settings
body: win_region

unicode_language: not required, default: undefined. # The unicode language format to set for all users, see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.aspx) for a list of culture names to use. This needs to be set if C(location) or C(format) is not set. After setting this value a reboot is required for it to take effect.

copy_settings: not required, default: false. # This will copy the current format and location values to new user profiles and the welcome screen. This will only run if C(location), C(format) or C(unicode_language) has resulted in a change. If this process runs then it will always result in a change.

location: not required, default: undefined. # The location to set for the current user, see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd374073.aspx) for a list of GeoIDs you can use and what location it relates to. This needs to be set if C(format) or C(unicode_language) is not set.

format: not required, default: undefined. # The language format to set for the current user, see U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.aspx) for a list of culture names to use. This needs to be set if C(location) or C(unicode_language) is not set.

win_regmerge.description: Merges the contents of a registry file into the windows registry
body: win_regmerge
path: required, default: no default. # The full path including file name to the registry file on the remote machine to be merged

compare_key: not required, default: no default. # The parent key to use when comparing the contents of the registry to the contents of the file.  Needs to be in HKLM or HKCU part of registry. Use a PS-Drive style path for example HKLM:\SOFTWARE not HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE If not supplied, or the registry key is not found, no comparison will be made, and the module will report changed.

win_robocopy.description: Synchronizes the contents of two directories using Robocopy
body: win_robocopy
dest: required, default: undefined. # Destination file/directory to sync (Will receive contents of src).
src: required, default: undefined. # Source file/directory to sync.
recurse: not required, default: no. # Includes all subdirectories (Toggles the C(/e) flag to RoboCopy).,If C(flags) is set, this will be ignored.

purge: not required, default: no. # Deletes any files/directories found in the destination that do not exist in the source.,Toggles the C(/purge) flag to RoboCopy. If C(flags) is set, this will be ignored.
flags: not required, default: undefined. # Directly supply Robocopy flags. If set, C(purge) and C(recurse) will be ignored.

win_route.description: Add or remove a static route.
body: win_route
metric: not required, default: 1. # Metric used by the static route.
destination: required, default: undefined. # Destination IP address in CIDR format (ip address/prefix length)
gateway: not required, default: undefined. # The gateway used by the static route.,If C(gateway) is not provided it will be set to C(0.0.0.0).
state: not required, default: present. # If present, it adds a network static route. If absent, it removes a network static route.

win_say.description: Text to speech module for Windows to speak messages and optionally play sounds
body: win_say

end_sound_path: not required, default: undefined. # Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play after the text has been spoken.,Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has finished speaking.
msg: not required, default: undefined. # The text to be spoken.,Use either C(msg) or C(msg_file).,Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.

start_sound_path: not required, default: undefined. # Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play before the text is spoken.,Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has something to say.

voice: not required, default: system default voice. # Which voice to use. See notes for how to discover installed voices.,If the requested voice is not available the default voice will be used. Example voice names from Windows 10 are C(Microsoft Zira Desktop) and C(Microsoft Hazel Desktop).

msg_file: not required, default: undefined. # Full path to a windows format text file containing the text to be spokend.,Use either C(msg) or C(msg_file).,Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.
speech_speed: not required, default: 0. # How fast or slow to speak the text.,Must be an integer value in the range -10 to 10.,-10 is slowest, 10 is fastest.
win_scheduled_task
executable: not required, default: undefined. # Command the scheduled task should execute
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the scheduled task
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description for the scheduled task
runlevel: not required, default: limited. # The level of user rights used to run the task
enabled: not required, default: true. # Enable/disable the task
days_of_week: not required, default: undefined. # Days of the week to run a weekly task, not idempotent
state: required, default: undefined. # State that the task should become
store_password: not required, default: true. # Store the password for the user running the task.  If C(false), the task will only have access to local resources.
frequency: not required, default: undefined. # The frequency of the command, not idempotent
arguments: not required, default: undefined. # Arguments to provide scheduled task action
time: not required, default: undefined. # Time to execute scheduled task, not idempotent
path: not required, default: \. # Task folder in which this task will be stored - creates a non-existent path when C(state) is C(present), and removes an empty path when C(state) is C(absent)

password: not required, default: undefined. # Password for the user account to run the scheduled task as.  This is required for running a task without the user being logged in, excluding Windows built-in service accounts.  This should be used for specifying credentials during initial task creation, and changing stored user credentials, as setting this value will cause the task to be recreated.
user: not required, default: DOMAIN\user. # User to run the scheduled task as; defaults to the current user
win_security_policy

section: required, default: undefined. # The ini section the key exists in.,If the section does not exist then the module will return an error.,Example sections to use are 'Account Policies', 'Local Policies', 'Event Log', 'Restricted Groups', 'System Services', 'Registry' and 'File System'
key: required, default: undefined. # The ini key of the section or policy name to modify.,The module will return an error if this key is invalid.
value: required, default: undefined. # The value for the ini key or policy name.,If the key takes in a boolean value then 0 = False and 1 = True.
win_service
username: not required, default: undefined. # The username to set the service to start as.,This and the C(password) argument must be supplied together.
display_name: not required, default: undefined. # The display name to set for the service.
desktop_interact: not required, default: false. # Whether to allow the service user to interact with the desktop.,This should only be set to true when using the LocalSystem username.

force_dependent_services: not required, default: false. # If True, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services will force the dependent services to stop or restart also.,If False, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services may fail.

dependency_action: not required, default: set. # Used in conjunction with C(dependency) to either add the dependencies to the existing service dependencies.,Remove the dependencies to the existing dependencies.,Set the dependencies to only the values in the list replacing the existing dependencies.
description: not required, default: undefined. # The description to set for the service.
start_mode: not required, default: undefined. # Set the startup type for the service.,C(delayed) added in Ansible 2.3

state: not required, default: undefined. # C(started)/C(stopped)/C(absent)/C(pause) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.,C(restarted) will always bounce the service.,C(absent) added in Ansible 2.3,C(pause) was added in Ansible 2.4,Only services that support the paused state can be paused, you can check the return value C(can_pause_and_continue).,You can only pause a service that is already started.

dependencies: not required, default: undefined. # A list of service dependencies to set for this particular service.,This should be a list of service names and not the display name of the service.,This works by C(dependency_action) to either add/remove or set the services in this list.
path: not required, default: undefined. # The path to the executable to set for the service.

password: not required, default: undefined. # The password to set the service to start as.,This and the C(username) argument must be supplied together.,If specifying LocalSystem, NetworkService or LocalService this field must be an empty string and not null.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the service
win_share
deny: not required, default: undefined. # Specify user list that should get no access, regardless of implied access on share, separated by comma.
full: not required, default: undefined. # Specify user list that should get full access on share, separated by comma.
encrypt: not required, default: no. # Sets whether to encrypt the traffic to the share or not.
name: required, default: undefined. # Share name.
read: not required, default: undefined. # Specify user list that should get read access on share, separated by comma.
list: not required, default: no. # Specify whether to allow or deny file listing, in case user got no permission on share.
state: not required, default: present. # Specify whether to add C(present) or remove C(absent) the specified share.
caching_mode: not required, default: Manual. # Set the CachingMode for this share.
path: required, default: undefined. # Share directory.
change: not required, default: undefined. # Specify user list that should get read and write access on share, separated by comma.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Share description

win_shell.description: Execute shell commands on target hosts.
body: win_shell
creates: not required, default: undefined. # a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path exists on the target host, the task will be skipped.
free_form: required, default: undefined. # The C(win_shell) module takes a free form command to run.  There is no parameter actually named 'free form'. See the examples!
chdir: not required, default: undefined. # set the specified path as the current working directory before executing a command
removes: not required, default: undefined. # a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path B(does not) exist on the target host, the task will be skipped.

executable: not required, default: undefined. # change the shell used to execute the command (eg, C(cmd)). The target shell must accept a C(/c) parameter followed by the raw command line to be executed.
win_shortcut
windowstyle: not required, default: undefined. # Influences how the application is displayed when it is launched.
src: not required, default: undefined. # Executable or URL the shortcut points to.,The executable needs to be in your PATH, or has to be an absolute path to the executable.
description: not required, default: undefined. # Description for the shortcut.,This is usually shown when hoovering the icon.
dest: required, default: undefined. # Destination file for the shortcuting file.,File name should have a C(.lnk) or C(.url) extension.
args: not required, default: undefined. # Additional arguments for the executable defined in C(src).
directory: not required, default: undefined. # Working directory for executable defined in C(src).
state: not required, default: present. # When C(present), creates or updates the shortcut.  When C(absent), removes the shortcut if it exists.
hotkey: not required, default: undefined. # Key combination for the shortcut.

icon: not required, default: undefined. # Icon used for the shortcut.,File name should have a C(.ico) extension.,The file name is followed by a comma and the number in the library file (.dll) or use 0 for an image file.

win_stat.description: returns information about a Windows file
body: win_stat
path: required, default: undefined. # The full path of the file/object to get the facts of; both forward and back slashes are accepted.

get_md5: not required, default: true. # Whether to return the checksum sum of the file. Between Ansible 1.9 and 2.2 this is no longer an MD5, but a SHA1 instead. As of Ansible 2.3 this is back to an MD5. Will return None if host is unable to use specified algorithm.,This option is deprecated in Ansible 2.3 and is replaced with C(checksum_algorithm=md5).
get_checksum: not required, default: true. # Whether to return a checksum of the file (default sha1)
checksum_algorithm: not required, default: sha1. # Algorithm to determine checksum of file. Will throw an error if the host is unable to use specified algorithm.
win_tempfile
path: not required, default: %TEMP%. # Location where temporary file or directory should be created.,If path is not specified default system temporary directory (%TEMP%) will be used.
state: not required, default: file. # Whether to create file or directory.
prefix: not required, default: ansible.. # Prefix of file/directory name created by module.
suffix: not required, default: . # Suffix of file/directory name created by module.

win_template.description: Templates a file out to a remote server.
body: win_template
src: required, default: undefined. # Path of a Jinja2 formatted template on the local server. This can be a relative or absolute path.

force: not required, default: yes. # the default is C(yes), which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source.  If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.
trim_blocks: not required, default: no. # If this is set to True the first newline after a block is removed (block, not variable tag!).
dest: required, default: undefined. # Location to render the template to on the remote machine.
block_end_string: not required, default: %}. # The string marking the end of a block.
variable_start_string: not required, default: {{. # The string marking the beginning of a print statement.
newline_sequence: not required, default: \r\n. # Specify the newline sequence to use for templating files.
variable_end_string: not required, default: }}. # The string marking the end of a print statement.
block_start_string: not required, default: {%. # The string marking the beginning of a block.
win_timezone
timezone: required, default: undefined. # Timezone to set to. Example Central Standard Time

win_toast.description: Sends Toast windows notification to logged in users on Windows 10 or later hosts
body: win_toast
popup: not required, default: true. # If false, the notification will not pop up and will only appear in the Action Center.
group: not required, default: Powershell. # Which notification group to add the notification to.
expire: not required, default: 45. # How long in seconds before the notification expires.
title: not required, default: Notification HH:mm. # The notification title, which appears in the pop up..
msg: not required, default: Hello, World!. # The message to appear inside the notification.  May include \n to format the message to appear within the Action Center.
tag: not required, default: Ansible. # The tag to add to the notification.

win_unzip.description: Unzips compressed files and archives on the Windows node
body: win_unzip
dest: required, default: undefined. # Destination of zip file (provide absolute path of directory). If it does not exist, the directory will be created.
src: required, default: undefined. # File to be unzipped (provide absolute path).
delete_archive: not required, default: no. # Remove the zip file, after unzipping.
recurse: not required, default: no. # Recursively expand zipped files within the src file.
