creates: not required, default: undefined. # If this file or directory exists the specified src will not be extracted.
win_updates
log_path: not required, default: undefined. # If set, C(win_updates) will append update progress to the specified file. The directory must already exist.

state: not required, default: installed. # Controls whether found updates are returned as a list or actually installed.,This module also supports Ansible check mode, which has the same effect as setting state=searched
category_names: not required, default: CriticalUpdates,SecurityUpdates,UpdateRollups. # A scalar or list of categories to install updates from
win_uri
body: not required, default: undefined. # The body of the HTTP request/response to the web service.
dest: not required, default: undefined. # Output the response body to a file.
status_code: not required, default: 200. # A valid, numeric, HTTP status code that signifies success of the request.,Can also be comma separated list of status codes.
removes: not required, default: undefined. # A filename, when it does not exist, this step will be skipped.

use_basic_parsing: not required, default: yes. # This module relies upon 'Invoke-WebRequest', which by default uses the Internet Explorer Engine to parse a webpage.,There's an edge-case where if a user hasn't run IE before, this will fail.,The only advantage to using the Internet Explorer praser is that you can traverse the DOM in a powershell script.,That isn't useful for Ansible, so by default we toggle 'UseBasicParsing'. However, you can toggle that off here.
content_type: not required, default: undefined. # Sets the "Content-Type" header.
password: not required, default: undefined. # Password to use for authentication.
url: required, default: undefined. # Supports FTP, HTTP or HTTPS URLs in the form of (ftp|http|https)://host.domain:port/path.,Also supports file:/// URLs through Invoke-WebRequest.

maximum_redirection: not required, default: 5. # Specifies how many times C(win_uri) redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails.,If C(maximum_redirection) is set to 0 (zero) or C(follow_redirects) is set to C(none), or set to C(safe) when not doing C(GET) or C(HEAD) it prevents all redirection.
method: not required, default: GET. # The HTTP Method of the request or response.
creates: not required, default: undefined. # A filename, when it already exists, this step will be skipped.
headers: not required, default: undefined. # Key Value pairs for headers. Example "Host: www.somesite.com"

timeout: not required, default: 30. # Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out (in seconds).,The value 0 (zero) specifies an indefinite time-out.,A Domain Name System (DNS) query can take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution, and you set C(timeout) to a value greater than zero, but less than 15 seconds, it can take 15 seconds or more before your request times out.

follow_redirects: not required, default: safe. # Whether or not the C(win_uri) module should follow redirects.,C(all) will follow all redirects.,C(none) will not follow any redirects.,C(safe) will follow only "safe" redirects, where "safe" means that the client is only doing a C(GET) or C(HEAD) on the URI to which it is being redirected.

return_content: not required, default: no. # Whether or not to return the body of the response as a "content" key in the dictionary result. If the reported Content-type is "application/json", then the JSON is additionally loaded into a key called C(json) in the dictionary results.
validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
client_cert: not required, default: undefined. # Specifies the client certificate(.pfx)  that is used for a secure web request.
user: not required, default: undefined. # Username to use for authentication.
win_user
update_password: not required, default: always. # C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
password: not required, default: null. # Optionally set the user's password to this (plain text) value.
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the user to create, remove or modify.
description: not required, default: null. # Description of the user

groups_action: not required, default: replace. # If C(replace), the user is added as a member of each group in I(groups) and removed from any other groups.  If C(add), the user is added to each group in I(groups) where not already a member.  If C(remove), the user is removed from each group in I(groups).
password_expired: not required, default: null. # C(yes) will require the user to change their password at next login. C(no) will clear the expired password flag.

state: not required, default: present. # When C(present), creates or updates the user account.  When C(absent), removes the user account if it exists.  When C(query) (new in 1.9), retrieves the user account details without making any changes.

groups: not required, default: undefined. # Adds or removes the user from this comma-separated lis of groups, depending on the value of I(groups_action). When I(groups_action) is C(replace) and I(groups) is set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups.
account_disabled: not required, default: null. # C(yes) will disable the user account.  C(no) will clear the disabled flag.
fullname: not required, default: null. # Full name of the user
password_never_expires: not required, default: null. # C(yes) will set the password to never expire.  C(no) will allow the password to expire.
account_locked: not required, default: null. # C(no) will unlock the user account if locked.
user_cannot_change_password: not required, default: null. # C(yes) will prevent the user from changing their password.  C(no) will allow the user to change their password.
win_user_right

action: not required, default: set. # C(add) will add the users/groups to the existing right.,C(remove) will remove the users/groups from the existing right.,C(set) will replace the users/groups of the existing right.

name: required, default: undefined. # The name of the User Right as shown by the C(Constant Name) value from U(https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd349804.aspx).,The module will return an error if the right is invalid.

users: required, default: undefined. # A list of users or groups to add/remove on the User Right.,These can be in the form DOMAIN\user-group, user-group@DOMAIN.COM for domain users/groups.,For local users/groups it can be in the form user-group, .\user-group, SERVERNAME\user-group where SERVERNAME is the name of the remote server.,You can also add special local accounts like SYSTEM and others.

win_wait_for.description: Waits for a condition before continuing
body: win_wait_for

host: not required, default: 127.0.0.1. # A resolvable hostname or IP address to wait for.,If C(state=drained) then it will only check for connections on the IP specified, you can use '0.0.0.0' to use all host IPs.
port: not required, default: undefined. # The port number to poll on C(host).
delay: not required, default: undefined. # The number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.

state: not required, default: started. # When checking a port, C(started) will ensure the port is open, C(stopped) will check that is it closed and C(drained) will check for active connections.,When checking for a file or a search string C(present) or C(started) will ensure that the file or string is present, C(absent) will check that the file or search string is absent or removed.
sleep: not required, default: 1. # Number of seconds to sleep between checks.
timeout: not required, default: 300. # The maximum number of seconds to wait for.
exclude_hosts: not required, default: undefined. # The list of hosts or IPs to ignore when looking for active TCP connections when C(state=drained).

search_regex: not required, default: undefined. # Can be used to match a string in a file.,If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the regex matches.,If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the regex does not match.,Defaults to a multiline regex.

path: not required, default: undefined. # The path to a file on the filesystem to check.,If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the file exists.,If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the file does not exist.
connect_timeout: not required, default: 5. # The maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.

win_wakeonlan.description: Send a magic Wake-on-LAN (WoL) broadcast packet
body: win_wakeonlan
broadcast: not required, default: 255.255.255.255. # Network broadcast address to use for broadcasting magic Wake-on-LAN packet.
mac: required, default: undefined. # MAC address to send Wake-on-LAN broadcast packet for.
port: not required, default: 7. # UDP port to use for magic Wake-on-LAN packet.

win_webpicmd.description: Installs packages using Web Platform Installer command-line
body: win_webpicmd
name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the package to be installed
xattr
path: required, default: None. # The full path of the file/object to get the facts of.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(name).

state: not required, default: read. # defines which state you want to do. C(read) retrieves the current value for a C(key) (default) C(present) sets C(name) to C(value), default if value is set C(all) dumps all data C(keys) retrieves all keys C(absent) deletes the key
key: not required, default: None. # The name of a specific Extended attribute key to set/retrieve
value: not required, default: None. # The value to set the named name/key to, it automatically sets the C(state) to 'set'
follow: not required, default: true. # if yes, dereferences symlinks and sets/gets attributes on symlink target, otherwise acts on symlink itself.
xbps
recurse: not required, default: false. # When removing a package, also remove its dependencies, provided that they are not required by other packages and were not explicitly installed by a user.
state: not required, default: present. # Desired state of the package.
upgrade: not required, default: false. # Whether or not to upgrade whole system
update_cache: not required, default: true. # Whether or not to refresh the master package lists. This can be run as part of a package installation or as a separate step.
name: not required, default: null. # Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.
xenserver_facts

xml.description: Manage bits and pieces of XML files or strings
body: xml
xpath: not required, default: /. # A valid XPath expression describing the item(s) you want to manipulate.,Operates on the document root, C(/), by default.
count: not required, default: no. # Search for a given C(xpath) and provide the count of any matches.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.

set_children: not required, default: undefined. # Set the child-element(s) of a selected element for a given C(xpath).,Removes any existing children.,Child elements must be specified as in C(add_children).,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
xmlstring: required, default: undefined. # A string containing XML on which to operate.,This parameter is required, unless C(path) is given.
attribute: not required, default: undefined. # The attribute to select when using parameter C(value).,This is a string, not prepended with C(@).
pretty_print: not required, default: no. # Pretty print XML output.

add_children: not required, default: undefined. # Add additional child-element(s) to a selected element for a given C(xpath).,Child elements must be given in a list and each item may be either a string (eg. C(children=ansible) to add an empty C(<ansible/>) child element), or a hash where the key is an element name and the value is the element value.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.

value: not required, default: undefined. # Desired state of the selected attribute.,Either a string, or to unset a value, the Python C(None) keyword (YAML Equivalent, C(null)).,Elements default to no value (but present).,Attributes default to an empty string.
content: not required, default: undefined. # Search for a given C(xpath) and get content.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
state: not required, default: present. # Set or remove an xpath selection (node(s), attribute(s)).
namespaces: not required, default: undefined. # The namespace C(prefix:uri) mapping for the XPath expression.,Needs to be a C(dict), not a C(list) of items.
input_type: not required, default: yaml. # Type of input for C(add_children) and C(set_children).
print_match: not required, default: no. # Search for a given C(xpath) and print out any matches.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
path: required, default: undefined. # Path to the file to operate on. File must exist ahead of time.,This parameter is required, unless C(xmlstring) is given.
backup: not required, default: no. # Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

yum.description: Manages packages with the I(yum) package manager
body: yum

allow_downgrade: not required, default: no. # Specify if the named package and version is allowed to downgrade a maybe already installed higher version of that package. Note that setting allow_downgrade=True can make this module behave in a non-idempotent way. The task could end up with a set of packages that does not match the complete list of specified packages to install (because dependencies between the downgraded package and others can cause changes to the packages which were in the earlier transaction).

name: required, default: null. # Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0). If a previous version is specified, the task also needs to turn C(allow_downgrade) on. See the C(allow_downgrade) documentation for caveats with downgrading packages. When using state=latest, this can be '*' which means run C(yum -y update).  You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file (using state=present). To operate on several packages this can accept a comma separated list of packages or (as of 2.0) a list of packages.
exclude: not required, default: null. # Package name(s) to exclude when state=present, or latest
list: not required, default: null. # Package name to run the equivalent of yum list <package> against.
disable_gpg_check: not required, default: no. # Whether to disable the GPG checking of signatures of packages being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
conf_file: not required, default: null. # The remote yum configuration file to use for the transaction.
state: not required, default: present. # Whether to install (C(present) or C(installed), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent) or C(removed)) a package.

disablerepo: not required, default: null. # I(Repoid) of repositories to disable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".
update_cache: not required, default: no. # Force yum to check if cache is out of date and redownload if needed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).

enablerepo: not required, default: null. # I(Repoid) of repositories to enable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".
skip_broken: not required, default: no. # Resolve depsolve problems by removing packages that are causing problems from the trans action.
security: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes), and C(state=latest) then only installs updates that have been marked security related.

validate_certs: not required, default: yes. # This only applies if using a https url as the source of the rpm. e.g. for localinstall. If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates as it avoids verifying the source site.,Prior to 2.1 the code worked as if this was set to C(yes).
installroot: not required, default: /. # Specifies an alternative installroot, relative to which all packages will be installed.
yum_repository

metalink: not required, default: null. # Specifies a URL to a metalink file for the repomd.xml, a list of mirrors for the entire repository are generated by converting the mirrors for the repomd.xml file to a I(baseurl).
ip_resolve: not required, default: whatever. # Determines how yum resolves host names.,C(4) or C(IPv4) - resolve to IPv4 addresses only.,C(6) or C(IPv6) - resolve to IPv6 addresses only.
reposdir: not required, default: /etc/yum.repos.d. # Directory where the C(.repo) files will be stored.
proxy_password: not required, default: null. # Username to use for proxy.
mirrorlist_expire: not required, default: 21600. # Time (in seconds) after which the mirrorlist locally cached will expire.,Default value is 6 hours.

bandwidth: not required, default: 0. # Maximum available network bandwidth in bytes/second. Used with the I(throttle) option.,If I(throttle) is a percentage and bandwidth is C(0) then bandwidth throttling will be disabled. If I(throttle) is expressed as a data rate (bytes/sec) then this option is ignored. Default is C(0) (no bandwidth throttling).
cost: not required, default: 1000. # Relative cost of accessing this repository. Useful for weighing one repo's packages as greater/less than any other.
file: not required, default: null. # File to use to save the repo in. Defaults to the value of I(name).
owner: not required, default: null. # Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

exclude: not required, default: null. # List of packages to exclude from updates or installs. This should be a space separated list. Shell globs using wildcards (eg. C(*) and C(?)) are allowed.,The list can also be a regular YAML array.

keepalive: not required, default: no. # This tells yum whether or not HTTP/1.1 keepalive should be used with this repository. This can improve transfer speeds by using one connection when downloading multiple files from a repository.
repo_gpgcheck: not required, default: no. # This tells yum whether or not it should perform a GPG signature check on the repodata from this repository.
group: not required, default: null. # Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

failovermethod: not required, default: roundrobin. # C(roundrobin) randomly selects a URL out of the list of URLs to start with and proceeds through each of them as it encounters a failure contacting the host.,C(priority) starts from the first I(baseurl) listed and reads through them sequentially.

unsafe_writes: not required, default: false. # Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

deltarpm_metadata_percentage: not required, default: 100. # When the relative size of deltarpm metadata vs pkgs is larger than this, deltarpm metadata is not downloaded from the repo. Note that you can give values over C(100), so C(200) means that the metadata is required to be half the size of the packages. Use C(0) to turn off this check, and always download metadata.
gpgkey: not required, default: null. # A URL pointing to the ASCII-armored GPG key file for the repository.,It can also be a list of multiple URLs.
setype: not required, default: null. # Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

http_caching: not required, default: all. # Determines how upstream HTTP caches are instructed to handle any HTTP downloads that Yum does.,C(all) means that all HTTP downloads should be cached.,C(packages) means that only RPM package downloads should be cached (but not repository metadata downloads).,C(none) means that no HTTP downloads should be cached.
priority: not required, default: 99. # Enforce ordered protection of repositories. The value is an integer from 1 to 99.,This option only works if the YUM Priorities plugin is installed.
serole: not required, default: null. # Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
mirrorlist: not required, default: null. # Specifies a URL to a file containing a list of baseurls.,This or the I(baseurl) parameter is required if I(state) is set to C(present).
params: not required, default: null. # Option used to allow the user to overwrite any of the other options. To remove an option, set the value of the option to C(null).
gpgcheck: not required, default: no. # Tells yum whether or not it should perform a GPG signature check on packages.

include: not required, default: null. # Include external configuration file. Both, local path and URL is supported. Configuration file will be inserted at the position of the I(include=) line. Included files may contain further include lines. Yum will abort with an error if an inclusion loop is detected.
proxy_username: not required, default: null. # Password for this proxy.
username: not required, default: null. # Username to use for basic authentication to a repo or really any url.

ui_repoid_vars: not required, default: releasever basearch. # When a repository id is displayed, append these yum variables to the string if they are used in the I(baseurl)/etc. Variables are appended in the order listed (and found).
metadata_expire: not required, default: 21600. # Time (in seconds) after which the metadata will expire.,Default value is 6 hours.
description: not required, default: null. # A human readable string describing the repository.,This parameter is only required if I(state) is set to C(present).
state: not required, default: present. # State of the repo file.
selevel: not required, default: s0. # Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
sslclientcert: not required, default: null. # Path to the SSL client certificate yum should use to connect to repos/remote sites.

baseurl: not required, default: null. # URL to the directory where the yum repository's 'repodata' directory lives.,It can also be a list of multiple URLs.,This or the I(mirrorlist) parameter is required if I(state) is set to C(present).
gpgcakey: not required, default: null. # A URL pointing to the ASCII-armored CA key file for the repository.
s3_enabled: not required, default: no. # Enables support for S3 repositories.,This option only works if the YUM S3 plugin is installed.
async: not required, default: yes. # If set to C(yes) Yum will download packages and metadata from this repo in parallel, if possible.
sslcacert: not required, default: null. # Path to the directory containing the databases of the certificate authorities yum should use to verify SSL certificates.

includepkgs: not required, default: null. # List of packages you want to only use from a repository. This should be a space separated list. Shell globs using wildcards (eg. C(*) and C(?)) are allowed. Substitution variables (e.g. C($releasever)) are honored here.,The list can also be a regular YAML array.
enablegroups: not required, default: yes. # Determines whether yum will allow the use of package groups for this repository.
sslverify: not required, default: yes. # Defines whether yum should verify SSL certificates/hosts at all.
password: not required, default: null. # Password to use with the username for basic authentication.
retries: not required, default: 10. # Set the number of times any attempt to retrieve a file should retry before returning an error. Setting this to C(0) makes yum try forever.
protect: not required, default: no. # Protect packages from updates from other repositories.

ssl_check_cert_permissions: not required, default: no. # Whether yum should check the permissions on the paths for the certificates on the repository (both remote and local).,If we can't read any of the files then yum will force I(skip_if_unavailable) to be C(yes). This is most useful for non-root processes which use yum on repos that have client cert files which are readable only by root.

throttle: not required, default: null. # Enable bandwidth throttling for downloads.,This option can be expressed as a absolute data rate in bytes/sec. An SI prefix (k, M or G) may be appended to the bandwidth value.
name: required, default: undefined. # Unique repository ID.,This parameter is only required if I(state) is set to C(present) or C(absent).

deltarpm_percentage: not required, default: 75. # When the relative size of delta vs pkg is larger than this, delta is not used. Use C(0) to turn off delta rpm processing. Local repositories (with file:// I(baseurl)) have delta rpms turned off by default.
sslclientkey: not required, default: null. # Path to the SSL client key yum should use to connect to repos/remote sites.

seuser: not required, default: null. # User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
enabled: not required, default: yes. # This tells yum whether or not use this repository.

skip_if_unavailable: not required, default: no. # If set to C(yes) yum will continue running if this repository cannot be contacted for any reason. This should be set carefully as all repos are consulted for any given command.
keepcache: not required, default: 1. # Either C(1) or C(0). Determines whether or not yum keeps the cache of headers and packages after successful installation.

mode: not required, default: null. # Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like 0644). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
timeout: not required, default: 30. # Number of seconds to wait for a connection before timing out.

attributes: not required, default: None. # Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).

metadata_expire_filter: not required, default: read-only:present. # Filter the I(metadata_expire) time, allowing a trade of speed for accuracy if a command doesn't require it. Each yum command can specify that it requires a certain level of timeliness quality from the remote repos. from "I'm about to install/upgrade, so this better be current" to "Anything that's available is good enough".,C(never) - Nothing is filtered, always obey I(metadata_expire).,C(read-only:past) - Commands that only care about past information are filtered from metadata expiring. Eg. I(yum history) info (if history needs to lookup anything about a previous transaction, then by definition the remote package was available in the past).,C(read-only:present) - Commands that are balanced between past and future. Eg. I(yum list yum).,C(read-only:future) - Commands that are likely to result in running other commands which will require the latest metadata. Eg. I(yum check-update).,Note that this option does not override "yum clean expire-cache".
proxy: not required, default: null. # URL to the proxy server that yum should use. Set to C(_none_) to disable the global proxy setting.
zabbix_group
http_login_password: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth password
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout of API request(seconds).
login_user: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user name.
http_login_user: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth login
server_url: required, default: undefined. # Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
state: not required, default: present. # Create or delete host group.
host_groups: required, default: undefined. # List of host groups to create or delete.
login_password: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user password.
zabbix_host
status: not required, default: enabled. # Monitoring status of the host.
inventory_mode: not required, default: None. # Configure the inventory mode.
login_user: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user name, used to authenticate against the server.

interfaces: not required, default: . # List of interfaces to be created for the host (see example below).,Available values are: dns, ip, main, port, type and useip.,Please review the interface documentation for more information on the supported properties,https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/2.0/manual/appendix/api/hostinterface/definitions#host_interface
server_url: required, default: undefined. # Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https).
proxy: not required, default: None. # The name of the Zabbix Proxy to be used
host_groups: not required, default: undefined. # List of host groups the host is part of.
login_password: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user password.
force: not required, default: yes. # Overwrite the host configuration, even if already present
http_login_password: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth password
http_login_user: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth login
visible_name: not required, default: undefined. # Visible name of the host in Zabbix.

state: not required, default: present. # State of the host.,On C(present), it will create if host does not exist or update the host if the associated data is different.,On C(absent) will remove a host if it exists.
host_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the host in Zabbix.,host_name is the unique identifier used and cannot be updated using this module.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout of API request (seconds).
link_templates: not required, default: None. # List of templates linked to the host.
zabbix_hostmacro
http_login_password: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth password
macro_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the host macro.
macro_value: required, default: undefined. # Value of the host macro.
login_user: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user name.
http_login_user: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth login
server_url: required, default: undefined. # Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https).

state: not required, default: present. # State of the macro.,On C(present), it will create if macro does not exist or update the macro if the associated data is different.,On C(absent) will remove a macro if it exists.
host_name: required, default: undefined. # Name of the host.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout of API request (seconds).
login_password: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user password.
zabbix_maintenance
http_login_password: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth password
name: required, default: undefined. # Unique name of maintenance window.
login_user: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user name.
http_login_user: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth login
server_url: required, default: null. # Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).

host_names: not required, default: null. # Hosts to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple hosts with commas. C(host_name) is an alias for C(host_names). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_groups) specified.

host_groups: not required, default: null. # Host groups to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple groups with commas. C(host_group) is an alias for C(host_groups). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_names) specified.
state: not required, default: present. # Create or remove a maintenance window.
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout of API request (seconds).
login_password: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user password.
collect_data: not required, default: true. # Type of maintenance. With data collection, or without.
minutes: not required, default: 10. # Length of maintenance window in minutes.
desc: required, default: Created by Ansible. # Short description of maintenance window.
zabbix_screen

screens: required, default: undefined. # List of screens to be created/updated/deleted(see example).,If the screen(s) already been added, the screen(s) name won't be updated.,When creating or updating screen(s), C(screen_name), C(host_group) are required.,When deleting screen(s), the C(screen_name) is required.,The available states are: C(present) (default) and C(absent). If the screen(s) already exists, and the state is not C(absent), the screen(s) will just be updated as needed.
http_login_password: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth password
timeout: not required, default: 10. # The timeout of API request (seconds).
login_password: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user password.
login_user: required, default: undefined. # Zabbix user name.
http_login_user: not required, default: None. # Basic Auth login
server_url: required, default: undefined. # Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https).
zfs
origin: not required, default: null. # Snapshot from which to create a clone

state: required, default: undefined. # Whether to create (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a file system, snapshot or volume. All parents/children will be created/destroyed as needed to reach the desired state.
name: required, default: undefined. # File system, snapshot or volume name e.g. C(rpool/myfs)
key_value: not required, default: null. # The C(zfs) module takes key=value pairs for zfs properties to be set. See the zfs(8) man page for more information.
zfs_facts
parsable: not required, default: false. # Specifies if property values should be displayed in machine friendly format.
depth: not required, default: None. # Specifiies recurion depth.
name: required, default: undefined. # ZFS dataset name.
type: not required, default: all. # Specifies which datasets types to display. Multiple values have to be provided in comma-separated form.
recurse: not required, default: false. # Specifies if properties for any children should be recursively displayed.
properties: not required, default: all. # Specifies which dataset properties should be queried in comma-separated format. For more information about dataset properties, check zfs(1M) man page.

znode.description: Create, delete, retrieve, and update znodes using ZooKeeper
body: znode
state: not required, default: None. # The state to enforce. Mutually exclusive with op.
hosts: required, default: undefined. # A list of ZooKeeper servers (format '[server]:[port]').
name: required, default: undefined. # The path of the znode.
timeout: not required, default: 300. # The amount of time to wait for a node to appear.
op: not required, default: None. # An operation to perform. Mutually exclusive with state.
value: not required, default: None. # The value assigned to the znode.
recursive: not required, default: false. # Recursively delete node and all its children.
zpool_facts
parsable: not required, default: false. # Specifies if property values should be displayed in machine friendly format.
name: not required, default: undefined. # ZFS pool name.
properties: not required, default: all. # Specifies which dataset properties should be queried in comma-separated format. For more information about dataset properties, check zpool(1M) man page.

zypper.description: Manage packages on SUSE and openSUSE
body: zypper
force: not required, default: no. # Adds C(--force) option to I(zypper). Allows to downgrade packages and change vendor or architecture.

name: required, default: undefined. # Package name C(name) or package specifier.,Can include a version like C(name=1.0), C(name>3.4) or C(name<=2.7). If a version is given, C(oldpackage) is implied and zypper is allowed to update the package within the version range given.,You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.,When using state=latest, this can be '*', which updates all installed packages.
disable_gpg_check: not required, default: no. # Whether to disable to GPG signature checking of the package signature being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
extra_args: not required, default: undefined. # Add additional options to C(zypper) command.,Options should be supplied in a single line as if given in the command line.

state: not required, default: present. # C(present) will make sure the package is installed. C(latest)  will make sure the latest version of the package is installed. C(absent)  will make sure the specified package is not installed. C(dist-upgrade) will make sure the latest version of all installed packages from all enabled repositories is installed.,When using C(dist-upgrade), I(name) should be C('*').

oldpackage: not required, default: no. # Adds C(--oldpackage) option to I(zypper). Allows to downgrade packages with less side-effects than force. This is implied as soon as a version is specified as part of the package name.
update_cache: not required, default: no. # Run the equivalent of C(zypper refresh) before the operation. Disabled in check mode.

disable_recommends: not required, default: yes. # Corresponds to the C(--no-recommends) option for I(zypper). Default behavior (C(yes)) modifies zypper's default behavior; C(no) does install recommended packages.
type: not required, default: package. # The type of package to be operated on.
zypper_repository
repo: not required, default: none. # URI of the repository or .repo file. Required when state=present.
name: not required, default: none. # A name for the repository. Not required when adding repofiles.

auto_import_keys: not required, default: no. # Automatically import the gpg signing key of the new or changed repository.,Has an effect only if state is I(present). Has no effect on existing (unchanged) repositories or in combination with I(absent).,Implies runrefresh.
enabled: not required, default: yes. # Set repository to enabled (or disabled).
disable_gpg_check: not required, default: no. # Whether to disable GPG signature checking of all packages. Has an effect only if state is I(present).,Needs zypper version >= 1.6.2.
priority: not required, default: undefined. # Set priority of repository. Packages will always be installed from the repository with the smallest priority number.,Needs zypper version >= 1.12.25.
state: not required, default: present. # A source string state.
autorefresh: not required, default: yes. # Enable autorefresh of the repository.
overwrite_multiple: not required, default: no. # Overwrite multiple repository entries, if repositories with both name and URL already exist.
runrefresh: not required, default: no. # Refresh the package list of the given repository.,Can be used with repo=* to refresh all repositories.
description: not required, default: none. # A description of the repository
